There are 70,000 new AIDS orphans a year .
By the year 2010 , it is estimated that over 20 million children will be orphaned by AIDS .
In 2005 the highest number of AIDS orphans as a percentage of all orphans was in Zimbabwe .
In statistics from the Joint United Nations Programme on HIV\/AIDS -LRB- UNAIDS -RRB- , the World Health Organization -LRB- WHO -RRB- and the United Nations Children 's Fund -LRB- UNICEF -RRB- , the term is used for a child whose mother has died due to AIDS before the child 's 15th birthday , regardless of whether the father is still alive .
The highest number of orphans due to AIDS alive in 2007 was in South Africa -LRB- although the definition of AIDS orphan in South African statistics includes children up to the age of 18 who have lost either biological parent -RRB- .
As a result of this definition , one study estimated that 80 % of all AIDS orphans still have one living parent .
An AIDS orphan is a child who became an orphan because one or both parents died from AIDS .

The 1953 Korean War Armistice is a major example of an armistice which has not been followed by a peace treaty .
It is derived from the Latin arma , meaning weapons and statium , meaning a stopping .
An armistice is a modus vivendi and is not the same as a peace treaty , which may take months or even years to agree on .
A truce or ceasefire usually refers to a temporary cessation of hostilities for an agreed limited time or within a limited area .
A truce may be needed in order to negotiate an armistice .
The most notable armistice , simply known by Europeans as `` The Armistice '' , was the armistice at the end of World War I , on 11 November 1918 , signed near CompiÃ gne , France , and effective at the `` eleventh hour of the eleventh day of the eleventh month . ''
An armistice is a situation in a war where the warring parties agree to stop fighting .
Armistices are always negotiated between the parties themselves and are thus generally seen as more binding than non-mandatory UN cease-fire resolutions in modern international law .
The United Nations Security Council often imposes or tries to impose cease-fire resolutions on parties in modern conflicts .

As of 2000 , the population was 48,498 .
Granville County is a county located in the U.S. state of North Carolina .
In 1752 parts of Granville County , Bladen County , and Johnston County were combined to form Orange County .
Its county seat is Oxford .
Granville County is a member of the Kerr-Tar Regional Council of Governments .
In 1764 the eastern part of Granville County became Bute County .

Choking back tears , Clarkson performed the ballad `` A Moment Like This '' , the song written for the winner of American Idol , which would subsequently appear on her debut album , Thankful .
Clarkson attended Pauline G Hughes Middle School and Burleson High School .
Upon high school graduation , Clarkson was offered full scholarships to The University of Texas at Austin , University of North Texas , and Berklee , but decided against college because she had `` already written so much music and wanted to try it on her own , '' and she figured `` you 're never too old to go to college . ''
Her albums have sold over 10.5 million copies in the United States . Clarkson is the only American Idol contestant to have reached number one in the UK .
Kelly Brianne Clarkson -LRB- born April 24 , 1982 -RRB- is an American pop rock singer-songwriter and actress .
Clarkson is also ranked on the top 200 album sellers of the Nielsen SoundScan era at number 187 .
In seventh grade , a teacher -LRB- Mrs. Cynthia Glenn -RRB- overheard her singing in a hallway and asked her to audition for the school choir ; Clarkson told the teacher that she had never received professional vocal training .
She wanted to become a marine biologist but changed her mind after seeing the movie Jaws .
Clarkson rose to fame after winning the inaugural season of the television series American Idol in 2002 and would later become the runner-up in the television special World Idol in 2003 .
You 've got to sing .
When Clarkson was six years old , her parents divorced after seventeen years of marriage .
Clarkson continued singing and soon started classical training , hoping that music would be her ticket to a college scholarship .
She sang at her high school talent show , after which an audience member shared some inspiring words with her : `` God has given you this gift .
Clarkson won the first season of American Idol on September 4 , 2002 , earning 58 % of the vote to 42 % for runner-up Justin Guarini .
When released as a single in October 2002 , it set a record on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 chart when it rose from number 52 to number one .
In high school , Clarkson performed in musicals such as Annie Get Your Gun , Seven Brides for Seven Brothers and Brigadoon .
Clarkson was born in Fort Worth , Texas , and grew up in the small town of Burleson , a suburb of Fort Worth . She is the third and youngest child of Jeanne Rose , a first grade English teacher of Greek descent , and Stephen Michael Clarkson , a former engineer of Welsh extraction .

For instance , thyrotoxicosis could instead be caused by ingestion of exogenous thyroid hormone or inflammation of the thyroid gland , causing it to release its stores of thyroid hormones .
Hyperthyroidism is thus a cause of thyrotoxicosis , the clinical condition of increased thyroid hormones in the blood . It is important to note that hyperthyroidism and thyrotoxicosis are not synonymous .
Labor Co-operative describes those candidates in British elections standing on behalf of both the Labor Party and the Co-operative Party , based on a national agreement between the two parties .

The Edict of Milan -LRB- Edictum Mediolanense -RRB- was a letter signed by emperors Constantine I and Licinius that proclaimed religious toleration in the Roman Empire .
The two Augusti were in Milan to celebrate the wedding of Constantine 's younger half-sister Constantia with Licinius .
The letter was issued in AD 313 , shortly after the conclusion of the Diocletianic Persecution .
The Christians ' meeting places and other properties were to be returned : ... the same shall be restored to the Christians without payment or any claim of recompense and without any kind of fraud or deception ...
The Edict of Milan was issued in AD 313 , in the names of the Emperor Constantine , who ruled the western parts of the empire , and Licinius , who ruled the East .
Wherefore , for this our indulgence , they ought to pray to their God for our safety , for that of the republic , and for their own , that the commonwealth may continue uninjured on every side , and that they may be able to live securely in their homes .
Flavius Theodosius -LRB- 11 January 347 â `` 17 January 395 -RRB- , commonly known as Theodosius I or Theodosius the Great , was Roman Emperor from 379 to 395 .
Theodosius was the last emperor to rule over both the eastern and the western halves of the Roman Empire .
He also issued decrees that effectively made Christianity the official state religion of the Roman Empire .

The Penny Lilac was the basic penny postage stamp of Great Britain from its first issue on 12 July 1881 and was used until 1901 .
This stamp remained the standard letter stamp for the remainder of Victoria 's reign , and vast quantities were printed .
A regular n-simplex may be constructed from a regular -LRB- n â ' 1 -RRB- - simplex by connecting a new vertex to all original vertices by the common edge length .
A single point may be considered a 0-simplex , and a line segment may be considered a 1-simplex .
In geometry , a simplex -LRB- plural simplexes or simplices -RRB- is a generalization of the notion of a triangle or tetrahedron to arbitrary dimension . Specifically , an n-simplex is an n-dimensional polytope which is the convex hull of its n + 1 vertices .
A regular simplex is a simplex that is also a regular polytope .
For example , a 2-simplex is a triangle , a 3-simplex is a tetrahedron , and a 4-simplex is a pentachoron .

A Song of Ice and Fire is a series of epic fantasy novels by American novelist and screenwriter George R. R. Martin .
Originally planned as a trilogy , the series now consists of four published volumes with three more planned .

The series has been translated into more than twenty languages and the fourth volume reached the top of The New York Times bestseller lists upon its release .

The other members of the hadron family are the baryons : subatomic particles composed of three quarks rather than two .
Charged mesons decay -LRB- sometimes through intermediate particles -RRB- to form electrons and neutrinos . Uncharged mesons may decay to photons .
Mesons are part of the hadron particle family , defined simply as particles composed of quarks .
Since quarks have a spin of 1\/2 , the difference in quark-number between mesons and baryons results in mesons being bosons while baryons are fermionsâ '' that is , mesons have integer spin while baryons have half-integer spin .
The pool does have animal and plant life , including pickleweed , aquatic insects , and the Badwater snail .

Badwater Basin is an endorheic basin in Death Valley National Park , Death Valley , Inyo County , California , noted as the lowest point in North America , with an elevation of 282 f below sea level .
During the Holocene , when the regional climate was less dry , streams running from nearby mountains gradually filled Death Valley to a depth of almost 3 f , and together with Cotton Bail Marsh and Middle Basin , made up the 80 m long , Lake Manly .
While the basin is flooded , some of the salt is dissolved ; it is redeposited as clean crystals when the water evaporates .
The pool itself is not actually the lowest point of the basin : the lowest point -LRB- which is only slightly lower -RRB- is several miles to the west and varies in position .
However , the salt flats are hazardous to traverse -LRB- in many cases being only a thin white crust over mud -RRB- , and so the sign is at the pool .
At Badwater , significant rainstorms flood the valley bottom periodically , covering the salt pan with a thin sheet of standing water .
A Girl Like Me : The Gwen Araujo Story is a 2006 LGBT biography television movie directed by award-winning director Agnieszka Holland and aired on Lifetime Television .
Scenes depicting the murder trial are shown alternating with the story of Gwen 's life .
The story documents the real life of Gwen Araujo , born Edward Araujo , Jr. , a transgender teenager who was murdered after it was discovered by acquaintances that she had male genitalia .
It premiered on the Lifetime Television network in the US on June 19 , 2006 .
The movie stars J. D. Pardo as Eddie\/Gwen , Mercedes Ruehl as her mother , and Avan Jogia as her brother , Danny .

The Adventures of Pinocchio is a novel for children by Italian author Carlo Collodi , written in Florence . The first half was originally a serial between 1881 and 1883 , and then later completed as a book for children in February 1883 .
The Moral Code was adopted at the 22nd Congress of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union in 1961 , as part of the new Party Programme .
Moral Code of the Builder of Communism was a set of twelve codified moral rules in the Soviet Union which every member of the Communist Party of the USSR and every Komsomol member were supposed to follow .
For example , `` You shall not commit adultery '' of Moses loosely corresponds to `` Mutual respect in a family , concern about the upbringing of children '' of the Code .
-LRB- An example of the latter one is ` One for all , and all for one ' -LRB- '' Ð Ð Ð Ð Ñ Ð Ð Ð Ð Ñ Ð Ñ
The Code contained a number of popular Soviet clichÃ s ; in fact it was intentionally formulated to contain catch phrases , either invented by Soviet ideologists , or borrowed .
For example , the `` Do not steal '' may be loosely matched to `` Concern of everyone about the preservation and multiplication of the common wealth '' .
Four of the rules , making up one-third of the Code , are of a political character .
Unlike the Ten Commandments , however , the rules of the Code were not concrete rules of conduct ; they were stated as the rules of attitude .
The very first moral principle was `` Devotion to the cause of communism '' .

Lymph nodes are found all through the body , and act as filters or traps for foreign particles .
Humans have approximately 500-600 lymph nodes distributed throughout the body , with clusters found in the underarms , groin , neck , chest , and abdomen .
However , lymphocytes , a type of white blood cell , will meet the antigens , or proteins , in the peripheral lymphoid organs , which includes lymph nodes . The antigens are displayed by specialized cells in the lymph nodes .
A lymph node is a small ball-shaped organ of the immune system , distributed widely throughout the body including the armpit and stomach\/gut and linked by lymphatic vessels . Lymph nodes are garrisons of B , T , and other immune cells .
They attempt to show that the assumed propositions lead to a logical contradiction and can not therefore all be correct .
Versions such as these are referred to as the logical problem of evil .
This assertion leads to a polytheistic interpretation of Christianity where god is not omnipotent , but since Plantinga 's goal is to defeat only the assertion that God and evil are logically incompatible , even a highly implausible but possible , coherent instance of God 's coexistence with evil is sufficient for his purposes .
Many philosophers accept that arguments such as Plantinga 's free will defense -LRB- in brief , that possibly God allows evil in order to achieve the ultimately greater good of free will -RRB- successfully solve the logical problem of evil in terms of human action ; the question of how free will and God 's Omniscience are compatible remains , however -LRB- see the Argument from free will -RRB- .
Some responses include the arguments that true free will can not exist without the possibility of evil , that humans can not understand God , that suffering is necessary for spiritual growth or evil is the consequence of a fallen world .

Nausea -LRB- Latin nausea , from Greek , nausiÄ `` , `` motion sickness '' , or `` wamble '' -RRB- , is a sensation of unease and discomfort in the upper stomach with an involuntary urge to vomit .
While most causes of nausea are not serious some serious causes do occur .

Connective Tissue -LRB- CT -RRB- is found throughout the body .
Connective tissue is a fibrous tissue .
It is one of the four traditional classes of tissues -LRB- the others being epithelial , muscle , and nervous tissue -RRB- .
Collagen is the main protein of connective tissue in animals and the most abundant protein in mammals , making up about 25 % of the total protein content .
Connective tissue makes up a variety of physical structures including , tendons , blood , cartilage , bone , adipose tissue , and lymphatic tissue .
CT is classified into three subtypes ; Embryonic CT , Proper CT , and Special CT .
It has 3 main components ; cells , fibers , and extracellular matrix .

Finntroll 's first singer Katla decided to use Swedish over Finnish since he was part of a Swedish-speaking minority in Finland and the sound of the language seemed to better suit the band 's `` trollish '' outfit .

Finntroll is an extreme metal and folk metal band from Helsinki , Finland .
On January 29 , 2006 , Tapio Wilska , vocalist of the band since 2002 , was fired from the band .
They combine elements of black metal , death metal , and folk metal with a type of Finnish folk music called humppa .

Yorkshire and the Humber is one of the nine government office regions of England .
It covers most of the historic county of Yorkshire , along with the part of northern Lincolnshire that was , from 1974 to 1996 , within the former shire county of Humberside .

A groove may be through , meaning that it passes all the way through the surface and its ends are open , or stopped , meaning that one or both of the ends finish before the groove meets edge of the surface .
Typically , a groove is used to house the panels in frame and panel construction and the bottoms of drawers .
In joinery , a groove is a slot or trench cut into a member which runs parallel to the grain .
Grooves are used for a range of purposes in cabinet making and other woodworking fields .
A groove is thus differentiated from a dado , which runs across the grain .

Currently , one can fairly easily update the BIOS in a modern PC ; devices like video cards or modems often rely on firmware dynamically loaded by a device driver and may thus get transparently updated through the operating system update mechanisms .
Firmware is also a relative term , as most embedded devices contain firmware at more than one level .

When he realized that Severus had other intentions , Albinus had himself declared Emperor in 195 but was defeated by Septimius Severus at the Battle of Lugdunum on 19 February 197 .
However , three other prominent Romans challenged for the throne : Pescennius Niger in Syria , Clodius Albinus in Britain , and Septimius Severus in Pannonia .
The Year of the Five Emperors refers to the year 193 AD , in which there were five claimants for the title of Roman Emperor .
The five were Pertinax , Didius Julianus , Pescennius Niger , Clodius Albinus and Septimius Severus .
Clodius Albinus initially supported Septimius Severus believing that he would succeed him .
Consolidating his power , Septimius Severus battled Pescennius Niger at Cyzicus and Nicea in 193 and then decisively defeated him at Issus in 194 .
Later that day , Didius Julianus outmaneuvered Titus Flavius Sulpicianus -LRB- Pertinax 's father-in-law and also the new City Prefect -RRB- for the title of Emperor .
The year 193 opened with the murder of Commodus on New Year 's Eve , 31 December 192 and the proclamation of the City Prefect Pertinax as Emperor on New Year 's Day , 1 January 193 .
Didius Julianus however offered 25,000 to each soldier to win the auction and was proclaimed Emperor by the Roman Senate on 28 March .
Flavius Sulpicianus offered to pay each soldier 20,000 sestertii to buy their loyalty -LRB- eight times their annual salary ; also the same amount offered by Marcus Aurelius to secure their favors in 161 -RRB- .
Costing Â # 71.4 million -LRB- 2005\/6 -RRB- , it is the BBC 's most expensive national radio network and is considered by many to be the corporation 's flagship .
The controller of Radio 4 is Gwyneth Williams .
The station has also been designated as the UK 's national broadcaster in times of national emergency such as a war : if all other radio stations were forced to close , Radio 4 would still carry on broadcasting .
Radio 4 carries these regular weather forecasts for shipping and gale warnings because the long-wave service can be received clearly at sea around the coasts of Britain and Ireland .
It replaced the BBC Home Service in 1967 .
BBC Radio 4 is a domestic radio station in the United Kingdom that broadcasts a wide variety of spoken-word programs , including news , drama , comedy , science and history .
There are occasional concerts , and documentaries related to various forms of popular music , almost entirely absent from the station until fairly recently , are broadcast from time to time , and ball-by-ball commentaries of most test cricket matches played by England are broadcast on long wave for over 70 days a year which means listeners rely on FM broadcasts or increasingly DAB for mainstream Radio 4 broadcasts for a fifth of the year .
A sister station , now BBC Radio 4 Extra , broadcasts archive Radio 4 programs and some extended content .
Radio 4 is the second most popular British domestic radio station , after Radio 2 , and was named `` UK Radio Station of the Year '' at the 2003 , 2004 and 2008 Sony Radio Academy Awards .

In this way , the United Kingdom became the union of the kingdoms of England , Ireland and Scotland . Disputes within Ireland over the terms of Irish Home Rule led eventually to the partition of the island in 1921 , with Dominion status for the Irish Free State in 1922 while Northern Ireland remained part of the UK .
The UK nevertheless remains a great power with leading economic , cultural , military , scientific and political influence .
It was the world 's first industrialised country and the world 's foremost power during the 19th and early 20th centuries , but the economic and social cost of two world wars and the decline of its empire in the latter half of the 20th century diminished its leading role in global affairs .
Almost a century later the Kingdom of Ireland merged with the Kingdom of Great Britain to form the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland with the passing of the Act of Union 1800 .
The UK is a developed country , with the world 's sixth largest economy by nominal GDP and eighth largest economy by purchasing power parity .
It is the ultimate legislative authority in the United Kingdom since the devolved parliament in Scotland and devolved assemblies in Northern Ireland , and Wales are not sovereign bodies and could , theoretically , be abolished by the UK parliament .
It is a Member State of the European Union , a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council , and a member of the Commonwealth of Nations , G8 , G20 , NATO , OECD , the Council of Europe and the World Trade Organization .

His best-known work is The Threepenny Opera -LRB- 1928 -RRB- , a reworking of John Gay 's The Beggar 's Opera written in collaboration with Bertolt Brecht .
A prominent and popular Jewish composer , Weill was officially denounced for his socialist views and populist sympathies , and became a target of the Nazi authorities , who criticized and even interfered with performances of his later stage works , such as Aufstieg und Fall der Stadt Mahagonny -LRB- Rise and Fall of the City of Mahagonny , 1930 -RRB- , Die BÃ 1\/4 rgschaft -LRB- 1932 -RRB- , and Der Silbersee -LRB- 1933 -RRB- .

Engel directed the original production of The Threepenny Opera in 1928 . It contains Weill 's most famous song , `` Mack the Knife '' -LRB- `` Die Moritat von Mackie Messer '' -RRB- .
Weill 's working association with Brecht , although successful , came to an end over politics in 1930 .

Angel is an American television series , a spin-off of the television series Buffy the Vampire Slayer .

The Capetian dynasty is the largest and oldest European royal house , consisting of the descendants of Hugh Capet of France in the male line .
In contemporary times , both King Juan Carlos of Spain and Grand Duke Henri of Luxembourg are members of this family , both through the Bourbon branch of the dynasty .

Some countries have a different emergency number for each of the different emergency services ; these often differ only by the last digit .
Many countries ' public telephone networks have a single emergency telephone number , sometimes known as the universal emergency telephone number or occasionally the emergency services number , that allows a caller to contact local emergency services for assistance .
An emergency telephone number call may be answered by either a telephone operator or an emergency service dispatcher .
The emergency telephone number is a special case in the country 's telephone number plan .
This `` antisymmetric wavefunction '' behavior implies that fermions are subject to the Pauli exclusion principle , i.e. no two fermions can occupy the same quantum state at the same time . This results in `` rigidity '' or `` stiffness '' of states that include fermions -LRB- atomic nuclei , atoms , molecules , etc. -RRB- , so fermions are sometimes said to be the constituents of matter , while bosons are said to be the particles that transmit interactions -LRB- i.e. force carriers -RRB- or the constituents of electromagnetic radiation .

The Standard Model recognizes two types of elementary fermions : quarks and leptons .

Drosophila pseudoobscura is a species of fruit fly , used extensively in lab studies of speciation .
Dodd 's experiment has been easy for many others to replicate , including with other kinds of fruit flies and foods .
In 2005 , D. pseudoobscura was the second Drosophila species to have its genome sequenced , after the model organism Drosophila melanogaster .
Diane Dodd was able to show allopatric speciation by reproductive isolation in D. pseudoobscura after only eight generations using different food types , starch and maltose .

The LÃ 1\/4 beck law was the constitution of a municipal form of government developed at LÃ 1\/4 beck in Schleswig-Holstein after it was made a free city in 1226 .
An official LÃ 1\/4 beck law transcript was never available or used until the revised edition of 1586 was printed by printer Johann Balhorn , but rather LÃ 1\/4 beck was the a leader in German cities giving rights to town citizens and overturning aristocratic privilege .
Later in the 13th century , cities governed by the LÃ 1\/4 beck Law formed into a powerful trade association , the Hanseatic League , which amounted to a confederacy with headquarters at LÃ 1\/4 beck .
The municipality was formed in 1882 by splitting from Vergeletto .

The Gasterosteidae are a family of fish including the sticklebacks .
However several of the species have a number of recognized subspecies , and the taxonomy of the family is thought to be in need of revision .
The males construct a nest from vegetation held together by secretions from their kidneys .
The males then attract females to the nest who lay their eggs inside where the male can fertilise them .
The male then guards the eggs until they hatch .
Sticklebacks are distinguished by the presence of strong and clearly isolated spines in the dorsal fin .
FishBase currently recognizes sixteen species in the family , grouped in five genera .
An unusual feature of sticklebacks is that they have no scales , although some species have bony armor plates .
The Great Seal was first used publicly in 1782 .
The obverse of the great seal is used as the national coat of arms of the United States . It is officially used on documents such as United States passports , military insignia , embassy placards , and various flags .
As a coat of arms , the design has official colors ; the physical Great Seal itself , as affixed to paper , is monochrome .
The Great Seal of the United States is used to authenticate certain documents issued by the United States federal government .
The obverse of the great seal is used as the national coat of arms of the United States .
The Victoria Cross -LRB- VC -RRB- is the highest military decoration which is , or has been , awarded for valor `` in the face of the enemy '' to members of the armed forces of various Commonwealth countries , and previous British Empire territories .
Since then , the medal has been awarded 1,356 times to 1,353 individual recipients .
As a result , the original Victoria Cross is sometimes referred to as the `` Commonwealth Victoria Cross '' or the `` Imperial Victoria Cross '' , to distinguish it from the newer awards .
The VC was introduced on 29 January 1856 by Queen Victoria to honor acts of valor during the Crimean War .
Only 13 medals , nine to members of the British Army , and four to the Australian Army , have been awarded since the Second World War .
It takes precedence over all other orders , decorations and medals .
The Luxembourg national football team is the national football team of Luxembourg , and is controlled by the Luxembourg Football Federation .

The treaty was a mutual defense treaty subscribed to by eight communist states in Eastern Europe .

The Don Cossacks , who settled the fertile valley of the river in the 16th and 17th centuries , were named for the river .
It rises in the town of Novomoskovsk 60 kilometres southeast from Tula , southeast of Moscow , and flows for a distance of about 1,950 kilometres -LRB- 1,220 mi -RRB- to the Sea of Azov .
In modern literature , the Don is often featured in the works of Mikhail Aleksandrovich Sholokhov , a writer from the stanitsa of Veshenskaya .
In antiquity , the river was viewed as the border between Europe and Asia by some ancient Greek geographers .
In the Book of Jubilees , it is mentioned as being part of the border , beginning with its easternmost point up to its mouth , between the allotment of Japheth to the north and that of Shem to the south , sons of Noah .
The Khazar fortress of Sarkel used to dominate this point in the Middle Ages .
105 kilometres -LRB- 65 mi -RRB- -RRB- , connecting both rivers , is a major waterway .
This part of the river saw heavy fighting during Operation Uranus , one of the turning points of the Second World War .
Tanais appears in ancient Greek sources as both the name of the river and of a city on it , situated in the Maeotian marshes .
During the times of the old Scythians , it was known in Greek as the TanaÃ s , and has been a major trading route ever since .
The name derives from Scythian -LRB- East Iranian -RRB- DÄ nu `` river '' , akin to Ossetic don `` river '' , and Pashto dand -LRB- Ú Ù Ú -RRB- or dun -LRB- depending on dialect -RRB- `` pond , lake '' .
At its easternmost point , the Don comes near the Volga , and the Volga-Don Canal -LRB- length ca .
From its source , the river first flows southeast to Voronezh , then southwest to its mouth .
The main city on the river is Rostov on Don , its main tributary , the Donets .

The term heterodox is occasionally used by some Christians to refer to themselves when they are in disagreement with orthodox understandings , but voice this disagreement while still maintaining the overall value of the tradition .
By contrast , a denial of the doctrine of `` Original Sin '' -LRB- thereby negating the necessity of baptism for children -RRB- or Papal Infallibilityâ '' would be labeled heretical .
As an adjective , heterodox is commonly used to describe a subject as `` characterized by departure from accepted beliefs or standards '' -LRB- status quo -RRB- .
Many Roman Catholics profess some heterodox views , either on doctrinal or social issues .
A heterodox Catholic might profess the belief that unbaptized infants are offered the option to accept or deny salvation by God at their judgment .
The belief is not orthodox , as the Church does not profess a belief as to what happens to unbaptized infants ; however , it is also not heresy , as the Church accepts that such a scenario might be possible .
The heterodox Christian therefore remains in the tradition and attempts to stimulate constructive dialog around issues with which they disagree .
Heterodoxy is generally defined as `` any opinions or doctrines at variance with an official or orthodox position '' .
In the Eastern Orthodox Church , the term is used to refer to Christian churches not belonging to the Eastern Orthodox communion and holding doctrines different from those of Orthodox Christianity .
For example , the orthodox Catholic position on unbaptized infants is that their fate is uncertain , and `` the Church can only entrust them to the mercy of God '' -LRB- Catechism of the Catholic Church 1261 -RRB- .
For example , in the Roman Catholic and Eastern Orthodox churches heterodoxy may describe beliefs that differ from strictly orthodox views but that fall short of heresy .
Nicknamed `` Tige , '' Anderson was noted as one of Robert E. Lee 's hardest-fighting subordinates .
George Thomas Anderson -LRB- February 3 , 1824 -- April 4 , 1901 -RRB- was a general in the Confederate States Army during the American Civil War .

Software development -LRB- also known as application development , software design , designing software , software application development , enterprise application development , or platform development -RRB- is the development of a software product . The term `` software development '' may be used to refer to the activity of computer programming , which is the process of writing and maintaining the source code , but in a broader sense of the term it includes all that is involved between the conception of the desired software through to the final manifestation of the software , ideally in a planned and structured process .

The Dhund Abbasi are a tribe of northern Pakistan .
The tribe claims descent from Dhond Khan -LRB- a nickname of Shah Wali Khan -RRB- and â Abbas ibn â Abd al-Muttalib and hence are known as Dhund Abbasi .
The rule of the Abbasi extended eastwards across Afghanistan into the South Asian subcontinent , covering the eastern part of modern-day Pakistan .
The descendants of Abbas displaced the Umayyad rulers and were known as the Abbasids . This dynasty governed for 500 years from Baghdad , Iraq .
The tribe is spread throughout Circle Bakote , Poonch District , Bagh , Kashmir , and the Murree Hills area .
The tribe speak the Dhundi-Kairali dialect .
Although the tribe traces its roots back to Abbas , it is more likely that the Dhund Abbasi people are descended from the Abbasid dynasty .
The following lists all rail stations of the Mass Rapid Transit -LRB- MRT -RRB- system in Singapore , with underground stations listed in italics .
There are currently 78 stations in operation with another one completed but operationally delayed until its surrounding area is more built up .
Many more are currently in various stages of planning and construction -LRB- as shown in the latest system map -RRB- .

The movie received mainly negative reviews .

The city is built on hills surrounding Port Jackson which is commonly known as Sydney Harbour , where the iconic Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge are featured prominently .

The presidency armies were named after the presidencies : the Bengal Army , the Madras Army and the Bombay Army .
The three separate Presidency Armies therefore continued to exist , and their European officers continued to be listed as members of the Bengal , Madras or Bombay Army rather than the British Army .
These troops are often referred to as â H.M. â s Regimentsâ or â Royal regimentsâ .
Following the Indian Mutiny of 1857-58 and the consequent abolition of the East India Company , its European regiments were amalgamated in 1860 with the British Army , but its â Nativeâ regiments were not .
From the mid-eighteenth century onwards , the Crown began to despatch regiments of the regular British Army to India , to reinforce the Companyâ s armies .
All three armies contained European regiments in which both the officers and men were Europeans , as well as a larger number of â Nativeâ regiments , in which the officers were Europeans and the other ranks were Indians .
In 1895 the three presidency armies were merged into a united Indian Army , which in turn gave rise to the armies of India and of Pakistan following Independence in 1947 .
However , the Presidency Armies began to be described collectively as the Indian Army .
The presidency armies were the armies of the three presidencies of the East India Company 's rule in India , later the forces of the British Crown in India .
The Bengal Army , Madras Army , and Bombay Army were quite distinct , each with its own Regiments and cadre of European officers .
From the mid-eighteenth century , the East India Company began to maintain armies at each of its three main stations , or Presidencies of British India , at Calcutta -LRB- Bengal -RRB- , Madras and Bombay .
The presidency armies , like the presidencies themselves , belonged to the Company until the Indian Mutiny of 1857 , when the Crown took over all three presidencies .
BÃ 1\/4 llingen is a largely German language-speaking municipality located in the Belgian province of LiÃ ge .
Melrose Place is an American television primetime soap opera that aired on Fox in the United States from July 8 , 1992 , to May 24 , 1999 for seven seasons .
The 8-day Blackpool Dance Festival is the world 's first and most famous annual ballroom dance competition of international significance , held in the Empress Ballroom at the Winter Gardens , Blackpool , England since 1920 .
It covers Ballroom and Latin American dancing , and incorporates the British Open Championships in categories of adult amateur and professional couples and formation teams .
It is also the largest ballroom competition : in 2003 , 1539 couples from 54 countries took part in the festival .
The annual World Professional Dancesport Championship is often held in Blackpool -LRB- 4 times between 1989 and 2005 -RRB- , but is not connected with the Dance Festival .
As of the early 21st century the festival is held in May .
In 2005 two new categories were introduced : the British Rising Star Amateur Ballroom and Latin Competitions .
Two invitation events , the Professional Team Match and the Exhibition Competition , create much interest .
The Junior Dance Festival , Blackpool Sequence Dance Festival which incorporates the British Sequence Championships , and British National Dance Festival are also held annually in Blackpool .

William Jefferson Hague -LRB- born 26 March 1961 -RRB- is a British Conservative politician .
Following the Conservatives ' defeat in the 1997 general election , he was elected as leader of the Conservative Party .
Educated at Ripon Grammar School , a selective grammar school , then the University of Oxford and INSEAD , Hague was first elected to the House of Commons in a by-election in 1989 .
The Complutense University of Madrid -LRB- , UCM -RRB- is a university in Madrid , and one of the oldest universities in the world .
It is located on a sprawling campus that occupies the entirety of the Ciudad Universitaria district of Madrid , with annexes in the district of Somosaguas in the neighboring city of Pozuelo de AlarcÃ n.
According to the annual university rankings conducted by El Mundo , the Complutense University ranks as the top public university in Spain , with its Schools of Philosophy , Spanish Literature , History , Pharmacy , Optometry , Journalism , Psychology , and Sociology holding the top national rankings .

A second or third subdivision level is referred to with another number each .
The standard is developed and regulated by the European Union , and thus only covers the member states of the EU in detail .
NUTS is thus in some extent similar to the ISO 3166-2 standard , as well as the FIPS 10-4 standard of the United States .
In case the subdivision has more than nine entities , capital letters are used to continue the numbering .
Note that not all countries have every level of division , depending on their size .
There are three levels of NUTS defined , with two levels of local administrative units -LRB- LAUs -RRB- below .
These were called NUTS levels 4 and 5 until July 2003 , but were officially abolished by regulation , although they are sometimes still described as such .
In addition to the full three levels for the European Union countries , all other countries have a NUTS code with a two-letter code for a continent and two numbers for the country , and for the USA , Canada and Australia the states , provinces , and territories are numbered separately .
The Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics or Nomenclature of Units for Territorial Statistics , -LRB- NUTS , after the French nomenclature d'unit Ã s territoriales statistiques -RRB- is a geocode standard for referencing the subdivisions of countries for statistical purposes .
The subdivision of the country is then referred to with one number .
A NUTS code begins with a two-letter code referencing the country , which is identical to the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code -LRB- except UK instead of GB for the United Kingdom -RRB- .
Each numbering starts with 1 , as 0 is used for the upper level .
It also includes violence against religious institutions , persons , or objects , when the violence is motivated by the religious aspect of the target of the violence .
It is possible that the Bantu languages originated in the region of eastern Nigeria or Cameroon .
Parts of the Bantu area include languages from other language families -LRB- see map -RRB- .
Zulu comes second with 10.3 million speakers .
Some estimate that about 2000 years ago the Bantu people spread southwards and eastwards , introducing agriculture and iron working and colonizing much of the continent in the Bantu expansion .
According to Ethnologue the Bantu language with the largest number of speakers as a first language is Shona with 10.8 million speakers in Zimbabwe .
Some words from various Bantu languages have been borrowed into western languages .
The Bantu languages -LRB- technically Narrow Bantu languages -RRB- constitute a traditional sub-branch of the Niger-Congo languages .
Bantu languages are spoken largely east and south of the present day country of Cameroon ; i.e. , in the regions commonly known as central Africa , east Africa , and southern Africa .

After unifying the region with his kingdom in the early 700s BC , king Argishtis I of Urartu resettled many of its inhabitants to his newly built city of Erebuni -LRB- modern day Armenian capital Yerevan -RRB- .
Sophene , or , -RRB- was a province of the Armenian Kingdom and of the Roman Empire , located in the south-west of the kingdom .
Zareh and his descendants ruled the kingdom of Sophene until it was reunified with Greater Armenia by Tigranes the Great in the 80s BC .
It currently lies in modern-day southeastern Turkey .
Sophene later become part of the Roman Empire , and was made into a province of the Roman Empire .
In the early 200s BC , at the instigation of the Seleucid Empire , which was trying to weaken the Armenian kingdom , Sophene , split from Greater Armenia , forming the Kingdom of Sophene .
The capital was Amida -LRB- modern DiyarbakÄ r -RRB- .
Around 54 , the province was ruled by Sohaemus of Emesa .
Following Antiochus ' defeat by Romans at the battle of Magnesia in 190 BC , both Zareh and Artashes declared themselves independent kings .
Pompey gave Sophene to Tigranes , after defeating his father Tigranes the Great .
In 530 , Sophene was included into the province of Armenia IV .
The region that was to become Sophene was part of the kingdom of Ararat -LRB- Urartu -RRB- in the 8th-7th centuries BC .
Around 200 BC , in his attempt to finally subjugate Armenia , Seleucian king Antiochus III conquered both Greater Armenia and Sophene , installing Armenian generals Artaxias I and Zariadres as governors-strategoses respectively in each kingdom .
According to Anania Shirakatsi 's Ashkharatsuyts -LRB- `` World Atlas , '' 7th century -RRB- , Tsopk -LRB- Sophene -RRB- was the 2nd among the 15 provinces of Greater Armenia .
The kingdom was ruled by a branch of the Armenian royal dynasty of Orontids .
Around 600 BC , Sophene became part of the newly emerged ancient Armenian Kingdom of the Orontids .
After Alexander the Great 's campaigns in 330s BC and the subsequent collapse of the Achaemenid Empire , Sophene remained part of the newly independent kingdom of Greater Armenia .
Monkey brains are eaten as a delicacy in South East Asia , China , and Africa .
Monkeys are generally considered to be intelligent and , unlike apes , monkeys usually have tails .
In this version of the fable , a character named Moneke is the son of Martin the Ape . The word Moneke may have been derived from the Italian monna , which means `` a female ape '' .
All primates that are not prosimians or apes are monkeys .
A group of monkeys may be referred to as a mission or a tribe .
Some characteristics are shared among the groups ; most New World monkeys have prehensile tails while Old World monkeys have non-prehensile tails or no visible tail at all .
Thus , scientifically speaking , monkeys are paraphyletic -LRB- not a single coherent group -RRB- and Old World monkeys are actually more closely related to the apes than they are to the New World monkeys .
A navel piercing -LRB- also referred to as a belly button piercing -RRB- is a type of body piercing .
It may heal very quickly and with no problems , like an ear piercing , or may heal more like a surface piercing with the associated extended healing time .

Matanzas is one of the provinces of Cuba .
The resort town of Varadero is also located in this province .
The north-western coast is largely rocky , with a few beaches , while the north-eastern coast has numerous small cays of its coast -LRB- part of Sabana-Camaguey Archipelago -RRB- , and scrubland and mangroves near the shoreline .
East of the peninsula lies the Bay of Pigs , the site of the failed US backed invasion .
The second largest in Cuba , Matanzas province is largely flat , with its highest point -LRB- Pan de Matanzas -RRB- at only 380m above sea level .
The southern coast has one of Cuba 's most distinctive features : an enormous marsh , CiÃ naga de Zapata that covers both the southern part of the province and the Zapata Peninsula .
Of Cuba 's provinces , Matanzas is one of the most industrialised , with petroleum wells , refineries , supertanker facilities , and 21 sugar mills to process the harvests of the fields of sugarcane in the province .

Kilkenny is a city and is the county town of the eponymous County Kilkenny in Ireland .
Kilkenny borough has a population of 8,591 , however the majority of the population of Kilkenny live outside the borough boundary .
People from Kilkenny are often referred to as Cats . The seat of the Roman Catholic Bishop of Ossory is at St. Mary 's Cathedral and the Church of Ireland Bishop of Cashel and Ossory is at St. Canice 's Cathedral .

In 1609 King James I of England granted Kilkenny a Royal Charter giving it the status of a city .

The Neckar is a major right tributary of the River Rhine .

In physiology , transduction is the conversion of a stimulus from one form to another .
The light causes a conformational change in a protein called rhodopsin .
For example , in the visual system , sensory cells called rod and cone cells in the retina convert the physical energy of light signals into electrical impulses that travel to the brain .
Thus , in this example , more light hitting the photoreceptor results in the transduction of a signal into fewer electrical impulses , effectively communicating that stimulus to the brain .

After the English Civil War and the execution of Charles I , the republic 's existence was initially declared by An Act declaring England to be a Commonwealth by the Rump Parliament , on 19 May 1649 .
The Commonwealth of England was the republic which ruled first England , and then Ireland and Scotland from 1649 to 1660 .
The term Commonwealth is , however , loosely used to describe the system of government during the whole of 1649 to 1660 , when England was de facto , and arguably de jure , a republic -LRB- or , to monarchists , under the English Interregnum -RRB- .
The government during 1653 to 1659 is properly called The Protectorate , and took the form of direct personal rule by Oliver Cromwell and , after his death , his son Richard , as Lord Protector ; this arrangement led to the state being labeled a `` crowned republic '' .

Hoover Dam , once known as Boulder Dam , is a concrete arch-gravity dam in the Black Canyon of the Colorado River , on the border between the US states of Arizona and Nevada .
Hoover Dam is a major tourist attraction ; nearly a million people tour the dam each year . Heavily traveled U.S. 93 ran along the dam 's crest until October 2010 , when the Hoover Dam Bypass opened .

Domesday Book is the record of the great survey of much of England and parts of Wales completed in 1086 , executed for William I of England , or William the Conqueror .
In 1986 , the BBC released the BBC Domesday Project , the results of a project to create a survey to mark the 900th anniversary of the original Domesday Book . In August 2006 the contents of Domesday went on-line , with an English translation of the book 's Latin .

As technology increased and demand for the resources remained high , catches far exceeded the sustainable limit for whale stocks .
In 1986 the International Whaling Commission -LRB- IWC -RRB- banned commercial whaling so that stocks might recover . While the moratorium has been successful in averting the extinction of whale species due to overhunting , contemporary whaling is subject to intense debate .
Whaling is the hunting of whales mainly for meat and oil .
In the late 1930s more than 50,000 whales were killed annually and by the middle of the century whale stocks were not being replenished .
The reason for the moratorium -LRB- on commercial whaling -RRB- was scientific uncertainty about the number of whales .
In 1986 the International Whaling Commission -LRB- IWC -RRB- banned commercial whaling so that stocks might recover .
Its earliest forms date to at least 3000 BC .
Anti-whaling countries and environmental groups contend that those stocks remain vulnerable and that whaling is immoral , unsustainable , and should remain banned permanently .
Piraeus is the third largest municipality in Greece with an official population of 175,697 -LRB- in 2001 -RRB- .
Piraeus is now the third largest municipality in Greece ; the city proper with its suburbs form the Piraeus urban area , which is incorporated in the Athens urban area , thus making Piraeus an integral part of the Greek capital .

With Nicolai 's departure in 1847 , the orchestra nearly folded , and was not very active until 1860 , when Karl Anton Eckert joined as conductor .
The Vienna Philharmonic -LRB- in German : Wiener Philharmoniker -RRB- is an orchestra in Austria , regularly considered one of the finest in the world .
During Richter 's tenure , the orchestra gave the premieres of the 2nd and 3rd symphonies of Johannes Brahms , and the 8th symphony of Anton Bruckner .
Each New Year 's Day since 1 January 1941 , the VPO has sponsored the Vienna New Year 's Concerts , dedicated to the music of the Strauss family composers , and particularly that of Johann Strauss II .
These have included a great many of the world 's best known conductors , including Richard Strauss , Arturo Toscanini , Hans Knappertsbusch , Wilhelm FurtwÃ ngler , John Barbirolli , Carlo Maria Giulini , Georg Solti , Erich Kleiber , James Levine , Zubin Mehta , Carlos Kleiber , Claudio Abbado , Riccardo Muti , Nikolaus Harnoncourt , Pierre Boulez , Lorin Maazel , Mariss Jansons , Daniel Barenboim and Valery Gergiev .
Since 1933 , the orchestra has had no single principal conductor , but instead has a number of guest conductors .
Three conductors , however , were particularly associated with the post-war era : Herbert von Karajan and Karl BÃ hm , who were made honorary conductors , and Leonard Bernstein , who was made an honorary member of the orchestra .
He gave a series of four subscription concerts , and since then , the orchestra has given concerts continuously .
The orchestra can trace its origins to 1842 , when Otto Nicolai formed the Philharmonische Academie ; which was a fully independent orchestra and which took all its decisions by a democratic vote of all its members .
From 1875 to 1898 Hans Richter was principal conductor , except for the season 1882-1883 when he was in dispute with the orchestral committee .
Gustav Mahler held the post from 1898 to 1901 , and under his baton the orchestra played abroad for the first time at the 1900 Paris World Exposition .
Subsequent conductors were Felix Weingartner , Wilhelm FurtwÃ ngler and Clemens Krauss .
Kapellen -LRB- old spelling : Cappellen -RRB- is a municipality located in the Belgian province of Antwerp . The municipality consists only of the town of Kapellen proper .
The Montes Taurus were named by Johannes Hevelius after the Taurus Mountains in southern Turkey .
These peaks are located on a highland region to the east of the Mare Serenitatis , in the northeastern quadrant of the Moon 's near side .
The selenographic coordinates of this range are 28.4 Â N , 41.1 Â E , and they have a diameter of 172 km .
At the southwestern edge of the range is the crater RÃ mer , and Newcomb is located in the northeastern section .
Some of the peaks within the range achieve heights of 3000 m.
A number of craters lie embedded within this range .
Several satellite craters also lie throughout the Montes Taurus .
Montes Taurus is a rugged , jumbled mountainous region on the Moon .

He claims that in Hitler 's `` RÃ hm Purge '' speech to the Reichstag on July 13 , 1934 , the third group of `` pathological enemies of the state '' that Hitler lists are , in fact , the Freikorps fighters .
Between World War I and World War II the term was also used for the paramilitary organizations that arose during the period of the Weimar Germany .
Freikorps leaders symbolically gave their old battle flags to Hitler 's Sturmabteilung -LRB- SA -RRB- and Schutzstaffel -LRB- SS -RRB- on November 9 , 1933 in a huge ceremony .
Historian Robert Waite claims that Hitler had many problems with the Freikorps .
The meaning of the word `` freikorps '' changed over time .
Later , Ludwig Adolf Wilhelm von LÃ 1\/4 tzow , a survivor of Schill 's Freikorps , formed the LÃ 1\/4 tzow Free Corps which took part in the German War of Liberation .
They were also used to defeat the Bavarian Soviet Republic in 1919 .
They received considerable support from Minister of Defense Gustav Noske , a member of the Social Democratic Party of Germany , who used them to crush the German Revolution and the Marxist Spartacist League and arrest Karl Liebknecht and Rosa Luxemburg , who were killed on 15 January 1919 .
Numerous future members and leaders of the Nazi Party had served in the Freikorps , including Ernst RÃ hm , future head of the Sturmabteilung , or SA , Heinrich Himmler , future head of the Schutzstaffel , or SS , and Rudolf HÃ Ã , the future Kommandant of the Auschwitz concentration camp .
In 1920 , Adolf Hitler had just begun his political career as the leader of the tiny and as-yet-unknown German Workers Party -LRB- soon renamed the National Socialist German Workers Party , NSDAP -RRB- in Munich .
Many of the Freikorps had joined the SA , so when the Night of the Long Knives came , they were among those targeted for killing or arrest , including Ehrhardt and RÃ hm .
The Freikorps were regarded as unreliable by regular armies , so they were mainly used as sentries and for minor duties .
After 1918 , the term was used for the paramilitary organizations that sprang up around Germany as soldiers returned in defeat from World War I. They were the key Weimar paramilitary groups active during that time .
The first Freikorps were recruited by Frederick II of Prussia in the 18th century during the Seven Years ' War .
Hermann Ehrhardt , founder and leader of Marinebrigade Ehrhardt , and his deputy Commander Eberhard Kautter , leaders of the Viking League , refused to help Hitler and Erich Ludendorff in their Beer Hall Putsch and conspired against them .

The Achaemenid Empire -LRB- c. 550 â `` 330 B.C.E. -RRB- , , also known as the Persian Empire , was the successor state of the Median Empire , expanding to eventually rule over significant portions of the ancient world which at around 500 B.C.E. stretched from the Indus Valley in the east , to Thrace and Macedon on the northeastern border of Greece .

In a 1982 case involving hereditary deafness , the Supreme Court of California was the first state supreme court to endorse the child 's right to sue for wrongful life , but in the same decision , limited the child 's recovery to special damages .
Historically , only parents could sue for their own damages incurred as a result of the birth of a disabled child -LRB- e.g. , the mother 's own pregnancy medical bills and cost of psychiatric treatment for both parents ' emotional distress resulting from the realization that their child was disabled -RRB- .
This cause of action is known as wrongful birth .
Typically a child and the parents will sue a doctor or a hospital for failing to provide information about the disability during the pregnancy , or a genetic disposition before the pregnancy .
In four U.S. states , the child is allowed to bring a wrongful life cause of action for such damages .
Most other jurisdictions , including New York , England and Ontario , have refused to allow the wrongful life cause of action .

Thongchai `` Bird '' McIntyre -LRB- born Albert Thongchai McIntyre , December 8 , 1958 -RRB- is a Thai pop singer who released his debut album in 1986 .
Bird played his first TV series with Kai while still working in a bank .
He was featured on CNN and Variety magazine .
It marks the first time in history a Thai pop artist has made an international tour .
His popular singles released recently include luk thung singles Mah Tummai -LRB- with Jintara Poonlarp -RRB- , Fan Ja -LRB- with Jintara and Jarin B. -LRB- Joey Boy -RRB- , Nat Myria Benedetti and Katreeya English -RRB- , Lao Su Kan Fang , and Yak Tham Kor Tob and Mai Kang Ying Pae from his album `` Volume One '' .
Thongchai McIntyre was born in Bangkok in 1958 to parents James and Udom McIntyre .
He is the most successful singer in Thailand , having sold more than 20 million albums .
Westerners became aware of him in the mid nineties as he became the first Thai artist to receive an International MTV Award , be featured in the most high budget Thai film at the time , `` Sunset at Chaopraya '' -LRB- which reached international acclaim in Japan as well as the U.S. -RRB- .
Among his best-known songs are Duay Rak Lae Pook Pan , Koo Gud , Sabai Sabai and Kob Jai Jing Jing .
He started working in a bank as an officer .
Thongchai McIntyre or `` Bird Thongchai '' is best known for his string -LRB- Thai pop -RRB- and luk thung music .
While working in a bank , he had a chance to meet the famous Thai TV producer `` Kai Varayuth '' who saw entertainment talent in Bird .
His father died when Bird was still a child .
He reached the height of his musical career in the early nineties .
In late 2007 , he released another album entitled `` Simply Bird '' , which features songs such as Chuay Rap Tee and Mee Tae Kid Tueng .
His most memorable role was that of Captain Kobori from Koo Kam , a tragic love story between a Japanese soldier -LRB- played by Bird -RRB- and a local Thai girl during the World War II where he starred in both a TV series and reprised his role in the 1996 film adaptation , Sunset at Chaophraya .
His family were musicians , hence he enjoyed an upbringing in a musical environment .
In 2010 , Bird made his first international tour in Los Angeles and the 50th Anniversary of Lincoln Center in New York .
He has also acted in numerous films , on television , musicals , and in commercials .
His Grammy label mates have previously only performed at local venues .
An award winning documentary on his life entitled `` Crossing Borders '' directed by Phanjanit Garnploog can be seen at St. John 's University in New York which includes rare interviews with the director .

The choice of Bonn was made mainly due to the advocacy of Konrad Adenauer , a former Cologne Mayor and Chancellor of West Germany after World War II , who came from that area , despite the fact that Frankfurt already had most of the required facilities and using Bonn was estimated to be 95 million DM more expensive than using Frankfurt .
Because of its relatively small size for a capital city , Bonn was sometimes referred to , jokingly , as the Bundeshauptstadt ohne nennenswertes Nachtleben -LRB- Federal capital without noteworthy night-life -RRB- or the ` Bundesdorf ' -LRB- Federal Village -RRB- .
It 's used for receptions of guests of the town , and as a bureau for the mayor .

This axis is interrupted by a railway line and Bonn Hauptbahnhof , a building erected in 1883\/84 .
Beethoven 's birth place is located in Bonngasse near the market place .
Following World War II , Bonn was in the British zone of occupation , and in 1949 became the capital of West Germany .
Bonn 's international airport is Cologne Bonn Airport .
The Poppelsdorfer Allee is an alley flanked by chestnut trees which had the first horsecar of the town . It connects the KurfÃ 1\/4 rstliches Schloss with the Poppelsdorfer Schloss , a palace that was built as a resort to prince-electors in the first half of the 18th century , and whose grounds are now a botanical garden -LRB- the Botanischer Garten Bonn -RRB- .
The three highest buildings in the city are the radio mast of WDR in Bonn-Venusberg -LRB- 180 m -RRB- , the headquarters of the Deutsche Post called Post Tower -LRB- 162.5 m -RRB- and the former building for the German members of parliament Langer Eugen -LRB- 114.7 m -RRB- now the new location of the UN-Campus .
Next to the market place is the Old Town Hall , built in 1737 in Rococo style , under the rule of Clemens August of Bavaria .
They held that both the Bible and Christian tradition taught that alcohol is a gift from God that makes life more joyous , but that overindulgence leading to drunkenness is a sin .
Today , all three of these positions exist in Christianity , but the historic position remains the most common worldwide .
In the mid-19th century , some Protestant Christians moved from this historic position of allowing moderate use of alcohol -LRB- sometimes called moderationism -RRB- to either deciding that not imbibing was wisest in the present circumstances -LRB- abstentionism -RRB- or prohibiting all ordinary consumption of alcohol because it was believed to be a sin -LRB- prohibitionism -RRB- .
The biblical languages have several words for alcoholic beverages , and though prohibitionists and some abstentionists -LRB- see `` Current views '' below -RRB- dissent , there is a broad consensus that the words did ordinarily refer to intoxicating drinks .
Throughout the first 1,800 years of church history , Christians consumed alcoholic beverages as a common part of everyday life and nearly always used wine -LRB- that is , fermented grape juice -RRB- in their central riteâ '' the Eucharist or Lord 's Supper .
Since nearly all Christians base their views of alcohol in whole or in part on their understanding of what the Bible says about it , the Bible is an important source on the subject , along with Jewish and Christian traditions which start with the Bible and expand upon it .
Negatively , wine is personified as a mocker and beer a brawler , and drinking a cup of strong wine to the dregs and getting drunk are sometimes presented as a symbol of God 's judgment and wrath .
Positively , wine is used as a symbol of abundance and physical blessing , for example .

Moreover , given the often political IAL environment in which those that speak a language are not merely language users but adherents to its system and linguistic philosophy as well , there are two categories of those that know the language , Ido speakers and Ido supporters . Ido resembles Esperanto to a large extent , and many Esperantists have learned Ido out of curiosity while still not using it , preferring to support the more well-known Esperanto movement instead .

The pronouns of Ido were revised to make them more acoustically distinct than those of Esperanto , which all end in i. Especially the singular and plural first-person pronouns mi and ni may be difficult to distinguish in a noisy environment , so Ido has me and ni instead . Ido also distinguishes between intimate -LRB- tu -RRB- and formal -LRB- vu -RRB- second-person singular pronouns as well as plural second-person pronouns -LRB- vi -RRB- not marked for intimacy .

Romain Grosjean -LRB- born April 17 , 1986 in Geneva , Switzerland -RRB- is a racing driver , who holds dual nationality from France and Switzerland , but competes under a French racing licence .
He was the 2007 Formula Three Euroseries drivers ' champion and the inaugural GP2 Asia Series champion and drove in Formula One in 2009 .
This territory , under the Arab name Al-Andalus , became first an Emirate and then an independent Umayyad Caliphate , the Caliphate of CÃ rdoba , after the overthrowing of the dynasty in Damascus by the Abbasids .
The Mughal Empire declined in 1707 after the death of Aurangzeb and was officially abolished by the British after the Indian Rebellion of 1857 .
When the Caliphate dissolved in 1031 , the territory split into small Taifas , and gradually the Christian kingdoms started the Reconquest up to 1492 , when Granada , the last kingdom of Al-Andalus fell under the Catholic Monarchs .
Wars were between the Byzantine Empire and at first the Rashidun and then the Umayyad caliphates and resulted in the conquest of the Greater Syria , Egypt , North Africa and Armenia -LRB- Byzantine Armenia and Sassanid Armenia -RRB- .
The Muslim conquests brought about the collapse of the Sassanid Empire and a great territorial loss for the Byzantine Empire .
Most historians agree that the Sassanid Persian and Byzantine Roman empires were militarily and economically exhausted from decades of fighting one another .
In Sub-Saharan Africa , the Sahelian kingdom expanded Muslim territories far from the coast .
The modern era saw the rise of three powerful Muslim empires : the Ottoman Empire of the Middle East and Europe , the Safavid Empire of Persia and Central Asia , and the Mughal Empire of India ; along with their contest and fall to the rise of the colonial powers of Europe .
In 711 , an expedition led by Muhammad bin Qasim defeated Raja Dahir at what is now Hyderabad in Sindh and established Umayyad rule by 712 .

Hurricane Madeline is notable for being the most intense Pacific hurricane at landfall .
Hurricane Liza was the deadliest storm of the season when it killed over 600 people in Mexico .

The first millennium is a period of time that commenced on January 1 , AD 1 , and ended on December 31 , AD 1000 , of the Julian calendar .
It was named in October 2002 after the mythological Erinome , said to be a `` daughter of Celes , compelled by Venus to fall in love with Jupiter . ''
It was discovered by a team of astronomers from the University of Hawaii led by Scott S. Sheppard et al . in 2000 , and given the temporary designation .
Erinome is about 3.2 kilometres in diameter , and orbits Jupiter at an average distance of 22,986 Mm in 711.965 days , at an inclination of 164 Â to the ecliptic -LRB- 162 Â to Jupiter 's equator -RRB- , in a retrograde direction and with an eccentricity of 0.2552 .
Erinome belongs to the Carme group , made up of irregular retrograde moons orbiting Jupiter at a distance ranging between 23 and 24 Gm and at an inclination of about 165 Â .
Blood plasma is the yellow liquid component of blood in which the blood cells in whole blood are normally suspended .
It is mostly water -LRB- 93 % by volume -RRB- and contains dissolved proteins , glucose , clotting factors , mineral ions , hormones and carbon dioxide -LRB- plasma being the main medium for excretory product transportation -RRB- .
Blood plasma is prepared by spinning a tube of fresh blood containing an anti-coagulant in a centrifuge until the blood cells fall to the bottom of the tube . The blood plasma is then poured or drawn off .
It makes up about 55 % of the total blood volume .
Blood plasma is prepared by spinning a tube of fresh blood containing an anti-coagulant in a centrifuge until the blood cells fall to the bottom of the tube .
Blood serum is blood plasma without fibrinogen or the other clotting factors -LRB- i.e. , whole blood minus both the cells and the clotting factors -RRB- .
The blood plasma is then poured or drawn off .
Tavaux-et-Ponts Ã ricourt is a commune in the Aisne department in Picardy in northern France .
Sinhala is the official and national language of Sri Lanka .
It belongs to the Indo-Aryan branch of the Indo-European languages .
Sinhala is the mother tongue of the Sinhalese people , who make up the largest ethnic group in Sri Lanka , numbering about 15 million . Sinhala is also spoken by other ethnic groups in Sri Lanka , totalling about 3 million .
Sinhala has its own writing system -LRB- see Sinhala alphabet -RRB- which is a member of the Brahmic family of scripts , and a descendant of the ancient Indian Brahmi script .
The oldest Sinhala inscriptions found are from the 6th century BCE , on pottery ; the oldest existing literary works date from the 9th century CE .
The closest relative of Sinhala is the language of the Maldives and Minicoy Island -LRB- India -RRB- , Dhivehi .
Sinhala -LRB- à à ' à à à 1\/2 , ISO 15919 : siá hala , pronounced , sometimes referred by alternative spelling Singhalese -RRB- , also known as Helabasa . Sinhala is the mother tongue of the Sinhalese people , who make up the largest ethnic group in Sri Lanka , numbering about 15 million .

Beaver is a town in Carroll County , Arkansas , United States .
In 1861 , over 40 years after his death , the ride became the subject of `` Paul Revere 's Ride '' , a poem by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow .
He and William Dawes were instructed by Dr. Joseph Warren to ride from Boston to Lexington to warn John Hancock and Samuel Adams of the movements of the British Army , which was beginning a march from Boston to Lexington , ostensibly to arrest Hancock and Adams and seize the weapons stores in Concord .
At 10 pm on the night of April 18 , 1775 , Revere received instructions from Dr. Joseph Warren to ride to Lexington to warn John Hancock and Samuel Adams of the British approach .
Paul Revere -LRB- - May 10 , 1818 -RRB- was an American silversmith and a patriot in the American Revolution .
On the night of April 18 â `` 19 , 1775 , just hours before the battles of Lexington and Concord , Revere performed his `` Midnight Ride '' .
Drogue chutes are used to aid horizontal deceleration of a vehicle -LRB- a fixed-wing aircraft , or a drag racer -RRB- , or to provide stability -LRB- tandem free-fall , or space shuttle after a touchdown -RRB- .
381v -RRB- dated to ca .
Only slightly later , a more sophisticated parachute was sketched by the polymath Leonardo da Vinci in his Codex Atlanticus -LRB- fol .
Reserve parachutes are packed and deployed differently .
Exact numbers are difficult to estimate , but approximately one in a thousand sports main parachute openings malfunction , and must be cut away , although some skydivers have many hundreds of jumps and never cut away .
According to the historian of technology Lynn White , these conical and pyramidal designs , much more elaborate than early artistic jumps with rigid parasols in Asia , mark the origin of `` the parachute as we know it '' .
The feasibility of Leonardo 's pyramidal design was successfully tested in 2000 by the British Adrian Nicholas and again in 2008 by another skydiver .
If a parachute is not packed properly it can result in death because the main parachute might fail to deploy correctly or fully .
Parachutes can malfunction in several ways .
Sport skydivers are always trained to pack their own primary `` main '' parachutes .
In the U.S. and many developed countries , emergency and reserve parachutes are packed by `` riggers '' who must be trained and certified according to legal standards .
Leonardo 's canopy was held open by a square wooden frame , which alters the shape of the parachute from conical to pyramidal .
In the U.S. , the average fatality rate is considered to be about 1 in 80,000 jumps .
This yields an even smaller probability of a double malfunction , although the possibility of a main malfunction that can not be cut away causing a reserve malfunction is a very real risk .
Most skydivers also equip themselves with small barometric computers -LRB- known as an AAD or automatic activation device like Cypres , FXC or Vigil -RRB- that will automatically activate the reserve parachute if the skydiver himself has not deployed a parachute to reduce his rate of descent by a preset altitude .
They are also designed more conservatively , and are built and tested to more exacting standards , making them more reliable than main parachutes .
Malfunctions can range from minor problems that can be corrected in-flight and still be landed , to catastrophic malfunctions that require the main parachute to be cut away using a modern 3-ring release system , and the reserve be deployed .
A parachute is carefully folded , or `` packed '' to ensure that it will open reliably .
However , the primary safety advantage of a reserve chute comes from the probability of an unlikely main malfunction being multiplied by the even less likely probability of a reserve malfunction .
Most injuries and fatalities in sport skydiving occur under a fully functional main parachute because the skydiver made an error in judgment while flying the canopyâ '' resulting in high-speed impact with the ground , impact with a hazard on the ground that might otherwise have been avoided , or collision with another skydiver under canopy .
Here , the scale of the parachute is in a more favorable proportion to the weight of the jumper .
It is not known whether the Italian inventor was influenced by the earlier design , but he may have learned about the idea through the intensive oral communication among artist-engineers of the time .
Beginning on 20 November 1923 , 1,000,000,000,000 old Marks were exchanged for 1 Rentenmark so that 4.2 Rentenmarks were worth 1 US dollar , exactly the same rate the Mark had in 1914 .
In December 1923 the exchange rate was 4,200,000,000,000 Marks to 1 US dollar .
In 1922 , the highest denomination was 50,000 Mark . By 1923 , the highest denomination was 100,000,000,000,000 Mark .

Today Greenlanders display both the Erfalasorput and the Dannebrog , often side-by-side .
The following year , a newspaper solicited eleven design proposals -LRB- all but one of which was a Nordic cross -RRB- and polled the people to determine the most popular .
He described the white stripe as representing the glaciers and ice cap , which cover more than 80 % of the island ; the red stripe , the ocean ; the red semicircle , the sun , with its bottom part sunk in the ocean ; and the white semicircle , the icebergs and pack ice .
To honor the tenth anniversary of the Erfalasorput , the Greenland Post Office issued commemorative stamps and a leaflet by its creator .
The design is also reminiscent of the setting sun half-submerged below the horizon and reflected on the sea .
In 1978 , Denmark granted home rule to Greenland , making it an equal member of the RigsfÃ llesskab .
Finally the present red-and-white design by Christiansen narrowly won over a green-and-white Nordic cross by a vote of fourteen to eleven .
Its local name in the Greenlandic language is Erfalasorput , which means `` our flag '' , but Aappalaartoq -LRB- meaning `` the red '' -RRB- is also used for both the Greenlandic flag and the Dannebrog .
The Dannebrog was better liked than any .
Christiansen 's red-and-white flag was officially adopted June 21 , 1985 .
The home rule government held an official call for flag proposals , receiving 555 -LRB- of which 293 were submitted by Greenlanders -RRB- .
Greenland first entertained the idea of a flag of its own in 1973 when five Greenlanders proposed a green , white and blue flag .
It features two equal horizontal bands of white -LRB- top -RRB- and red with a large disk slightly to the hoist side of center .
The flag of Greenland was designed by Greenland native Thue Christiansen .
The top half of the disk is red , the bottom half is white .

The Lieutenant Governor is the representative on the Isle of Man of the Lord of Mann , currently Queen Elizabeth II .
Previously the Lieutenant Governor wielded all judicial , fiscal and executive power and circa 1900 had more power over his realms than any other Commonwealth leader .
In October 2005 Tynwald sought to change the title of the Lieutenant Governor to Crown Commissioner .
Today the role of Lieutenant Governor is essentially ceremonial , although certain powers under Isle of Man legislation do still fall to the Governor or Governor-in-Council -LRB- a decision on the advice , and with the approval of , the Council of Ministers -RRB- .
However , in April 2006 , after much public disapproval , Tynwald rejected their own proposal and withdrew their request for Royal Assent .
The official residence of the Governor is Government House , Governor 's Road , Onchan .
He\/she has the power to grant Royal Assent and is styled His Excellency .
This proposal was sent to the British Department of Constitutional Affairs for submission to the Lord of Mann Elizabeth II for approval .
No Manx-born person has ever been appointed Lieutenant Governor , although Manx born First Deemsters -LRB- ex officio Deputy Governors -RRB- have taken on the role during the transition of power between Governors , and during periods when the Lieutenant Governor is off-Island .
In recent times the Governor has either been a retired diplomat or senior military officer .

In the negative connotation , compromise may be referred to as capitulation , referring to a `` surrender '' of objectives , principles , or material , in the process of negotiating an agreement .
In arguments , compromise is a concept of finding agreement through communication , through a mutual acceptance of termsâ '' often involving variations from an original goal or desire .
To compromise is to make a deal where one person gives up part of his or her demand .
In human relationships `` compromise '' is frequently said to be an agreement that no party is happy with , this is because the parties involved often feel that they either gave away too much or that they received too little .
Defining and finding the best possible compromise is an important problem in fields like game theory and the voting system .
Research has indicated that suboptimal compromises are often the result of negotiators failing to realize when they have interests that are completely compatible with those of the other party and settle for suboptimal agreements .
Extremism is often considered as antonym to compromise , which , depending on context , may be associated with concepts of balance , tolerance .
Mutually better outcomes can often be found by careful investigation of both parties ' interests , especially if done early in negotiations .
In geometry , a parallelogram is a quadrilateral with two pairs of parallel sides .
In Euclidean Geometry , the opposite or facing sides of a parallelogram are of equal length and the opposite angles of a parallelogram are of equal measure .
Eighteen is a composite number , its proper divisors being 1 , 2 , 3 , 6 and 9 .

In Your House was a pay-per-view series created by the World Wrestling Federation -LRB- WWF -RRB- .
The original concept was that , in months when the WWF was not holding one of its major PPV events -LRB- WrestleMania , King of the Ring , SummerSlam , Survivor Series , and Royal Rumble , which at the time ran for three hours and retailed for $ 29.95 -RRB- , they would offer a two-hour PPV , priced at $ 19.95 .

Henry Spencer Moore OM CH FBA -LRB- 30 July 1898 â `` 31 August 1986 -RRB- was an English sculptor and artist .
He became well-known through his larger-scale abstract cast bronze and carved marble sculptures , and was instrumental in introducing a particular form of modernism to the United Kingdom .
Moore was born in Castleford , the son of a mining engineer .
His forms are generally pierced or contain hollow spaces .
Many interpreters liken the undulating form of his reclining figures to the landscape and hills of his birthplace , Yorkshire .
Moore 's works are usually suggestive of the female body , apart from a phase in the 1950s when he sculpted family groups .
Yet he lived frugally and most of the money he earned went towards endowing the Henry Moore Foundation , which continues to support education and promotion of the arts .
His ability in later life to fulfill large-scale commissions made him exceptionally wealthy .
He was best known for his abstract monumental bronze sculptures which are located around the world as public works of art .
