The kitchen spatula , also called an egg slice , a `` turner , '' or a flipper is a utensil with a long handle and a broad flat edge , used for lifting and turning fried foods .
Kitchen spatulas are usually made of plastic or metal , with a wooden or plastic handle to insulate them from heat .
This is particularly visible in snakes , which are able to open their mouths very wide to accommodate comparatively large prey .
The squamates and tuatara together are a sister group to crocodiles and birds , the extant archosaurs .
From morphological data , Iguanid lizards have been thought to have diverged from other squamates very early , but recent molecular phylogenies , both from mitochondrial and nuclear DNA , do not support this early divergence .
Squamates are a monophyletic group that is a sister group to the tuatara .
It has been shown that snake venom evolved via a process by which a gene encoding for a normal body protein , typically one involved in key regulatory processes or bioactivity , is duplicated , and the copy is selectively expressed in the venom gland .
Natural Selection has driven the origination and diversification of the toxins to counter the defenses of their prey .
Venom has been known in the families Caenophidia , Anguimorpha , and Iguania and has been shown that it evolved a single time along these lineages before the three families diverged because all lineages share nine common toxins .
Once toxins have been recruited into the venom proteome , they form large multigene families and evolve via the birth-and-death model of protein evolution , which leads to a diversification of toxins that allows the sit-and-wait predators the ability to attack a wide range of prey .
Members of the order are distinguished by their skins , which bear horny scales or shields .
Recent research suggests that the evolutionary origin of venom may exist deep in the squamate phylogeny , with 60 % of squamates placed in this hypothetical group called Toxicofera .
The fossil record does show that the divergence between anguimorphs , iguanians , and advanced snakes dates back roughly 200 MYA to the Late Triassic\/Early Jurassic .
They are the most variably-sized order of reptiles , ranging from the 16 mm -LRB- 0.63 in . -RRB-
Jaragua Sphaero -LRB- Sphaerodactylus ariasae -RRB- to the 8 m -LRB- 26 ft. -RRB- Green Anaconda -LRB- Eunectes murinus -RRB- .
Squamate fossils first appear in the early Jurassic , but a mitochondrial phylogeny suggests that they evolved in the late Permian .
The evolutionary relationships within the squamates are not yet completely worked out , with the relationship of snakes to other groups being most problematic .
Of these , the lizards form a paraphyletic group -LRB- since `` lizards '' excludes the sub-clade of snakes -RRB- .
They also possess movable quadrate bones , making it possible to move the upper jaw relative to the braincase .
Because snakes have a faster molecular clock than other squamates , and there are few early snake and snake ancestor fossils , it is difficult to resolve the relationship between snakes and other squamate groups .
In newer classifications the name Sauria is used for reptiles and birds in general , and the Squamata are divided differently :

Two organizations have received the Peace Prize multiple times . The International Committee of the Red Cross received it three times : in 1917 and 1944 for its work during the world wars ; and in 1963 during the year of its centenary .
In 1968 , Sveriges Riksbank instituted an award that is often associated with the Nobel prizes , the Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel . The first such prize was awarded in 1969 .
The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees has won the Peace Prize twice for assisting refugees : in 1954 and 1981 .
Although not technically a Nobel Prize , it is identified with the awards ; its winners are announced with the Nobel Prize recipients , and the Prize in Economic Sciences is presented at the Swedish Nobel Prize Award Ceremony .
The Nobel Peace Prize is not awarded by a Swedish organization but by the Norwegian Nobel Committee .
The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences awards the Nobel Prize in Physics , the Nobel Prize in Chemistry , and the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences .
Satyagraha is a portmanteau of the Sanskrit words satya -LRB- meaning `` truth '' -RRB- and Agraha -LRB- `` insistence '' , or `` holding firmly to '' -RRB- .
Gandhi deployed satyagraha in the Indian independence movement and also during his earlier struggles in South Africa .
Satyagraha theory influenced Nelson Mandela 's struggle in South Africa under apartheid , Martin Luther King , Jr. 's campaigns during the civil rights movement in the United States , and many other social justice and similar movements .
Someone who practices satyagraha is a satyagrahi .
For Gandhi , satyagraha went far beyond mere `` passive resistance '' and became strength in practising non-violent methods .
Satyagraha theory also influenced Martin Luther King , Jr. during the campaigns he led during the civil rights movement in the United States :
Satyagraha -LRB- satyÄ graha -RRB- , loosely translated as `` Soul Force , '' `` truth force , '' or `` holding on to truth , '' is a philosophy and practice of nonviolent resistance developed and conceived by Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi -LRB- also known as `` Mahatma '' Gandhi -RRB- .

Many of the books involve sailing ; other common subjects include fishing and camping .

The Caryophyllaceae , commonly called the pink family or carnation family , is a family of flowering plants .
The species are dicotyledons included in the order Caryophyllales .
It is a large family , with 88 genera and some 2,000 species .
The Turkic languages constitute a language family of at least thirty five languages , spoken by Turkic peoples across a vast area from Eastern Europe and the Mediterranean to Siberia and Western China , and are considered to be part of the proposed Altaic language family .
Turkic languages are spoken as a native language by some 165 to 180 million people ; and the total number of Turkic speakers is over 250 million , including speakers of a second language .
The Turkic language with the greatest number of speakers is Turkish proper , or Anatolian -LRB- and Balkan -RRB- Turkish , the speakers of which account for about 40 % of all Turkic speakers .
It is found in Cameroon and Democratic Republic of the Congo .
Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests .
Christy 's Dormouse -LRB- Graphiurus christyi -RRB- is a species of rodent in the Gliridae family .
Hadrosaurus foulkii is the only species in this genus and has been the official state dinosaur of New Jersey , United States since 1991 .
Ironically , Hitler attended performances that included Jewish and foreign singers , long after they had been banned from all other venues across Germany .
Following Wagner 's death , his widow Cosima continued running the festival at one or , more frequently , two year intervals .
Winifred 's influence with Hitler was so strong that Hitler even wrote a letter -LRB- at her behest -RRB- to the anti-fascist Italian conductor Arturo Toscanini , begging him to lead the festival .
Present at this unique musical event were Kaiser Wilhelm , Dom Pedro II of Brazil , King Ludwig -LRB- who attended in secret , probably to avoid the Kaiser -RRB- , and other members of the nobility , as well as the philosopher Friedrich Nietzsche who committed much effort to helping his then good friend Wagner establish the festival , and such accomplished composers as Anton Bruckner , Edvard Grieg , Pyotr Tchaikovsky , and Franz Liszt .
Following the war , Winifred Wagner was sentenced to probation by a war court for her support of the Nazi party .
In the 1920s , well before the rise of the Nazi party , Winifred Wagner became a strong supporter and close personal friend of Adolf Hitler .
After Cosima 's retirement in 1906 , Siegfried Wagner took over management of the festival , introducing new staging and performance styles .
The Bayreuth Festival is a music festival held annually in Bayreuth , Germany , at which performances of operas by the 19th century German composer Richard Wagner are presented .
Two-thirds of the town of Bayreuth was destroyed by Allied bombing in the final days of World War II , though the theater itself was undamaged .
During the war , the festival was turned over to the Nazi party , which continued to sponsor operas for wounded soldiers returning from the front .
Toscanini refused .
These soldiers were forced to attend lectures on Wagner before the performances , and most found the festival to be tedious .

Household income is a measure commonly used by the United States government and private institutions , that counts the income of all residents over the age of 18 in each household , including not only all wages and salaries , but such items as unemployment insurance , disability payments , child support payments , regular rental receipts , as well as any personal business , investment , or other kinds of income received routinely .

Linux Mint is a Linux-based operating system for computers . Linux Mint is available in several editions with different codebases , all of which are ultimately based on Ubuntu except for LMDE -LRB- Linux Mint Debian Edition -RRB- and Linux Mint Xfce which are based on Debian .
The same year , in an effort to increase the compatibility between the two systems , Linux Mint decided to abandon its code-base and changed the way it built its releases . Starting with version 6 `` Felicia '' each release was now completely based on the latest Ubuntu release , built directly from it , timed for approximately one month after the corresponding Ubuntu release -LRB- i.e. usually in May and November -RRB- .

Before his death , Guru Gobind Singh decreed that the GurÅ `` Granth SÄ hib would be the final and perpetual guru of the Sikhs . The Sikhs believe that the spirit of Guru Nanak was passed from one guru to the next , '' just as the light of one lamp , which lights another and does not diminish '' , and is also mentioned in their Guru Granth Sahib .
Each guru added to and reinforced the message taught by the previous , resulting in the creation of the Sikh religion .
The term guru comes from the Sanskrit gurÅ `` , meaning teacher , guide , or mentor .
The traditions and philosophy of Sikhism were established by ten specific gurus from 1499 to 1708 .
Guru Gobind Singh was the final guru in human form .
Guru Nanak Dev was the first guru and appointed a disciple as successor .

In ice hockey , a goal is scored when the puck completely crosses the goal line between the two goal posts and below the goal crossbar .
The goal judge is an official positioned off ice behind each goal for the specific purpose of indicating when the puck has crossed the goal line and entered the goal . For arenas so equipped , the goal judge turns on a red light behind the goal when he sees the puck cross the goal line .

When a quotation is followed by other writing on a line of text , a space follows the closing quotation mark unless it is immediately followed by other punctuation within the sentence , such as a colon or closing punctuation .
The important rule is that the style of opening and closing quotation marks must be matched :

When quoted text is interrupted , such as with the phrase he said , a closing quotation mark is used before the interruption , and an opening quotation mark after .

With regard to quotation marks adjacent to periods and commas , there are two styles of punctuation in widespread use .
In all major forms of English , question marks and exclamation marks are placed inside or outside quoted material depending on whether they apply to the whole sentence or just the quoted portion , but colons and semicolons are always placed outside .

The fact that living things inherit traits from their parents has been used since prehistoric times to improve crop plants and animals through selective breeding .
Although he did not know the physical basis for heredity , Mendel observed that organisms inherit traits via discrete units of inheritance , which are now called genes .
Genetics -LRB- from Ancient Greek ' , `` genitive '' and that from ' , `` origin '' -RRB- , a discipline of biology , is the science of genes , heredity , and variation in living organisms .
However , the modern science of genetics , which seeks to understand the process of inheritance , only began with the work of Gregor Mendel in the mid-19th century .
When studying human genetic diseases , geneticists often use pedigree charts to represent the inheritance of traits .

The term lava flow is commonly shortened to lava .
Pillow lava is the lava structure typically formed when lava emerges from an underwater volcanic vent or subglacial volcano or a lava flow enters the ocean .
Pillow lava is the lava structure typically formed when lava emerges from an underwater volcanic vent or subglacial volcano or a lava flow enters the ocean . However , pillow lava can also form when lava is erupted beneath thick glacial ice .

Napoleon himself occupied Berlin , causing the king , queen and the rest of the royal family to flee , despite Louise 's illness , in the dead of winter to KÃ nigsberg in the easternmost part of the kingdom .
Napoleon reportedly remarked the king `` has lost his best minister . ''
Louise 's untimely death left her husband alone during a period of great difficulty , as the Napoleonic Wars and need for reform continued .
On 19 July 1810 , while visiting her father in Strelitz , the Queen died in her husband 's arms from an unidentified illness .
The queen 's subjects attributed the French occupation as the cause of her early death .
Napoleon had previously attempted to destroy her reputation by questioning Louise 's marital fidelity , but the queen met him anyway , attempting to use her beauty and charm to flatter him into more favorable terms .
The king and queen had accompanied their troops into battle at Jena -LRB- with Louise apparently dressed `` like an Amazon '' -RRB- , but had to flee from French troops .
On the journey there , there was no food or clean water , and the king and queen were forced to share the same sleeping arrangements in `` one of the wretched barns they call houses '' , according to one witness traveling with them .
Duchess Louise of Mecklenburg-Strelitz -LRB- Luise Auguste Wilhelmine Amalie ; 10 March 1776 -- 19 July 1810 -RRB- was Queen consort of Prussia as the wife of King Frederick William III .
Though Prussia had not fought in a war since 1795 , its military leaders were confident that they could win against Napoleon 's troops .
Prussian troops began mobilizing , culminating in the October 1806 Battle of Jena-Auerstedt , which was a disaster for Prussia , as the ability of its armed forces to continue the war were effectively wiped out .
After a small incident concerning an anti-French pamphlet occurred , King Frederick William was finally pressured by his wife and family to break off his uneasy peace and enter the war against the French emperor .
Formerly Louise had regularly referred to him as `` the Monster '' , but nevertheless made a request for a private interview with the emperor , whereon she threw herself at his feet ; though he was impressed by her grace and determination , Napoleon refused to make any concessions , writing back to his wife Empress JosÃ phine that Louise `` is really charming and full of coquettishness toward me .
Queen Louise 's efforts to protect her adopted country from French aggression became well admired by future generations .
After various events took place , Napoleon demanded , from a highly superior position , peace terms in what was to be called the Peace of Tilsit -LRB- 1807 -RRB- .
As the king felt that her presence might put Napoleon in a `` more relaxed mood '' ; Louise reluctantly agreed to meet the emperor at Tilsit , but only to save `` her Prussia . ''

Number 2 fuel oil is a distillate home heating oil .
Number 3 fuel oil was a distillate oil for burners requiring low-viscosity fuel .
The term fuel oil is also used in a stricter sense to refer only to the heaviest commercial fuel that can be obtained from crude oil , heavier than gasoline and naphtha .
Fuel oil is a fraction obtained from petroleum distillation , either as a distillate or a residue .
Trucks and some cars use similar diesel fuel with a cetane number limit describing the ignition quality of the fuel .
Price usually decreases as the fuel number increases .
Broadly speaking , fuel oil is any liquid petroleum product that is burned in a furnace or boiler for the generation of heat or used in an engine for the generation of power , except oils having a flash point of approximately and oils burned in cotton or wool-wick burners .
In this sense , diesel is a type of fuel oil .
Fuel oil is made of long hydrocarbon chains , particularly alkanes , cycloalkanes and aromatics .
Viscosity also increases with number , and the heaviest oil has to be heated to get it to flow .
Kumho Tire Co. v. Carmichael , , is a United States Supreme Court case that applied the Daubert standard to expert testimony from non-scientists .
Three months later , the Carmichaels sued the manufacturer of the tire , claiming that the tire was defective and the defect caused the accident .
The district court found the tire expert 's methods not to be scientifically valid , and hence excluded his testimony .
This resulted in a conclusion that Kumho Tire would rightly prevail .
The Eleventh Circuit reversed the district court 's ruling .
It reasoned that Daubert was expressly limited only to scientific expert testimony and did not apply to `` skill - or experience-based observation . ''
The Carmichaels ' case rested largely on testimony from a tire failure expert .
Kumho also disagreed with certain aspects of the tire expert 's methodology , and asked the federal district court hearing the case to exclude it under Rule 702 of the Federal Rules of Evidence .
The tire failure expert relied on features of tire technology that the manufacturer did not dispute , as well as background facts about the particular tire on the Carmichaels ' van .
The Carmichaels appealed to the Eleventh Circuit .
The district court took its cue from Daubert v. Merrell Dow Pharmaceuticals , which had solidified a gatekeeping role for trial judges in admitting expert testimony .
Patrick Carmichael was driving his minivan on July 6 , 1993 , when the right rear tire blew out .
One of the passengers in the vehicle died , and others were severely injured .
Kumho Tire asked the Supreme Court to review whether Daubert applied solely to scientific evidence .
The tire expert 's testimony rested on such unscientific `` observation and experience '' , and so the Eleventh Circuit reasoned the district court should have made a different ruling based on their legal reasoning over Rule 702 without the Daubert gloss .
The expert 's conclusion that a defect in the tire caused the accident rested on certain observations about the tire that Kumho Tire vigorously disputed .
Under Daubert , certain factors contribute to the reliability , and hence the admissibility , of expert testimony , one of which is the general validity of the expert 's methods .
The British Rail Class 48 was a diesel locomotive class which consisted of five examples , built at Brush Falcon Works in Loughborough and delivered between September 1965 and July 1966 .
They were part of the British Rail Class 47 order , but differed from their classmates by being fitted with a Sulzer V12 12LVA24 power unit producing 2650 b , as opposed to the standard 12LDA28C twin-bank twelve-cylinder unit of the remaining fleet .

The Nice model popular among planetary scientists postulates that the gas giant planets migrated in orbit at this time , causing objects in the asteroid belt and\/or Kuiper belt to be put onto eccentric orbits that reached the terrestrial planets .
The Late Heavy Bombardment -LRB- commonly referred to as the lunar cataclysm , or LHB -RRB- is a period of time approximately 4.1 to 3.8 billion years ago -LRB- Ga -RRB- during which a large number of impact craters are believed to have formed on the Moon , and by inference on Earth , Mercury , Venus , and Mars as well .
Nevertheless , some argue that the lunar sample data do not require a cataclysmic cratering event near 3.9 Ga , and that the apparent clustering of impact melt ages near this time is an artifact of sampling material affected by a single large impact basin .
The evidence for this event comes primarily from the dating of lunar samples , which indicates that most impact melt rocks formed in this rather narrow interval of time .
While many hypotheses have been put forth to explain a `` spike '' in the flux of either asteroidal or cometary materials to the inner solar system , no consensus yet exists as to its cause .
Observation of the satellite 's orbit has made possible an accurate determination of Hermione 's mass. .
It has not yet been officially named , but `` LaFayette '' has been proposed by a group of astronomers in reference to the frigate used in secret by the Marquis de Lafayette to reach America to help the insurgents .
Hermione is a Cybele asteroid and orbits beyond most of the main-belt asteroids .
As a C-type , it is probably composed of carbonaceous materials .
For the best-fit `` snowman '' model , the density is found to be 1.8 Â 0.2 g\/cm Â , giving a porosity of the order of 20 % , and possibly indicating that the main components are fractured solid bodies , but that the asteroid is rather not a rubble pile .
A satellite of Hermione was discovered in 2002 with the Keck II telescope , and is about 8 miles -LRB- 13 km -RRB- in diameter .
Hermione was discovered by J. C. Watson on May 12 , 1872 from Ann Arbor , and named after Hermione , daughter of Menelaus and Helen in Greek mythology .
Of several proposed shape models that agreed with the images , a `` snowman '' - like shape was found to best fit the observed precession rate of Hermione 's satellite .
The asteroid has a bi-lobed shape , as evidenced by adaptive optics images , the first of which were taken in December 2003 , with the Keck telescope .
121 Hermione is a very large asteroid of the dark C spectral type , orbiting in the Cybele group in the far outer main belt .
The satellite is currently designated S\/2002 -LRB- 121 -RRB- 1 .
Occultations by Hermione have been successfully observed three times so far , the last time in February 2004 .

BenoÃ t Pedretti -LRB- born 12 November 1980 in Audincourt , Doubs -RRB- is a French football midfielder playing for AJ Auxerre .
The title was imported to the monarchies of medieval Europe , and in many countries developed into a high military rank and great officer of State -LRB- e.g. , the Constable of France -RRB- .
The office of constable can vary significantly in different jurisdictions .
Historically , a constable could also be someone in charge of the defense of a castle .
Even today , there is a Constable of the Tower of London .
The equivalent position is that of Marshal , which derives from Old High German marah `` horse '' and schalh `` servant '' , and originally meant `` stable keeper '' , which has a similar etymology .
However , in the Channel Islands a constable is an elected office-holder at the parish level .
Most constables in modern jurisdictions are law enforcement officers ; in the United Kingdom , Commonwealth of Nations and some European countries , a constable is the lowest rank of police officer -LRB- it is also , when preceded by the term ` sworn ' , used to describe any police officer with arrest and other powers -RRB- , while in the United States a constable is generally an elected peace officer with lesser jurisdiction than a sheriff .
A constable is a person holding a particular office , most commonly in law enforcement .
If a constable is not appointed as a constable with peace officer powers , they can only serve civil processes .
Historically , the title comes from the Latin comes stabuli -LRB- count of the stables -RRB- and originated from the Eastern Roman Empire ; originally , the constable was the officer responsible for keeping the horses of a lord or monarch .
Diving nearly vertically at the target , in the same direction the bombs will take , the aircraft will release the bombs very close to the target at high speed .
This allows a dive bomber to accurately place bombs on smaller and\/or moving targets with relative ease .
A dive bomber is a bomber aircraft that dives directly at its targets in order to provide greater accuracy for the bomb it drops .
This tactic also gave the advantage of attacking ships at a weak spot ; armor was typically heaviest near the waterline and thin or non-existent on the deck .
Additionally , no complicated precision bomb sight is needed for targeting .
In addition , dive bombing allowed relatively small aircraft carrying limited bomb loads to inflict disproportionately heavy damage .
Dive bombers were widely used to attack high value targets such as ships and bridges .

Although the Union states included the Western states of California , Oregon , and -LRB- after 1864 -RRB- Nevada , as well as states generally considered to be part of the Midwest , the Union has been also often loosely referred to as `` the North '' , both then and now .

Excommunication is a religious censure used to deprive or suspend membership in a religious community .
Censures and sanctions sometimes follow excommunication ; these include banishment , shunning , and shaming , depending on the religion , the offense that caused excommunication , or the rules or norms of the religious community .
In some religions , excommunication includes spiritual condemnation of the member or group .
The word means putting -LRB- someone -RRB- out of communion .

In the coiling method of construction , all of the energy required to form the main part of a piece is supplied indirectly by the hands of the potter .
A potter 's wheel may occasionally be referred to as a `` potter 's lathe '' . However , that term is better used for another kind of machine that is used for a different shaping process , turning , similar to that used for shaping of metal and wooden articles .
In Ancient Egyptian mythology , the deity Khnum was said to have formed the first humans on a potter 's wheel .
A potter 's wheel may occasionally be referred to as a `` potter 's lathe '' .
The wheel may also be used during process of trimming the excess body from dried ware and for applying incised decoration or rings of color .
Many early ceramics were hand-built using a simple coiling technique in which clay was rolled into long threads that were then pinched and beaten together to form the body of a vessel .

Gandhara was largely Mahayana Buddhist , and was also a stronghold of Vajrayana Buddhism .
Buddhism was also practiced in the Punjab and Sindh regions .
There are many archaeological sites from the Buddhist era in Swat .

Most Buddhists in Punjab reverted to Hinduism from 600 AD onwards .
The Swat Valley , known in antiquity as Uddiyana , was a kingdom tributary to Gandhara .
The Buddhist sage Padmasambhava is said to have been born in a village near the present day town of Chakdara in Lower Dir District , which was then a part of Uddiyana .
Buddhism was the faith practiced by the majority of the population of Sindh up to the Arab conquest by the Umayad Caliphate in 710 AD .
Gandhara remained a largely Buddhist land until around 800 AD , when the Pashtun people invaded the region from Southern Afghanistan and introduced the Islamic religion .
The region that is today known as Pakistan once had a large Buddhist population , with the majority of people in Gandhara -LRB- present day North Western Pakistan and Eastern Afghanistan -RRB- being Buddhist .

Reed stems are also important building materials in some areas .
Medicines obtained from stems include quinine from the bark of cinchona trees , camphor distilled from wood of a tree in the same genus that provides cinnamon , and the muscle relaxant curare from the bark of tropical vines .
Stem usually consist of three tissues , dermal tissue , ground tissue and vascular tissue .
Bamboo stems also have hundreds of uses , including paper , buildings , furniture , boats , musical instruments , fishing poles , water pipes , plant stakes , and scaffolding .
Tree bark is often used as a mulch and in growing media for container plants .
Amber is fossilized sap from tree trunks ; it is used for jewelry and may contain ancient animals .
Chicle , the main ingredient in chewing gum , is obtained from trunks of the chicle tree .
Wood pulp is widely used to make paper , paperboard , cellulose sponges , cellophane and some important plastics and textiles , such as cellulose acetate and rayon .
Gum arabic is an important food additive obtained from the trunks of Acacia senegal trees .
The earliest paper was obtained from the stems of papyrus by the ancient Egyptians .
The other main structural axis of plants is the root .
In most plants stems are located above the soil surface but some plants have underground stems .
Sugarcane stems are a major source of sugar .
Rattan , used for furniture and baskets , is made from the stems of tropical vining palms .
Trunks of palm trees and tree ferns are often used for building .
Cork is obtained from the bark of the cork oak .
The spice , cinnamon is bark from a tree trunk .
A stem is one of two main structural axes of a vascular plant .
The stem is normally divided into nodes and internodes , the nodes hold buds which grow into one or more leaves , inflorescence -LRB- flowers -RRB- , cones or other stems etc. .
Vegetables from stems are asparagus , bamboo shoots , cactus pads or nopalitos , kohlrabi , and water chestnut .
Maple sugar is obtained from trunks of maple trees .
Bast fibers for textiles and rope are obtained from stems include flax , hemp , jute and ramie .
Cellulose from tree trunks is a food additive in bread , grated Parmesan cheese , and other processed foods .
Tannins used for tanning leather are obtained from the wood of certain trees , such as quebracho .
There are thousands of species whose stems have economic uses .

Rubber is obtained from the trunks of Hevea brasiliensis .
Stems provide a few major staple crops such as potato and taro .
Resins from conifer wood are used to produce turpentine and rosin .

A stream cipher generates successive elements of the keystream based on an internal state .
For example , if a 128-bit block cipher received separate 32-bit bursts of plaintext , three quarters of the data transmitted would be padding .
Various schemes have been proposed to increase the security of LFSRs .
The use of LFSRs on their own , however , is insufficient to provide good security .
In the most common form , binary digits are used -LRB- bits -RRB- , and the keystream is combined with the plaintext using the exclusive or operation -LRB- XOR -RRB- .
Stream ciphers typically execute at a higher speed than block ciphers and have lower hardware complexity .
Stream ciphers represent a different approach to symmetric encryption from block ciphers .
Another approach is to tag the ciphertext with markers at regular points in the output .
Single-digit errors are limited in their effect , affecting only up to N plaintext digits .
A one-time pad uses a keystream of completely random digits .
An alternative name is a state cipher , as the encryption of each digit is dependent on the current state .
Another approach to improving the security of an LFSR is to pass the entire state of a single LFSR into a non-linear filtering function .
In a stream cipher the plaintext digits are encrypted one at a time , and the transformation of successive digits varies during the encryption .
The latter device can then be designed and used in less stringent environments .
To restore synchronisation , various offsets can be tried systematically to obtain the correct decryption .
Various properties of such a combining function are critical for ensuring the security of the resultant scheme , for example , in order to avoid correlation attacks .
If a block cipher -LRB- not operating in a stream cipher mode -RRB- were to be used in this type of application , the designer would need to choose either transmission efficiency or implementation complexity , since block ciphers can not directly work on blocks shorter than their block size .
If digits are added or removed from the message during transmission , synchronisation is lost .
In a synchronous stream cipher a stream of pseudo-random digits is generated independently of the plaintext and ciphertext messages , and then combined with the plaintext -LRB- to encrypt -RRB- or the ciphertext -LRB- to decrypt -RRB- .
Another approach uses several of the previous N ciphertext digits to compute the keystream .
In practice , the digits are typically single bits or bytes .
However , this comes at a cost : because the keystream is now pseudorandom , and not truly random , the proof of security associated with the one-time pad no longer holds : it is quite possible for a stream cipher to be completely insecure .
Such schemes are known as self-synchronizing stream ciphers , asynchronous stream ciphers or ciphertext autokey -LRB- CTAK -RRB- .
This can be alleviated by buffering the output .
In a synchronous stream cipher , the sender and receiver must be exactly in step for decryption to be successful .
An example of a self-synchronising stream cipher is a block cipher in cipher feedback -LRB- CFB -RRB- mode .
The idea of self-synchronization was patented in 1946 , and has the advantage that the receiver will automatically synchronise with the keystream generator after receiving N ciphertext digits , making it easier to recover if digits are dropped or added to the message stream .
Based on this key , it generates a pseudorandom keystream which can be combined with the plaintext digits in a similar fashion to the one-time pad .
This output is then -LRB- in some versions -RRB- combined with the output of a third LFSR clocked at a regular rate .
Instead of a linear driving device , one may use a nonlinear update function .
A stream cipher makes use of a much smaller and more convenient key â '' 128 bits , for example .
One approach to introducing non-linearity is to have the LFSR clocked irregularly , controlled by the output of a second LFSR .
RC4 is the most widely used stream cipher in software ; others include : A5\/1 , A5\/2 , Chameleon , FISH , Helix , ISAAC , MUGI , Panama , Phelix , Pike , SEAL , SOBER , SOBER-128 and WAKE .
However , stream ciphers can be susceptible to serious security problems if used incorrectly : see stream cipher attacks â '' in particular , the same starting state must never be used twice .
This mechanism suffers from timing attacks on the second generator , since the speed of the output is variable in a manner that depends on the second generator 's state .
One LFSR is clocked if the output of a second is a `` 1 '' , otherwise it repeats its previous output .
Normally LFSRs are stepped regularly .
If , however , a digit is corrupted in transmission , rather than added or lost , only a single digit in the plaintext is affected and the error does not propagate to other parts of the message .
Binary stream ciphers are often constructed using linear feedback shift registers -LRB- LFSRs -RRB- because they can be easily implemented in hardware and can be readily analyzed mathematically .
Such generators include the stop-and-go generator , the alternating step generator and the shrinking generator .
Because LFSRs are inherently linear , one technique for removing the linearity is to feed the outputs of several parallel LFSRs into a non-linear Boolean function to form a combination generator .
This property is useful when the transmission error rate is high ; however , it makes it less likely the error would be detected without further mechanisms .
In cryptography , a stream cipher is a symmetric key cipher where plaintext bits are combined with a pseudorandom cipher bit stream -LRB- keystream -RRB- , typically by an exclusive-or -LRB- xor -RRB- operation .
Moreover , because of this property , synchronous stream ciphers are very susceptible to active attacks â '' if an attacker can change a digit in the ciphertext , he might be able to make predictable changes to the corresponding plaintext bit ; for example , flipping a bit in the ciphertext causes the same bit to be flipped in the plaintext .
Block ciphers operate on large blocks of digits with a fixed , unvarying transformation .
The stop-and-go generator -LRB- Beth and Piper , 1984 -RRB- consists of two LFSRs .
Block ciphers must be used in ciphertext stealing or residual block termination mode to avoid padding , while stream ciphers eliminate this issue by naturally operating on the smallest unit that can be transmitted -LRB- usually bytes -RRB- .
Another advantage of stream ciphers in military cryptography is that the cipher stream can be generated in a separate box that is subject to strict security measures and fed to other devices , e.g. a radio set , which will perform the xor operation as part of their function .
For example , Klimov and Shamir proposed triangular functions -LRB- T-Functions -RRB- with a single cycle on n bit words .
Stream ciphers are often used for their speed and simplicity of implementation in hardware , and in applications where plaintext comes in quantities of unknowable lengthâ '' for example , a secure wireless connection .
This is termed a binary additive stream cipher .

Shogi , also known as Japanese chess , is a two-player board game in the same family as Western chess , chaturanga , and Chinese Xiangqi , and is the most popular of a family of chess variants native to Japan .
In early years , however , shogi was written è æ # -LRB- the same as Xiangqi , `` elephant chess '' -RRB- .
Shogi in its present form was played as early as the 16th century , while a direct ancestor without the `` drop rule '' was recorded from 1210 in a historical document NichÅ `` reki , which is an edited copy of ShÅ chÅ `` reki and KaichÅ `` reki from the late Heian period -LRB- ca 1120 -RRB- .
The earliest predecessor of the game , chaturanga , originated in India in the 6th century , and spread from China to Japan , where it spawned a number of variants .
According to ChessVariants.com , `` Perhaps the enduring popularity of Shogi can be attributed to its ` drop rule ' ; it was the first chess variant wherein captured pieces could be returned to the board to be used as one 's own .
David Pritchard credits the drop rule to the practice of 16th century mercenaries who switched loyalties when capturedâ '' no doubt as an alternative to execution . ''
The Venezuelan Sylph -LRB- Aglaiocercus berlepschi -RRB- is a small bird in the hummingbird family , Trochilidae .
It is restricted to a small area of north-eastern Venezuela and is classed as an endangered species by BirdLife International .
It is sometimes considered to be a subspecies of the Long-tailed Sylph -LRB- A. kingi -RRB- .
The Long-tailed Sylph is similar in appearance but does not overlap in range .
The throat is blue and the outer tail-feathers are violet , becoming blue towards the tips .
The tail is shorter than that of the male but still fairly long and slightly forked .
The female is 9.5-11 centimetres long .
Males of the subspecies caudatus have a mostly blue tail and no blue throat patch while males of the subspecies margarethae have green tips to the tail-feathers .
Its plumage is mostly irridescent green .
Females have a rufous breast and belly .
Females have a blue crown and white throat , breast and belly .
The male is 22 centimetres in length with the elongated outer tail-feathers accounting for 14-15 centimetres .

The following names were used for named storms that formed in the north Atlantic in 1999 . The names not retired from this list were used again in the 2005 season .
A tropical depression that formed in the Bay of Campeche on August 18 reached tropical storm strength late on August 19 .
The 1999 Atlantic hurricane season officially began on June 1 , 1999 , and lasted until November 30 , 1999 .
It is the same list used for the 1993 season .

It made landfall at Puerto Cabezas , Nicaragua , during the time it was a tropical storm .
It weakened back to a Category 1 storm , only to rapidly strengthen to its maximum pressure just as it made landfall on the south coast of Saint Croix on November 17 .
The storm died over the Yucatan Peninsula on November 1 as it was absorbed by a cold front .
The storm continued inland and dissipated over northern Mexico on August 25 .

Hurricane Keith , the strongest hurricane of the 2000 Atlantic hurricane season , was a Caribbean hurricane that caused great damage across Belize and southern Mexico .
Hurricane Keith began as a tropical wave that moved off the coast of Africa on September 16 .
It weakened slightly after its eyewall passed over Ambergris Caye and Caye Caulker , Belize , on October 1 .
The storm was able to intensify to a 90 m hurricane before making its final landfall near Tampico , Mexico on October 5 . Keith dissipated over northeastern Mexico the next day .
The name Keith was retired in the spring of 2001 and was replaced with Kirk , but the name Kirk has yet to be used , as the 2006 Atlantic hurricane season did not have enough storms to reach the name .
It spent two days looping off of Belize 's coast . During this time , it weakened dramatically and was only a tropical storm when it made landfall in Belize .
Conditions became nearly ideal for Keith 's development on September 30 , with little to no shear , a well developed anticyclone over it , and warm Caribbean water temperatures allowing for the storm to strengthen . Keith became a hurricane on September 30 , which was followed by rapid intensification to a 140 mph -LRB- 225 km\/h -RRB- Category 4 hurricane only 18 hours later .
The newly-formed tropical cyclone drifted northwestward , and became Tropical Storm Keith on September 29 .

Traditional artists ' canvas is made from linen , but less expensive cotton fabric has gained popularity .
This can be done with a rag and some turpentine for a certain time while the paint is wet , but after a while , the hardened layer must be scraped . Oil paint dries by oxidation , not evaporation , and is usually dry to the touch within a span of two weeks .
Often an oil such as linseed was boiled with a resin such as pine resin or even frankincense ; these were called ` varnishes ' and were prized for their body and gloss . Other oils occasionally used include poppyseed oil , walnut oil , and safflower oil .
It is generally dry enough to be varnished in six months to a year .
Oil paint is usually mixed with linseed oil , artist grade mineral spirits or other solvents to create a thinner , faster or slower drying paint . A basic rule of oil paint application is ` fat over lean . '
These additional media can aid the painter in adjusting the translucency of the paint , the sheen of the paint , the density or ` body ' of the paint , and the ability of the paint to hold or conceal the brushstroke . These variables are closely related to the expressive capacity of oil paint .
The linseed oil itself comes from the flax seed , a common fiber crop . It is interesting to note that linen , an important `` support '' for oil painting -LRB- see below -RRB- also comes from the flax plant .
Oil painting is the process of painting with pigments that are bound with a medium of drying oil â '' especially in early modern Europe , linseed oil .
Art conservators do not consider an oil painting completely dry until it is 60 to 80 years old .

The term foreign worker is generally used in the United States to refer to someone fitting the international -LRB- UN -RRB- definition of a migrant worker while the term migrant worker is considered someone who regularly works away from home , if they have a home at all .
Structural engineering is a field of engineering dealing with the analysis and design of structures that support or resist loads .
Structural engineering has existed since humans first started to construct their own structures .
Structural building engineering includes all structural engineering related to the design of buildings .
It became a more defined and formalised profession with the emergence of the architecture profession as distinct from the engineering profession during the industrial revolution in the late 19th Century .
Entry-level structural engineers may design the individual structural elements of a structure , for example the beams , columns , and floors of a building .
More experienced engineers would be responsible for the structural design and integrity of an entire system , such as a building .
Structural engineers often specialize in particular fields , such as bridge engineering , building engineering , pipeline engineering , industrial structures , or special mechanical structures such as vehicles or aircraft .
Structural engineers are most commonly involved in the design of buildings and large nonbuilding structures but they can also be involved in the design of machinery , medical equipment , vehicles or any item where structural integrity affects the item 's function or safety .
The earliest version of Sketches by Boz was published by John Macrone in two series : the first as a two-volume set in February 1836 , just a month before the publication of the first number of The Pickwick Papers -LRB- 1836-37 -RRB- , and a `` Second Series '' in August 1836 .
When Macrone died unexpectantly at age 28 Dickens helped to publish a book -LRB- Pic-Nic Papers -RRB- to benefit Macrone 's widow and children .
Sketches by `` Boz , '' Illustrative of Every-day Life and Every-day People -LRB- commonly known as Sketches by Boz -RRB- is a collection of short pieces published by Charles Dickens in 1836 accompanied by illustrations by George Cruikshank .
After Dickens ' fame skyrocketed he was able to buy out his agreements with Macrone .

Between Clays Ferry in Madison County and Frankfort , the river passes through the Kentucky River Palisades , a series of dramatic steep gorges approximately 100 mi -LRB- 160 km -RRB- in length .
It is formed in eastern Kentucky at Beattyville , in Lee County , by the confluence of the North , Middle and South Forks at about 670 feet -LRB- 204 m -RRB- elevation , and flows generally northwest , in a highly meandering course through the mountains , through the Daniel Boone National Forest , then past Irvine and Boonesborough , then southwest , passing south of Lexington , then north through Frankfort .
According to Robert F. Collins of the United States Forest Service , Dr. Thomas Walker named the river , in 1750 , Louisa River , after Princess Louisa , the wife of Prince William Augustus , Duke of Cumberland -LRB- Walker had just named the Cumberland River a month or two earlier -RRB- .
At High Bridge , it is joined by the Dix River .
It joins the Ohio at Carrollton .
At Frankfort , it is joined by Benson Creek .
Approximately 10 mi -LRB- 15 km -RRB- north of Frankfort , it is joined by Elkhorn Creek .
Approximately 20 mi -LRB- 30 km -RRB- southwest of Boonesborough it is joined by Silver Creek .
Approximately 15 mi -LRB- 25 km -RRB- southwest of Boonesborough it is joined by the Red River .

The sea slug Glaucus atlanticus also feeds on the Portuguese Man o ' War , as does the violet snail Janthina janthina .
The skin of the turtle is too thick for the Portuguese Man o ' War sting to penetrate and launch its venom .
The name `` man-of-war '' is borrowed from the man-of-war , a 16th century English armed sailing ship .
The Portuguese Man o ' War is often found with a variety of marine fish , including shepherd fish , clownfish and yellow jack , species that are rarely found elsewhere .
The blanket octopus is immune to the venom of the Portuguese Man o ' War , and they have been known to rip off its tentacles and use them for defensive purposes .
The Loggerhead Turtle feeds on the Portuguese Man o ' War , a common part of the Loggerhead 's diet .
These fish benefit from the shelter from predators provided by the stinging tentacles , and for the Portuguese Man o ' War the presence of these species may attract other fish to feed on .
The Portuguese Man o ' War -LRB- Physalia physalis -RRB- , also known as the Portuguese man-of-war , man-of-war , or bluebottle , is a jelly-like marine invertebrate of the family Physaliidae .
The clownfish can swim among the tentacles with impunity , possibly due to its mucus that does not trigger the nematocysts .
The shepherd fish seems to avoid the larger , stinging tentacles , but feeds on the smaller tentacles beneath the gas bladder .

The possibility of a Neptune Orbiter was discussed , yet other than that , no other missions have been given serious thought . As Neptune is a gas giant and has no solid surface , a surface mission such as a lander or rover is impossible .
Voyager 2 studied Neptune 's atmosphere , Neptune 's rings , its magnetosphere , and Neptune 's moons .
Triton was flown by at about 25,000 miles away , and became the last solid world Voyager 2 would explore within the Solar System .
Voyager 2 discovered six moons orbiting Neptune , but only three were photographed in detail : Proteus , Nereid , and Triton .
Triton was revealed to have remarkable active geysers and polar caps .
The planetary radio astronomy instrument found that Neptune 's day lasts sixteen hours , seven minutes .
Voyager 2 revealed that Neptune 's atmosphere was very dynamic , even though it receives only 3 % of the sunlight Jupiter receives .
Proteus turned out to be an ellipsoid , as large as an ellipsoid could become without rounding in a sphere .
Also seen in Neptune 's atmosphere at that time was an almond-shaped spot designated D2 , and a bright , quickly moving cloud high above the cloud decks dubbed `` Scooter '' .
Neptune 's magnetosphere was also studied by Voyager 2 .
Voyager 2 also discovered auroras , like on Earth , but much more complex .
In Voyager 2 's last planetary encounter , the spacecraft swooped only 3,000 miles above Neptune 's north pole , the closest approach it made to any body since it left Earth .
A very thin atmosphere was found , as well as thin clouds .
Proteus is very dark in color , almost like soot .
Voyager 2 discovered an anticyclone called the Great Dark Spot , similar to Jupiter 's Great Red Spot and Little Red Spot .
Nereid , though discovered in 1949 , still has very little known about it .
Voyager 2 found four rings and evidence for ring arcs , or incomplete rings above Neptune .
However , images taken by the Hubble Space Telescope revealed that the Great Dark Spot had disappeared .
Several discoveries were made , including the discovery of the Great Dark Spot and Triton 's geysers .
The exploration of Neptune has only begun with one explorer , Voyager 2 , which visited on August 25 , 1989 .

Schizophreniform disorder is a type of mental illness that is characterized by psychosis and closely related to schizophrenia .
Schizophreniform disorder is a mental disorder diagnosed when symptoms of schizophrenia are present for a significant portion of the time within a one-month period , but signs of disruption are not present for the full six months required for the diagnosis of schizophrenia .

As a suffix in an English or Welsh place name , it is in most regions pronounced , or sometimes .
The states of New South Wales , Victoria , Queensland and Western Australia use the term `` Shire '' for this unit .
Individually , or as a suffix in Scotland and in the far northeast of England , the word is pronounced .
`` Shire '' is the most common word in Australia for rural Local Government Areas -LRB- LGA -RRB- .
In Wales , the counties of Merioneth and Glamorgan are occasionally referred to with the `` shire '' suffix .

Floras can mean plant life of an historic era as in fossil flora .
Plants are grouped into floras based on region , period , special environment , or climate .
Regions can be geographically distinct habitats like mountain vs. flatland .
The term `` flora '' comes from Latin language Flora , the goddess of flowers in Roman mythology .
The corresponding term for animal life is fauna .
Bacterial organisms are sometimes included in a flora , and sometimes the terms bacterial flora and plant flora are used separately .

S.T.A.L.K.E.R. : Shadow of Chernobyl is a first-person shooter video game by the Ukrainian developer GSC Game World , published in 2007 .
THQ ran a competition in January 2007 offering the winners the chance to play the beta version of S.T.A.L.K.E.R. , in a 24 hour marathon session .
These monsters migrate in large groups .
Numerous tactics can be employed to complete the game , such as rushing or using stealth and sniping .
For instance , rescuing stalkers from danger , destroying stalker renegades , protecting or attacking stalker camps or searching for treasure .
A multiplayer demo was released to the public on March 15 , 2007 .
In late February GSC managed to release a public beta .
The background and some terminology of the game -LRB- `` The Zone '' , `` Stalker '' -RRB- is borrowed from the popular science fiction novella Roadside Picnic by Boris and Arkady Strugatsky and the 1979 Andrei Tarkovsky film Stalker that was loosely based on it , as well as Stalker , the film 's subsequent novelization by the original authors .
In October , 2005 , THQ confirmed that S.T.A.L.K.E.R. would not be out `` until the second half of THQ 's 2007 fiscal year - October 2006 at the earliest . ''
A weather system is integrated into various parts of the landscape and allows a variety of weather effects , such as sunshine , storms and showers .
The weapons available , behavior of the AI , game tactics and ranking systems depend on the weather .
It features an alternate reality theme , where a second nuclear disaster occurs at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in the near future and causes strange changes in the area around it .
The game has a non-linear storyline and features gameplay elements such as trading and two-way communication with NPCs .
In February 2006 , THQ revised this possible release window , saying the game would not be in stores until the first quarter of 2007 .
In February 2005 , THQ expressed a desire to see the game released toward the end of its 2006 fiscal year -LRB- March 31 , 2006 -RRB- but maintained that no release date had been set .
On the morning of the event , the winners were met at the venue by the THQ staff that had organized the event , who were embarrassed to report that they had been unable to get any copies of the game .
ALife supports more than one thousand characters inhabiting the Zone .
In an interview at the Russian Gameland Awards , PR Manager Oleg Yavorsky indicated that release was planned for September 2006 .
The X-ray engine uses GSC Game World 's proprietary ALife artificial intelligence engine .
The NPCs have a full life cycle -LRB- task accomplishment , combat , rest , feeding and sleep -RRB- and the same applies to the many monsters living in the Zone -LRB- hunting , attacking stalkers and other monsters , resting , eating , sleeping -RRB- .
Meanwhile hundreds of screenshots of the game had been released , as well as a dozen preview video clips , accompanied by other forms of promotion by GSC , such as inviting fans to their offices in Kiev to play the current build of the game .
The event , scheduled to take place on January 24 , 2007 , was subsequently changed to a 12 hour session days before it was supposed to occur .
The non-scripted nature of the characters means that there are an unlimited number of random quests .
The game was first announced in November 2001 and had its release date , originally in 2003 , pushed back several times .

The Cucurbitales are an order of flowering plants , included in the rosid group of dicotyledons .
Specifically , the Cucurbitaceae are responsible for some food species , such as squash , pumpkin -LRB- both from Cucurbita -RRB- , watermelon -LRB- Citrullus vulgaris -RRB- and other melons , and cucumber -LRB- Cucumis -RRB- .
The large families of Cucurbitales include several economically important plants .
This order mostly belongs to tropical areas , with limited presence in subtropic and temperate regions .
The order includes various shrubs and trees , together with many herbs and climbers .

Peake 's mother was an Army nurse , and his brother was a naval aviator .
Peake grew up in a US military family .
In 2004 , he retired from a 38-year United States Army career .
At the age of 18 , he set upon his own Army career when he was accepted to West Point .
Awards and decorations that Peake has received include the Distinguished Service Medal -LRB- with oak leaf cluster -RRB- , Silver Star , Defense Superior Service Medal , Legion of Merit -LRB- with three oak leaf clusters -RRB- , Bronze Star with `` V '' device -LRB- with one oak leaf cluster -RRB- , Purple Heart -LRB- with oak leaf cluster -RRB- , Meritorious Service Medal -LRB- with two oak leaf clusters -RRB- , Air Medal , Joint Services Commendation Medal , Army Commendation Medal with `` V '' device -LRB- with one oak leaf cluster -RRB- , Humanitarian Service Medal , the Armed Forces Expeditionary Medal , Combat Infantryman Badge , Combat Medical Badge , Navy Meritorious Unit Commendation , Joint Meritorious Unit Award -LRB- with one oak leaf cluster -RRB- , Senior Parachutist Badge , Pathfinder Badge , Ranger Tab and Army Staff Identification Badge .
After retiring from the Army , Peake served as Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer of Project Hope , a non-profit international health foundation operating in more than 30 countries .
His father began as an enlisted man in the Army , and became an officer who spent most of his 30-year career in the Medical Service Corps .
Peake received his Bachelor of Science degree from U.S. Military Academy at West Point in 1966 and was commissioned a second lieutenant in the U.S. Army Infantry .
While at Project HOPE he helped to orchestrate the use of civilian volunteers aboard the Navy Hospital Ship Mercy as it responded to the Tsunami disaster in Indonesia and also as part of the Hurricane Katrina response aboard the Hospital Ship Comfort .
He retired from the Army in 2004 , as a Lieutenant General .
James Benjamin Peake -LRB- born June 18 , 1944 -RRB- is a former United States Secretary of Veterans Affairs , serving from 2007 to 2009 .
Peake served for four years as the United States Army Surgeon General .
He was awarded a medical doctorate in 1972 .
Just prior to his nomination as Secretary of Veterans Affairs , Peake served as Chief Medical Officer and Chief Executive Officer for QTC , one of the largest private providers of government-outsourced occupational health and disability examination services in the nation .
After Vietnam , he attended Cornell University 's Weill Cornell Medical College .
He was confirmed by the United States Senate on December 14 , 2007 and sworn in at VA headquarters by Vice President Dick Cheney on December 20 .
Peake 's selection as VA secretary was announced on October 30 , 2007 .
He also served as the 40th Surgeon General of the United States Army .
Following service in Vietnam with the 101st Airborne Division where he was awarded the Silver Star , a Bronze Star with â Vâ device and the Purple Heart with oak leaf cluster , Peake entered medical school at Cornell University in New York .
Previous key assignments include Commander , U.S. Army Medical Department Center and School and Installation Commander , Fort Sam Houston , Texas ; Deputy Commander , U.S. Army Medical Command , Fort Sam Houston , Texas ; Commanding General , Madigan Army Medical Center\/Northwest Health Service Support Activity , Tacoma , Washington ; Commanding General , 44th Medical Brigade\/Corps Surgeon , XVIII Airborne Corps , Fort Bragg , North Carolina ; Deputy Director , Professional Services\/Chief , Consultant , Office of the Surgeon General , Falls Church , Virginia ; Commander , 18th Medical Command and 121st Evacuation Hospital\/Command Surgeon , Seoul , Korea ; Deputy Commander for Clinical Services , Tripler Army Medical Center , Honolulu , Hawaii ; Assistant Chief , Cardiothoracic Surgery , Brooke Army Medical Center , Fort Sam Houston , Texas ; Staff General Surgeon\/Chief , General Surgery Clinic , DeWitt Army Hospital , Fort Belvoir , Virginia ; and General Surgery Resident , Brooke Army Medical Center , Fort Sam Houston , Texas .
He also served as commander of several Army medical units .
Peake was born in St. Louis , Missouri .
He is also a graduate of the United States Army War College , in 1988 .

Schrock is a member of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences , National Academy of Sciences and was elected to the Board of Overseers of Harvard University in 2007 .
Schrock carbenes are named after Schrock .
Schrock was the first to elucidate the structure and mechanism of so called ` black box ' olefin metathesis catalysts .
He holds a B.A. -LRB- 1967 -RRB- from the University of California , Riverside and a Ph. . D. -LRB- 1971 -RRB- from Harvard University .
In 2005 , Schrock received the Nobel Prize in Chemistry , with Robert H. Grubbs and Yves Chauvin , for his work in the area of olefin metathesis , an organic synthesis technique .
In 1972 , he was hired by DuPont , where he worked at the Experimental Station in Wilmington , Delaware in the group of George Parshall .
He married Nancy Carlson in 1971 and has two children , Andrew and Eric .
At Harvard he studied under J.A. Osborn .
Nancy Schrock is the Thomas F. Peterson , Jr. .
He has held his current post , the Frederick G. Keyes Professor of Chemistry , at MIT since 1989 .
Richard Royce Schrock -LRB- born 4 January 1945 -RRB- is an American chemist and Nobel laureate recognized for his contributions to the metathesis reaction used in organic chemistry .
Conservator of Special Collections for the MIT Libraries .
Born in Berne , Indiana , Schrock went to Mission Bay High School in San Diego , California .
He joined the faculty of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 1975 and became full professor in 1980 .
The family lives in Winchester , Massachusetts .
Composers such as Orlando Gibbons , John Blow , Sigismund von Neukomm , and Henry Purcell wrote voluntaries , although sometimes they preferred to use other titles such as fancy -LRB- an English form of the Italian word fantasia -RRB- , or even fugue .
The music that an organist plays before and after a service is always called a voluntary .
In music a voluntary is a piece of music , usually for organ , which is played as part of a church service .
However , these fugues were not composed in the proper fugue style : they just started off with imitation as in a fugue , but continued in a freer style .
The title was often used by English composers in the late Renaissance or Baroque periods for a piece of organ music that was free in style , i.e. it did not have to be composed in a strict form such as sonata form or a fugue .
The word â voluntaryâ can be used for the title of a piece of music .

A medical illustrator is a professional artist who interprets and creates visual material to help record and disseminate medical , biological and related knowledge .
In the late 1890s , Max BrÃ del , a talented artist from Leipzig , was brought to The Johns Hopkins School of Medicine in Baltimore to illustrate for Harvey Cushing , William Halstead , Howard Kelly , and other notable clinicians .
As a profession , medical illustration has a more recent history .
Medical illustrators not only produce such material but can also function as consultants and administrators within the field of biocommunication .

Gulf County is a county located in the panhandle of the U.S. state of Florida .
Males had a median income of $ 27,539 versus $ 20,780 for females .
Gulf County is heavily Democratic .
Gulf County , created in 1925 , was named for the Gulf of Mexico .
Its county seat is Port St. Joe , Florida .
25.50 % of all households were made up of individuals and 11.40 % had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older .
The U.S. Census Bureau 2005 estimate for the county is 13,975 .
The median income for a household in the county was $ 30,276 , and the median income for a family was $ 36,289 .
Other examples include Idaho County , Idaho , and Malheur County , Oregon , having parts in both Mountain and Pacific time zones as well as Cherry County , Nebraska which is in both the Mountain and Central Time Zones .
The population density was 24 people per square mile -LRB- 9\/km Â -RRB- .
As of 2000 , the population was 13,332 .
2.03 % of the population were Hispanic or Latino of any race .
However , the county tends to vote Republican in statewide and national elections .
In 2004 , Gulf County re-elected President George W. Bush by a 2 to 1 margin .
The per capita income for the county was $ 14,449 .
Despite remaining a Democratic stronghold , In the 2008 Presidential election John McCain carried the county with 69 % of the vote .
By way of the Intracoastal Waterway , Gulf County is one of a small number of counties in the United States to be under two time zones , Eastern and Central in this case .
For every 100 females age 18 and over , there were 116.70 males .

According to the 2000 census , the county has a total area of 744.59 s , of which 554.60 s -LRB- or 74.48 % -RRB- is land and 190.00 s -LRB- or 25.52 % -RRB- is water .
The racial makeup of the county was 79.89 % White , 16.94 % Black or African American , 0.65 % Native American , 0.40 % Asian , 0.05 % Pacific Islander , 0.53 % from other races , and 1.55 % from two or more races .
About 13.70 % of families and 16.70 % of the population were below the poverty line , including 20.80 % of those under age 18 and 14.10 % of those age 65 or over .
In 1965 the county seat was moved to Port Saint Joe , which under its original name Saint Joseph , had been the site of Florida 's first Constitutional Convention in 1838 .

At Powhatan 's capital of Matchcot , the English encountered a group of some senior Indian leaders -LRB- but not Powhatan himself , who was away -RRB- .
In March 1617 , Rolfe and Pocahontas boarded a ship to return to Virginia , however , the ship had only gone as far as Gravesend on the River Thames when Pocahontas became gravely ill. .
Pocahontas 's feelings about Rolfe and the marriage are unknown .
Pocahontas often went to the settlement and played games with the boys there .
She was a daughter of Wahunsunacawh , better known as Chief or Emperor Powhatan -LRB- to indicate his primacy -RRB- , who headed a network of tributary tribal nations in the Tidewater region of Virginia -LRB- called Tenakomakah by the Powhatan -RRB- .
Upon her baptism , Pocahontas took the Christian name `` Rebecca '' .
Smith did not meet Pocahontas , but wrote to Queen Anne , the wife of King James , urging that Pocahontas be treated with respect as a royal visitor .
Pocahontas -LRB- c. 1595 â `` March 21 , 1617 -RRB- , later known as Rebecca Rolfe , was a Virginia Indian chief 's daughter notable for having assisted colonial settlers at Jamestown . She converted to Christianity and married the English settler John Rolfe .
Pocahontas believed that account until she learned that he was living in England when she traveled there several years later , already the wife of John Rolfe .
In the fall of 1609 , an injury from a gunpowder explosion forced Smith to return to England for medical care .
When the colonists were starving , `` every once in four or five days , Pocahontas with her attendants brought him -LRB- Smith -RRB- so much provision that saved many of their lives that else for all this had starved with hunger . ''
John Smith was living in London at the time and while Pocahontas was in Plymouth , she learned he was still alive .

The 6-PUL units were designated 6-COR until 1935 -LRB- the COR designation was later used for 4-COR units -RRB- .
The Southern Railway -LRB- SR -RRB- gave the designations 6-PUL , 6-CITY and 6-PAN to electric multiple units built to work the routes between London and Brighton , West Worthing and Eastbourne .

Australia 's first parliamentary elections were conducted for the New South Wales Legislative Council in 1843 , again with voting rights -LRB- for males only -RRB- tied to property ownership or financial capacity .
Voter rights were extended further in New South Wales in 1850 and elections for legislative councils were held in the colonies of Victoria , South Australia and Tasmania .
In 1840 , the Adelaide City Council and the Sydney City Council were established .
An innovative secret ballot was introduced in Victoria , Tasmania and South Australia in 1856 , in which the government supplied voting paper containing the names of candidates and voters could select in private . This system was adopted around the world , becoming known as the `` Australian Ballot '' .
In 1855 , limited self government was granted by London to New South Wales , Victoria , South Australia and Tasmania .
1855 also saw the granting of the right to vote to all male British subjects 21 years or over in South Australia .
The Leader of the Opposition in New Zealand is the politician who , at least in theory , commands the support of the non-government bloc of members in the New Zealand Parliament .
Often , these relate to national security matters , which are supposed to transcend party politics - the New Zealand Security Intelligence Service , for example , is required to brief the Leader of the Opposition as well as the Prime Minister on certain matters .
The Leader of the Opposition does not have a large official role , as most of the post 's functions are ceremonial . Nevertheless , there are several ways in which the Leader of the Opposition participates directly in affairs of state .
The Leader of the Opposition also receives a higher salary than other members of the Opposition , being paid the same amount as a Cabinet Minister .
In the debating chamber the Leader of the Opposition sits directly opposite the Prime Minister .
as of 2010 the Leader of the Opposition is Phil Goff .
By convention , the Leader of the Opposition is the leader of the largest party of the Opposition .

In Freud 's psychology , displacement -LRB- from German Verschiebung , literally meaning ` shift ' or ` move ' -RRB- is an unconscious defense mechanism whereby the mind redirects affects from an object felt to be dangerous or unacceptable to an object felt to be safe or acceptable .
In a metal carbon dioxide complexes , CO2 serves as a ligand , which can facilitate the conversion of CO2 to other chemicals .
As part of the carbon cycle known as photosynthesis , plants , algae , and cyanobacteria absorb carbon dioxide , sunlight , and water to produce carbohydrate energy for themselves and oxygen as a waste product . By contrast , during respiration they emit carbon dioxide , as do all other living things that depend either directly or indirectly on plants for food .

British governance of large swathes of Indian territory began with Robert Clive 's victory over the Nawab of Bengal , Siraj ud-Daulah , at the Battle of Plassey in 1757 .
The victory gave the British East India Company dominion over Bengal , which became the headquarters of British administration in the sub-continent .
After the Indian rebellion of 1857 -LRB- known as the `` Mutiny '' -RRB- , the British government took direct control away from the East India Co. , and established its imperial capital at Calcutta , the city founded by the Company .

The physics affecting the bullet once it leaves the barrel , is termed external ballistics .
The primary factors affecting the aerodynamics of a bullet in flight are the bullet 's shape and the rotation imparted by the rifling of the gun barrel .
The outcome of the impact is determined by the composition and density of the target material , the angle of incidence , and the velocity and physical characteristics of the bullet itself .
Mould manufacturers such as RCBS , Paul Jones Moulds , and David Mos offer many different calibers and designs .
Bullets must be produced to a high standard , as surface imperfections can affect firing accuracy .
With a mould , bullets can be made at home for reloading one 's own ammunition , where local laws allow .
Bullets must have a surface which will form this seal without causing excessive friction .
Actual bullet shapes are many and varied , and an array of them can be found in any reloading manual that sells bullet moulds .
Cast and jacketed bullets are also commercially available from numerous manufacturers for hand loading and are much more convenient than casting bullets from bulk lead .
The bullet must also engage the rifling without damaging the gun 's bore .
These unstable bullets tumbled erratically and provided only moderate accuracy , however the aerodynamic shape changed little for centuries .
Bullets are generally designed to penetrate , deform , and\/or break apart .
They must first form a seal with the gun 's bore .
Bullet designs have to solve two primary problems .
See Terminal ballistics and\/or Stopping power for an overview of how bullet design affects what happens when a bullet impacts with an object .
These interactions between bullet and bore are termed internal ballistics .
Any asymmetry in the bullet is largely canceled as it spins .
With smooth-bore firearms , a spherical shape was optimum because no matter how it was oriented , it presented a uniform front .
Rotational forces stabilize the bullet gyroscopically as well as aerodynamically .
Hand-casting , however , is only time - and cost-effective for solid lead bullets .
If a strong seal is not achieved , gas from the propellant charge leaks past the bullet , reducing efficiency .
For a given material and bullet , the strike velocity is the primary factor determining which outcome is achieved .

In those treated for diabetes a diagnosis of hypoglycemia can be made based on the presence of a low blood sugar alone . Otherwise Whipple 's triad is required which include symptoms consistent with hypoglycemia , a low blood sugar , and resolution of these symptoms once the blood sugar improves .

San Diego Comic-Con International , also known as Comic-Con International : San Diego -LRB- as given on its website -RRB- , and commonly known as Comic-Con or the San Diego Comic-Con , was founded as the Golden State Comic Book Convention and later the San Diego Comic Book Convention in 1970 by Shel Dorf and a group of San Diegans .
Though monumental architecture at the site dates back as far as the 4th century BC , Tikal reached its apogee during the Classic Period , ca .
Following the end of the Late Classic Period , no new major monuments were built at Tikal and there is evidence that elite palaces were burned .
Tikal -LRB- or Tikâ al according to the modern Mayan orthography -RRB- is one of the largest archaeological sites and urban centres of the pre-Columbian Maya civilization .
The reliance on seasonal rainfall left Tikal vulnerable to prolonged drought , which is thought by some to have played a role in the Classic Maya Collapse .
During this time , the city dominated much of the Maya region politically , economically , and militarily , while interacting with areas throughout Mesoamerica such as the great metropolis of Teotihuacan in the distant Valley of Mexico .
One of the largest of the Classic Maya cities , Tikal had no water other than what was collected from rainwater and stored in ten reservoirs .
Tikal prospered with intensive agricultural techniques , which were far more advanced than the slash and burn methods originally theorized by archaeologists .
Archaeologists working in Tikal during the 20th century refurbished one of these ancient reservoirs to store water for their own use .

The program is set in Seattle , Washington , and was filmed in Vancouver , British Columbia , at Lions Gate Studios .

20000 Varuna is a large classical Kuiper belt object -LRB- KBO -RRB- and a potential dwarf planet .
Given the rapid rotation , rare for objects so large , Varuna is thought to be an elongated spheroid -LRB- ratio of axis 2:3 -RRB- , with a mean density around 1 g\/cm3 -LRB- roughly the density of water -RRB- .

Hershey and Chase conducted their experiments on the T2 phage , a virus whose structure had recently been shown by electron microscopy .
The Hersheyâ `` Chase experiments were a series of experiments conducted in 1952 by Alfred Hershey and Martha Chase , confirming that DNA was the genetic material , which had first been demonstrated in the 1944 Averyâ `` MacLeodâ `` McCarty experiment .
The phage infects a bacterium by attaching to its outer membrane and injecting its genetic material , leaving its empty shell attached to the bacterium .
Hershey shared the 1969 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine with Chase for their â discoveries concerning the genetic structure of viruses .

Talencieux is a commune in the ArdÃ che department in southern France .
Eukaryotic cells are typically much larger than those of prokaryotes .
In most eukaryotes , these protein-carrying vesicles are released and further modified in stacks of flattened vesicles , called Golgi bodies or dictyosomes .
In higher plants , most of a cell 's volume is taken up by a central vacuole , which primarily maintains its osmotic pressure .
It includes the rough ER where ribosomes are attached to synthesize proteins , which enter the interior space or lumen .
In multicellular organisms , hormones are often produced in vesicles .
Eukaryotic cells include a variety of membrane-bound structures , collectively referred to as the endomembrane system .
Many cells ingest food and other materials through a process of endocytosis , where the outer membrane invaginates and then pinches off to form a vesicle .
Simple compartments , called vesicles or vacuoles , can form by budding off other membranes .
They have a variety of internal membranes and structures , called organelles , and a cytoskeleton composed of microtubules , microfilaments , and intermediate filaments , which play an important role in defining the cell 's organization and shape .
Subsequently , they generally enter vesicles , which bud off from the smooth ER .
Eukaryotic DNA is divided into several linear bundles called chromosomes , which are separated by a microtubular spindle during nuclear division .

`` Evil on Your Mind '' is the name of a popular Country music song , originally made famous by Grand Ole Opry star , Jan Howard in 1966 .
The song set the stage for a number of Top 20 and Top 10 hits Howard would have as a solo and duet artist between 1966 and 1971 .
A rock music group titled , The Stumbleweeds recorded Howard 's `` Evil on Your Mind '' .

Pascagoula is a city in Jackson County , Mississippi , United States .
The population was 26,200 at the 2000 census .
It is the principal city of the Pascagoula , Mississippi Metropolitan Statistical Area , as a part of the Gulfport -- Biloxi -- Pascagoula , Mississippi Combined Statistical Area .
It is the county seat of Jackson County .
