The Sundance Film Festival is a film festival that takes place annually in the state of Utah , in the United States . It is the largest independent cinema festival in the United States .
GÃ del 's incompleteness theorems are two theorems of mathematical logic that establish inherent limitations of all but the most trivial axiomatic systems for mathematics .
For example , one might take all true statements about the natural numbers to be axioms -LRB- and no false statements -RRB- , which gives the theory known as `` true arithmetic '' .
The two results are widely interpreted as showing that Hilbert 's program to find a complete and consistent set of axioms for all of mathematics is impossible , thus giving a negative answer to Hilbert 's second problem .
The theorems , proven by Kurt GÃ del in 1931 , are important both in mathematical logic and in the philosophy of mathematics .
In 1925 Albers was promoted to Professor , the year the Bauhaus moved to Dessau .
His work in Dessau included designing furniture and working with glass .
Accomplished as a designer , photographer , typographer , printmaker and poet , Albers is best remembered for his work as an abstract painter and theorist .
In this rigorous series , begun in 1949 , Albers explored chromatic interactions with flat colored squares arranged concentrically .
Josef Albers -LRB- March 19 , 1888 â `` March 25 , 1976 -RRB- was a German-born American artist and educator whose work , both in Europe and in the United States , formed the basis of some of the most influential and far-reaching art education programs of the 20th century .
Most famous of all are the hundreds of paintings and prints that make up the series Homage to the Square .
He studied art in Berlin , Essen , and Munich , before enrolling as a student in the basic course of Johannes Itten at the prestigious Weimar Bauhaus in 1920 .
Albers was born in Bottrop , Westphalia -LRB- Germany -RRB- .

Pulitzer shifted its focus to human-interest stories , scandal , and sensationalism .
Under Pulitzer 's leadership circulation grew from 15,000 to 600,000 , making it the largest newspaper in the country .
In 1902 , Columbia 's new president Nicholas Murray Butler was more receptive to the plan for a school and prizes , but it would not be until after Pulitzer 's death that this dream would be fulfilled .
In 1879 he bought the St. Louis Dispatch , and the St. Louis Post and merged the two papers as the St. Louis Post-Dispatch , which remains St. Louis 's daily newspaper .
The university initially turned down the money , evidently turned off by Pulitzer 's odd personality .
In 1883 , Pulitzer , by then a wealthy man , purchased the New York World , a newspaper that had been losing $ 40,000 a year , for $ 346,000 from Jay Gould .
In 1895 the World introduced the immensely popular The Yellow Kid comic by Richard F. Outcault , the first newspaper comic printed with color .
In 1887 , he recruited the famous investigative journalist Nellie Bly .
In 1917 , the first Pulitzer Prizes were awarded , in accordance with Pulitzer 's wishes .
Pulitzer left the university $ 2 million in his will , which led to the creation in 1912 of the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism , but by then at Pulitzer 's urging the Missouri School of Journalism had been created at the University of Missouri .
In 1892 , Pulitzer offered Columbia University 's president , Seth Low , money to set up the world 's first school of journalism .
Pulitzer 's already failing health deteriorated rapidly and he withdrew from the daily management of the newspaper , although he continued to actively manage the paper from his vacation retreat in Bar Harbor , Maine , and his New York mansion .
After the World exposed an illegal payment of $ 40 million by the United States to the French Panama Canal Company in 1909 , Pulitzer was indicted for libeling Theodore Roosevelt and J. P. Morgan .
In 1872 , Pulitzer purchased a share in the Westliche Post for $ 3,000 , and then sold his stake in the paper for a profit in 1873 .
This competition with Hearst , particularly the coverage before and during the Spanish-American War , linked Pulitzer 's name with yellow journalism .
In 1989 Pulitzer was inducted into the St. Louis Walk of Fame .
He is interred in the Woodlawn Cemetery in The Bronx , New York .
In 1884 , he was elected to the U.S. House of Representatives , but resigned after a few months ' service on account of the pressure of journalistic duties .
The courts dismissed the indictments .
It was at the Post-Dispatch that Pulitzer developed his role as a champion of the common man with exposÃ s and a hard-hitting populist approach .
In 1895 , William Randolph Hearst purchased the rival New York Journal from Pulitzer 's brother , Albert , which led to a circulation war .
A Cockapoo is a cross breed dog , bred for the first time in the United States , by crossing an American Cocker Spaniel or English Cocker Spaniel and a poodle -LRB- in most cases the miniature poodle or toy poodle -RRB- , or by breeding cockapoo to cockapoo .
There are currently three cockapoo clubs in America that are working towards developing the cockapoo by breeding successive generations , and establishing the cockapoo as a recognized breed .

Lepisma saccharina , frequently called silverfish , fishmoths , carpet sharks or paramites , are small , wingless insects in the order Thysanura .
Its common name derives from the animal 's silvery light gray and blue color , combined with the fish-like appearance of its movements , while the scientific name indicates the silverfish 's diet of carbohydrates such as sugar or starches .

In efforts to protect the remaining population , three potoroos -LRB- one male and two females -RRB- were translocated to Bald Island in August 2005 where they are free from predation .
A few young were born in the first couple of years , but then breeding stopped for no known reason .
It is currently not known how long gestation is for Gilbertâ s potoroo , but it is estimated to be similar to the Long-nosed Potorooâ s length of 38 days .
Liz Sinclair had been doing research on wallabies and caught the potoroo in one of her traps .
Potoroos live under dense bushes and shrubs .
If the first baby does not go to term , this allows a second baby to start growing right away .
This small population size is what has made them be listed as critically endangered .
They have the ability to keep a second embryo in a state of diapause while the first embryo is growing .
It is one of the worldâ s rarest mammals .
Australia has the majority of different kinds of truffles and Potoroos like to eat a variety of them .

It is described as pointed in the face and about the size of a rabbit .
The female potoroos can have two babies in a year , while carrying only one at a time .
The species was thus considered extinct for 120 years before it was re-discovered in 1994 in Two Peoples Bay Nature Reserve .
Potoroos have sharp three toed claws that help them dig into the ground to unearth truffles hiding underneath the earthâ s surface .
Potoroos are nocturnal and spend their days hiding under the dense thicket and rarely cross over large areas .

It is commonly used as a measure of antagonist drug potency in pharmacological research .
EC50 also represents the plasma concentration required for obtaining 50 % of a maximum effect in vivo .
This quantitative measure indicates how much of a particular drug or other substance -LRB- inhibitor -RRB- is needed to inhibit a given biological process -LRB- or component of a process , i.e. an enzyme , cell , cell receptor or microorganism -RRB- by half .
According to the FDA , IC50 represents the concentration of a drug that is required for 50 % inhibition in vitro .
It is comparable to an EC50 for agonist drugs .
Sometimes , it is also converted to the pIC50 scale -LRB- - log IC50 -RRB- , in which higher values indicate exponentially greater potency .
In other words , it is the half maximal -LRB- 50 % -RRB- inhibitory concentration -LRB- IC -RRB- of a substance -LRB- 50 % IC , or IC50 -RRB- .

Unlike 1 Maccabees , 2 Maccabees was written in Koine Greek , probably in Alexandria , Egypt , c 124 BC .
2 Maccabees is a deuterocanonical book of the Bible , which focuses on the Jews ' revolt against Antiochus IV Epiphanes and concludes with the defeat of the Syrian general Nicanor in 161 BC by Judas Maccabeus , the hero of the work .
It presents a revised version of the historical events recounted in the first seven chapters of 1 Maccabees , adding material from the Pharisaic tradition , including prayer for the dead and a resurrection on Judgment Day .
Nicolas-Joseph Cugnot -LRB- 26 February 1725 â `` 2 October 1804 -RRB- was a French inventor .
He is believed to have built the first self-propelled mechanical vehicle .
Emphysema is a long-term , progressive disease of the lungs that primarily causes shortness of breath . In people with emphysema , the tissues necessary to support the physical shape and function of the lungs are destroyed .
Emphysema is called an obstructive lung disease because the destruction of lung tissue around smaller sacs , called alveoli , makes these air sacs unable to hold their functional shape upon exhalation .
Lee Baxter -LRB- born 17 June 1976 -RRB- is a Swedish football goalkeeper and goalkeeper coach of Anglo-Scottish descent who currently plays for AIK .
Drivers did not finish the Grand Prix , but were classified as they completed over 90 % of the race distance .
The FIA World Council approved the 2008 schedule on 24 October 2007 .
It began on 16 March and ended on 2 November with eighteen Grand Prix races .
Eleven teams competed in the championship , although Super Aguri withdrew on 6 May from the 2008 Formula One season due to financial troubles , completing four races .
Singapore was Formula One 's first ever night race .
In a scandal that became known as `` Crashgate '' in the media , during the 2009 season around the time of the Belgium Grand Prix , allegations by former Renault driver Nelson Piquet Jr. about his crash in the 2008 Singapore Grand Prix led to charges of race-fixing against Renault and the departure of team boss Flavio Briatore and engineering director Pat Symonds .
The 2008 Formula One season was the 59th FIA Formula One World Championship season .

Jacques Plante holds the record for winning the most Vezinas with seven , trailed by Bill Durnan and Dominik Hasek both of whom have won six .
Billy Smith of the New York Islanders was the first winner of the Vezina under the current system .
Hasek has won the most under the current system of honoring the best individual goalie .
The William M. Jennings Trophy was created as a new award for the goaltender -LRB- s -RRB- of the team that surrenders the fewest goals in regular season play .
Since 1981 , the Vezina Trophy has been awarded by the NHL general managers to the most outstanding goaltender .
It was recognized that this system often meant the trophy went to the goaltender of the better team rather than the individual and hence a change was made to offer the William M. Jennings Trophy to the goaltender -LRB- s -RRB- playing for the team with the fewest goals against . Since 1981 , the Vezina Trophy has been awarded by the NHL general managers to the most outstanding goaltender .
Chuck Rayner was the only goaltender to win the Hart Memorial Trophy , but never the Vezina .
Players for the Montreal Canadiens have won the Vezina 28 times .
There are only three players that have won both the Vezina and Hart Memorial Trophy for the same season : Jacques Plante , who won both trophies for the 1961 â `` 62 season ; Dominik Hasek who won both for the 1996 â `` 97 and 1997 â `` 98 seasons ; and Jose Theodore , who won the Vezina and Hart for the 2001 â `` 02 NHL season .
The NHL adopted the current criteria for the Vezina Trophy beginning in 1981-82 .
The Vezina Trophy is awarded annually to the National Hockey League 's goaltender who is `` adjudged to be the best at this position '' .
At the end of each season , the 30 General Managers of the teams in the National Hockey League vote to determine the goaltender who was the most valuable to his team during the regular season .
Two other Vezina winning goaltenders have also won the Hart Memorial Trophy : Roy Worters and Al Rollins .
In 1946 , the trophy was amended to go to the goaltender -LRB- s -RRB- of the team allowing the fewest number of goals during the regular season . This criteria was in place until the 1980 â `` 81 season .
Vezina collapsed during a game in 1925 and was diagnosed as having tuberculosis , of which he died in 1926 .
Upon Vezina 's death , the trophy was donated to the League by the Canadiens ' owners , Leo Dandurand , Louis Letourneau and Joe Cattarinich to honor Vezina permanently .
In the 1973 â `` 74 NHL season , Tony Esposito of the Chicago Black Hawks and Bernie Parent of the Philadelphia Flyers finished tied for the fewest goals against , the only time that there would be a tie between two players from different teams .
Under the original definition , there would often be multiple winners from the same team during one season .
It was recognized that this system often meant the trophy went to the goaltender of the better team rather than the individual and hence a change was made to offer the William M. Jennings Trophy to the goaltender -LRB- s -RRB- playing for the team with the fewest goals against .
There have been numerous instances of players receiving the trophy many times in different years , and players tying for the trophy .
The Vezina Trophy was named in honor of Georges VÃ zina , an exceptional goaltender with the Montreal Canadiens .
The voting is conducted at the end of the regular season by the 30 general managers of the teams in the National Hockey League , and each individual voter ranks their top three candidates on a 5-3-1 points system .
Three finalists are named and the trophy is awarded at the NHL Awards ceremony after the playoffs .

In the great statuary , the artist explores themes such as suffering , sleep or old age .

Few examples of Greek wall paintings have survived the centuries .
The figurines were equally fashionable .
Their mother Gaia , come to their aid , can do nothing and must watch them twist in pain under the blows of the gods .
In a completely different genre , there are the `` grotesques '' , which contrast violently with the canons of `` Greek beauty '' : the koroplathos -LRB- figurine maker -RRB- fashions deformed bodies in tortuous poses â '' hunchbacks , epileptics , hydrocephalics , obese women , etc. .
The Hellenistic period produced some masterpieces like the Gonzaga cameo , now in the Hermitage Museum , and spectacular hardstone carvings like the Cup of the Ptolemies in Paris .
This search is particularly flagrant in the portraits : more than the precision of the traits represented , the artist seeks to represent the character of his\/her subject .
It concerns cutting in relief on a stone composed of several colored layers , allowing the object to be presented in relief with more than one color .
Starting from a simple fortress located on the Acropolis , the various Attalid kings set up a colossal architectural complex .
Previously reserved for religious use , in Hellenistic Greece the terra cotta figurine was more frequently used for funerary , and even decorative , purposes .
Pergamon did not distinguish itself with its architecture alone : it was also the seat of a brilliant school of sculpture called Pergamene Baroque .
The most representative copies of this style come from Centuripe in Sicily , where a workshop was active until the 3rd century BC .
Molded glass continued , notably in the creation of intaglio jewelry .
The work on metal vases took on a new fullness : the artists competed among themselves with great virtuosity .
It is decorated with a 32-centimetre-tall frieze of figures in relief representing Dionysus surrounded by Ariadne and her procession of satyrs and maenads .
Because of this , only the smaller objects still exist .
Artemis Rospigliosi of the Louvre is probably a copy of one of them ; as for copies of the Dying Gaul , they were very numerous in the Roman period .
The Olympians triumph in it , each on his side , over Giants most of which are transformed into savage beasts : serpents , birds of prey , lions or bulls .
It was the time of gigantism : thus it was for the second temple of Apollo at Didyma , situated twenty kilometers from Miletus in Ionia .
The fragility of the pigments preventing frequent use of these vases , they were reserved for use in funerals .
The jewellers of the time excelled at handling details and filigrees : thus , the funeral wreaths present very realistic leaves of trees or stalks of wheat .
The art of glass developed especially in Italy .
The shapes of the vases are also inspired by the tradition of metal : thus with the lagynos -LRB- pictured here -RRB- , a wine jar typical of the period .
In parallel there subsisted a tradition of polychromatic figurative painting : the artists sought a greater variety of tints than in the past .
In it one sees four doves perched on the edge of a basin filled with water .
For example , the tomb said to be that of Philip II has provided a great frieze representing a royal lion hunt , remarkable by its composition , the arrangement of the figures in space and its realistic representation of nature .
Certain mosaics , however , provide a pretty good idea of the `` grand painting '' of the period : these are copies of frescoes .
The `` grotesques '' are equally common at Tarsus and also at Alexandria .
One such is the Barberini Faun of Munich , representing a sleeping satyr with relaxed posture and anxious face , perhaps the prey of nightmares .
The art of engraving gems hardly advanced at all , limiting itself to mass-produced items that lacked originality .
Sometimes , they were reduced to echoing a form from the great sculptures : thus one finds numerous copies in miniature of the Tyche -LRB- good luck -RRB- of Antioch , of which the original dates to the beginning of the 3rd century BC .
It is believed to be a copy of a painting described by Pliny the Elder -LRB- XXXV , 110 -RRB- which had been painted by Philoxenus of Eretria for King Cassander of Macedon at the end of the 4th century BC , or even of a painting by Apelles contemporaneous with Alexander himself .
Attalus I -LRB- 269-197 BC -RRB- , to commemorate his victory at Caicus against the Gauls â '' called Galatians by the Greeks â '' had two series of votive groups sculpted : the first , consecrated on the Acropolis of Pergamon , includes the famous Gaul killing himself and his wife , of which the original is lost -LRB- the best copy is in the Massimo alle Terme museum of Rome , see illustration -RRB- ; the second group , offered to Athens , is composed of small bronzes of Greeks , Amazons , gods and giants , Persians and Gauls .
The evolution is similar for the art of jewellery .
Fortunately , during Hellenistic Greece , the raw materials were plentiful following eastern conquests .
An example is the Alexander Mosaic , showing the confrontation of the young conqueror and the Grand King Darius III at the Battle of Issus , a mosaic from a floor in the House of the Faun at Pompeii -LRB- now in Naples -RRB- .
Another phenomenon appears in Hellenistic sculpture : privatization , which involves the recapture of older public patterns in decorative sculpture .
The mosaic allows us to admire the choice of colors , the composition of the ensemble with turning movement and facial expressivity .
In Tanagra , in Boeotia , the figurines , full of lively colors , most often represent elegant women in scenes full of charm .
One of them is watering herself while the others seem to be resting , which creates effects of reflections and shadow perfectly studied by the artist .
At Smyrna , in Asia Minor , two major styles occurred side-by-side : first of all , copies of masterpieces of great sculpture , such as Farnese Hercules in gilt terra cotta .
The refinement of molding techniques made it possible to create true miniature statues , with a high level of detail .
LaocoÃ n , strangled by snakes , tries desperately to loosen their grip without affording a glance at his dying sons .
Many of the large bronze statues were lost â '' with the majority being melted to recover the material .
At Panagyurishte -LRB- now in Bulgaria -RRB- , skillfully sculpted gold vases have been found : on an amphora , two rearing centaurs form the handles .
The drunk woman , also at Munich , portrays without reservation an old woman , thin , haggard , clutching against herself her jar of wine .
In Derveni , not far from Salonica , a tomb has provided a great krater with bronze volutes dating from approximately 320 BC and weighing 40 kilograms -LRB- Derveni krater -RRB- .
Portraiture is tinged with naturalism , under the influence of Roman art .
This type of retrospective style also exists in ceramics .
Pergamon in particular is a characteristic example of Hellenistic architecture .
As compensation , the cameo made its appearance .
These characteristics are pushed to their peak in the friezes of the Great Altar of Pergamon , decorated under the order of Eumenes II -LRB- 197-159 BC -RRB- with a gigantomachy stretching 110 metres in length , illustrating in the stone a poem composed especially for the court .
A colossal theater , able to contain nearly 10,000 spectators , has benches embedded in the flanks of the hill .
The figures , often female , are represented in colored clothing : blue-violet chiton , yellow himation , white veil .
It was in the Hellenistic period that the Greeks , who until then only knew molded glass , discovered the technique of glass blowing , thus permitting new forms .
Or they could simply be caricatures , designed to provoke laughter .
They represented divinities as well as subjects from contemporary life .
Thus , Venus de Milo , even while echoing a classic model , is distinguished by the twist of her hips .
The expression of sentiments , the forcefulness of details â '' bushy hair and moustaches here â '' and the violence of the movements are characteristic of the Pergamene style .
The Hellenistic period is that of the decline of painting on vases .
One finds also more complex relief , based on animals or mythological creatures .
Thus emerged the theme of the `` negro '' , particularly in Ptolemaic Egypt : these statuettes of Black adolescents were successful up to the Roman period .
The most common vases are black and uniform , with a shiny appearance approaching that of varnish , decorated with simple motifs of flowers or festoons .
In this period the insetting of precious stones flourished .
It is also the period when vases in relief appeared , doubtless in imitation of vases made of precious metals : wreaths in relief were applied to the body of the vase , or again the one shown here received veins or gadroons .
Hellenistic sculpture repeats the innovations of the `` second classicism '' : perfect sculpture-in-the-round , allowing the statue to be admired from all angles ; study of draping and effects of transparency of clothing ; suppleness of poses .
It has long been necessary to content oneself with studying the Hellenistic influences in Roman frescoes , for example those of Pompeii or Herculaneum .
Progress in bronze casting made it possible for the Greeks to create large works , such as the Colossus of Rhodes , with a height of 32 meters .

OXO was a computer game written for the EDSAC computer in 1952 , an implementation of the game known as Noughts and Crosses in the UK , or tic-tac-toe in the United States .
It was written by Alexander S. Douglas as an illustration for his Ph. D. thesis on human-computer interaction for the University of Cambridge .

The Southern Railway -LRB- SR -RRB- gave the designation Sub to the wide variety of electric multiple units that were used on inner-suburban workings in the South London area .
Originally these units were formed as three-car units , but in the 1940s , all surviving units were increased to four cars by the addition of an ` Augmentation ' trailer .
New four-car units were also built at this time , and these survived in passenger use until late 1983 , by which time British Rail had allocated to them TOPS Class 405 .
The Kamakura period is a period of Japanese history that marks the governance by the Kamakura Shogunate , officially established in 1192 in Kamakura by the first shogun Minamoto no Yoritomo .
During this time , a number of monks who had left the Tendai sect founded separate Buddhist sects of their own , including The older Buddhist sects such as Shingon , Tendai and the early schools of the Nara period continued to thrive through the Kamakura period , and even experienced some measure of a revival .
The Kamakura period ended in 1333 with the destruction of the shogunate and the short reestablishment of imperial rule under Emperor Go-Daigo by Ashikaga Takauji , Nitta Yoshisada , and Kusunoki Masashige .

It is undisputed that this identification is Chinese in form and Buddhist in implication , which suggests that the name must have been regularized centuries after the lifetime ascribed to Jimmu , possibly during the time in which legends about the origins of the Yamato dynasty were compiled as the chronicles known today as the Kojiki .
This emperor 's posthumous name literally means `` divine might '' or `` god-warrior '' .

The scientific study of plants , known as botany , has identified about 350,000 extant species of plants , defined as seed plants , bryophytes , ferns and fern allies .
They include familiar organisms such as trees , flowers , herbs , bushes , grasses , vines , ferns , mosses , and green algae .

The length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle can be found using the Pythagorean theorem , which states that the square of the length of the hypotenuse equals the sum of the squares of the lengths of the other two sides .
In geometry , a hypotenuse is the longest side of a right-angled triangle , the side opposite the right angle .

However , because the basso continuo is usually made up of at least two instruments -LRB- typically a cello or bass viol and a keyboard instrument such as the harpsichord -RRB- , trio sonatas are typically performed by at least four musicians .
The trio sonatas by Arcangelo Corelli -LRB- opus I , 1681 , opus III , 1689 -RRB- set an inspiring example .
A well-known exception is the trio sonata in Johann Sebastian Bach 's The Musical Offering , which is for violin and flute .
A trio sonata is written for two solo melodic instruments and basso continuo , making three parts in all , hence the name trio sonata .
The trio sonata is a musical form which was particularly popular around the 17th century and the 18th century .
A further innovation of Bach was the creation of what are strictly trio sonatas , involving a concertante -LRB- obligato -RRB- harpsichord part and one melodic instrument , thus for two players . Known examples are the six sonatas for harpsichord and solo violin -LRB- BWV 1014-1019 -RRB- , three sonatas for harpsichord and viola da gamba -LRB- BWV 1027-1029 -RRB- and the three sonatas for harpsichord and flauto traverso -LRB- BWV 1030-1032 -RRB-

He was one of the founders of La Questione Sociale , the Italian language anarchist paper published in Paterson .
In 1898 , high bread prices led to demonstrations all over Italy .
Bresci was born at Coiano , near Prato , Tuscany , and emigrated from Italy to the United States , making his living as a weaver in Paterson , New Jersey , which had a large Italian-American community .
In Monza , where the king was visiting on July 29 , 1900 , he shot him four times with a five-shot .32 revolver .
The people ignored the order to disperse , whereupon the General gave the signal to fire with muskets and cannons , resulting in a massacre of the demonstrators .
More than ninety people died .
There being no capital punishment in Italy at the time , he was sentenced in Milan on August 29 , 1900 , to penal servitude for life on Santo Stefano Island near Ventotene , where numerous other anarchists had also been sent over the years .
In Milan , an unarmed crowd of protestors marched toward the palace , which was surrounded by a strong military carabinieri force under command of General Fiorenzo Bava-Beccaris .
Less than a year later he was found dead in prison .
Gaetano Bresci -LRB- November 11 , 1869 â `` May 22 , 1901 -RRB- was an Italian American anarchist who assassinated Italian King Umberto I. Bresci was the first person to kill a European monarch -LRB- without toppling the monarchy -RRB- and not be executed .
King Umberto later decorated Bava-Beccaris , complimenting him upon his `` brave defense of the royal house '' â '' as a result of which Bresci became determined to kill the king .
Bresci was captured and put on trial , where he was defended by the anarchist lawyer Francesco Saverio Merlino .
Bresci had his loan to the paper returned -LRB- without telling his comrades why -RRB- , and with the money he went to Italy .
It is not clear whether he committed suicide , as officially announced , or whether he was murdered by his guards .

About 40 % of the Earth 's surface is now underlain by continental crust .
Continental crust is also less dense than oceanic crust , though it is considerably thicker ; mostly 25 to 70 km versus the average oceanic thickness of around 7 â `` 10 km .
Consisting mostly of granitic rock , continental crust has a density of about 2.7 g\/cm3 and is less dense than the material of the Earth 's mantle , which consists of mafic rock .
The continental crust is the layer of igneous , sedimentary , and metamorphic rocks which form the continents and the areas of shallow seabed close to their shores , known as continental shelves .

Cobalt -LRB- II -RRB- hydroxide decomposes to cobalt -LRB- II -RRB- oxide at 168 Â C under vacuum and is oxidized by air to form cobalt -LRB- III -RRB- hydroxide , Co -LRB- OH -RRB- 3 .
It also is used in cobalt blue glass . Cobalt -LRB- II -RRB- hydroxide or cobaltous hydroxide is the chemical compound composed of cobalt and the hydroxide ion with the formula Co -LRB- OH -RRB- 2 .
Parasitic wasps are typically parasitoids , and extremely diverse in habits , many laying their eggs in inert stages of their host -LRB- egg or pupa -RRB- , or sometimes paralyzing their prey by injecting it with venom through their ovipositor .
Parasitic wasps are increasingly used in agricultural pest control as they prey mostly on pest insects and have little impact on crops .
With most species , adult parasitic wasps themselves do not take any nutrients from their prey , and , much like bees , butterflies , and moths , those that do feed as adults typically derive all of their nutrition from nectar .
The host remains alive until the parasitoid larvae are mature , usually dying either when the parasitoids pupate , or when they emerge as adults .
They then insert one or more eggs into the host or deposit them upon the host externally .
Almost every pest insect species has at least one wasp species that preys upon it or parasitizes it , making wasps critically important in natural control of their numbers , or natural biocontrol .
The various species of wasps fall into one of two main categories : solitary wasps and social wasps .

Valencia is not as tight as Circuit de Monaco but overtaking opportunities are still relatively few , due to the straights not being straight and the dust off line .
The Valencia Street Circuit is a semi-permanent street circuit in Valencia , Spain which will host the Formula One European Grand Prix for seven years .
The first race meeting on the circuit was held over the 23\/24 August 2008 weekend , with Felipe Massa winning the main event , the European Grand Prix , after starting from pole position .
The circuit has been criticised by the drivers for its lack of overtaking opportunites .
The track is 5.419 k long and incorporates a total of 25 turns â `` 11 right-handers and 14 left-handers .
The official track layout was unveiled by Valencia councillor and transport counselor , Mario Flores , on 19 July 2007 .

Anatoliy Oleksandrovych Tymoshchuk -LRB- born 30 March 1979 in Lutsk -RRB- is a Ukrainian football midfielder who plays for German Bundesliga club Bayern Munich and the Ukrainian national team .
Nikolai Suetin used Suprematist motifs on works at the St. Petersburg Lomonosov Porcelain Factory where Malevich and Chashnik were also employed , and Malevich designed a Suprematist teapot .
This development in artistic expression came about when Russia was in a revolutionary state , ideas were in ferment , and the old order was being swept away .
He created a suprematist ` grammar ' based on fundamental geometric forms ; in particular , the square and the circle .
Malevich 's architectural projects were known after 1922 Arkhitektoniki .
`` Black Square '' was painted in 1915 and was presented as a breakthrough in his career and in art in general .
As the new order became established , and Stalinism took hold from 1924 on , the state began limiting the freedom of artists .
The centerpiece of his show was the Black Square , placed in what is called the red\/beautiful corner in Russian Orthodox tradition ; the place of the main icon in a house .
Another part of the formalism was low regard for triangles which were `` dismissed as Ancient , pagan , or Christian '' .
I felt only night within me and it was then that I conceived the new art , which I called Suprematism .
There was some crossover with Constructivism , with Suprematists such as Popova and especially El Lissitzky working on propaganda and industrial design .
Lissitzky spread Suprematist ideas abroad in the early 1920s .
`` White on White '' was a breakthrough from polychrome to monochrome Suprematism .
From the late 1920s the Russian avant-garde experienced direct and harsh criticism from the authorities and in 1934 the doctrine of Socialist Realism became official policy , and prohibited abstraction and divergence of artistic expression .
Some of the titles to paintings in 1915 express the concept of a non-euclidian geometry which imagined forms in movement , or through time ; titles such as : Two dimensional painted masses in the state of movement .
The Suprematists also made architectural models in the 1920s which offered a different conception of socialist buildings to those developed in Constructivist architecture .
Designs emphasized the right angle , with similarities to De Stijl and Le Corbusier , and were justified with an ideological connection to communist governance and equality for all .
In the 0.10 Exhibition in 1915 , Malevich exhibited his early experiments in suprematist painting .
Salmonella is closely related to the Escherichia genus and are found worldwide in cold - and warm-blooded animals -LRB- including humans -RRB- , and in the environment .
They cause illnesses like typhoid fever , paratyphoid fever , and the foodborne illness .
Salmonella is typically voicing the initial letter `` L , '' although it is named for pathologist Daniel Elmer Salmon .

Du PrÃ primarily played two Stradivarius cellos , the 1673 cello -LRB- now called the `` du PrÃ Stradivarius '' -RRB- , and the 1712 Davidov Stradivarius .
It was the Peresson cello that du PrÃ played for the remainder of her career until 1973 , using it for a second , live , recording of the Elgar Concerto , and her last studio recording , of FrÃ dÃ ric Chopin 's Cello Sonata in G minor and CÃ sar Franck 's Violin Sonata in A arranged as a cello sonata , in December 1971 .
Her last public concerts were in New York in February 1973 : four performances of the Brahms Double Concerto with Pinchas Zukerman , and Leonard Bernstein conducting the New York Philharmonic were scheduled .
She performed with the 1673 Stradivarius from 1961 until 1964 , when she acquired the Davidov .
She performed at the Proms in 1963 , playing the Elgar Concerto with Sir Malcolm Sargent .
After her death , a rose cultivar named in her honor received the Award of Garden Merit from the Royal Horticultural Society .
Du PrÃ recalled that she had problems judging the weight of the bow , and just opening the cello case had become difficult .
From 1969 to 1970 du PrÃ played a Francesco Goffriller cello , and in 1970 she acquired a modern instrument from the Philadelphia violin maker Sergio Peresson .
Jacqueline du PrÃ met pianist Daniel Barenboim on New Year 's Eve 1966 .
Both instruments were gifts from her godmother , Ismena Holland .
She regularly performed with such famous conductors as Barbirolli , Sargent , Sir Adrian Boult , Daniel Barenboim , Zubin Mehta , and Leonard Bernstein .
She converted to Judaism , and they were married on 15 June 1967 at the Western Wall .
In 1965 , at age 20 , du PrÃ recorded the Elgar Concerto for EMI with the London Symphony Orchestra and Sir John Barbirolli , which brought her international recognition .
Du PrÃ became a favorite at the Proms , performing every year until 1969 .
Her last London concerts were in February 1973 , performing the Elgar Concerto with Zubin Mehta and the New Philharmonia Orchestra .
Many of her most famous recordings were made on this instrument , including the Elgar Concerto with Barbirolli , the Robert Schumann Cello Concerto with Barenboim , and the two Brahms cello sonatas .
In 1971 du PrÃ â s playing began an irreversible decline as she started to lose sensitivity in her fingers and other parts of her body .
Du PrÃ performed with several prestigious orchestras , including the Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra , London Symphony , London Philharmonic , New Philharmonia Orchestra , BBC Symphony Orchestra , New York Philharmonic , Philadelphia Orchestra , Israel Philharmonic , and the Los Angeles Philharmonic Orchestra .
She participated in a Pablo Casals masterclass in Zermatt , Switzerland in 1960 , and undertook short-term studies with Paul Tortelier in Paris in 1962 and Mstislav Rostropovich in Russia in 1966 .
In March 1961 , at age 16 , du PrÃ made her formal dÃ but , at Wigmore Hall , London . She made her concerto dÃ but in 1962 at the Royal Festival Hall playing the Elgar Cello Concerto with the BBC Symphony Orchestra under Rudolf Schwarz .
She was made an honorary fellow of St Hilda 's College , Oxford , whose music building bears her name .
Du PrÃ â s main teacher from 1955 to 1961 both privately and at the Guildhall School of Music in London , was the celebrated cellist William Pleeth .
At the age of four du PrÃ is said to have heard the sound of the cello on the radio and asked her mother for `` one of those . ''
She started with lessons from her mother , who composed little pieces accompanied by illustrations , before beginning study at the London Violoncello School at age five .
Her mother , born Iris Greep , was a talented pianist , and taught at the Royal Academy of Music in London .
Her first teacher was Alison Dalrymple .
Born in Oxford , England , du PrÃ was the second child of Derek and Iris du PrÃ .

Ike killed 7 people as it traversed nearly the entirety of Cuba .

ACE is , broadly speaking , a measure of the power of the hurricane multiplied by the length of time it existed , so storms that last a long time -LRB- such as Bertha -RRB- as well as particularly strong hurricanes -LRB- such as Ike -RRB- , have high ACEs .
A tropical disturbance in the eastern Caribbean Sea was in an area unfavorable for development in the second week of October .
An area of low pressure became stationary in the Caribbean Sea without showing tropical development for several days at the beginning of November .
ACE is only officially released for full advisories on tropical systems at or exceeding 34 knots -LRB- 39 mph , 63 km\/h -RRB- or tropical storm strength , so Tropical Depression Sixteen does not have an ACE .
Tropical Depression Thirteen formed from a very small but well-organized low in the Bay of Campeche on October 6 .
After crossing into the Atlantic , Fay turned westward again and crossed northern Florida on August 22 .
It then degenerated to a remnant low the next day .
The following names were used for named storms that formed in the North Atlantic in 2008 .
Paloma caused up to $ 300 million -LRB- 2008 USD -RRB- in damage to Cuba , and $ 15 million in damage to the Cayman Islands .
The depression was upgraded to a tropical storm later the same day as it passed to the south of the Cape Verde islands .
Ike developed an eye late on September 3 as it underwent explosive intensification , as it strengthened from a tropical storm to a Category 4 hurricane in twelve hours with an estimated pressure drop of 43 m , from 991 t ; and a 24 hour pressure drop of 61 m , from 996 t. Ike weakened back to a Category 2 hurricane before re-intensifying back to Category 4 .
Significant flooding resulted in much of eastern Florida , along with some wind damage .
At one point , tropical storm-force winds were estimated to extend only 10 m from the center , which makes it the smallest tropical cyclone on record .
The Bolivar Peninsula was worst affected by the surge , while Galveston Island -LRB- where waves topped the seawall -RRB- and the Port Arthur areas also saw extensive damage .
On October 1 it became `` post-tropical '' as it moved over cooler waters .
Early on July 1 , a weak tropical wave emerged off the coast of Africa .
It was upgraded to a tropical storm later that day and named Hanna .
At one point , the diameter of Ike 's tropical storm and hurricane force winds were 600 and 240 miles -LRB- 965 and 390 km -RRB- , respectively , making Ike the largest Atlantic hurricane ever recorded .
It rapidly intensified into Tropical Storm Gustav early that afternoon and into Hurricane Gustav early on August 26 .
This energy aloft helped to organize a surface low along the shearline early on August 2 , which slowly organized over the following day .
It continued northward and maintained hurricane strength until landfall near Yarmouth , Nova Scotia in Canada late on September 28 .
A disturbance developed in the deep tropical Atlantic in the fourth week of August .
Tropical Depression Eight formed on August 28 from a low pressure area east-northeast of the northern Leeward Islands .
It meandered around Puerto Rico and Hispaniola , dumping torrential rains across the islands causing a significant amount of damage , despite never developing a closed circulation .
On September 1 it became Tropical Depression Nine while west of the Cape Verde islands and intensified into a tropical storm later that day , when it was given the name Ike .
Marco dissipated that night as the small circulation moved inland .
The National Hurricane Center noted that this tropical cyclone was remarkably forecast up to a week in advance by many global computer models .
On November 9 , Paloma was downgraded to a tropical storm and then a depression .
It remained a hurricane through that night and it changed little in intensity through the next day , but that evening Omar intensified quickly and became a 115 mph Category 3 storm , and became a 125 mph -LRB- 205 km\/h -RRB- storm the next morning .
The National Hurricane Center upgraded the system to Tropical Depression Two in the morning hours of July 3 after the system was able to maintain convection over its center for at least 12 hours .
Bertha again began to rapidly intensify on July 9 as a new eye had formed and the system became more symmetrical .
It tracked westward into the Caribbean Sea where it encountered more favorable conditions , and became a tropical depression on the morning of August 25 , west of the Windward Islands .
A few hours later , Kyle became extratropical as the cold waters of the Bay of Fundy took effect .
On July 12 , Bertha slowed in movement , becoming almost stationary and by July 13 this slow movement weakened the storm to tropical storm strength .
On August 15 , a closed circulation was found and the system was declared Tropical Storm Fay .

Brooms are a group of evergreen , semi-evergreen , and deciduous shrubs in the subfamily Faboideae of the legume family Fabaceae , mainly in the three genera Chamaecytisus , Cytisus and Genista , but also in five other small genera -LRB- see box , right -RRB- .
All genera in this group are from the tribe Genisteae .
These genera are all closely related and share similar characteristics of dense , slender green stems and very small leaves , which are adaptations to dry growing conditions .
Like most brooms , it has apparently leafless stems that in spring and summer are covered in profuse golden-yellow flowers .
In late summer , its peapod-like seed capsules burst open , often with an audible pop , spreading seed from the parent plant .
A traditional rhyme from Sussex says : `` Sweep the house with blossed broom in May\/sweep the head of the household away . ''
Many brooms -LRB- though not all -RRB- are fire-climax species , adapted to regular stand-replacing fires which kill the above-ground parts of the plants , but create conditions for regrowth from the roots and also for germination of stored seeds in the soil .
Despite this , it was also common to include a decorated bundle of broom at weddings .
All the brooms and their relatives -LRB- including Laburnum and Ulex -RRB- are natives of Europe , north Africa and southwest Asia , with the greatest diversity in the Mediterranean region .
It makes a shrub about 1 â `` 3m tall , rarely to 4 m. It is also the hardiest broom , tolerating temperatures down to about -25 Â C.
Norman Jay Coleman -LRB- May 16 , 1827 -- November 3 , 1911 -RRB- was a newspaper publisher and the first United States Secretary of Agriculture .
His political career continued when he was appointed as Lieutenant Governor of Missouri from 1875 to 1877 .
He was a member of the Freemasons .
During his tenure he campaigned for the creation of the United States Department of Agriculture under the administration of President Grover Cleveland , of which he served as its inaugural Secretary for the remainder of Clevelandâ s term .
He received a law degree from the University of Louisville Law School in 1849 .
As a result of his publication , Coleman became a prominent figure in Missouri farming circles , which set the path for a political career in the Missouri House of Representatives .
The publication of Colemanâ s newspaper was interrupted by the American Civil War , but three years after the war he founded the Colemanâ s Rural World .
In 1855 he founded the Valley Farmer newspaper .
His position as Secretary of Agriculture was never confirmed by the United States Senate .
Coleman was born in Richfield Springs , New York , and later moved to Kentucky to become an educator .
Coleman then moved to Missouri and went into farming .

Extending the definition of remainder for real numbers as described above is not of theoretical importance in mathematics ; however , many programming languages implement this definitionâ '' see modulo operation .
If a and d are integers , with d non-zero , then a remainder is an integer r such that a = qd + r for some integer q , and with 0 â r -LRB- d .
42 = 8 -LRB- 5 -RRB- + -LRB- 2 -RRB- .
If the quotient is constrained to being an integer however , the concept of remainder is still necessary .
As in the case of division of integers , the remainder could be required to be negative , that is , - d -LRB- r â 0 .
In the case above , the negative remainder is obtained from the positive one just by subtracting 5 , which is d. This holds in general .
It can be proved that there exists a unique integer quotient q and a unique real remainder r such that a = qd + r with 0 â r -LRB- d .
When a and d are real numbers , with d non-zero , a can be divided by d without remainder , with the quotient being another real number .
When defined this way , there are two possible remainders .
If a and d are natural numbers , with d non-zero , it can be proven that there exist unique integers q and r , such that a = qd + r and 0 â r -LRB- d. The number q is called the quotient , while r is called the remainder .
So the remainder is then either 3 or 2 .
For example , the division of 42 by 5 can be expressed as either
When dividing by d , if the positive remainder is r1 , and the negative one is r2 , then
In arithmetic , the remainder -LRB- or residue -RRB- is the amount `` left over '' after the division of two integers which can not be expressed with an integer quotient .
Hannah Montana : The Movie is the musical film adaptation of the American teen sitcom Hannah Montana .
The series focuses on a girl who lives a double life as an average teenage school girl named Miley Stewart -LRB- played by Miley Cyrus -RRB- by day and a famous pop singer named Hannah Montana by night , concealing her real identity from the public , other than her close friends and family .
Filming began in April 2008 , much of it occurring in Columbia , Tennessee , and Los Angeles , California , and was completed in July 2008 .
The film was released on April 10 , 2009 in the United States and Canada .
First-generation technologies , which are already mature and economically competitive , include biomass , hydroelectricity , geothermal power and heat . Second-generation technologies are market-ready and are being deployed at the present time ; they include solar heating , photovoltaics , wind power , solar thermal power stations , and modern forms of bioenergy .

A territory -LRB- from the word ` terra ' , meaning ` land ' -RRB- is a defined area , including land and waters , considered to be a possession of a person , organization , institution , animal , state or country subdivision .
Unlike charts in the United States , no airplay statistics are used for the official UK Singles Chart .
The full chart contains the top selling 200 singles in the United Kingdom based upon combined record sales and download numbers , though some media outlets only list the Top 40 -LRB- such as the BBC -RRB- or the Top 75 -LRB- such as Music Week Magazine -RRB- of this list .
The UK Singles Chart is compiled by The Official Charts Company -LRB- OCC -RRB- on behalf of the British record-industry .
Around 6,500 British retail outlets contribute sales data , as well as most UK online digital download stores .
The districts typically have populations of 174,000 to 1.1 million .
In 1986 the metropolitan county councils were abolished by the Local Government Act 1985 and most of their functions were devolved to the boroughs , making them to a large extent unitary authorities .
The new districts replaced the previous system of county boroughs , municipal boroughs , urban and rural districts .
Some of the functions of the abolished county councils were taken over by joint bodies such as passenger transport authorities , and joint fire , police and waste disposal authorities .
A metropolitan borough is a type of local government district in England , and is a subdivision of a metropolitan county .

A symbol for square foot , square feet , and `` per square foot '' commonly used in architecture , real estate and interior space plans is a simple square with a vertical line bisecting it .
However , the driftwood provides shelter and food for birds , fish and other aquatic species as it floats in the ocean .
Gribbles , shipworms and bacteria decompose the wood and gradually turn it into nutrients that are reintroduced to the food web .
Driftwood is wood that has been washed onto a shore or beach of a sea or river by the action of winds , tides , waves or man .
Driftwood can be used as part of decorative furniture or other art forms , and is a popular element in the scenery of fish tanks .
According to Norse mythology , the first humans , Ask and Embla , were formed out of two pieces of driftwood , an ash and an elm , by the god Odin and his brothers , Vili and VÃ .
Driftwood carried by Arctic rivers was the main , or sometimes only , source of wood for some Inuit and other Arctic populations living north of the tree line until they came into regular contact with European traders .
In some waterfront areas , driftwood is a major nuisance .
Sometimes , the partially decomposed wood washes ashore , where it also shelters birds , plants , and other species .
Driftwood can become the foundation for sand dunes .
It is a bird of large inland and coastal waters , especially large lakes .
It breeds in southern Asia from southern Pakistan across India east to Indonesia .
The Spot-billed Pelican or Grey Pelican -LRB- Pelecanus philippensis -RRB- is a member of the pelican family .
Courteron is a commune in the Aube department in north-central France .
Decent people wo n't believe angry remarks that others say about you .
Those articles should be avoided , abandoned , as areas of continual confrontation , at least for a few weeks .
However , even a small percentage of 10 million users , is a considerable number of difficult users .
Wikipedia has roughly 10 million registered users , so if the vast bulk of people were jerks , then every article would be totally trashed , and every user-page would be filled with warring insults added by everyone else .
Then , later , try to improve some other significant article , which is not a battleground for such controversies .
Consequently , they are encountered , every few days , and even though rare , they know how to be difficult .
So it is not a real problem , like it might be in live social settings , where typically , insults must be backed by some real facts to convince others .
The vast majority of Wikipedia articles are written by normal people , with healthy attitudes , and common courtesy .
Avoiding those users also means avoiding some significant articles where they obsess and dwell .
However , remember , in general , when it comes to your `` bad '' wiki-reputation , no one really cares .
Even though they are few , when perhaps 5 people gang up and spew vitriol onto a new user , it gives the intense illusion , as one person concluded : `` the inmates are running the asylum '' .
If people really cared about that , then certainly all difficult users would have been banned for their reputations , many years ago , banned from the wiki-Solar System long ago .
It 's a volunteer project , and most people are too busy to worry about wiki-reputations .
Again , the interactions with difficult users can be so unpleasant that many people have quit .
It might be tempting to try to reform the difficult users .
Most people have simply decided to ignore those difficult users and , also , ignore the veiled insults or other mud thrown at wiki-reputations .
They have a history of being difficult , so they 've had a lot of practice , and know all the tricks to upsetting people .
Basically , you do n't even need to be present at all to have a long set of problems thrust into each article you wrote , contacts to users you know and debates stating how wrong your opinions are -LRB- or rather , would be -RRB- .
A moderate amount of personal discussion , with those users , could be considered as beneficial to Wikipedia .
Each veiled insult , or slur , against your wiki-reputation can be given an easy spin , with follow-on wording that focuses on a strongly positive view about each comment .
A dull veiled insult , obviously intended to scar your reputation -LRB- in writing -RRB- , is reformed into a 100x times greater compliment , to all who later see the entry .
Most of the admins are well-mannered and grounded in reality , and the few unusual admins are generally removed , and soon .
Of course , numerous Wikipedia editors have left in disgust at such petty , psycho behavior .
However , soon , some of those users will likely `` archive '' your comment topics -LRB- as being old topics -RRB- from the active talk-page , further denying your voice about the article .
The real dangers :
Instead , just keep a private list , off-line from Wikipedia , so that when the names of difficult users re-appear , you can review their infamous antics of the past , and take evasive action .
Now , remember , that several users might just be copy-catting bad behavior , so the first impressions , of how people behave , are somewhat misleading .
Because of the hugely wonderful , over-the-top positive wording , those spins have a second benefit of laughing away the insults , which were not just undone , but thoroughly trounced , beaten down 100 times , by the overly-positive wording of the enthusiastic spin .
In general , people do n't think about who is wrong or who is right , but rather , `` Those guys sure argued a whole lot '' .
Although the glowing , positive terms might seem excessive , the effect is perfect .
It would be unethical to use Wikipedia outside the stated policies of the Wikimedia Foundation , even when following good intentions .
You will have won , completely , and avoided the insulting words of the difficult users .
Rather than having to re-read , each time , the negative wording of the insult , the text to be seen , each time , is the glowing positive view of the improvements -LRB- or other `` great impact to the universe '' -RRB- that you have made .
But they have n't ; instead , troublesome users are generally ignored , and so are their angry remarks about your wiki-reputation .
Most people in charge are not nut-cases , not slowly insulting others .
Confrontations with them can be utterly demoralizing and make people want to abandon Wikipedia .
The illusion of `` jerk-ipedia '' is fostered when difficult users band together , as a sort of gang mentality .
Even though you never even entered the discussion , some users will predict your opinions -LRB- in writing -RRB- just to let others see how wrong you are about something you never said .
Specific changes will be reverted and disallowed by them .
At any given time , there are well over 50,000 highly significant articles , so just visit some minor articles first , until those difficult users have lost interest in following .
The problem of wiki-stalking involves tracing user-editing of various pages , along with determining a list of people you have contacted , by analyzing your access to user-talk pages .
To avoid them , perhaps just switch the subject to edit even 5 other , minor articles , and the trolls will lose interest , because the controversial issue they debated has been washed away by the numerous details in 5 dull articles .
Only a few users are difficult , so they should be avoided to keep working with the nice guys .
Wikipedia warns new users not to reveal personal information .
However , Wikipedia is funded to write the encyclopedia , not provide cyber-counseling or psychiatric treatment to disturbed individuals , and not to convert the hearts of hateful people to become humanized or Christianized .
Perhaps the most you can do is say a prayer , or otherwise , counsel with them outside the scope of Wikipedia , but always protect your identity : `` Beyond this point , there be demons '' .
Mustering the renewed enthusiasm , to improve even one more article , is the ultimate win .
Vast numbers of users , rarely seen , are highly considerate and intelligent people .
Many types , of difficult users , can be detected early , by off-balance actions that they employ : `` where there 's smoke there 's fire '' .
Perhaps the most that can be done is to lodge a `` POV dispute '' on an article 's talk-page , but not carry out a protracted debate , because the difficult users will likely escalate any rebellion to become wiki-stalking and hounding of their rivals .
Many difficult users tend to block progress , and some simply want to stop others from writing articles .
The reason each spin can work so well , against the insults , is that , typically , an insulting remark must be mild -LRB- otherwise it becomes a vicious personal attack -RRB- , so consequently the positive spin can easily claim a viewpoint 100x times the opposite , as an enormous compliment .
Eventually , they snapped , and went out in `` a blaze of glory '' by insulting everything and everyone , until the admins reverted their hateful , final rants from the pages where they had cast their vicious parting remarks .
No , instead , most wiki-people are basically good , and it is just a `` small group '' of difficult users who cause most problems .
Try to tune out the difficult users and , instead , always remember the millions of other people who are helping to improve Wikipedia .
One user thought the solution was to list every difficult user on his user-talk page , but that tends to merely anger them .
There are relatively few difficult users , but they need to be avoided to stay focused on writing the encyclopedia , and not let petty squabbles cause frustrations and doubts about other , decent users .
Consequently , because of that focus , the simple act of ignoring troublesome users , and moving on to improve another article , constitutes a total victory over their attempts to block other people from working on articles .
Just as the troll exerts power against those wanting to cross the bridge , the difficult users feel they have a `` captive audience '' in particular articles .
Many difficult users have left within 2 years of joining Wikipedia , as they struggled to gain more power , but were continually ignored or rejected .
The result : insults can always be reworded as a 100x better compliment .
Look for 2 or more warning signs , and compare as repeated patterns of behavior .
However , other less maniacal users have acted as `` semi-trolls '' with more balance , and remained years longer .
Again , many difficult users have a lot of impact , so some new users might get goaded into bad behavior , in a copy-cat manner , and it takes a few combined actions to realize the behavior is a pattern of intentional , negative , and insulting actions by truly difficult users .
Similar to a legendary troll under the bridge , who waits and makes demands of travelers trying to cross the bridge , the difficult users tend to hang around some significant articles , knowing that certain people will want to change or correct part of the text .
Although they do n't necessarily know where anyone lives , some difficult users find where you write .
It 's a guaranteed easy win , with a humerous spin 100x times funnier than the meager insults .
However , if ignored , they lose interest when their victims escape , so they move on to find other victims .
Acrocanthosaurus -LRB- , meaning ` high-spined lizard ' -RRB- is a genus of theropod dinosaur that existed in what is now North America during the Aptian and early Albian stages of the Early Cretaceous . Like most dinosaur genera , Acrocanthosaurus contains only a single species , A. atokensis .

The Daily News of New York City is the fifth most-widely circulated daily newspaper in the United States with a daily circulation of 632,595 , as of June 13 , 2009 .
It has won ten Pulitzer Prizes .
The Black Vulture , Coragyps atratus , also known as the American Black Vulture , is a bird in the New World vulture family whose range extends from the southeastern United States to Central Chile and Uruguay in South America .
Despite the similar name and appearance , this species is unrelated to the Eurasian Black Vulture .
Although a common and widespread species , it has a somewhat more restricted distribution than its compatriot , the Turkey Vulture , which breeds well into Canada and south to Tierra del Fuego .
A database transaction comprises a unit of work performed within a database management system -LRB- or similar system -RRB- against a database , and treated in a coherent and reliable way independent of other transactions .
If an error occurs during the transaction , or if the user specifies a rollback operation , the data manipulations within the transaction are not persisted to the database . In no case can a partial transaction be committed to the database since that would leave the database in an inconsistent state .
In physics and engineering , mechanical advantage -LRB- MA -RRB- is the factor by which a mechanism multiplies the force or torque applied to it .
The ideal mechanical advantage -LRB- IMA -RRB- , or theoretical mechanical advantage , is the mechanical advantage of an ideal machine .

Sebaceous glands can usually be found in hair-covered areas , where they are connected to hair follicles -LRB- see image at top -RRB- .
Sebaceous glands secrete the oily , waxy substance called sebum -LRB- Latin , meaning fat or tallow -RRB- that is made of fat -LRB- lipids -RRB- , wax , and the debris of dead fat-producing cells .
Excess sebum has been linked to eating red meats , fried , oily or other foods , but studies are not conclusive .
A condition involving enlarged sebaceous glands is known as sebaceous hyperplasia .
The preputial glands of mice and rats are large modified sebaceous glands that produce pheromones .
Although it is commonly believed that sebum acts to protect and waterproof hair and skin , scientists have contended that `` low levels of sebaceous gland activity are not correlated with dry skin '' and it may serve little or no purpose in modern humans .
In humans , they are found in greatest abundance on the face and scalp , though they are distributed throughout all skin sites except the palms and soles .
In the glands , sebum is produced within specialized cells and is released as these cells burst ; sebaceous glands are thus classified as holocrine glands .
There are several related medical conditions , including acne , sebaceous cysts , hyperplasia , sebaceous adenoma and sebaceous gland carcinoma -LRB- see section below : Pathology -RRB- .
In the skin pores , sebum and keratin can create a hyperkeratotic plug called a `` microcomedone '' .
In females , they appear predominantly in the labia minora .
The activity of the sebaceous glands increases during puberty because of heightened levels of androgens .
A blocked sebaceous gland can result in a sebaceous cyst .
In the glands , sebum is produced within specialized cells and is released as these cells burst ; sebaceous glands are thus classified as holocrine glands . Seborrhoea is the name for the condition of greasy skin caused by excess sebum .
Certain species of Demodex mites feed on sebum and are commonly found in the sebaceous glands of mammals , including those of humans .
Sebum can also build up around body piercings .
At the rim of the eyelids , meibomian glands are a specialized form of sebaceous gland .
The prescription drug isotretinoin significantly reduces the amount of sebum produced by the sebaceous glands , and is used to treat acne .
Earwax is partly composed of sebum .

This is however normal , not to be confused with an STD .
In the eyelids , meibomian sebaceous glands secrete a special type of sebum into tears .
The sebaceous glands are microscopic glands in the skin that secrete an oily\/waxy matter , called sebum , to lubricate the skin and hair of mammals .
Sebaceous gland carcinoma is a rare and aggressive form of cancer involving the sebaceous glands ; sebaceous adenoma is a more benign neoplasm of the sebaceous glands .
The glands deposit sebum on the hairs , and bring it to the skin surface along the hair shaft .
The structure consisting of hair , hair follicle , arrector pili muscle , and sebaceous gland is known as a pilosebaceous unit .
A branched type of acinar gland , the sebaceous glands exist in humans throughout the skin except in the palms of the hands and soles of the feet .
Sapienic acid is a sebum fatty acid that is unique to humans .
The sebaceous gland is stimulated due to some steroids conversion into dihydrotestosterone .
Sebaceous glands are involved in skin problems such as acne and keratosis pilaris .
The extreme use -LRB- up to 10 times doctor-prescribed amounts -RRB- of anabolic steroids by bodybuilders , for muscle gain can cause acne .
Sebum is the cause of some people 's experiencing `` oily '' hair , as in hot weather or if not washed for several days .
Sebaceous glands are also found in non-haired areas -LRB- glabrous skin -RRB- of eyelids , nose , penis , labia minora and nipples .
In males , sebaceous glands begin to appear predominantly on the penis , on the shaft and around the rim of the penile head during and after puberty .
The sebaceous glands of a human fetus in utero secrete a substance called Vernix caseosa , a `` waxy '' or `` cheesy '' white substance coating the skin of newborns .
This may cause serious acne on the face , neck , chest , back and shoulders .
Here , the sebum traverses ducts that terminate in sweat pores on the surface of the skin .
They secrete a form of sebum -LRB- called meibum -RRB- onto the eye , slowing the evaporation of tears .

A wind farm is a group of wind turbines in the same location used for production of electric power . A large wind farm may consist of several hundred individual wind turbines , and cover an extended area of hundreds of square miles , but the land between the turbines may be used for agricultural or other purposes .

Each recipient uses the corresponding private key to decrypt the session key .
Each user has a pair of cryptographic keysâ '' a public encryption key and a private decryption key .
The distinguishing technique used in public key cryptography is the use of asymmetric key algorithms , where the key used to encrypt a message is not the same as the key used to decrypt it .
The person who anticipates receiving messages first creates both a public key and an associated private key , and publishes the public key .
Messages are encrypted with the recipient 's public key and can only be decrypted with the corresponding private key .

From its peak in the 1980s , the Leadbeater 's Possum population is expected to further decline rapidly , by as much as 90 % .
Following the death of Kasia , the last captive Leadbeater 's Possum , at Toronto Zoo in January 2010 -LRB- the last Australian specimen held at Healesville Sanctuary having died in May 2006 -RRB- , there are now no Leadbeater 's Possums in captivity anywhere in the world and so no breeding program to assist this animal 's survival .
They live in small family colonies of up to 24 individuals , usually a breeding pair , their offspring , and sometimes an unrelated extra male or two .
The possum was not discovered until 1867 and was originally known only through five specimens , the last one collected in 1909 .
Dr. David Lindenmeyer -LRB- Australian National University -RRB- has argued that the need for nest boxes indicates that logging practices are not ecologically sustainable , for conserving hollow-dependent species like Leadbeater 's possum .
Large areas of bushland around Marysville , Narbethong and Healesville have been destroyed .
The mapped distribution of the Leadbeater 's possum exactly matches the area burnt in the Kilmore East Murrundindi Rubicon Media Map of the fires .
The formation of the Friends of Leadbeater 's Possum group is seen as a positive step towards raising the profile of this unique animal and an opportunity to continue to lobby the State Government to properly protect its declining habitat .
From that time on , the fear that it might be extinct gradually grew into near-certainty after the swamps and wetlands in Australia around Bass River in south-west Gippsland were drained for farming in the early 1900s .
Author , Peter Preuss , stated that the possum 's population faltered in 1997 with current habitat -LRB- limited to a 50-square-kilometre area -RRB- under threat from logging .
In consequence , mortality among young female Leadbeater 's Possums is highâ '' average female lifespan is little more than 27 months , as opposed to about 10 years in captivity .
Young , newly independent Leadbeater 's Possums are very vulnerable to owls .
Most litters are of one or two young , which stay in the pouch for 80 or 90 days , and first emerge from the nest about three weeks after that .
It was named after John Leadbeater the then taxidermist at the Museum of Victoria .
With its known habitat destroyed in the disastrous bushfires of February 2009 - large areas of forest around Marysville , Narbethong and Healesville - the species status is currently in doubt .
The logging in 1993 of `` much of the possum 's habitat , as zone one '' a five hectare reserve east of Powelltown , followed a `` mapping error . ''
All members sleep together in a nest made out of shredded bark in a tree hollow , anywhere from 6 to 30 metres above ground level and roughly in the center of a territory of 10,000 to 20,000 square metres , which they defend actively .
However , the status of Leadbeater 's Possum is in even more doubt following the disastrous bushfires that swept its only known habitat on Black Saturday in February 2009 .
Leadbeater 's Possums can be moderately common within the very small areas they inhabit : their requirement for year-round food supplies and tree-holes to take refuge in during the day restricts them to mixed-age wet sclerophyll forest with a dense mid-story of Acacia .
It is the only species in the Gymnobelideus genus .
Studies have shown that clear-felling operations , such as the logging run in state forest between the Yarra Ranges National Park and Mount Bullfight Conservation Reserve in February 2006 , lead to the deaths of most possums in the area - `` Adult animals have a strong affinity with their home range and are reluctant to move '' .
Births are usually timed for the beginning of winter -LRB- May and June -RRB- or late spring -LRB- October and November -RRB- .
Their diet is omnivorous : they take a range of saps and exudates , lerps , and a high proportion of arthropods which they find under the loose bark of eucalypts : spiders , crickets , beetles , and the like .
Leadbeater 's Possum -LRB- Gymnobelideus leadbeateri -RRB- is an endangered possum restricted to small pockets of remaining old growth mountain ash forests in the central highlands of Victoria -LRB- Australia -RRB- north-east of Melbourne .
Failing human intervention , and assuming that a reduced population could have survived that long , natural tree hollows were expected to develop in the Black Friday regrowth as the trees reached about 150 years of age in the second half of the 21st century , and numbers to begin climbing again .
In 1968 , the State of Victoria made Leadbeater 's Possum its faunal emblem .

The first electric passenger trains ran in 1914 , on the West London Line route -LRB- Willesden to Earls Court -RRB- , but full services over the whole network did not commence until 1922 , work having been delayed by the First World War .
During 1909-1922 the London and North Western Railway embarked on a project to electrify their London inner-suburban network , encompassing the lines from London Euston to Watford and the North London Railway from London Broad Street to Richmond , including branch lines such as Watford to Croxley Green -LRB- where a depot was built to house the electric units -RRB- , and links to what was to become the London Underground network .
The London , Midland and Scottish Railway extended the network in 1927 , by electrifying the branch to Rickmansworth .

Casualty actuaries , also known as non-life or general insurance actuaries , deal with catastrophic , unnatural risks that can occur to people or property .
Products prominent in their work include auto insurance , homeowners insurance , commercial property insurance , workersâ compensation , title insurance , malpractice insurance , products liability insurance , directors and officers liability insurance , environmental and marine insurance , terrorism insurance and other types of liability insurance .

Vladimir Borisovich Kramnik -LRB- ; born 25 June 1975 -RRB- is a Russian chess grandmaster .
He was the Classical World Chess Champion from 2000 to 2006 , and the undisputed World Chess Champion from 2006 to 2007 .
In October 2000 , he defeated Garry Kasparov in a match played in London , and became the Classical World Chess Champion .
In October 2006 , Kramnik , the Classical World Champion , defeated reigning FIDE World Champion Veselin Topalov in a unification match , the World Chess Championship 2006 .
On 30 December 2006 he married French journalist Marie-Laure Germon .
Kramnik has been diagnosed with an uncommon form of arthritis , called ankylosing spondylitis .
He scored a +4 result , earning the highest performance rating -LRB- 2847 -RRB- of the 1307 participating players .
He challenged Anand at the World Chess Championship 2008 to regain his title , but lost .
As a result Kramnik became the first undisputed World Champion , holding both the FIDE and Classical titles , since Kasparov split from FIDE in 1993 .
The tournament , and the world championship , was won by Viswanathan Anand .
He returned from treatment in June 2006 , playing in the 37th Chess Olympiad .
He has a daughter named Daria who was born 28 December 2008 .
