Xangsane made landfall in the Philippines , battering the northern islands with torrential rains and strong winds , and causing widespread flooding and landslides .
Later that day the JTWC upgraded as the depression moved towards the west it was upgraded to a Tropical Storm by the JTWC .
Philippine Airlines canceled over half of its flights to and from Ninoy Aquino International Airport for September 28 , and various transit services also suspended service .
When it became clear that Xangsane would approach the Capital , PAGASA upgraded the warning for Manila and central Luzon to Storm Signal Number 3 on September 28 .
The JTWC ceased advisories after landfall , while the JMA carried the storm inland until it was over Thailand as a tropical depression .
Storm Signal Number 2 , for winds of 60 - 100 km\/h -LRB- 37 - 62 mph -RRB- , was raised for northern Samar Island and central Luzon .
On September 27 , PAGASA issued Storm Signal Number 3 , a warning for winds of 100 - 185 km\/h -LRB- 62 - 115 mph -RRB- , for areas of southern Luzon .
Early the next day Xangsane was upgraded to a category 2 typhoon and then over the next six hours Xangsane rapidly intensified into a category 4 typhoon with wind speeds of 115 kts -LRB- 130 mph , 215 km\/h -RRB- .
Schools in the warned area were suspended , and airports and seaports were closed .
Typhoon Xangsane -LRB- international designation : 0615 , JTWC designation : 18W , PAGASA name : Typhoon Milenyo -RRB- was a deadly typhoon that affected the Philippines , Vietnam , and Thailand during the 2006 Pacific typhoon season .
After passing over Manila and emerging over the South China Sea , the typhoon made a second landfall in central Vietnam , also causing flooding and landslides there and in Thailand .
The JTWC assessed the development of a significant Tropical cyclone , as fair .
Late on September 24 , 2006 , the Joint Typhoon Warning Center , noted that an area of convection , had persisted about 460 NM to the southeast of Manila , in the Philippines .
Early that afternoon the JTWC reported that Xangsane , had reached its peak wind speeds of 125 kts -LRB- 145 mph , 230 km\/h -RRB- .
It was the fifteenth tropical storm and ninth typhoon recognized by the Japan Meteorological Agency operationally during the season , although in post-operational analysis it became the tenth typhoon of the season with the addition of Typhoon Maria .
Meanwhile the JMA reported that Xangsane had reached its peak wind speeds of 85 kts -LRB- 100 mph , 155 km\/h -RRB- .
Xangsane then passed through the Philippine islands , wreaking havoc and becoming the strongest typhoon to directly impact Metro Manila in eleven years .
Later on September 26 , the JMA upgraded Xangsane to a severe tropical storm , whilst six hours later both the JMA and the JTWC upgraded Xangsane to typhoon with the JTWC reporting wind speeds equivalent to a category one typhoon .
Later that morning the JTWC reassessed the potential of the disturbance forming into a significant tropical Cyclone within 24 hours as good , and issued a Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert on the developing disturbance .
According to the Joint Typhoon Warning Center , Xangsane was the sixteenth tropical storm and tenth typhoon of the season , and was a Category 4-equivalent typhoon in terms of 1-minute average wind speeds .
Storm Signal Number 1 -LRB- 30 - 60 km\/h , 20 - 37 mph -RRB- was issued for northwestern Luzon , including Metro Manila , and northern Visayas , including the rest of Samar Island .
This was because convection was beginning to flare up near a developing Low Level Circulation Center , the JTWC also noted that the disturbance had a broad circulation .
Early the next day both the Japan Meteorological Agency and the Philippine Atmospheric , Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration -LRB- PAGASA -RRB- designated the Tropical disturbance as a Tropical Depression with PAGASA assigning the local name of Tropical Depression Milenyo , to the depression .
As it entered the South China Sea as a weak typhoon , it began to re-intensify , reaching its secondary peak strength shortly before landfall at Danang , Vietnam on October 1 .
Early that afternoon the JTWC started to issue advisories on the disturbance and designated it as Tropical Depression 18W .

The steam dissolves the wallpaper paste , allowing the wallpaper to be peeled off .
Wallpaper is a kind of material used to cover and decorate the interior walls of homes , offices , and other buildings ; it is one aspect of interior decoration .
It is usually sold in rolls and is put onto a wall using wallpaper paste .
Wallpapers can come plain -LRB- so that it can be painted -RRB- , textured -LRB- such as Anaglypta -RRB- , or with patterned graphics .
Another method of removal is to apply steam to wallpaper in order to dissolve the wallpaper paste . A wallpaper steamer consists of a reservoir of water , an electric heating element , and a hose to direct the steam at the wallpaper .

Her mainstream pop career began in 1982 when she formed the electropop duo Yazoo with former Depeche Mode member Vince Clarke .
After leaving school at 16 , she worked as a shop assistant and trained as a piano tuner .

She grew up in Basildon , where she attended Nicholas School .

Tlaloc would require weeping boys in the first months of the Aztec calendar to be ritually murdered .
Human sacrifices would prevent the end of the world that could happen on each cycle of 52 years .
A number of mummies of sacrificed children have been recovered in the Inca regions of South America , an ancient practice known as capacocha .
In the 1487 re-consecration of the Great Pyramid of Tenochtitlan some estimate that 80,400 prisoners were sacrificed though numbers are difficult to quantify as all obtainable Aztec texts were destroyed by Christian missionaries during the period 1528 â `` 1548 .
The Aztecs were particularly noted for practicing human sacrifice on a large scale ; an offering to Huitzilopochtli would be made to restore the blood he lost , as the sun was engaged in a daily battle .

The only serum that could stop the outbreak was in Anchorage , nearly a thousand miles -LRB- 1,600 km -RRB- away .
The engine of the only aircraft that could quickly deliver the medicine was frozen and would not start . After considering all of the alternatives , officials decided to move the medicine by sled dog .
More than 20 mushers took part , facing a blizzard with 23 Â F temperatures and strong winds .
The serum was transported by train from Anchorage to Nenana , where the first musher embarked as part of a relay aimed at delivering the needed serum to Nome .
In January 1925 , doctors realized that a potentially deadly diphtheria epidemic was poised to sweep through Nome 's young people .
Friedrich Wilhelm Heinrich Alexander Freiherr von Humboldt -LRB- September 14 , 1769 -- May 6 , 1859 -RRB- was a German naturalist and explorer , and the younger brother of the Prussian minister , philosopher and linguist Wilhelm von Humboldt -LRB- 1767 â `` 1835 -RRB- .
In 1766 he married Maria Elizabeth Colomb , the widow of Baron von Hollwede , and they had two sons .
The Humboldt Tropical Medicine Institute at Cayetano Heredia University , Lima , Peru , was named after Alexander von Humboldt , as well as Humboldt State University in Arcata , California , Alexander Von Humboldt school in Mexico City , Several German schools -LRB- including Humboldt University of Berlin -RRB- are named after Alexander 's brother Wilhelm .
Humboldt was born in Berlin in the Margraviate of Brandenburg .
His father , Alexander George von Humboldt , belonged to a prominent Pomeranian family ; he was a major in the Prussian Army and was rewarded for his services during the Seven Years ' War with the post of Royal Chamberlain ; he married the daughter of the Prussian general adjutant , von Schweder .
Humboldt 's quantitative work on botanical geography laid the foundation for the field of biogeography .

The letter informed William that if he were to land in England with a small army , the signatories and their allies would rise up and support him .
It was carried to William in The Hague by Rear Admiral Arthur Herbert -LRB- the later Lord Torrington -RRB- disguised as a common sailor , and identified by a secret code .
The invitation convinced William to carry out his existing plans to land with a large Dutch army , culminating in the Glorious Revolution during which James was deposed and replaced by William and Mary as joint rulers .
The Invitation to William was a letter sent by seven notable Englishmen , later named the Immortal Seven , to William III , Prince of Orange , received by him on 30 June 1688 -LRB- Julian calendar , 10 July Gregorian calendar -RRB- .
In England a Catholic male heir to the throne , James Francis Edward Stuart , had been born , and the letter asked William to force the ruling king , his father-in-law James II of England , by military intervention to make William 's Protestant wife Mary , James 's eldest daughter , heir , preferably by establishing that the newborn Prince of Wales was a fraud .

The National Register of Historic Places -LRB- NRHP -RRB- is the United States government 's official list of districts , sites , buildings , structures , and objects deemed worthy of preservation .
Each year approximately 30,000 properties are added to the National Register as part of districts or by individual listings .
There are several other different types of historic preservation associated with the properties of the National Register of Historic Places that can not be classified as either simple buildings and historic districts .
In addition , historic districts consist of contributing and non-contributing properties .
Of the more than one million properties on the National Register , 80,000 are listed individually .
The passage of the National Historic Preservation Act -LRB- NHPA -RRB- in 1966 established the National Register and the process for adding properties to it .
All of the radioactive bromine isotopes are relatively short lived .
Bromine has two stable isotopes , 79Br -LRB- 50.69 % -RRB- and 81Br -LRB- 49.31 % -RRB- .
Being less reactive than chlorine but more reactive than iodine , bromine reacts vigorously with metals , especially in the presence of water , to give bromide salts .

The sculpture was made from the same weathering steel -LRB- also known as Cor-Ten -RRB- as the Angel of the North sculpture , which gradually develops a tightly adhering oxide layer as it is exposed to the elements .
Despite Gormley 's plea , removal of B of the Bang began in April 2009 .
In May 2006 a total of nine spikes were removed from the sculpture and taken away for metallurgical analysis , to discover the stresses being placed on the steel .
It was dismantled in 2009 because of structural problems .
B of the Bang originally stood 56 m tall with 180 hollow tapered steel columns or spikes radiating from a central core .
One possibility involved the replacement of the steel spikes with alternatives made from carbon fiber , although the report underlined the necessity for extensive testing .
This was the largest load that could be transferred via road from the factory , and required a police escort .
As a result some of the joints were re-welded , with equipment put in place to prevent excessive movement .
After inspection , the event went ahead as planned .
Six days before the launch , the sculpture suffered the first of three visible structural problems as the tip of one of the spikes detached and fell to the ground .
The report recognized the sculpture 's aesthetic value for Manchester and Manchester City Council committed itself to working with the artist to reach a long-term solution .
The sculpture was commissioned in 2003 ; construction overran and the official unveiling was delayed until 12 January 2005 .
The artwork had been nicknamed KerPlunk by the locals after the popular children 's game from the 1970s .
It was taller and leaned at a greater angle than the Leaning Tower of Pisa .
It took its name from a quotation of British sprinter Linford Christie in which he said that he started his races not merely at the ` bang ' of the starting pistol , but at ` The B of the Bang ' .
The location of the time capsule after dismantling is currently unknown .
Legal action started a year later , resulting in an out-of-court settlement totalling Â # 1.7 million .
In total the sculpture cost Â # 1.42 million to design and construct â '' twice the original estimate , as the initial costing had neglected to include installation costs .
The design was selected by a panel consisting of both local residents and art experts via a competition in 2002 and was designed by Thomas Heatherwick .
Prior to the construction of Aspire at the University of Nottingham , B of the Bang was Britain 's tallest sculpture at well over twice the height of the Angel of the North , which stands at 66 f. It was designed to look like an exploding firework and was taller and leaned at a greater angle than the Leaning Tower of Pisa .
It was approved at the start of 2003 , with the central core arriving in Manchester on the 13 June 2004 .
Funding was sourced from a European Regional Development Fund contribution of Â # 700,000 , the North West Development Agency , contributing Â # 500,000 , and Manchester City Council providing Â # 120,000 .
It was angled at 30 degrees and supported by five 25 m long , tapered steel legs which connected to the spikes 22 m above the ground .
Early estimates had given an optimistic completion date of July 2003 , which contributed to the sculpture gaining the nickname G of the Bang .
In February 2009 , Manchester City Council announced that the sculpture would be dismantled and placed in storage , as the `` only practical alternative '' .
The tip of one of the 2.1 m spikes detached and fell from the sculpture on the 6 January 2005 , only six days before the official unveiling .
Four months later , in May 2005 , a second spike had to be cut off by firefighters after it was discovered hanging loose .
This layer inhibits further corrosion by reducing its permeability to water .
This consisted of retrofitting tip weights to 170 of the spikes .
The foundations are 20 m deep .
The official unveiling by Linford Christie took place on 12 January 2005 .
The sculpture weighed 165 tonnes , with the concrete in the foundations weighing over 1,000 tonnes , including a 400 m reinforced concrete slab .
As part of the design , the spikes swayed slightly in the wind in order to withstand gusts in excess of 100 m. At the time of construction a time capsule was placed in one of the spikes of the sculpture , containing children 's poems and paintings , due to be opened circa 2300 .
The agreement was to pay the council Â # 1.7 m in damages for breach of contract and negligence .
Despite the promise of storage and potential reassembly , the core and legs of the sculpture were cut apart during removal .
In January 2009 , Antony Gormley , creator of the Angel of the Northâ '' to which B of the Bang is often comparedâ '' spoke out in support of the sculpture , stating that , `` It is a great tribute to Manchester that this ground-breaking work was commissioned .
This central core was lifted into place in August 2004 , after which the 180 spikes could begin being attached .
In November 2008 this culminated in an out-of-court settlement being reached between Manchester City Council , the project 's designers Thomas Heatherwick Studio Ltd , and the engineering and construction subcontractors Packman Lucas Ltd , Flint and Neill Partnership and Westbury Structures Ltd. .
Despite these modifications , B of the Bang remained fenced off , prompting a local newspaper campaign to ` Get It Sorted ' .
Commissioned to mark the 2002 Commonwealth Games , it was one of the tallest structures in the City of Manchester and was the tallest sculpture in the UK until the completion of Aspire in 2008 .
It was announced in October 2007 that Manchester City Council were taking legal action against the makers of the sculpture , with the aim of completing the necessary repairs to the sculpture .
Acting on a report in January 2009 , the city council recommended that B of the Bang should be dismantled and placed in storage until funds could be raised for its safe reinstatement .
To allow it to disappear would be a loss not just of an inspirational artwork but also of the council 's nerve . ''
The sculpture was constructed in Sheffield by Thomas Heatherwick Studio , Packman Lucas , Flint and Neill and Westbury Structures .
B of the Bang was a sculpture designed by Thomas Heatherwick , in Manchester , England , located next to the City of Manchester Stadium at Sportcity .
The sculpture took its name from a quotation of British sprinter Linford Christie , in which he said that he started his races not merely at the `` bang '' of the starting pistol , but at `` the B of the Bang '' .
More substantial hoarding was erected around the site and demolition firm Connell Bros Ltd. began removing the spikes with oxyacetylene cutting equipment .
At that time the sculpture was closed off to the public , and the junction and pathway near the sculpture were temporarily closed .
B of the Bang was located next to the City of Manchester Stadium at Sportcity , in Beswick , at the corner of Alan Turing Way and Ashton New Road ; coordinates .
The council expressed its commitment to working closely with the design team in order to `` determine whether there is a robust and affordable strategy for the re-construction of the structure on the site '' .
It was commissioned by New East Manchester Limited to commemorate the 2002 Commonwealth Games .
Although the council had promised to store the complex central core and legs , these too were cut apart during removal , casting doubt on future prospects for the landmark sculpture 's return .
Brian May , the only child of Harold and Ruth May , was born in Hampton , London and attended Hampton Grammar School -LRB- now Hampton School -RRB- .
May earned a PhD in astrophysics from Imperial College in 2007 and is currently the Chancellor of Liverpool John Moores University .
During this time he formed his first band with vocalist and bassist Tim Staffell , named Nineteen Eighty-Four after George Orwell 's novel of the same name .
He left Hampton Grammar School with ten GCE Ordinary Levels and three Advanced Levels in Physics , Mathematics and Applied Mathematics .
He was ranked 39th in Rolling Stone magazine 's list of the `` 100 Greatest Guitarists of All Time '' .
However , its components are edible , and there are stories of pigs , sheep or other farm animals consuming duroplast .
Duroplast is a composite thermosetting plastic , a close relative of formica and bakelite . It is a resin plastic reinforced with fibers -LRB- either cotton or wool -RRB- making it a fiber-reinforced plastic similar to glass-reinforced plastic .
It is made of recycled material , cotton waste and phenol resins .
Duroplast can not be further recycled , and burning it produces toxic fumes , so disposing of the bodies of old Trabants is a problem .
Duroplast was used by Central European automobile manufacturer VEB Sachsenring Automobilwerke Zwickau to produce the body of the mass-produced Trabant motor car .
Because it can be made in a press similar to shaping steel , it is more suitable for volume car production than fibreglass .
A Berlin biotechnology company claims that it has developed a solution to the duroplast problem : a bacterium that will eat a Trabant in 20 days and leave only compost .
It was also used to make suitcases .
The product was first used in the body of the IFA F8 and later also the AWZ P70 or Zwickau P70 and the Trabant .
Duroplast is light , flexible , and strong .

On 4 October 1943 , Himmler referred explicitly to the extermination of the Jewish people during a secret SS meeting in the city of PoznaÅ -LRB- Posen -RRB- .
After the Night of the Long Knives , the SS-Totenkopfverb Ã nde organized and administered Germany 's regime of concentration camps and , after 1941 , extermination camps in occupied Poland as well .
The SS , through its intelligence arm , the Security Service -LRB- Sicherheitsdienst , or SD -RRB- , dealt with Jews , Gypsies , communists and those persons of any other cultural , racial , political or religious affiliation deemed by the Nazis to be either Untermensch -LRB- sub-human -RRB- or in opposition to the regime , and placed them in concentration camps .
Himmler opened the first of these camps at Dachau on 22 March 1933 .
The San Gabriel Valley Tribune is the daily newspaper located in West Covina , California that serves the San Gabriel Valley .
Thomson sold the Tribune to Singleton 's MediaNews Group in 1996 .
It is also part of the San Gabriel Valley Newspaper Group , along with the Pasadena Star-News and the Whittier Daily News .

It consists of the Royal Australian Navy , the Australian Army , the Royal Australian Air Force and a number of ` tri-service ' units .

Class 159 trains are almost identical to Class 158s , having been converted from Class 158 to Class 159 in two batches .
British Rail Class 158 Express Sprinter is a diesel multiple-unit -LRB- DMU -RRB- train , built for British Rail between 1989 and 1992 by BREL at its Derby Works .
They were built to replace many locomotive-hauled passenger trains , and allowed cascading of existing Sprinter units to replace elderly ` heritage ' DMUs .
The foundation stone of Valletta was laid by the Grandmaster of the Order , Jean Parisot de la Valette on 28 March 1566 .
The Advertising Council , commonly known as the Ad Council , is an American non-profit organization that distributes public service announcements on behalf of various sponsors , including non-profit organizations and agencies of the United States government .
The Advertising Council was conceived in 1941 , and shortly after , in February 1942 , it was incorporated as The War Advertising Council for the purpose of mobilizing the advertising industry in support of the war effort .
In 1945 , the Ad Council began working with the National Safety Council .
The Advertising Council generally does not produce public service advertisements itself , rather , it acts as a coordinator and distributor .
After the conclusion of the Second World War the War Advertising Council changed its name to the Advertising Council and shifted its focus to peacetime campaigns .
The Advertising Council accepts requests from sponsor organizations for advertising campaigns that focus on particular social issues .

The British Rail Class 127 diesel multiple units were built by BR Derby in 1959 .
Thirty 4-car units were built , formed of two outer driving motor vehicles , sandwiching two intermediate trailers which were classified class 186 .
The technical description of such as 4-car unit was DMBS + TSL + TS + DMBS .

The POV of the editor-in-chief : \* Wikizine is small in the number of staff members and readers : \* Wikizine will never ever knowingly report lies : \* Wikizine makes no guarantee of validity : \* Wikizine considers itself an independent publication : \* Wikizine is not a publication of the Wikimedia Foundation : \* Wikizine is ugly and proud of it .
: Wikizine is a -LRB- nearly -RRB- weekly news letter .
: \* Wikizine is short so it does not take long to read it : \* If possible every topic is only a very brief summary with the URLs to more information about it : \* Technical news is considered the most important news : \* News is mostly only included if it is relevant or interesting for the larger Wikimedia community and not only for a specific wiki : \* The target audience are sysops and higher , ambassadors , board members of the chapters : \* It is written in English but it is for readers from many languages : \* It is hoped that the readers will spread the news that is relevant for their home-wiki to their local community and that they report news back upstream so it can be shared with the rest of the Wikimedia community : \* It is POV .
Plain text only , distribution by email : \* Wikizine is available under the GNU Free Documentation License
: If you like to show your support for Wikizine you can put a banner on your userpage .
It attempts to bring the most important news from the global Wikimedia family for everybody involved with Wikimedia .

The Roman Catholic acts of consecration , reparation and devotion were introduced when the feast of the Sacred Heart was declared .
It was in the fervent atmosphere of the Benedictine or Cistercian monasteries , in the world of Anselmian or Bernardine thought , that the devotion arose , although it is impossible to say positively what were its first texts or who were its first devotees . It was already well known to St. Gertrude , St. Mechtilde , and the author of the Vitis mystica -LRB- previously ascribed to St. Bernard , now attributed to St. Bonaventure -RRB- .

From the thirteenth to the sixteenth centuries , the devotion was propagated but it did not seem to have developed in itself .
It was , nevertheless , a private , individual devotion of the mystical order .
In his Papal Bull Auctorem Fidei , Pope Pius VI praised devotion to the Sacred Heart .
The practice of the Enthronement is based upon Pope Pius XII 's declaration that devotion to the Sacred of Jesus is `` the foundation on which to build the kingdom of God in the hearts of individuals , families , and nations ... ''
Little by little , the devotion to the Sacred Heart became a separate one , and on August 31 , 1670 , the first feast of the Sacred Heart was celebrated in the Grand Seminary of Rennes .
Sacred Heart is still a widely used name for many Roman Catholic institutions , including schools , colleges , and hospitals in many countries around the world .
It is common in Roman Catholic services and occasionally is to be found in Anglican services .
Coutances followed suit on October 20 , a day with which the Eudist feast was from then on to be connected .
The devotion spread , particularly in religious communities .
It was everywhere practiced by individuals and by different religious congregations , such as the Franciscans , Dominicans , Carthusians , etc. .
The mirror images reflect an eternal binding of the two hearts .
It is also the name of many Roman Catholic parishes , religious orders , and stores selling Roman Catholic goods .
The Feast of the Sacred Heart is a solemnity in the Roman Catholic liturgical calendar , and is celebrated 19 days after Pentecost .
It is in the eleventh and twelfth centuries that the first indications of devotion to the Sacred Heart are found .
The Marseilles plague , 1720 , furnished perhaps the first occasion for a solemn consecration and public worship outside of religious communities .
There is nothing to indicate that she had known the devotion prior to the revelations , or at least that she had paid any attention to it .
Worship of the Sacred Heart mainly consists of several hymns , the Salutation of the Sacred Heart , and the Litany of the Sacred Heart .

Since c. 1850 , groups , congregations , and States have consecrated themselves to the Sacred Heart .

Religious imagery depicting the Sacred Heart is frequently featured in Roman Catholic , and sometimes Anglican and Lutheran homes .
A blessed image of the Sacred Heart , either a statue or a picture , is then `` enthroned '' in the home to serve as a constant reminder to those who dwell in the house of their consecration to the Sacred Heart .

The Enthronement of the Sacred Heart is a Roman Catholic ceremony in which a priest or head of a household consecrates the members of the household to the Sacred Heart .

Chicken eggs are widely used in many types of dishes , both sweet and savory , including many baked goods .
Most commercially produced chicken eggs intended for human consumption are unfertilized , since the laying hens are kept without roosters .
Fertile eggs can be purchased and eaten as well , with little nutritional difference .
The most commonly used bird eggs are those from the chicken . Duck and goose eggs , and smaller eggs such as quail eggs are occasionally used as a gourmet ingredient , as are the largest bird eggs , from ostriches .
In addition , the protein in raw eggs is only 51 % bio-available , whereas that of a cooked egg is nearer 91 % bio-available , meaning the protein of cooked eggs is nearly twice as absorbable as the protein from raw eggs .

Selenium tetrachloride is the inorganic compound composed with the formula SeCl4 .
Selenium tetrachloride is the inorganic compound composed with the formula SeCl4 . This compound exists as yellow to white volatile solid .
It is one of two commonly available selenium chlorides , the other example being selenium monochloride , Se2Cl2 . SeCl4 is used in the synthesis of other selenium compounds .

Following the Turko-Persian Ghaznavid conquest of South Asia , a hybrid language of Turkish , Arabic and Persian and local dialects began to form , one that would eventually be known as Urdu .
Under Persian influence from the state , the Persian script and Nasta ` liq form of cursive writing was adopted , with additional figures added to accommodate the Indic phonetic system .
This language was called Zaban-e-Ordu -LRB- ` language of the army ' -RRB- to distinguish it from Farsi , the court language , and was later shortened to just Urdu .
Many distinctly Persian forms of literature , such as Ghazal , Qasida , Marsia and Nazms , caried over into Urdu literature , producing a distinct melding of Iranian and South Asian heritages .
Some grammatical elements peculiar to Persian , such as the enclitic ezÄ fe , and the use of the takhallus , were readily absorbed into Urdu literature both religious and secular .
A famous cross-over writer was Amir Khusro , whose Persian and Urdu couplets are to this day read in South Asia .
Urdu is grammatically an Indic language , written in the Perso-Arabic script , and contains literary conventions and specialised vocabulary largely from Persian .
Despite the heavy influence of Persian on Urdu , linguistically , Urdu is not classified as an Iranian language -LRB- as is Persian -RRB- but rather as an Indo-Aryan language -LRB- like Hindi , Gujarati , Bengali , Punjabi , Seraiki and Sindhi -RRB- .
The Persian language influenced the formation of many modern languages of the Greater Middle East , Central Asia , and South Asian regions , including Urdu .
It grew from the interaction of Persian and Turkic speaking Muslim soldiers and the native peoples .
Urdu soon gained distinction in literary and cultural spheres because of the hybrid nature of the language .
Canadian Tire ` money ' distinguishes the company from other retailers in Canada .

All contributors to the Knol project must sign in first with a Google account and are supposed to state their real names .
Readers with Google accounts may rate , comment on , or suggest edits to the articles , in the style of comments after a blog entry .
What you 're seeing here , slowly , is Google embracing an advertising-driven model , in which money will have a greater impact on what people have ready access to . ''
The non-profit Wikimedia Foundation , which owns the name Wikipedia and the servers hosting the Wikipedia projects , welcomed the Google Knol initiative saying that `` The more good free content , the better for the world . ''
All contributions are licensed by default under the Creative Commons CC-BY-3 .0 license -LRB- which allows anyone to reuse the material as long as the original author is named -RRB- , but authors may choose the CC-BY-NC-3 .0 license -LRB- which prohibits commercial reuse -RRB- or traditional all rights reserved copyright protections instead .
The project was led by Udi Manber of Google , announced December 13 , 2007 , and was opened in beta to the public on July 23 , 2008 with a few hundred articles mostly in the health and medical field .
Jeff Chester , executive director of the Center for Digital Democracy , raised similar concerns : `` At the end of the day , there 's a fundamental conflict between the business Google is in and its social goals .
Also forbidden is discriminatory or violent content .
Knol employs `` nofollow '' outgoing links , using an HTML directive to prevent links in its articles from influencing search engine rankings .
Content designed to promote businesses , products or services is allowed , but articles devoid of substantive content and created solely to generate ad revenue are not .
If permission is given , Google will check the veracity of the name information by credit card or phone -LRB- currently only for users residing in the US -RRB- .
When the project was announced , Manber said that `` Google will not serve as an editor in any way , and will not bless any content .
Knol has a content policy describing topics unacceptable for the project .
Google '' -LRB- believes -RRB- that knowing who wrote what will significantly help users make better use of web content '' , and it hopes that `` knols will include the opinions and points of view of the authors who will put their reputation on the line '' .
Knol has been described both as a rival to encyclopedia sites such as Wikipedia , Citizendium , and Scholarpedia and as a complement to Wikipedia , offering a different format that addresses many of Wikipedia 's shortcomings .
Knol is a Google project that aims to include user-written articles on a range of topics .
There has been debate whether Google search results can remain neutral because of possible conflict of interest .
According to Danny Sullivan , the editor of Search Engine Land , `` Googleâ s goal of making Knol pages easy to find on search engines could conflict with its need to remain unbiased . ''
The term knol , which Google defines as a `` unit of knowledge '' , refers to both the project and an article in the project .
Several experts see Knol as Google 's attempt to compete with Wikipedia , while others point out the differences between the projects .
Relevant nudity is allowed -LRB- in most countries -RRB- , but pornography , commercial or otherwise , is forbidden .
All editorial responsibilities and control will rest with the authors . ''

Gyeongju was the capital of the ancient kingdom of Silla -LRB- 57 BC â `` 935 AD -RRB- which ruled most of the Korean Peninsula between the 7th and 9th centuries .
As well as its rich historical heritage , Gyeongju today is affected by the economic , demographic , and social trends that have shaped modern South Korean culture .
Gyeongju is often referred to as `` the museum without walls '' .
The city borders Cheongdo and Yeongcheon to the west , Ulsan to the south and Pohang to the north , while to the east lies the coast of the Sea of Japan -LRB- East Sea -RRB- .
To the east , it has no neighbor but the sea .
Gyeongju is a coastal city in the far southeastern corner of North Gyeongsang province in South Korea .
Tourism remains the major economic driver , but manufacturing activities have developed due to its proximity to major industrial centers such as Ulsan and Pohang .
Gyeongju is 370 k southeast of Seoul , and 55 k east of the provincial capital , Daegu .
It is similar to 53 other small - and medium-sized cities with a population under 300,000 people in South Korea .
The many major historical sites have helped Gyeongju become one of the most popular tourist destinations in South Korea .
The city of Gyeongju was united with the nearby rural Gyeongju County in 1995 and is now an urbanâ `` rural complex .
Among such historical treasures , Seokguram grotto , Bulguksa temple , Gyeongju Historic Areas and Yangdong Folk Village are designated as World Heritage Sites by UNESCO .
It is the second largest city by area in the province after Andong , covering 1324 k with a population of 269,343 people according to the 2008 census .

Cologne or Eau de Cologne is a toiletry , a perfume in a style that originated from Cologne , Germany .
It is nowadays a generic term for scented formulations in typical concentration of 2-5 % essential oils .
His shop at Obenmarspforten opened in 1709 and is today the world 's oldest fragrance factory .

Cornell University was founded on April 27 , 1865 as the result of a New York State -LRB- NYS -RRB- Senate bill that named the university as the state 's land grant institution . Senator Ezra Cornell offered his farm in Ithaca , New York as a site and $ 500,000 of his personal fortune as an initial endowment .
Founded in 1865 by Ezra Cornell and Andrew Dickson White , the university was intended to teach and make contributions in all fields of knowledge -- from the classics to the sciences and from the theoretical to the applied . These ideals , unconventional for the time , are captured in Cornell 's motto , an 1865 Ezra Cornell quotation : `` I would found an institution where any person can find instruction in any study . ''

Shields , in the traditional sense of the word , though less common than omni-directional force fields , have also featured in works of science fiction , notably including -LRB- but not limited to -RRB- those featuring mecha . These shields sometimes resemble , or are explicitly advanced versions of , police riot and\/or tactical shields , complete with windows and\/or gun ports and designed for use in primarily ranged combat ; other shields in science fiction works are more clearly inspired by ancient or medieval shields .
Over time , these were displaced by the kite shield , which was rounded at the top and tapered at the bottom .
Kite shields were commonly used by cavalry as well .
In other works , shields consist of a device that generates an energy barrier in the shape of a traditional shield -LRB- as opposed to the more typical skin-tight or globular `` shields '' described above -RRB- and used in much the same way , such as the `` beam shields '' -LRB- based on beam saber technology -RRB- of Gundam F-91 and later works in the Universal Century timeline , or the shields carried by some of the battle droids in the climactic land battle in Star Wars Episode I : The Phantom Menace . Such shields , whether composed of matter or energy , are typically able to block most or all attacks from weapons comparable in size to the shield , i.e. personal shields are typically impenetrable by personal weapons but not to larger vehicle or ship weapons , while the shields used by mobile suits in the various Gundam anime can block mobile suit weapons and tank guns and some battleship weapons ; because of their limited coverage , however , shields are generally depicted as ineffective against area-affecting attacks like grenades and other explosives , and of limited or no use when attacked by surprise or from multiple directions .

The equation of `` organic '' with living organisms comes from the now-abandoned idea of vitalism that attributed a special force to life that alone could create organic substances .
In a forest , for example , leaf litter and woody material falls to the forest floor .
The definition of organic matter varies upon the subject for which it is being used .
This idea was first questioned after the abiotic synthesis of urea by Friedrich WÃ hler in 1828 .
Polymers and plastics , although they may be organic compounds , are usually not considered organic material , due to their poor ability to decompose . A clam 's shell , while biotic , would not be considered organic matter by this definition because of its inability to decay .
When the organic matter has broken down into a stable humic substances that resist further decomposition it is called humus .
Organic matter -LRB- or organic material -RRB- is matter that has come from a once-living organism ; is capable of decay , or the product of decay ; or is composed of organic compounds . The definition of organic matter varies upon the subject for which it is being used .

The organic matter in soil derives from plants and animals .
This is sometimes referred to as organic material .
When it decays to the point in which it is no longer recognizable it is called soil organic matter .

Electronic feedback loops take two forms : negative feedback loops and positive feedback loops .
In systems containing an input and output , feeding back part of the output so as to increase the input is positive feedback -LRB- regeneration -RRB- ; feeding back part of the output in such a way as to partially oppose the input is negative feedback -LRB- degeneration -RRB- .
Since the microphone is in front of the speaker , the original sound -LRB- now coming from the speaker -RRB- goes back into the microphone .
Such a loop is called a feedback loop .
Such a loop is called a feedback loop . In systems containing an input and output , feeding back part of the output so as to increase the input is positive feedback -LRB- regeneration -RRB- ; feeding back part of the output in such a way as to partially oppose the input is negative feedback -LRB- degeneration -RRB- .

All objects in the sky can be thought of as projected upon the celestial sphere .
This divides the sphere into the north celestial hemisphere and the south celestial hemisphere .
A celestial sphere can also refer to a physical model of the celestial sphere or celestial globe .
The celestial sphere is divided by projecting the equator into space .
The oldest surviving example of such an artefact is the globe of the Farnese Atlas sculpture , a 2nd-century copy of an older -LRB- Hellenistic period , ca .
Likewise , one can locate the Celestial Tropic of Cancer , Celestial Tropic of Capricorn , North Celestial Pole , and South Celestial Pole .
This is the diurnal motion .
As an angle of 1 Â corresponds to 4 minutes in time -LRB- 360 Â = 24 hours -RRB- , we need therefore 4 extra minutes of diurnal motion to see the Sun back on -LRB- for example -RRB- the meridian again , making the duration of one rotation just 24 hours exactly -LRB- on the average , ignoring small seasonal variations , see equation of time -RRB-
As the Earth rotates from west to east around its axis once every 24 hours , the celestial sphere and all objects on it appear to rotate from east to west around the celestial poles in the same time .
Such globes map the constellations on the outside of a sphere , resulting in a mirror image of the constellations as seen from Earth .
In astronomy and navigation , the celestial sphere is an imaginary sphere of arbitrarily large radius , concentric with the Earth and rotating upon the same axis .
The reason for this apparent misadjustment of our clocks is that the Sun is not standing still on the celestial sphere , as the stars do , but moves about 1 Â per day eastwards over a great circle known as the ecliptic -LRB- which is 360 Â or a full circle in one year , the annual motion of the Sun -RRB- .
On the next night a particular star will rise again , but with our normal clocks running a 24 hour 0 minutes cycle , it will do so 4 minutes earlier .

Christopher Marlowe was the first English author to make full use of the potential of blank verse , and also established it as the dominant verse form for English drama in the age of Elizabeth I and James I. The major achievements in English blank verse were made by William Shakespeare , who wrote much of the content of his plays in unrhymed iambic pentameter , and Milton , whose Paradise Lost is written in blank verse . Miltonic blank verse was widely imitated in the 18th century by such poets as James Thomson -LRB- in The Seasons -RRB- and William Cowper -LRB- in The Task -RRB- .
Among American poets , Hart Crane and Wallace Stevens are notable for using blank verse in extended compositions at a time when many other poets were turning to free verse .
The first documented use of blank verse in the English language was by Henry Howard , Earl of Surrey in his interpretation of the Ã neid -LRB- c. 1554 -RRB- . He was possibly inspired by the Latin original , as classical Latin verse -LRB- as well as Greek verse -RRB- did not use rhyme ; or he may have been inspired by the Italian verse form of Versi Sciolti , which also contained no rhyme .

The best known example of planetshine is earthshine , which can be seen from Earth when the Moon is a thin crescent .
The phenomenon known as planetshine occurs when reflected sunlight from a planet illuminates the night side of one of its moons .
Evaporation is especially high in its eastern half , causing the water level to decrease and salinity to increase eastward .
Evaporation greatly exceeds precipitation and river runoff in the Mediterranean , a fact that is central to the water circulation within the basin .
The Sea of Marmara is often considered a part of the Mediterranean Sea , whereas the Black Sea is generally not .
The Mediterranean is characterized and immediately recognized by its deep blue color .
The combination of similarly shared climate , geology and access to a common sea has led to numerous historical and cultural connections between the ancient and modern societies around the Mediterranean .
As a sea around which some of the most ancient human civilizations were arranged , it has had a major influence on the history and ways of life of these cultures .
It provided a way of trade , colonization and war , and was the basis of life -LRB- via fishing and the gathering of other seafood -RRB- for numerous communities throughout the ages .
The Mediterranean Sea is connected to the Atlantic Ocean by the Strait of Gibraltar on the west and to the Sea of Marmara and the Black Sea , by the Dardanelles and the Bosporus respectively , on the east .
This pressure gradient pushes relatively cool , low-salinity water from the Atlantic across the basin ; it warms and becomes saltier as it travels east , then sinks in the region of the Levant and circulates westward , to spill over the Strait of Gibraltar .
Being nearly landlocked affects the Mediterranean Sea 's properties ; for instance , tides are very limited as a result of the narrow connection with the Atlantic Ocean .
Thus , seawater flow is eastward in the Strait 's surface waters , and westward below ; once in the Atlantic , this chemically distinct `` Mediterranean Intermediate Water '' can persist thousands of kilometers away from its source .
Gerald `` Jerry '' Wexler -LRB- January 10 , 1917 -- August 15 , 2008 -RRB- was a music journalist turned music producer , and was regarded as one of the major record industry players behind music from the 1950s through the 1980s .
He coined the term `` rhythm and blues '' , and was integral in signing and\/or producing many of the biggest acts of the last 50 years , including Ray Charles , the Allman Brothers , Chris Connor , Aretha Franklin , Led Zeppelin , Wilson Pickett , Dusty Springfield and Bob Dylan .
Wexler was inducted in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1987 .

U Thant -LRB- ; ; Ë uË Ë Î É ` Ë nt ; January 22 , 1909 â `` November 25 , 1974 -RRB- was a Burmese diplomat and the third Secretary-General of the United Nations , from 1961 to 1971 .

He also established many of the UN 's development and environmental agencies , funds and programs , including the UN Development Programme -LRB- UNDP -RRB- , the UN University , UNCTAD , United Nations Institute for Training and Research -LRB- UNITAR -RRB- , and the UN Environmental Programme .
In his farewell address to the United Nations General Assembly , Secretary-General U Thant stated that he felt a `` great sense of relief bordering on liberation '' on relinquishing the `` burdens of office '' .
During his time in office , he oversaw the entry into the UN of dozens of new Asian and African states and was a firm opponent of apartheid in South Africa .
From 1957 to 1961 , he was Burma 's permanent representative to the United Nations and became actively involved in negotiations over Algerian independence .
Thant followed UFO reports with some interest ; in 1967 , he arranged for American atmospheric physicist James E. McDonald to speak before the UN 's Outer Space Affairs Group regarding UFOs .

In an interaction known as the Fujiwhara effect , the broad circulation of the secondary low swung the primary nor ` easter northwestward towards southern New York and New England .
Deemed a `` hybrid storm '' , the cyclone rapidly intensified in warm waters of up to 80 F from the Gulf Stream combined with a cold air mass over the United States .
On December 23 and 24 , the nor ` easter intensified to attain a barometric pressure of 970 m. An upper-level low pressure system that developed behind the storm began to intensify and grew to be larger in size than the original disturbance .
Despite these indications of tropical characteristics , `` There was no front associated with it and it had a warm core , but the radius of maximum winds was more than 150 n , so under the standard NHC criteria it did n't qualify as a tropical storm . ''
On December 25 , the system began to rapidly weaken as it moved towards Nova Scotia , before the pair of low pressure systems moved out to sea in tandem in the early hours of December 26 .
The Christmas 1994 nor ` easter was an intense cyclone along the East Coast of the United States and Atlantic Canada .
The original low passed along the south shore of Long Island , and made landfall near New York City on December 24 .

In modern times , the largest known prime has almost always been a Mersenne prime .
Fast algorithms for finding Mersenne primes are available , and the largest known prime numbers as of 2009 are Mersenne primes .
In the 4th century BC , Euclid demonstrated that if M ' p is a Mersenne prime then
While it is true that only Mersenne numbers M ` p , where p = 2 , 3 , 5 , â could be prime , often M ' p is not prime even for a prime exponent p. The smallest counterexample is the Mersenne number
Mersenne primes are interesting to many for their connection to perfect numbers .
The lack of an obvious rule to determine whether a given Mersenne number is prime makes the search for Mersenne primes an interesting task , which becomes difficult very quickly , since Mersenne numbers grow very rapidly .
This rules out primality for numbers such as M4 = 24 â ' 1 = 15 : since the exponent 4 = 2 Ã -- 2 is composite , the theorem predicts that 15 is also composite ; indeed , 15 = 3 Ã -- 5 .
A Mersenne prime is a Mersenne number that is prime .

Three species of Loricifera have been found in the sediments at the bottom of the L'Atalante basin in Mediterranean Sea , more than 3,000 meters down , the first multicellular organisms known to spend their entire lives in an oxygen-free environment .
They are found at all depths , in different sediment types , and in all latitudes .
Their size ranges from 100 Â m to ca .
They are characterised by a protective outer case called a lorica and their habitat , which is in the spaces between marine gravel to which they attach themselves .
They are among the most recently discovered groups of Metazoans .
They are able to do this because they rely on hydrogenosomes -LRB- or similar organelles -RRB- instead of on mitochondria for energy .
Very complex and plastic life cycles of pliciloricids include also paedogenetic stages with different forms of parthenogenetic reproduction .
The first specimen was collected in the 1970s , and later described in 1983 .
They attach themselves quite firmly to the substratum , and hence remained undiscovered for so long .
The animals have a head , mouth and digestive system as well as a lorica .

Dildo is a town on the island of Newfoundland in the province of Newfoundland and Labrador , Canada . It is located on the southeastern Dildo Arm of Trinity Bay about 60 kilometres west of St. John 's .
Dildo is home to a local church , All Saints ' Anglican Church . The first church building was constructed in 1878 .
It was a simple structure that had no tower and was 30 f wide by 80 f long .
In 1613 , Henry Crout , whilst sailing up Dildo Arm , came in contact with the Beothuks , who were residing on Dildo Island at this time .
He traded with them and left gifts .
The Dildo area has a long history , going as far back as 2000 BC when Maritime Archaic aboriginal people resided at Anderson 's Cove .
South Dildo is a neighbouring unincorporated community .
By 700 AD Dorset had inhabited Dildo Island .

A trading post -LRB- or as frequently a trading fort in colonial contexts or circumstances -RRB- is a place or establishment where the trading of goods takes place .
Trading posts were also places for people to meet and exchange the news of the world or simply the news from their home country -LRB- many of the world 's trading posts were located in places which were popular destinations for emigration -RRB- in a time when not even newspapers existed .
The preferred travel route to a trading post or between trading posts , is known as a trade route .

So far reaching were the bishopâ s powers that the steward of Bishop Anthony Bek commented in 1299 AD : â There are two kings in England , namely the Lord King of England , wearing a crown in sign of his regality and the Lord Bishop of Durham wearing a mitre in place of a crown , in sign of his regality in the diocese of Durhamâ All this activity was administrated from the castle and buildings surrounding the Palace Green .
However , as the north east was so far from Westminster the bishops of Durham enjoyed extraordinary powers such as the ability to hold their own parliament , raise their own armies , appoint their own sheriffs and Justices , administer their own laws , levy taxes and customs duties , create fairs and markets , issue charters , salvage shipwrecks , collect revenue from mines , administer the forests and mint their own coins .
Durham is well known for its Norman Cathedral and 11th-century castle , and is home to Durham University .
It lies to the south of Newcastle Upon Tyne , Chester-le-Street and Sunderland and to the north of Darlington .
The Prince Bishops also had their own court system , most notably the Durham Court of Chancery .
The present city can clearly be traced back to AD 995 , when a group of monks from Lindisfarne chose the strategic high peninsula as a place to settle with the body of Saint Cuthbert , that had previously lain in Chester-le-Street , founding a church there .
In 1974 it was merged with Durham Rural District and Brandon and Byshottles Urban District to form the City of Durham district of County Durham .
It is within the County Durham local government district , and is the county town of the larger ceremonial county .
The county also had its own attorney general , whose authority to bring an indictment for criminal matters was tested by central government in the infamous case of Rex v. Mary Ann Cotton -LRB- 1832 -RRB- .
The courts and judicial posts for the county were curtailed by the Law Terms Act 1830 and finally abolished by the Supreme Court of Judicature Act 1873 .
Durhamâ s geographical position has always given it an important position in the defense of England against the Scots .
Before the Reformation the shrine of Saint Cuthbert , situated behind the High Altar of Durham Cathedral , was the most important religious site in England until the martyrdom of St Thomas Becket at Canterbury .
Every Bishop of Durham from 1071 to 1836 was a Prince Bishop except for the first Norman-appointed Bishop Walcher who was styled an Earl-Bishop .
Saint Bede 's bones are also entombed in the cathedral , drawing the mediaeval pilgrim to the city .
HM Prison Durham is also located close to the city center .
Despite a brief translation back to Holy Island during the Norman Invasion the saint 's relics remain enshrined to the present day .
The city has played an important part in the defense of the north and Durham Castle is the only Norman castle keep never to have suffered a breach .
The city suffered from a number of plague outbreaks in 1544 , 1589 and 1598 .
Henry VIII curtailed some of the Prince-Bishop 's powers and , in 1538 , ordered the destruction of the shrine of Saint Cuthbert .
The last Prince Bishop of Durham Bishop William Van Mildert credited with the foundation of Durham University .
The Battle of Neville 's Cross which took place near the city on 17 October 1346 between the English and Scots is the most famous battle of the age .

The lion-tailed macaque -LRB- Macaca silenus -RRB- is an Old World monkey that is endemic to the Western Ghats of South India .
It is a good climber and spends a majority of its life in the upper canopy of tropical moist evergreen forests .
Unlike other macaques , it avoids humans .
The hair of the Lion-tailed macaque is dark-brown or black .
Many zoos take part in breeding programs which help to secure the survival of this species .
It was invented between 1830 and 1850 by the Belgian polymath Adolphe Quetelet during the course of developing `` social physics '' .
In 1988 a NIH report concluded that a BMI over 25 is overweight and a BMI over 30 is obese . In the 1990s the World Health Organization -LRB- WHO -RRB- decided that a BMI of 25 to 29 should be considered overweight and a BMI over 30 is obese , the standards the NIH set .
BMI does not actually measure the percentage of body fat .
The body mass index -LRB- BMI -RRB- , or Quetelet index , is a heuristic proxy for human body fat based on an individual 's weight and height . BMI does not actually measure the percentage of body fat .
BMI Prime , a simple modification of the BMI system , is the ratio of actual BMI to upper limit BMI -LRB- currently defined at BMI 25 -RRB- .
The WHO regard a BMI of less than 18.5 as underweight and may indicate malnutrition , an eating disorder , or other health problems , while a BMI greater than 25 is considered overweight and above 30 is considered obese .
In 1888 , Roux published the results of a series of defect experiments in which he took 2 and 4 cell frog embryos and killed half of the cells of each embryo with a hot needle .
His methodology was to interfere with developing embryos and observe the outcome .
This led him to propose his `` Mosaic '' theory of epigenesis : after a few cell divisions the embryo would be like a mosaic , each cell playing its own unique part in the entire design .
After a few years Roux 's theory was refuted by the studies of his colleague Hans Driesch and later , with more precision , Hans Spemann showed that , as a rule , Driesch 's conclusions were correct , but that results like Roux 's may be obtained after intervention in certain planes .
Roux 's research was based upon the notion of Entwicklungsmechanik or developmental mechanics : he investigated the mechanisms of functional adaptations of bones , cartilage , and tendons to malformation and disease .
Wilhelm Roux -LRB- 9 June 1850 -- 15 September 1924 -RRB- was a German zoologist and pioneer of experimental embryology .
Despite this early lapse into a fallacy of reductionism , Roux 's pioneering mechanical methodology was to prove most fruitful in 20th century biology .
He reported that they grew into half-embryos and surmised that the separate function of the two cells had already been determined .
For ten years he worked in Breslau -LRB- now Wroclaw -RRB- , becoming director of his own Institute of Embryology in 1879 .
Roux 's investigations were performed mainly on frogs ' eggs to research the earliest structures in amphibian development .
His goal was to show Darwinian processes at work on the cellular level .
He was professor at Innsbruck , Austria from 1889-95 , then accepted a professorial chair at the Anatomical Institute of the University of Halle , a post he retained until 1921 .

Oenothera is a genus of about 125 species of annual , biennial and perennial herbaceous flowering plants , native to North and South America .
Common names include evening-primrose , suncups , and sundrops .
It is the type genus of the family Onagraceae , the Evening Primrose Family .

Ergastic substances may appear in the protoplasm , in vacuoles , or in the cell wall .
The living protoplasm of a cell is sometimes called the bioplasm and distinct from the ergastic substances of the cell .
The latter are usually organic or inorganic substances that are products of metabolism , and include crystals , oil drops , gums , tannins , resins and other compounds that can aid the organism in defense , maintenance of cellular structure , or just substance storage .
Ergastic substances are non-protoplasm materials found in cells .
The Philadelphia Inquirer is a morning daily newspaper that serves the Philadelphia , Pennsylvania , metropolitan area of the United States .
The newspaper was founded by John R. Walker and John Norvell in June 1829 as The Pennsylvania Inquirer and is the third-oldest surviving daily newspaper in the United States .
The Philadelphia Inquirer was founded as The Pennsylvania Inquirer by printer John R. Walker and John Norvell , former editor of Philadelphia 's largest newspaper , the Aurora & Gazette .
Owned by Philadelphia Media Network , The Inquirer has the nineteenth largest average weekday U.S. newspaper circulation and has won eighteen Pulitzer Prizes .

Thracian troops were known to accompany neighboring ruler Alexander the Great when he crossed the Hellespont which abuts Thrace , and took on the Persian Empire of the day .
The name comes from the Thracians , an ancient Indo-European people inhabiting Central , Eastern and Southeastern Europe .
The Thracians did not describe themselves as such and Thrace and Thracians are simply the names given them by the Greeks .
Recently discovered funeral mounds in Bulgaria suggest that Thracian kings did rule regions of Thrace with distinct Thracian national identity .
The indigenous population of Thrace was a people called the Thracians , divided into numerous tribal groups .
Thrace -LRB- , adjective Thracian is or \/ Ë Î reÉ Ê iâ É n \/ , , , -RRB- is a historical and geographic area in southeast Europe .
Like Illyrians , Thracian tribes of the mountainous regions fostered a locally ruled warrior tradition , while the tribes based in the plains were purportedly more peaceable .
Divided into separate tribes , the Thracians did not manage to form a lasting political organization until the Odrysian state was founded in the 4th century BC .
The areas it comprises are southeastern Bulgaria -LRB- Northern Thrace -RRB- , northeastern Greece -LRB- Western Thrace -RRB- , and the European part of Turkey -LRB- Eastern Thrace -RRB- .

An aftershock is a smaller earthquake that occurs after a previous large earthquake , in the same area of the main shock .
Aftershocks occur with a pattern that follows Omori 's law .
In 1894 , Fusakichi Omori published his work on the aftershocks of earthquakes , in which he stated that aftershock frequency decreases by roughly the reciprocal of time after the main shock .

For more complex fields with pre-formated contents that would still be present even if the parameter was n't set , you can wrap it all in an '' # if '' statement to make the whole thing vanish when the parameter is not used .
Each row on the table can contain either a header , or a label\/data pair , or just a data cell .
; name : The template page name that the `` view\/discuss\/edit '' links should point to .
Image is centered by default .
See Infobox for an introduction to infoboxes and information on how to design them .
; caption , caption2 : Text to put underneath the images .
Use full image syntax , for example .
These are mutually exclusive states so if you define a row with both a header and a label\/data pair , the label\/data pair is ignored .
This template is intended as a meta-template : a template used for constructing other templates .
It is not meant for use directly in an article , but can be used on a one-off basis if required .
Usage is similar to , but with an additional distinction .
To make a row optional use a parameter that defaults to an empty string , like so :
; image , image2 : images to display at the top of the template .
; header -LRB- n -RRB- : Text to use as a header in row n. ; label -LRB- n -RRB- : Text to use as a label in row n. ; data -LRB- n -RRB- : Text to display as data in row n. ; below : Text to put in the bottom cell .
The bottom cell is intended for footnotes , see-also , and other such information .

The content is drawn randomly from a pre-defined list .

To see a real time example , see what links here .

ChÃ rancÃ is a commune in the Sarthe department in the Pays de la Loire region in north-western Anus .
Basement rock is too infertile to be farmed , but provides sporadic forest cover that can be grazed by animals .
The region is divided into three federal states : West Darfur , South Darfur , and North Darfur .
To the north the goz is overtaken by the desert sands of the Sahara .
The region 's main towns are Al Fashir , Nyala , and Geneina .
It is largely an arid plateau with the Marrah Mountains -LRB- Jebel Marra -RRB- , a range of volcanic peaks rising up to 3042 m of topographic prominence , in the center of the region .
Western Darfur is dominated by the third feature , basement rock , sometimes covered with a thin layer of sandy soil .
The fourth and final feature are the Marrah Mountains , volcanic plugs created by a massif , that rise up to a peak at Deriba crater where there is a small area of temperate climate , high rainfall and permanent springs of water .
In many places the goz is waterless and can only be inhabited where there are water reservoirs or deep boreholes .
A second feature are the wadis , which range from seasonal watercourses that flood only occasionally during the wet season to large wadis that flood for most of the rains and flow from western Darfur hundreds of miles west to Lake Chad .
The whole eastern half of Darfur is covered with plains and low hills of sandy soils , known as goz , and sandstone hills .
There are four main features of the physical geography .
Many wadis have pans of alluvium with rich soil that are also difficult to cultivate .

Postclassic Maya states also continued to survive in the southern highlands .
Many Mayan languages continue to be spoken as primary languages today ; the Rabinal AchÃ , a play written in the Achi language , was declared a Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO in 2005 .
The last Maya states , the Itza polity of Tayasal and the Ko ` woj city of Zacpeten , were continuously occupied and remained independent of the Spanish until late in the 17th century .
After the decline of the ruling dynasties of Chichen and Uxmal , Mayapan ruled all of YucatÃ n until a revolt in 1450 .
The Ko ` woj had their capital at Zacpeten .
The area then degenerated into competing city-states until YucatÃ n was conquered by the Spanish .
The Maya civilization participated in long distance trade with many of the other Mesoamerican cultures , including Teotihuacan , the Zapotec and other groups in central and gulf-coast Mexico , as well as with more distant , non-Mesoamerican groups , for example the Tainos in the Caribbean .
They were finally subdued by the Spanish in 1697 .
The Maya cities of the northern lowlands in YucatÃ n continued to flourish for centuries more ; some of the important sites in this era were Chichen Itza , Uxmal , EdznÃ , and Coba .
It ruled over an area extending across the Peten Lakes region , encompassing the community of Eckixil on Lake Quexil .
This includes the well-known cities of Tikal , Palenque , CopÃ n and Calakmul , but also the lesser known Dos Pilas , Uaxactun , Altun Ha , and Bonampak , among others .
The Itza Maya , Ko ` woj , and Yalain groups of Central Peten survived the `` Classic Period Collapse '' in small numbers and by 1250 reconstituted themselves to form competing city-states .
One of the Maya nations in this area , the K ` iche ' Kingdom of Q ` umarkaj , is responsible for the best-known Maya work of historiography and mythology , the Popol Vuh .
Maya influence can be detected from Honduras , Guatemala , Northern El Salvador and to as far as central Mexico , more than 1000 km -LRB- 625 miles -RRB- from the Maya area .
Initially established during the Pre-Classic period -LRB- c. 2000 BC to 250 AD -RRB- , according to the Mesoamerican chronology , many Maya cities reached their highest state of development during the Classic period -LRB- c. 250 AD to 900 AD -RRB- , and continued throughout the Post-Classic period until the arrival of the Spanish .
Other important archaeological remains include the carved stone slabs usually called stelae -LRB- the Maya called them tetun , or `` tree-stones '' -RRB- , which depict rulers along with hieroglyphic texts describing their genealogy , military victories , and other accomplishments .
The most notable monuments are the stepped pyramids they built in their religious centers and the accompanying palaces of their rulers .
The Itza maintained their capital at Tayasal -LRB- also known as Noh PetÃ n -RRB- , an archaeological site thought to underlay the modern city of Flores , Guatemala on Lake PetÃ n ItzÃ .
The Early Classic settlement distribution in the northern Maya lowlands is not as clearly known as the southern zone , but does include a number of population centers , such as Oxkintok , Chunchucmil , and the early occupation of Uxmal .
The palace at CancuÃ n is the largest in the Maya area , though the site , interestingly , lacks pyramids .
Today , the Maya and their descendants form sizable populations throughout the Maya area and maintain a distinctive set of traditions and beliefs that are the result of the merger of pre-Columbian and post-Conquest ideas and cultures .
Archeologists have also found gold from Panama in the Sacred Cenote of Chichen Itza .
The Maya civilization extended throughout the present-day southern Mexican states of Chiapas , Tabasco , and the YucatÃ n Peninsula states of Quintana Roo , Campeche and YucatÃ n. The Maya area also extended throughout the northern Central American region , including the present-day nations of Guatemala , Belize , Northern El Salvador and western Honduras .
The Maya area is generally divided into three loosely defined zones : the southern Maya highlands , the central lowlands , and the northern lowlands .
The disease may also be spread through blood transfusion and organ transplantation , ingestion of food contaminated with parasites , and from a mother to her fetus .

The Catholic Church gives the name Purgatory to the final purification of all who die in God 's grace and friendship , but still imperfectly purified .

It is also by far the largest of the three ; its more than 5,000 different species make up over 96 % of all living anurans .

In May 1745 , Le Breton announced the work as available for sale , but to his dismay , Mills had not done the work he was commissioned to do ; in fact , he could barely read and write French and did not even own a copy of Cyclopaedia .
As of 1750 , the full title was EncyclopÃ die , ou Dictionnaire raisonnÃ des sciences , des arts et des mÃ tiers , par une sociÃ tÃ de gens de lettres , mis en ordre par M. Diderot de l'Acad Ã mie des Sciences et Belles-Lettres de Prusse , et quant Ã la partie mathÃ matique , par M. d'Alembert de l'Acad Ã mie royale des Sciences de Paris , de celle de Prusse et de la SociÃ tÃ royale de Londres .
Within thirteen months , in August 1747 , Gua de Malves was fired for being an ineffective leader .
While many contributors to the EncyclopÃ die had no interest in radically reforming French society , the EncyclopÃ die as a whole pointed that way .
In 1743 , the translation was entrusted by the Parisian book publisher AndrÃ Le Breton to John Mills , an English resident in France .
Mills sued for assault , but Le Breton was acquitted in court as being justified .
Still , the EncyclopÃ die is famous above all for representing the thought of the Enlightenment .
Furious at having been swindled , Le Breton beat Mills with a cane .
For his new editor , Le Breton settled on the mathematician Jean Paul de Gua de Malves .
The EncyclopÃ die was an innovative encyclopedia in several respects . Among other things , it was the first encyclopedia to include contributions from many named contributors , and it was the first general encyclopedia to lavish attention on the mechanical arts .
EncyclopÃ die , ou dictionnaire raisonnÃ des sciences , des arts et des mÃ tiers was a general encyclopedia published in France between 1751 and 1772 , with later supplements , revised editions , and translations .
Le Breton then hired Diderot and Jean d'Alembert as the new editors .
The EncyclopÃ die was originally conceived as a French translation of Ephraim Chambers 's Cyclopaedia -LRB- 1728 -RRB- .
Modern Anti-Armenianism is usually associated with either extreme opposition to the actions or existence of the Armenian Republic , belief in an Armenian conspiracy to fabricate history and manipulate public and political opinion for political gain , or belief that Armenia is attempting to unfairly annex land from neighboring states .
, is hostility toward or prejudice against Armenian people , Armenian culture and the Republic of Armenia , which can range in expression from individual hatred to institutionalized persecution .
Several organizations have stated that difficulties currently experienced by the Armenian minority in Turkey are a result of an anti-Armenian attitude by the Turkish government as well as by ultra-nationalist groups such as the Grey Wolves .
For several months in 1994 , someone posted messages under the alias Serdar Argic claiming that the Armenian Genocide did not happen or that Armenians massacred Turks , on Usenet newsgroup threads mentioning the word Turkey .
The controversy and emotions surrounding the Armenian Genocide and Nagorno-Karabakh are two examples of intense anti-Armenianism in both countries .
Modern anti-Armenianism often seems to lack a racial and cultural basis and appears to be based more on geopolitics and history , in addition to diplomatic and strategic interests , involving the modern states of Turkey and Azerbaijan , although these prejudices usually extend to the widespread Armenian Diaspora .

Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol -LRB- XMPP -RRB- is an open-standard communications protocol for message-oriented middleware based on XML -LRB- Extensible Markup Language -RRB- . The protocol was originally named Jabber , and was developed by the Jabber open-source community in 1999 for , originally , near-real-time , extensible instant messaging -LRB- IM -RRB- , presence information , and contact list maintenance .
The XMPP Standards Foundation -LRB- XSF -RRB- develops and publishes extensions to XMPP through a standards process centered on XMPP Extension Protocols -LRB- XEPs , previously known as Jabber Enhancement Proposals - JEPs -RRB- .

In language structure , a diminutive , or diminutive form -LRB- abbreviated -RRB- , is a formation of a word used to convey a slight degree of the root meaning , smallness of the object or quality named , encapsulation , intimacy , or endearment .
Terms such as `` movie '' for `` moving picture '' are oft-heard terms in English .
For example , one comparative study found that English uses diminutives infrequently in comparison with the Czech language . Nevertheless , most dialects of English feature a fair lot of sidling and sibling diminutives .

The embedded magic word DEFAULTSORT applies to all categories on the page , no matter whether the lifetime template is before or after them .
The template provides a local sandbox and testcases for developing and testing changes -LRB- see documentation 's hat-note -RRB- .
If you want to substitute it , use the following syntax :
' is for quickly generating category tags related to birth and death years , including living people and missing or unknown values .
The general DEFAULTSORT can be embedded as well .
Other cases are handled with options .
For each option , the default value is displayed in bold and automatically assumed if the field is left blank .
Please note that MISSING results in Categories that are not displayed on the page .
This template supports substitution .
Often , editors accused of ownership may not even realize it , so it is important to assume good faith .
Others may try to promote their own point of view , failing to recognize the importance of the NPOV policy .
Similarly , if you do not want your ideas -LRB- for article organization , categorization , style , standards , etc. -RRB- challenged or developed by others , then do not submit them .
Some editors may think they are protecting the article from vandalism , and may respond to any changes with hostility .

Mongolia is a landlocked country in East and Central Asia .
During the collapse of the Qing Dynasty in 1911 , Mongolia declared independence , but had to struggle until 1921 to firmly establish de facto independence from the Republic of China , and until 1945 to gain international recognition .
The Mongol Empire was founded by Genghis Khan in 1206 .
In the 16th and 17th centuries , Mongolia came under the influence of Tibetan Buddhism . At the end of the 17th century , most of Mongolia had been incorporated into the area ruled by the Qing Dynasty .
After the collapse of the Yuan Dynasty , the Mongols returned to their earlier pattern of constant internal conflict and occasional raids on the Chinese borderlands .
Mongolia 's political system is a parliamentary republic .

Green Park tube station is a London Underground station located on the north side of Green Park , close to the intersection of Piccadilly and the pedestrian Queen 's Walk .
London Buses routes 9 , 14 , 19 , 22 , 38 and C2 serve the station .
The station is served by the Piccadilly line , between Piccadilly Circus and Hyde Park Corner , the Victoria line , between Victoria and Oxford Circus , and the Jubilee line , between Bond Street and Westminster .
It is in Travelcard Zone 1 .
Elective monarchy can practically function as a hereditary monarchy , for example in case of eligibility being limited to members of one family -LRB- or even further , if allowed by the rules of precedence in the election -RRB- . This has happened historically , usually slowly , in many past elective monarchies .
Hereditary monarchies most usually arrange succession by a legislated , definite order of succession so that it is well-known beforehand who will be the next monarch .
When that child dies , the crown is in turn passed to his or her child , or , if no child exists , a sister , brother , niece , nephew , cousin , or other relative .
Under a hereditary monarchy , all the monarchs come from the same family , and the crown is passed down from one member to another member of the family .
A hereditary monarchy is the most common type of monarchy and is the form that is used by almost all of the world 's existing monarchies .
For example , when the king or queen of a hereditary monarchy dies or abdicates , the crown is usually passed to the next generation , i. e , his or her child , typically in some order of seniority .
Nowadays , the typical order of succession in hereditary monarchies is based on some form of primogeniture , but there exist other methods such as seniority , tanistry and rotation , which were much more common in the past .
The ideal gas law is the equation of state of a hypothetical ideal gas .
where p is the absolute pressure of the gas ; V is the volume ; N is the number of particles in the gas ; k is Boltzmann 's constant relating temperature and energy ; and T is the absolute temperature .
