Since this value is near the approximate diameter of Ananke itself , it is likely the parent body was not heavily disrupted .
Their semi-major axes -LRB- distances from Jupiter -RRB- range between 19.3 and 22.7 Gm , their orbital inclinations between 145.7 Â and 154.8 Â , and their orbital eccentricities between 0.02 and 0.28 .
The Ananke group is a group of retrograde irregular satellites of Jupiter that follow similar orbits to Ananke and are thought to have a common origin .
The International Astronomical Union -LRB- IAU -RRB- reserves names ending in - e for all retrograde moons , including this group 's members .
The Ananke group is believed to have been formed when an asteroid was captured by Jupiter and subsequently fragmented by a collision .
The edible root of zedoary has a white interior and a fragrance reminiscent of mango ; however , its flavor is more similar to ginger , except with a very bitter aftertaste .
Zedoary has been used to treat coronary heart disease , liver cancer , anemia , chronic pelvic inflammation and helps prevent leukopenia due to cancer therapies .
Zedoary is also used in some traditional eastern medicines , where it is reputed to be an aid to digestion , a relief for colic and an agent for purifying the blood .
In Indonesia , it is ground to a powder and added to curry pastes , whereas in India , it tends to be used fresh or in pickling .
The penny sterling -LRB- plural pence , abbreviation p -RRB- is a subdivision of pound sterling , the currency for the United Kingdom .
Jette is one of the nineteen municipalities located in the Brussels-Capital Region of Belgium .
The term sometimes is used to refer specifically to climate change caused by human activity ; for example , the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change defines climate change as `` a change of climate which is attributed directly or indirectly to human activity that alters the composition of the global atmosphere and which is in addition to natural climate variability observed over comparable time periods . '' In the latter sense climate change is synonymous with global warming .
In recent usage , especially in the context of environmental policy , climate change usually refers to changes in modern climate .
The channel is on-air from 19:00 to around 04:00 each night , in order to share terrestrial television bandwidth with the CBBC Channel .
Nine million people watch BBC Three every week .
As part of the BBC 's discussions with the government regarding the founding of the channel , a longer news program had been promised to provide a daily section of news and current affairs .
The channel is the successor to the similar BBC Choice and was launched on 9 February 2003 , eleven months after the originally planned launch date -LRB- and the launch of BBC Four -RRB- .
These include John Humphrys , who argued that BBC Three and BBC Four should be shut down in the face of budget cuts to BBC Radio 4 's Today program , which he presents , John Sweeney of Panorama , and Jeremy Paxman are among other journalists have also criticised the channel and its content .
They are presented in a relaxed style in keeping with the rest of the channel .
Most recently , it won Broadcast Magazines Digital Channel of the Year Award for Best General Entertainment Channel , and MGEITF Non Terrestrial Channel of the Year .
The channel is aimed at 16-34 year olds , and competes with other digital channels including ITV2 and E4 .
80 % is original , covering all genres , from current affairs , to drama , to comedy to animation .
Meanwhile , Its share of the audience during its transmission hours is 2.6 % among 15-34 year olds , and 1.7 % among all individuals .
The channel features hourly news updates called 60 Seconds , presented by Sam Naz during the week , which include the top news , sport and entertainment stories .
The channel was launched by Stuart Murphy , who previously ran BBC Choice , and before that UK Play , the now-discontinued UKTV music and comedy channel on which ran Rock Profile , by Matt Lucas and David Walliams -LRB- who went on to star in Little Britain -RRB- .
The channel has had critical and popular successes , winning more awards in its six year history than its commercial rivals -LRB- Sky One , Living , E4 , ITV2 , Five and Comedy Central -RRB- have won in their combined 25-year history .
Despite several official complaints from the BBC , BARB continues to publish figures which the BBC argues are unrepresentative .
The News Show , as it came to be called upon launch was later rebranded The 7 O'Clock News .
In 2008 , BBC Three 's Gavin & Stacey won the BAFTA audience award and the best comedy performance award was awarded to James Corden for his part .
Unlike its commercial rivals , 90 % of BBC Three 's output is from the United Kingdom and other European Union countries .
Torchwood launched with an impressive 2.4 million viewers in October 2006 , breaking BBC Three 's previous record of 1.8 million for Little Britain .
In total BBC Three has won 7 BAFTA awards , 5 British Comedy Awards , 15 Royal Television Society Awards and 5 Rose d'Or Awards since the channel was launched in February 2003 .
However , the BBC discontinued the bulletin in 2005 , claiming that the program 's audience was minuscule and the output was provided elsewhere on the BBC .
BARB , the official ratings agency , averages out BBC Three 's viewing figures over 24 hours even though the channel only broadcasts in the evening , giving a distorted sense of the channel 's viewership .
The channel has also come in for criticism from several corners , the most prominent of which are some of the BBC 's long-standing presenters .

`` We reaffirm , as an essential foundation of the Information Society , and as outlined in Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights , that everyone has the right to freedom of opinion and expression ; that this right includes freedom to hold opinions without interference and to seek , receive and impart information and ideas through any media and regardless of frontiers .
The Rupal River is an east-west glacial stream rising from the meltwater of the Rupal Glacier in northern Pakistan .
The stream flows through the Rupal Valley , south of Nanga Parbat , before turning northeast to the village of Tarashing .
The Rupal drains into the Astore River , which eventually reaches the Indus near Jaglot .
-LRB- a -RRB- Share a large majority of their species and ecological dynamics ; -LRB- b -RRB- Share similar environmental conditions , and ; -LRB- c -RRB- Interact ecologically in ways that are critical for their long-term persistence .
Ecoregions cover relatively large areas of land or water , and contain characteristic , geographically distinct assemblages of natural communities and species .
An ecoregion -LRB- ecological region -RRB- , sometimes called a bioregion , is an ecologically and geographically defined area that is smaller than an ecozone and larger than an ecosystem .
The `` Global 200 '' is the list of ecoregions identified by WWF as priorities for conservation .
According to WWF , the boundaries of an ecoregion approximate the original extent of the natural communities prior to any major recent disruptions or changes .
WWF has identified 867 terrestrial ecoregions , and approximately 450 freshwater ecoregions across the Earth .
In addition to discovering hundreds of thousands of asteroids -LRB- 225,957 as of December 31 , 2007 -RRB- , LINEAR is also credited with the discovery , or co-discovery , or rediscovery of several periodic comets , including 11P\/Tempel-Swift-LINEAR , 146P\/Shoemaker-LINEAR , 148P\/Anderson-LINEAR , 156P\/Russell-LINEAR , 158P\/Kowal-LINEAR , 160P\/LINEAR -LRB- LINEAR 43 -RRB- , 165P\/LINEAR -LRB- LINEAR 10 -RRB- , and 176P\/LINEAR -LRB- LINEAR 52 , 118401 LINEAR : one of only five objects classified both as comets and asteroids -RRB- .
The Lincoln Near-Earth Asteroid Research -LRB- LINEAR -RRB- project is a cooperative project between the United States Air Force , NASA , and MIT 's Lincoln Laboratory for the systematic discovery and tracking of near-Earth asteroids .
As of 2007 , LINEAR had detected 226,193 new objects of which at least 2019 were near-Earth asteroids and 236 were comets .
All of LINEAR 's discoveries were made using robotic telescopes .

In 1835 , S.D. Poisson further described it under the name `` La loi des grands nombres '' -LRB- `` The law of large numbers '' -RRB- .
After Bernoulli and Poisson published their efforts , other mathematicians also contributed to refinement of the law , including Chebyshev , Markov , Borel , Cantelli and Kolmogorov and Khinchin -LRB- who finally provided a complete proof of the LLN for the arbitrary random variables -RRB- .
Thereafter , it was known under both names , but the `` Law of large numbers '' is most frequently used .
One is called the `` weak '' law and the other the `` strong '' law .
It took him over 20 years to develop a sufficiently rigorous mathematical proof which was published in his Ars Conjectandi -LRB- The Art of Conjecturing -RRB- in 1713 .
He named this his `` Golden Theorem '' but it became generally known as `` Bernoulli 's Theorem '' .

In computer science , linear search or sequential search is a method for finding a particular value in a list , that consists of checking every one of its elements , one at a time and in sequence , until the desired one is found .
Currently , Bala Prajapathi Adikalar , heir to the Payyan dynasty , is considered the leader of Ayyavazhi .
To the Ayyavazhi devotees , there are seven holy places , called Pathis , with the Pancha pathis being the most important .
Although the majority of these followers were from the Chanar cast , a large number of people from other castes also followed it .
The list of Pathis announced by the headquarters of Ayyavazhi does not include these Pathis .
After the time of Vaikundar , Ayyavazhi was spread through his teachings . The five Seedars , disciples of Vaikundar and their descendants , traveled to several parts of the country bearing the mission of Ayyavazhi .
Meanwhile , the Payyan dynasty started administrating the Swamithoppe pathi , while other Pathis came under the administration of the followers of Ayya .
By the middle of 19th century , Ayyavazhi had come to be recognized as a separate religion with deep roots in the regions of South Travancore and South Tirunelveli .

An air door or air curtain is a device used for separating two spaces from each other , usually at the exterior entrance .
The most common configuration for air curtains is a downward-facing blower fan mounted over an opening , blowing air across the surface of the opening .
It also helps keep out outside air , reducing infiltration though the opening . They can also be used to avoid cold drafts by mixing in warm air heated by the air curtain .
The fan must be powerful enough to generate a jet of air that can reach the floor .

Five classical groups of opsins are involved in vision , mediating the conversion of a photon of light into an electrochemical signal , the first step in the visual transduction cascade .
Another opsin found in the mammalian retina , melanopsin , is involved in circadian rhythms and pupillary reflex but not in image-forming .

John Gould -LRB- 14 September 1804 â `` 3 February 1881 -RRB- was an English ornithologist and bird artist .
The Gould League in Australia was named after him .
His identification of the birds now nicknamed `` Darwin 's finches '' played a role in the inception of Darwin 's theory of evolution by natural selection .
Gould 's work is referenced in Charles Darwin 's book , On the Origin of Species .

The concept of the Linux mascot being a penguin came from Linus Torvalds , the creator of Linux .
He has been featured in open-source look-alikes of other mainstream games , such as Tux Racer , Extreme Tux Racer , Tux Math Scrabble , TuxWordSmith Tux Math , SuperTux , Super Tux Kart , and Tux Paint . As such , several computer games , mostly free and open source and\/or for Linux , have starred Tux , including :
However , tux is also an abbreviation of tuxedo , the outfit which springs to mind when one sees a penguin .
Originally created as an entry to a Linux logo competition , Tux is the most commonly used icon for Linux , although different Linux distributions depict Tux in various styles .
Tux is a penguin character and the official mascot of the Linux kernel .
In a parliamentary system , the head of government is often styled Prime Minister , President of the Government , Premier , etc. . In presidential republics or absolute monarchies , the head of government may be the same person as the head of state , who is often called respectively a president or a monarch .
In some models the head of state and head of government are one and the same .

During the war , Buckles served in England and France , driving ambulances and motorcycles for the Army 's 1st Fort Riley Casual Detachment .
Later that year , he embarked for Europe aboard the RMS Carpathia , which was being used as a troop ship . While on board Carpathia , Buckles spoke with crew members who had taken part in the rescue of RMS Titanic survivors five years previously .
He was freed by Allied forces on February 23 , 1945 .
He was captured there by the Japanese in 1942 and spent the next three and a half years in the Los BaÃ os prison camp .
With a weight below 100 pounds , Buckles developed beriberi , yet led his fellow prisoners in calisthenics .
By 1942 , Buckles had worked for the White Star , American President , and W.R. Grace shipping companies , and shipping business took him to Manila in the Philippines .
Following his honorable discharge in November 1919 , he attended the dedication of the Liberty Memorial in Kansas City , Missouri , in honor of the Americans who died in World War I , and met General John Pershing , the commander of all United States Army forces in France during the war .
Joacim Cans -LRB- born 19 February 1970 in Mora , Sweden -RRB- is the lead singer of HammerFall , a Swedish power metal band .
One possible reason for this distinct biological feature may be formation of strong emotional bonds between sexual partners important for social interactions and , in the case of humans , long-term partnership rather than immediate sexual reproduction .
However , bonobos , dolphins , and chimpanzees are known to engage in sexual intercourse even when the female is not in estrus , and to engage in sex acts with same-sex partners .
Sexual intercourse , also known as copulation or coitus , commonly refers to the act in which the male reproductive organ enters the female reproductive tract .
Sex reinforces intimate social bonds between individuals to form larger social structures .
Humans , bonobos and dolphins are all intelligent social animals , whose cooperative behavior proves far more successful than that of any individual alone .
There are a variety of safe sex practices , including non-penetrative sex acts , and some heterosexual couples use oral sex or anal sex -LRB- or both -RRB- as a means of contraception .
The two entities may be of opposite sexes , or they may be hermaphroditic , as is the case with snails .
Like humans engaging in sex primarily for pleasure , this behavior in the above mentioned animals is also presumed to be for pleasure , and a contributing factor to strengthening their social bonds .
In humans and bonobos , the female undergoes relatively concealed ovulation so that both male and female partners commonly do not know whether she is fertile at any given moment .
In these animals , the use of sex has evolved beyond reproduction , to apparently serve additional social functions .
Mating is the term most often used to refer to sexual intercourse between animals other than humans ; for most , mating occurs at the point of estrus -LRB- the most fertile period of time in the female 's reproductive cycle -RRB- , which increases the chances of successful impregnation .
where T is a triangular number .

The other cowbird species have fewer known hosts , but all the species are generalists when it comes to choosing a host .
This means that the eggs may look different from the hosts ' eggs .
In order for the birds to remain mobile and stay with the herd , they have adapted by laying their eggs in other birds ' nests . The cowbird will watch for when its host lays eggs , and when the nest is left unattended , the female will come in and lay its own eggs .
Cowbirds are birds belonging to the genus Molothrus in the family Icteridae .
The Brown-headed Cowbird has over 220 hosts .

In September 2006 , emergency contraception expert Anna Glasier wrote a BMJ editorial entitled `` Emergency Contraception .
The current -LRB- December 2005 -RRB- ACOG Practice Bulletin on Emergency Contraception states : `` A prominent concern among both women and health care providers is that making emergency contraception more readily available could encourage irresponsible sexual behavior , which would increase the risks of both unintended pregnancy and sexually transmitted diseases .
Emergency contraception -LRB- EC -RRB- , or emergency postcoital contraception , refers to birth control measures that , if taken after sexual intercourse , may prevent pregnancy .
A Massachusetts law that went into effect on 14 December 2005 requires all hospitals in the state to provide emergency contraception to any `` female rape victim of childbearing age '' including Catholic Hospitals who oppose the provision of emergency contraception . In a letter criticizing the joint UN\/WHO Inter-agency Field Manual on Reproductive Health in Refugee Situations , the Catholic Church explains its belief that emergency contraception , along with IUDs and hormonal contraception , can not be considered `` solely contraceptive because in the case of effective fertilization a chemical abortion would be carried out during the first days of pregnancy . ''

Asada was not sent to the 2005 World Championships because she was not old enough . At the Junior World Championships , she won with a 20.31 lead over the silver medalist Kim Yu-Na .
At the age of 14 , Asada landed a triple axel in her free skating program at the 2004 Junior Grand Prix Final , held in December 2004 at Helsinki , Finland , becoming the first junior girl to do one in an international event . She has since been known for her triple axel jumps .
She competed in the ISU Junior Grand Prix , which is the Junior complement to the ISU Grand Prix of Figure Skating .
Having won everything on the Junior level , Asada moved to the senior level for the 2005 â `` 2006 season and competed on the Grand Prix circuit . This choice was made knowing that Asada would not be eligible to compete at the 2006 Winter Olympics , because the age standards for the Olympic and ISU championship competitions were different from those for the Grand Prix .
During her first two years on the international scene , Asada became known for her signature move , the cross-grab Biellmann position . She is also noted for performing the one-handed Biellmann spin in competition .

Boogie-woogie is a style of piano-based blues that became very popular in the late 1930s and early 1940s , but originated much earlier , and was extended from piano , to three pianos at once , guitar , big band , and country and western music , and even gospel .
Whilst the blues traditionally depicts a variety of emotions , boogie-woogie is mainly associated with dancing . It 's believed boogie-woogie gave birth to the earliest versions of uptempo music .

UNICEF Innocenti Research Centre in Florence , Italy , was established in 1988 to strengthen the research capability of the United Nations Children 's Fund -LRB- UNICEF -RRB- and to support its advocacy for children worldwide .
United Nations Children 's Fund -LRB- or UNICEF ; -RRB- was created by the United Nations General Assembly on December 11 , 1946 , to provide emergency food and healthcare to children in countries that had been devastated by World War II .
In 1953 , UNICEF became a permanent part of the United Nations System and its name was shortened from the original United Nations International Children 's Emergency Fund but it has continued to be known by the popular acronym based on this old name .
UNICEF is present in 190 countries and territories around the world .

The Daily Show , known in its current incarnation as The Daily Show with Jon Stewart , is an American late night satirical television program airing each Monday through Thursday on Comedy Central in the United States .

Lens manufacturers such as ARRI Media , ISCO Precision Optics , Schneider , Carl Zeiss AG , Canon and others still make variable focal length cine and video lenses regularly catalogued as variable prime lenses . A variable prime is sometimes distinguished from a `` true zoom '' in that the latter maintains focus as the focal length is varied .
In film and photography , a prime lens is either a photographic lens whose focal length is fixed , as opposed to a zoom lens , or it is the primary lens in a combination lens system .

While an infobox can provide a condensed summary of related data , it can oversimplify the connections , such as when a territory changes boundaries but is treated as being exactly the same place .
Colors could also be dark brown -LRB- # CC6622 -RRB- with '' '' .
Colors could also be beige -LRB- # DDDDBB -RRB- .
Also , notice setting the background-color as gray\/grey by use of the HTML CSS custom style directive -LRB- style = `` background : # DDDDDD '' -RRB- placed before the `` Notebox : '' text .
That viewpoint can focus the choice of wording , and the amount of complexity , to be used when developing infoboxes .
It is always important to think outside the infobox , as to the effect it has outside the English Wikipedia , in the many other-language Wikipedia articles .
It is very easy to code a small infobox outside , and below , as an extension of a formal template-infobox .
The use of infoboxes in Wikipedia articles has both advantages and disadvantages .
Users should learn how to create infoboxes , on the fly , and learn how to spot\/correct problems in infobox format .
Note that the first line of text must begin with the vertical-bar -LRB- '' '' -RRB- , although it can be indented as a bar further along the line .
Also , if the infobox is of limited scope , there is no need to expand pages by adding a separate infobox page , infobox-talk , and infobox-history pages .
Some infoboxes should be coded inside an article .
Generally , a separate Wikipedia template page is created to store the layout of an infobox .
The phrase `` Thinking outside the -LRB- info -RRB- box '' has many possible implications , as with the underlying phrase .
Colors could also be dark tan -LRB- # DD9922 -RRB- .
If a standardized infobox-template does not contain enough data fields , just create a follow-on infobox after the template -LRB- using the coding method as shown above -RRB- .
Notice that the title `` I am ... '' will not be centered , unless the 2 columns are spanned -LRB- by using the column prefix '' colspan = 2 align = center '' enclosed in vertical-bars -RRB- .
Colors could also be tan -LRB- # DDAA22 -RRB- .
However , there are other issues to consider :
Rather than fear the coding of infobox details , more writers should learn how infoboxes are coded , to more easily expand , or correct , the details of various infoboxes .
Colors could also be ochre -LRB- # DDDD11 -RRB- .
The width can be set , width = 200px .
However , do n't overuse infoboxes , when the details are better explained outside the infobox , in the article text .
General reminders :
However , when first creating a new infobox , it might be preferable to keep the infobox as hard-coded within the same article , to allow changing the infobox along with the article text for quick edit-preview .
For any item too wide , or too wordy , to fit in a standard infobox , just place '' -LRB- see notebox below -RRB- '' as the connection to the custom-coded notebox infobox .
Colors could also be brown -LRB- # DD7722 -RRB- .
Also , the structure of an infobox has implications , outside the English Wikipedia , for the other-language Wikipedias .
It is not necessary to code every infobox into a separate template page , outside the article .

Paul ErdÅ ` s has an ErdÅ ` s number of zero .
Also , Michael Barr suggests `` rational ErdÅ ` s numbers '' , generalizing the idea that a person who has written p joint papers with ErdÅ ` s should be assigned ErdÅ ` s number 1\/p .
ErdÅ ` s numbers have been a part of the folklore of mathematicians throughout the world for many years . Amongst all working mathematicians at the turn of the millennium who have a finite ErdÅ ` s number , the numbers range up to 15 , the median is 5 , and the mean ErdÅ ` s number is 4.65 ; almost everyone with a finite ErdÅ ` s number has a number less than 8 .

The system comprises 14 state-owned schools , all of which are NCAA Division II members by virtue of being members of the Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference .
Act 188 , which was signed into law on November 12 , 1982 and came into effect on July 1 , 1983 , established the Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education , and converted those state colleges into universities .
The Office of the Chancellor is situated in the capital city of Harrisburg at the Dixon University Center .
PASSHE universities also operate four branch campuses .
Its passage created 12 normal school districts in the state in which to establish private corporations answerable to the State Superintendent of Common Schools .
It is the tenth-largest university system in the United States and 43rd largest in the world .
The normal schools evolved from state normal schools , to state teacher 's colleges , to state colleges .
Afterward , the School Code of 1911 mandated that the Commonwealth purchase all the normal schools .
The Pennsylvania State System of Higher Education -LRB- PASSHE -RRB- is the largest provider of higher education in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and a large public university system in the United States .
The Normal School Act of 1857 was passed on the last day of session on 20 May 1857 .
Though geographers are historically known as people who make maps , map making is actually the field of study of cartography , a subset of geography .
Geographers study not only the physical details of the environment but also its effects on human and wildlife ecologies , weather and climate patterns , economics , and culture .
A geographer is a scientist whose area of study is geography , the study of Earth 's physical environment and human habitat .

Mario Kart : Super Circuit , known in Japan as Mario Kart Advance , is a racing game developed and published by Nintendo for the Game Boy Advance in 2001 .
All three parks had the intended effect of spurring residential development near them .
Shawnee Park is a municipal park in Louisville , Kentucky .
The one-way distance between the Belvedere and Shawnee Park is 6.2 m.
Louisville 's Riverwalk Trail , which passes through Shawnee Park , extends across Louisville 's waterfront , which is an extensive , mostly flat pedestrian pathway .
The Great Lawn , the principal feature of the park , is enclosed by plantings and a circular drive that is lined with trees .
All three were located on the geographic edges of the city , in Shawnee 's case it was the western edge bordering the Ohio River .
Dozens of subdivisions were built near Shawnee Park , and the neighborhood itself came to be called Shawnee .
River Park Drive was paved in 1899 , but the Broadway entrance remained unfinished until 1914 .
The land at the time was still mostly used for truck farms , but it was clear residential development was imminent even without the park .
The interest was so great that developers found themselves advertising the parks rather than their own developments , as the highest prices would exist for the park perceived to be best .
The only sizable park blacks were allowed access to was nearby Chickasaw Park , which many people entered by traveling through Shawnee .
It was designed by Frederick Law Olmsted , who designed 18 of the city 's 123 public parks .
The city had to condemn the properties to acquire the land for park , and won its case in 1895 .
In 1896 , the city began to create access to the park , another area in which Shawnee was lagging behind the other two parks .
Shawnee was the slowest of the parks to develop , as much of the land was already owned by investors who figured they could increase the sale price by holding out .
Although now overshadowed by the Louisville Waterfront Park , Shawnee boasts an expansive Great Lawn which is very useful for formal gatherings .
Shawnee Park was proposed in 1890 to be one of the three flagship parks in Louisville 's new park system .
The Olmsted firm initially advised the city not to build a golf course at Shawnee Park due to the `` grave danger to visitors in the park and especially the children '' but demand was such that the course was built anyway in 1927 .
Shawnee Park was legally restricted to whites from 1924 to 1954 , although park officials and police had a de facto policy of denying blacks access to the park for some years prior to that .
Along with the rest of the city 's Olmsted-designed park system , Shawnee Park was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1982 .

These results were published on February 1 , 2004 , by a team composed of Russian scientists at Dubna -LRB- Joint Institute for Nuclear Research -RRB- , and American scientists at the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory .
Ununtrium is the temporary name of a synthetic element with the temporary symbol Uut and atomic number 113 .
The Roman Senate was a political institution in ancient Rome .
It was one of the most enduring institutions in Roman history , being founded in the first days of the city -LRB- traditionally founded in 753 BC -RRB- .
The senate passed decrees called senatus consulta , which in form constituted `` advice '' from the senate to a magistrate .
As the Roman Empire grew , the senate also supervised the administration of the provinces , which were governed by former consuls and praetors , in that it decided which magistrate should govern which province .
While these advices did not hold legal force , they usually were obeyed in practice .
It survived the overthrow of the kings in 509 BC , the fall of the Roman Republic in the 1st century BC , the split of the Roman Empire in 395 AD , and the fall of the Western Roman Empire in 476 AD .
This was especially the case with regards to its management of state finances , as only it could authorize the disbursal of public fund from the treasury .
The senate also had an enormous degree of power over the civil government in Rome .
As of 2004 , the population recorded by the U.S. Census Bureau was 1,511 .
Palm Beach Shores is a town in Palm Beach County , Florida , United States .
Many children with Spinal Muscular Atrophy develop pectus excavatum due to the diaphragmatic breathing that is common with the disease . Because the heart is located behind the sternum , and because individuals with pectus excavatum have been shown to have visible deformities of the heart -LRB- seen both on radiological imaging and after autopsies -RRB- , it has been hypothesized that there is impairment of function of the cardiovascular system in individuals with pectus excavatum .
Pectus excavatum is sometimes referred to as cobbler 's chest , sunken chest , funnel chest or simply a dent in the chest .
Their melting and boiling points are generally lower than those of the transition metals and their electronegativity higher , and they are also softer .

He later married Alexandra Freifrau von Berlichingen .
His wife , Christiane Herzog , died on 19 June 2000 .

For his paper Die Wesensmerkmale der Staatsorganisation in rechtlicher und entwicklungsgeschichtlicher Sicht -LRB- `` Characteristics of State Organization from a Juristic and Developmental-Historical Viewpoint '' -RRB- , in 1964 he was awarded the title of professor , a title of academic distinction in Germany , and taught at the University of Munich until 1966 .
He studied law in Munich and took his first juristic state exam in 1957 .

In cryptography , Twofish is a symmetric key block cipher with a block size of 128 bits and key sizes up to 256 bits .
However , Twofish has seen less widespread usage than Blowfish , which has been available for a longer period of time .
Twofish 's distinctive features are the use of pre-computed key-dependent S-boxes , and a relatively complex key schedule .
Bruce Schneier responds in a 2005 blog entry that this paper does not present a full cryptanalytic attack , but only some hypothesized differential characteristics : `` But even from a theoretical perspective , Twofish is n't even remotely broken .
As a result , the Twofish algorithm is free for anyone to use without any restrictions whatsoever .
The Twofish cipher has not been patented and the reference implementation has been placed in the public domain .
As of 2010 , the best published cryptanalysis on the Twofish block cipher is a truncated differential cryptanalysis of the full 16-round version .
Twofish borrows some elements from other designs ; for example , the pseudo-Hadamard transform -LRB- PHT -RRB- from the SAFER family of ciphers .
One half of an n-bit key is used as the actual encryption key and the other half of the n-bit key is used to modify the encryption algorithm -LRB- key-dependent S-boxes -RRB- .
The paper claims that the probability of truncated differentials is 2-57 .3 per block and that it will take roughly 251 chosen plaintexts -LRB- 32 petabytes worth of data -RRB- to find a good pair of truncated differentials .
There have been no extensions to these results since they were published in 2000 . ''
Twofish uses the same Feistel structure as DES .
On most software platforms Twofish is slightly slower than Rijndael -LRB- the chosen algorithm for Advanced Encryption Standard -RRB- for 128-bit keys , but somewhat faster for 256-bit keys .
Twofish was designed by Bruce Schneier , John Kelsey , Doug Whiting , David Wagner , Chris Hall , and Niels Ferguson ; the `` extended Twofish team '' who met to perform further cryptanalysis of Twofish and other AES contest entrants included Stefan Lucks , Tadayoshi Kohno , and Mike Stay .
Villarosa is a town and comune in the province of Enna , in the region of Sicily in southern Italy .
Iron oxides are chemical compounds composed of iron and oxygen .
Altogether , there are sixteen known iron oxides and oxyhydroxides .

Dogri speakers are called Dogras , and the Dogri-speaking region is called Duggar .

Although it is still published under the byline `` Anonymous '' , press interviews and copyright records suggest that it is largely or wholly the work of its purported editor , Beatrice Sparks .
The diarist 's name is never given in the book .
The book purports to be the actual diary of an anonymous teenage girl who became addicted to drugs , and is presented as a testimony against drug use .
The story caused a sensation when published and remains in print as of 2011 .
Some of the days and dates referenced in the book put the timeline from 1968 until 1970 .

Go Ask Alice is a controversial 1971 book about the life of a troubled teenage girl .
The title is from the lyrics to the Jefferson Airplane song `` White Rabbit '' .
Revelations about the book 's origin have caused much doubt as to its authenticity and factual accounts , and the publishers have listed it as a work of fiction since at least the mid-late 1980s .
A constituency is all the constituents of a particular agent or representative .
Depending on the context , another closely-related meaning of constituent is that of a citizen residing in the area governed , represented , or otherwise served by a politician ; sometimes this is restricted to citizens who elected the politician .
All the constituents who are registered to vote are referred to as the electorate .
It became the 32th largest Wikipedia by size .
Rules in Bulgarian Wikipedia are not regarded as flexible in disputes as they are on the English project .
The Bulgarian Wikipedia was created on 6 December 2003 .
In 24 May 2010 , the distinctive Wikipedia globe logo for the Bulgarian Wikipedia was temporarily altered to include the number 100,000 to commemorate the 100,000 article milestone .
As of December 26 , 2007 it is the 30th largest Wikipedia by article count , with over 50,000 articles .
Difficult issues are resolved through the Arbitration Committee , which handles content disputes , blocks users or prohibit certain users from editing articles on certain topics .
On November 24 , 2005 , the Bulgarian language Wikipedia added its 20,000 th article , and was the 21st largest Wikipedia at the time .
Misuse of administrator privileges is typically appealed through the Arbitration Committee ; only this authority and Wikimedia stewards have the power to remove administrator flags .
On 24 May 2010 , it became the 32nd largest Wikipedia by size and it passed the 100,000 articles threshold .

The volcanic island of Saint Lucia is more mountainous than many other Caribbean islands , with the highest point being Mount Gimie , at 950 m above sea level .
Saint Lucia is also one of the few islands in the world that boasts a drive-in volcano .
Two other mountains , the Pitons , form the island 's most famous landmark .
The capital city of Saint Lucia is Castries , where about one third of the population lives .

Sequential hermaphrodites may produce both types of gametes over the course of their lifetime , but at any given point they are either female or male .
In many wrasses the opposite is trueâ '' most fish are initially female and become male when they reach a certain size .
In some ferns the default sex is hermaphrodite , but ferns which grow in soil that has previously supported hermaphrodites are influenced by residual hormones to instead develop as male .
In some turtles , for example , males are produced at lower incubation temperatures than females ; this difference in critical temperatures can be as little as 1 â `` 2 Â C.
Many insects use a sex determination system based on the number of sex chromosomes .
In genetic sex determination systems , an organism 's sex is determined by the genome it inherits .
The default sex , in the absence of a Y chromosome , is female .
Genetic sex determination usually depends on asymmetrically inherited sex chromosomes which carry genetic features that influence development ; sex may be determined either by the presence of a sex chromosome or by how many the organism has .
Some bacteria use conjugation to transfer genetic material between cells ; while not the same as sexual reproduction , this also results in the mixture of genetic traits .
In addition to animals , plants , and fungi , other eukaryotes -LRB- e.g. the malaria parasite -RRB- also engage in sexual reproduction .
Many fish change sex over the course of their lifespan , a phenomenon called sequential hermaphroditism .
Sexual reproduction is a process specific to eukaryotes , organisms whose cells contain a nucleus and mitochondria .
In clownfish , smaller fish are male , and the dominant and largest fish in a group becomes female .
For many species sex is not determined by inherited traits , but instead by environmental factors experienced during development or later in life .
Many reptiles have temperature-dependent sex determination : the temperature embryos experience during their development determines the sex of the organism .
The Hong Kong government supports cultural institutions such as the Hong Kong Heritage Museum , the Hong Kong Museum of Art , the Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts , and the Hong Kong Philharmonic Orchestra .
Five is the third prime number .
Five is a congruent number . Five is conjectured to be the only odd untouchable number and if this is the case then five will be the only odd prime number that is not the base of an aliquot tree .

Uwe Reinders -LRB- born 19 January 1955 in Essen -RRB- is a former German football -LRB- soccer -RRB- player and manager .
He holds the records for both the first and second longest unbeaten streaks in competitive chess history .
Many authorities consider him to have been the greatest attacking Grandmaster of all time .
Tal won a very strong tournament at ZÃ 1\/4 rich , 1959 . Following the Interzonal , the top players carried on to the Candidates ' Tournament , Yugoslavia 1959 .
Tal 's victory was attributed to his dominance over the lower half of the field ; whilst scoring only one win and three losses versus Keres , he won all four individual games against Fischer , and took 3 Â 1\/2 points out of 4 from each of GligoriÄ , Olafsson , and Benko .
In 1960 , at the age of 23 , Tal thoroughly defeated the relatively staid and strategic Mikhail Botvinnik in a World Championship match , held in Moscow , by 12 Â 1\/2 â `` 8 Â 1\/2 -LRB- six wins , two losses , and thirteen draws -RRB- , making him the youngest-ever world champion -LRB- a record later broken by Garry Kasparov , who earned the title at 22 -RRB- .
Between October 23 , 1973 and October 16 , 1974 , he played 95 consecutive games without a loss -LRB- 46 wins and 49 draws -RRB- , shattering his previous record .
Mikhail Tal -LRB- ; , Michail Nechem ` eviÄ Tal , ; sometimes transliterated Mihails Tals or Mihail Tal ; November 9 , 1936 -- June 28 , 1992 -RRB- was a Soviet -- Latvian chess player , a Grandmaster , and the eighth World Chess Champion .
Botvinnik , who had never faced Tal before the title match began , won the return match against Tal in 1961 , also held in Moscow , by 13 â `` 8 -LRB- ten wins to five , with six draws -RRB- .
Tal showed superior form by winning with 20\/28 points , ahead of Paul Keres with 18 Â 1\/2 , followed by Tigran Petrosian , Vasily Smyslov , Bobby Fischer , Svetozar GligoriÄ , FriÃ rik Ã `` lafsson , and Pal Benko .
In 1962 at CuraÃ ao , he had serious health problems , having undergone a major operation shortly before the tournament , and had to withdraw three-quarters of the way through , scoring just seven points -LRB- +3 -10 = 8 -RRB- from 21 games .
His short reign atop the chess world made him one of the two so-called `` winter kings '' who interrupted Botvinnik 's long reign from 1948 to 1963 -LRB- the other was Smyslov , world champion 1957 â `` 1958 -RRB- .
From July 1972 to April 1973 , Tal played a record 86 consecutive games without a loss -LRB- 47 wins and 39 draws -RRB- .
Tal played in a total of six Candidates ' Tournaments and match cycles , though he never again earned the right to play for the world title .
In the period between the matches Botvinnik had thoroughly analyzed Tal 's style , and turned most of the return match 's games into slow wars of maneuver or endgames , rather than the complicated tactical melees which were Tal 's happy hunting ground .
The Mikhail Tal Memorial is held in Moscow each year since 2006 to honor his memory .
These are the two longest unbeaten streaks in modern chess history .

The Compton effect was observed by Arthur Holly Compton in 1923 at Washington University in St. Louis and further verified by his graduate student Y. H. Woo in the years following . Compton earned the 1927 Nobel Prize in Physics for the discovery .
In physics , Compton scattering is a type of scattering that X-rays and gamma rays undergo in matter .
Compton scattering is an important effect in gamma spectroscopy which gives rise to the Compton edge , as it is possible for the gamma rays to scatter out of the detectors used .
The inelastic scattering of photons in matter results in a decrease in energy -LRB- increase in wavelength -RRB- of an X-ray or gamma ray photon , called the Compton effect .

It was installed in the mid-1930s by inventor Alonzo Billups over growing concern due to numerous train versus motor vehicle accidents at the crossing .

The Secretary of War was a member of the United States President 's Cabinet , beginning with George Washington 's administration .
At first , he was responsible for all military affairs .
In 1798 , the Secretary of the Navy was added to the cabinet , and the scope of this office was reduced to a general concern with the Army .
A similar position , called either `` Secretary at War '' or `` Secretary of War , '' was appointed to serve the Congress of the Confederation under the Articles of Confederation between 1781 and 1789 .
When Washington was inaugurated as the first president under the Constitution , he appointed Knox to continue serving .
In 1947 , the departments were recombined under the Secretary of Defense .
The Secretary of War led the War Department .
The Secretary of War was replaced by the Secretary of the Army and the Secretary of the Air Force , which , along with the Secretary of the Navy , are now non-Cabinet positions under the Secretary of Defense .
It lies on the river Aude about 30 k due south of Carcassonne .
Alfred Waterhouse -LRB- 19 July 1830 â `` 22 August 1905 -RRB- was a British architect , particularly associated with the Victorian Gothic Revival architecture .
Though expert within Neo-Gothic , Renaissance revival , and Romanesque revival styles , Waterhouse never limited himself to a single architectural style .
Financially speaking , Waterhouse was probably the most successful of all Victorian architects .
He is perhaps best known for his design for the Natural History Museum in London , and Manchester Town Hall , although he also built a wide variety of other buildings throughout the country .
During the 1970s and 80s , he was also a Visiting Professor at the California Institute of Technology , the University of Wisconsinâ `` Milwaukee and the University of California , Berkeley .
He was director at the Fritz Haber Institute of the MPG from 1986 till his retirement in 2004 .
In 1986 he became professor at the Free University of Berlin and at the Technical University of Berlin .
Ertl was born in Stuttgart , Germany where he would later study physics from 1955 to 1957 at the Technical University of Stuttgart and then at the University of Paris -LRB- 1957 â `` 1958 -RRB- and Ludwig Maximilians University in Munich -LRB- 1958 â `` 1959 -RRB- .
He always used new observation techniques like low-energy electron diffraction -LRB- LEED -RRB- at the beginning of his career , later ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopy -LRB- UPS -RRB- and scanning tunneling microscope -LRB- STM -RRB- yielding ground breaking results .
Ertl and his wife Barbara have two children and several grandchildren .
His hobbies include playing the piano and also playing with his cats when he is not doing experiments .
Then , he became a Professor at Institute for Physical Chemistry , Ludwig Maximilians University of Munich -LRB- 1973 â `` 1986 -RRB- .
After completing his PhD , he became an assistant and lecturer at Technical University of Munich -LRB- 1965 â `` 1968 -RRB- .
From 1968 to 1973 , he was Professor and Director at Technical University of Hannover .

Most other uses such as for table ware , sanitary piping , or building decoration in freezing environments require that the material be glazed .
The term is also used to refer to items made out of this material and to its natural , brownish orange color , which varies considerably .
Other colors include yellow , gray , and pink .
The fired material is weak compared to stoneware .
Some types of terracotta are created from clay that includes recycled terracotta -LRB- `` grog '' -RRB- .
After pit firing the hot ware is covered with sand to cool , and after kiln firing the kiln is slowly cooled .
After further thorough drying it is placed in a kiln , or atop combustible material in a pit , and then fired .
An appropriate refined clay is partially dried and cast , molded , or hand worked into the desired shape .
Terracotta , if uncracked , will ring if lightly struck , but not as brightly as will ware fired at higher temperature , which is called stoneware .
Its uses include vessels , water and waste water pipes and surface embellishment in building construction , along with sculpture such as the Terracotta Army and Greek terracotta figurines .
The unglazed color after firing can vary widely , but most common clays contain enough iron to cause an orange , orangish red , or brownish orange color , with this range including various colors described as `` terracotta '' .
When unglazed , the material will not be waterproof , but it is suitable for in-ground use to carry pressurized water -LRB- an archaic use -RRB- , for garden ware or building decoration in tropical environments , and for oil containers , oil lamps , or ovens .

Kyneton is a town on the Calder Highway in the Macedon Ranges of Victoria , Australia .
In 2009 the Kyneton District Racing Club partnered with the Northern Melbourne Institute of TAFE to use the facilities of the racecourse and its extensive grounds as an educational training facility .
Kyneton hosts several events during the year including the ANZAC Day parade , Kyneton Jazz Festival , Kyneton Daffodil Festival , Kyneton Agricultural show and the Kyneton Cup .

The Kyneton Courthouse tried Ned Kelly in 1870 for robbery under arms .
Kyneton 's main locally produced newspaper is the Midland Express , which also serves Castlemaine .
Unlike a majority of towns in the area , Kyneton predates the Victorian gold rushes , having being established in 1850 , whereas the gold rushes started the year after .
Kyneton is home to mineral springs , the Campaspe River , botanical gardens and historic houses , many with bluestone architecture .
Golfers play at the course of the Kyneton Golf Club on Black Hill Road .
The town has an Australian rules football team competing in the Bendigo Football League .

A quiz is a form of game or mind sport in which the players -LRB- as individuals or in teams -RRB- attempt to answer questions correctly .
In some countries , a quiz is also a brief assessment used in education and similar fields to measure growth in knowledge , abilities , and\/or skills .
Quizzes are usually scored in points and many quizzes are designed to determine a winner from a group of participants - usually the participant with the highest score .

The Reserve Officers ' Training Corps -LRB- ROTC -RRB- is a college-based , officer commissioning program , predominantly in the United States .
It is designed as a college elective that focuses on leadership development , problem solving , strategic planning , and professional ethics .
The Republic of the Philippines established its program in 1912 , with the creation of the first unit at the University of the Philippines during American colonial rule .
The U.S. Armed Forces and a number of other national militaries , particularly those countries with strong historical ties to the United States , have ROTC programs .

Online journals that publish haiku poetry exclusively -LRB- see the list in Haiku in English -RRB- and haiku sites owned by various haiku writers can be found online , as well as scores of pseudo-haiku .
Some groups , such as the Haiku International Association , try to promote exchanges between Japanese and foreign haiku poets .
In Japanese , haiku are traditionally printed in a single vertical line and tend to take aspects of the natural world as their subject matter , while haiku in English often appear in three lines to parallel the three phrases of Japanese haiku and may deal with any subject matter . Previously called hokku , haiku was given its current name by the Japanese writer Masaoka Shiki at the end of the 19th century .

Nigel Ernest James Mansell OBE -LRB- born 8 August 1953 in Upton-upon-Severn , Worcestershire , England -RRB- is a British racing driver who won both the Formula One World Championship -LRB- 1992 -RRB- and the CART Indy Car World Series -LRB- 1993 -RRB- .
Mansell remains the most successful British Formula One driver of all time in terms of race wins with 31 victories , and is fourth overall on the Formula One race winners list behind Michael Schumacher , Alain Prost , and Ayrton Senna .
Mansell raced in the GP Masters series and signed a one-off race deal for the Scuderia Ecosse GT race team to drive their number 63 Ferrari F430 GT2 car at Silverstone on 6 May 2007 .
Mansell was the reigning F1 champion when he moved over to CART , being the first person to win the CART title in his debut season , making him the only person to hold both titles simultaneously .
He was rated in the top 10 Formula One drivers of all time by longtime Formula One commentator Murray Walker .
His career in Formula One spanned 15 seasons , with his final two full seasons of top-level racing being spent in the CART series .

The aim of Royal Canadian Air Cadets is to : develop in youth the attributes of good citizenship and leadership ; promote physical fitness ; and stimulate the interest of youth in the sea , land , and air activities of the Canadian Forces .

The Flame Nebula is part of the Orion Molecular Cloud Complex , a star-forming region that includes the famous Horsehead Nebula .
It is about 900 to 1,500 light-years away .
The Flame Nebula , designated as NGC 2024 and Sh2-277 , is an emission nebula in the constellation Orion .
The bright star Alnitak -LRB- Î Ori -RRB- , the easternmost star in the Belt of Orion , shines energetic ultraviolet light into the Flame and this knocks electrons away from the great clouds of hydrogen gas that reside there .

In 1940 the Manchukuo yuan was being used to measure Manchukuo exports and imports to countries that included America , Germany and Japan .

Warm fronts lie within broader troughs of low pressure than cold fronts , and move more slowly than the cold fronts which usually follow because cold air is denser and harder to remove from the Earth 's surface . This also forces temperature differences across warm fronts to be broader in scale .
Air masses are large bodies of air with similar properties of temperature and humidity that form over source regions , and the warm air masses behind warm fronts are not only warmer but higher in humidity than the colder air preceding them . Because of a warm air massâ s higher temperature and thus lesser density , mixing between the two air masses is unlikely .

It was discovered on 7 August 1915 by the Soviet astronomer Grigory Nikolaevich Neujmin at Simeis , Ukraine .
916 America is a minor planet orbiting the Sun in the main belt between Mars and Jupiter .
Observations by the Infrared Astronomical Satellite have since shown that it has a diameter of 33.2 Â 1.3 km , with an absolute magnitude of 11.20 and an albedo of 0.053 Â 0.004 .
In 1986 , assuming that the asteroid was of S-type and that it had a diameter of 15 km , the rotational period was measured to be 38 hours .
Originally designated 916 Î # I , it was renamed ' 916 America ' on 24 February 1923 after the Council of Astronomers at Pulkovo Observatory decided to commemorate `` the friendly relations of the astronomical observatories and astronomers '' .
Another possible reason for the name was as a mark of appreciation for the help given during the famine in Crimea by the American Relief Administration under President Herbert Hoover .
A head coach , senior coach or manager is a professional at training and developing athletes .
In some sports such as soccer and baseball , the head coach is usually called a manager , whilst in other sports such as Australian rules football they are generally termed a senior coach .
Other coaches are usually subordinate to the head coach , often in offensive positions or defensive positions , and occasionally proceeding down into individualized position coaches .
They typically hold a more public profile and are paid more than other coaches .

The scientific name Fringillidae comes from the Latin word fringilla for the Chaffinch -LRB- Fringilla coelebs -RRB- -- a member of that last subfamily -- which is common in Europe .
The true finches are passerine birds in the family Fringillidae . They are predominantly seed-eating songbirds .
Many birds in other families are also commonly called `` finches '' , including some species in the very similar-looking waxbills or estrildid finches -LRB- family Passeridae , subfamily Estrildinae -RRB- of the Old World tropics and Australia ; several groups of the bunting and American sparrow family -LRB- Emberizidae -RRB- ; and Darwin 's finches of the Galapagos islands , which provided evidence of natural selection and are now recognized to be peculiar tanagers -LRB- Thraupidae -RRB- .
Some species are being imported or smuggled into other countries and sold as exotic pets .
The University of Texas at Arlington -LRB- also referred to as UT Arlington or UTA -RRB- is a public research university located in Arlington , Texas , United States .
The university was founded in 1895 and was primarily a military academy during the early 1900s .

The discovery of S. sikkanniensis in British Columbia in the 1990s made S. popularis the smaller of the Shonisaurus species .
Fossils of Shonisaurus were first found in a large deposit in Nevada in 1920 .
The better known S. popularis species was around 15 m long , but a more recently discovered species , S. sikkanniensis , was longer still , at 21 m.
All of these features suggest that Shonisaurus may be a relatively specialised offshoot of the main ichthyosaur evolutionary line .
It had a large whale-like body , a long dolphin-like snout , and its flippers were much longer , and narrower than in other ichthyosaurs .
These were named Shonisaurus , which means `` Lizard from the Shoshone Mountains '' , after the formation where the fossils were found .
An ichthyosaur found in the Himalayan mountains called Himalayasaurus , may be the same animal as Shonisaurus .
Excavations , begun in 1954 under the direction of Dr. Charles Camp and Dr. Samuel Welles of the University of California , Berkeley , were continued by Camp throughout the 60s .
Shonisaurus had a long pointed mouth that contained teeth only at the front end .
Thirty years later , they were excavated , uncovering the remains of 37 very large ichthyosaurs .
The Nevada fossil sites can currently be viewed at the Berlin-Ichthyosaur State Park .
The first species discovered , S. popularis , was adopted as the state fossil of Nevada in 1984 .

Versions are used by several NATO countries , including Spain , Italy , and the United States .
While manufacture of new Harriers concluded in 1997 , the last remanufactured aircraft -LRB- Harrier II Plus configuration -RRB- was delivered in December 2003 which ended the Harrier production line .

The BAE Systems\/Boeing Harrier II is a modified version of the AV-8B Harrier II that was used by the Royal Air Force -LRB- RAF -RRB- and the Royal Navy until 2010 .
Between 1969 and 2003 , 824 Harrier variants were delivered .

Aberdeen Football Club -LRB- also known as The Dons , The Dandies or The Reds -RRB- are a Scottish professional football club based in Aberdeen .
Aberdeen have played throughout their existence at Pittodrie Stadium , the name of which comes from the Pictish for `` place of manure '' .
Aberdeen inaugurated the Hall of Fame as part of the club 's centenary celebrations in 2003 .
This is a modern , twoâ `` tier design , completed in 1993 , containing hospitality suites which is significantly taller than the other structures at the ground .
This ball was crosshatched in such a way as to depict it as being inside the net , signifying the scoring of a goal .

Aberdeen were the last club outside of the Old Firm to win a league title , in 1984\/85 , and also the last Scottish team to win a European Championship .

The Victorian road network services the population centres , with highways generally radiating from Melbourne and other major cities and rural centres with secondary roads interconnecting the highways to each other .

Victoria is the home of Australian rules football , with ten of the seventeen clubs of the Australian Football League based in Victoria , and the traditional Grand Final held at the Melbourne Cricket Ground usually on the last Saturday in September .
Victoria has the highest population density in any state in Australia , with population centres spread out over most of the state ; only the far northwest and the Victorian Alps lack permanent settlement .
Additional seaports are at Westernport , Geelong , and Portland .
Victoria is represented in the National Rugby League by the Melbourne Storm and in Super Rugby by the Melbourne Rebels .

When the tax is levied on the income of companies , it is often called a corporate tax , corporate income tax , or corporation tax .
A property tax is a tax put on property by reason of its ownership .
An ad valorem tax is one where the tax base is the value of a good , service , or property . Sales taxes , tariffs , property taxes , inheritance taxes , and value added taxes are different types of ad valorem tax .
If input tax is greater than output tax the company can claim back money from the Local Tax Authority .
An ad valorem tax is typically imposed at the time of a transaction -LRB- sales tax or value added tax -LRB- VAT -RRB- -RRB- but it may be imposed on an annual basis -LRB- property tax -RRB- or in connection with another significant event -LRB- inheritance tax or tariffs -RRB- .

S\/2004 S 13 is a natural satellite of Saturn .
Its discovery was announced by Scott S. Sheppard , David C. Jewitt , Jan Kleyna , and Brian G. Marsden on May 4 , 2005 from observations taken between December 12 , 2004 and March 9 , 2005 .
S\/2004 S 13 is about 6 kilometres in diameter , and orbits Saturn at an average distance of 18,056 Mm in 905.848 days , at an inclination of 167 Â to the ecliptic -LRB- 143 Â to Saturn 's equator -RRB- , in a retrograde direction and with an eccentricity of 0.261 .

The Japanese and Chinese traditions in particular include hundreds of types of joints , many of which do not use glue or nails .
For example , the joinery used to build a house is different from that used to make puzzle toys , although some concepts overlap .
Many traditional wood joinery techniques use the distinctive material properties of wood , often without resorting to mechanical fasteners or adhesives .
While every culture in which pieces of wood are joined together to make furniture or structures has a joinery tradition , wood joinery techniques have been especially well documented and celebrated in the Chinese , European , and Japanese traditions .
Wood is stronger when stressed along the grain -LRB- longitudinally -RRB- than it is when stressed across the grain -LRB- radially and tangentially -RRB- .
Many wood joinery techniques either depend upon or compensate for the fact that wood is anisotropic : its material properties are different along different dimensions .

It had large , robust teeth that were built for crushing , and its back was covered with thick semispherical osteoderms .
Deinosuchus was probably capable of killing and eating large dinosaurs .
Deinosuchus fossils have been found in ten U.S. states , as well as northern Mexico .
Deinosuchus reached its largest size in its western habitat , but the eastern populations were far more abundant .
Opinion remains divided as to whether these two populations represent separate species .
One study indicates that Deinosuchus may have lived for up to 50 years , growing at a similar rate to that of modern crocodilians , but maintaining this growth over a much longer period of time .
Although Deinosuchus was far larger than any modern crocodile or alligatorâ '' measuring up to 12 m and weighing up to 8.5 Mâ '' its overall appearance was fairly similar to its smaller relatives .
It lived on both sides of the Western Interior Seaway , and was an opportunistic apex predator in the coastal regions of eastern North America .

Arsenic trioxide is the inorganic compound with the formula As2O3 .
Arsenic trioxide can be generated via many routine processing of arsenic compounds including the oxidation -LRB- combustion -RRB- of arsenic and arsenic-containing minerals in air .
Arsenic trioxide is the inorganic compound with the formula As2O3 . This commercially important oxide of arsenic is the main precursor to other arsenic compounds , including organoarsenic compounds .
It is less soluble in acids , although it will dissolve in hydrochloric acid , giving chloro compounds , ultimately arsenic trichloride with concentrated acid .
Only with strong oxidizing agents such as ozone , hydrogen peroxide , and nitric acid does it give arsenic pentoxide , As2O5 .

Following the news of his death , Scott became an iconic British hero , a status maintained for more than 50 years and reflected by the many permanent memorials erected across the nation .
From a previously unassailable position , Scott became a figure of controversy , with questions raised about his competence and character .
However , having taken this step , his name became inseparably associated with the Antarctic , the field of work to which he remained committed during the final twelve years of his life .
During this second venture , Scott led a party of five which reached the South Pole on 17 January 1912 , only to find that they had been preceded by Roald Amundsen 's Norwegian expedition .
In the closing decades of the 20th century , the legend was reassessed as attention focused on the causes of the disaster that ended his and his comrades ' lives , and the extent of Scott 's personal culpability .
Captain Robert Falcon Scott CVO -LRB- 6 June 1868 â `` 29 March 1912 -RRB- was a Royal Navy officer and explorer who led two expeditions to the Antarctic regions : the Discovery Expedition , 1901 -- 04 , and the ill-fated Terra Nova Expedition , 1910 -- 13 .
On their return journey , Scott and his four comrades all perished from a combination of exhaustion , starvation and extreme cold .
It was the chance for personal distinction that led Scott to apply for the Discovery command , rather than any predilection for polar exploration .
Before his appointment to lead the Discovery Expedition , Scott had followed the conventional career of a naval officer in peacetime Victorian Britain , where opportunities for career advancement were both limited and keenly sought after by ambitious officers .

The musical film was a natural development of the stage musical .
Musical films characteristically contain elements reminiscent of theater ; performers often treat their song and dance numbers as if there is a live audience watching .
Typically , the biggest difference between film and stage musicals is the use of lavish background scenery which would be impractical in a theater .
The Handmaid 's Tale received the very first Arthur C. Clarke Award in 1987 .

No rational number is transcendental and all real transcendental numbers are irrational .
In mathematics , a transcendental number is a number -LRB- possibly a complex number -RRB- which is not algebraicâ '' that is , it is not a root of a non-constant polynomial equation with rational coefficients . The most prominent examples of transcendental numbers are Ï and e. Though only a few classes of transcendental numbers are known -LRB- in part , because it can be extremely difficult to show that a given number is transcendental -RRB- transcendental numbers are not rare : indeed , almost all real and complex numbers are transcendental , since the algebraic numbers are countable while the sets of real and complex numbers are uncountable .
However , some irrational numbers are not transcendental .

The American Civil Liberties Union -LRB- ACLU -RRB- consists of two separate non-profit organizations : the ACLU Foundation , a 501 -LRB- c -RRB- -LRB- 3 -RRB- organization which focuses on litigation and communication efforts , and the American Civil Liberties Union , a 501 -LRB- c -RRB- -LRB- 4 -RRB- organization which focuses on legislative lobbying . The ACLU 's stated mission is `` to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties guaranteed to every person in this country by the Constitution and laws of the United States . ''
Founded in 1920 by Crystal Eastman , Roger Baldwin and Walter Nelles , the ACLU was the successor organization to the earlier National Civil Liberties Bureau founded during World War I. The ACLU reported over 500,000 members in 2010 .

Cortina d'Ampezzo had been awarded the games in June 1939 , but due to World War II , the 1944 Winter Olympics were canceled in 1941 .
The anticipated 1944 Winter Olympics , which would have been officially known as the V Olympic Winter Games -LRB- due to the cancellation of 1940 's V Olympic Winter Games -RRB- , were to be celebrated in February 1944 in Cortina d'Ampezzo , Italy .
The V Olympic Winter Games eventually took place in St. Moritz , Switzerland , in 1948 ; Cortina d'Ampezzo hosted the 1956 Winter Olympics .

Of the total nuclear fuel used today , MOX provides 2 % .
MOX fuel , consisting of 7 % plutonium mixed with depleted uranium , is equivalent to uranium oxide fuel enriched to about 4.5 % , assuming that the plutonium has about 60 â `` 65 % .
Mixed oxide fuel , commonly referred to as MOX fuel , is nuclear fuel that contains more than one oxide of fissile material .
MOX fuel contains plutonium blended with natural uranium , reprocessed uranium , or depleted uranium . MOX fuel is an alternative to the low-enriched uranium -LRB- LEU -RRB- fuel used in the light water reactors that predominate nuclear power generation .
The International Agency for Research on Cancer -LRB- IARC -RRB- recognizes arsenic and arsenic compounds as group 1 carcinogens , and the EU lists arsenic trioxide , arsenic pentoxide and arsenate salts as category 1 carcinogens .
When heated in air , arsenic oxidizes to arsenic trioxide ; the fumes from this reaction have an odour resembling garlic .
The yellow form has a density of 1.97 g\/cm3 .
It is rapidly transformed into the gray arsenic by light .
Elemental arsenic and arsenic compounds are classified as `` toxic '' and `` dangerous for the environment '' in the European Union under directive 67\/548\/EEC .
Arsenic makes arsenic acid with concentrated nitric acid , arsenious acid with dilute nitric acid , and arsenic trioxide with concentrated sulfuric acid .
This unstable allotrope , being molecular , is the most volatile , least dense and most toxic .
The three most common allotropes are metallic gray , yellow and black arsenic .
Minerals with the formula MAsS and MAs2 -LRB- M = Fe , Ni , Co -RRB- are the dominant commercial sources of arsenic , together with realgar -LRB- an arsenic sulfide mineral -RRB- and native arsenic .
Meanwhile , arsenic poisoning as a result of the natural occurrence of arsenic compounds in drinking water remains a problem for many parts of the world including the United States .
Nuiqsut is a city in North Slope Borough , Alaska , United States .
William `` Bill '' Maher , Jr. -LRB- ; born January 20 , 1956 -RRB- is an American stand-up comedian , television host , political commentator , author and actor .
Before his current role as the host of HBO 's Real Time with Bill Maher , Maher hosted a similar late-night talk show called Politically Incorrect originally on Comedy Central and later on ABC .
Data storage equipment uses either :
Most electronically processed data storage media -LRB- including some forms of computer data storage -RRB- are considered permanent -LRB- non-volatile -RRB- storage , that is , the data will remain stored when power is removed from the device .
Nitromethane is generally added to the methanol to increase power and to make the engine easier to tune .
Glow fuel is a generic term used to describe a fuel source used in model engines -- generally the same or similar fuels can be used in model airplanes , helicopters , cars and boats .
Methanol is usually the primary ingredient , as it provides the bulk of the fuel and is also needed as a solvent for the other ingredients .
The oils included in glow fuel generally are not burned by the engine , and are expelled out the exhaust of the engine .
Other commonly used names are nitro or just model fuel .
Note that the nitro name is generally inaccurate , as nitromethane is usually not the primary ingredient , and in fact many glow fuels , especially the so-called `` FAI '' type , named for the FÃ dÃ ration AÃ ronautique Internationale , which requires such fuel in some forms of aeromodeling competition , contain no nitromethane at all .
A given amount of nitromethane contains less energy than the same amount of methanol , but it requires less oxygen to burn -LRB- approximately half -RRB- , so more of it can be put into an engine during each stroke and this leads to a higher power output .
Glow fuel can be burned by very simple two stroke engines or by more complicated four stroke engines and these engines can provide impressive amounts of power for their very small size .
Nitromethane is often difficult to obtain in many countries since it is known as an explosive , so in these countries glow fuel generally has no nitromethane at all .
Four stroke model engines , since they are generally designed to be simple powerplants while still incorporating the usual ccmshaft , rocker arms and poppet valves of larger sized four stroke engines , are generally meant to use glow ignition and their fuel .
For racing use , the nitromethane content can be increased well above 30 % with a corresponding increase in cost , but some methanol is still required as it 's needed to allow the glow plug to ignite the fuel in the first place , and as a solvent to allow the lubricants and nitromethane to mix , so the nitromethane content usually does n't go any higher than 65 % .
Its presence is also required for the glow plug generally found in model engines to burn via a catalytic reaction .
The most commonly used lubricants are castor oil and synthetic oils , and many glow fuels include a mixture of the two .
Glow fuel is generally a mixture of methanol , nitromethane and oil .
Curtains come in a variety of shapes , materials , sizes , colors and patterns , and they often have their own sections within department stores , while some shops are completely dedicated to selling curtains .

It was sometimes called `` Demeter '' from 1955 to 1975 .

Palla -LRB- Italian for ball -RRB- is a traditional Tuscan ball game played in towns between Siena and Grosseto .
The game is played by facing teams who strike -LRB- not catch -RRB- the ball with either a bare or gloved hand .
Pisa , Prato , Rome , Siena , and various Tuscan towns still have streets named via Pallacorda or via Della Corda .
Adjacent buildings , objects , and sometimes spectators , are considered `` in play . ''

Note that MediaWiki only parses the code when the category page is re-rendered .
When this template is placed on a category page it can count the number of items in the category -LRB- pages + images + subcategories -RRB- .
Then it can be set to automatically only report when the number of items is above some limit .
This template puts the pages into : Category : Wikipedia backlog , where any editor can see where work needs to be done .
Thus we often do n't want to know about a backlog until it has reached some size .
Usually this template is used without any parameters , then it is always visible until it is manually removed .
Often it is more efficient to handle several cases in a backlog at a time , since then we are up to speed with what needs to be done .
-LRB- We fed 0 here to make it show in this documentation , but in real usage it would show the value 10 . -RRB-
That is , when someone views the page and it is more than one week since it was last re-rendered .
This template automatically shows the appropriate style depending on what kind of page it is shown on .
It can be put at the top of pages and categories that have a backlog which require attention .
The style above is for `` other '' pages such as `` Wikipedia : '' pages , and the style shown in the examples below is for category pages .
The autoreport limit can be set to whatever value you prefer .
A backlog is a list of things that need to be done and that have not been done for some time .
This is the message box .
To get an immediate change you can purge the page , for instance by clicking the button in the template .
Thus it can take a week before this template changes when the number of items have changed .
-LRB- But if no one visits the page then it can take forever . -RRB-

Dextromethorphan -LRB- DXM or DM -RRB- is an antitussive -LRB- cough suppressant -RRB- drug .
Its mechanism of action is via multiple effects , including actions as a nonselective serotonin reuptake inhibitor and a sigma-1 receptor agonist and the action of its major metabolite dextrorphan as an NMDA receptor antagonist , producing effects similar to those of the controlled substances ketamine and phencyclidine -LRB- PCP -RRB- , as well as the active metabolite 3-methoxymorphinan which produces anesthetic effects in rats with a potency above dextrorphan but below dextromethorphan itself .
In its pure form , dextromethorphan occurs as a white powder .
Dextromethorphan has also found other uses in medicine , ranging from pain relief to psychological applications .

Reformism is the belief that gradual democratic changes in a society can ultimately change a society 's fundamental economic relations and political structures .
This belief grew out of opposition to revolutionary socialism , which contends that revolutions are necessary to fundamentally change a society .
