In December , 1997 Ignacio Ramonet , editor of Le Monde Diplomatique , renewed the debate around the Tobin tax with an editorial titled `` Disarming the markets '' .
According to the legislation , Belgium will introduce the Tobin tax once all countries of the eurozone introduce a similar law .
On June 15 , 2004 , the Commission of Finance and Budget in the Belgian Federal Parliament approved a bill implementing a Spahn tax .
However , there have also been initiatives of national dimension about the tax .
Ramonet proposed to create an association for the introduction of this tax , which was named ATTAC -LRB- Association for the Taxation of financial Transactions for the Aid of Citizens -RRB- .
A Tobin tax , suggested by Nobel Laureate economist James Tobin , was originally defined as a tax on all spot conversions of one currency into another . The tax is intended to put a penalty on short-term financial round-trip excursions into another currency .
It has been proposed that having the United Nations manage a Tobin tax would solve this problem and would give the UN a large source of funding independent from donations by participating states .
In that context , Tobin suggested a new system for international currency stability , and proposed that such a system include an international charge on foreign-exchange transactions .
Then , on August 15 , 1971 , United States President Richard Nixon announced that the United States dollar would no longer be convertible to gold , effectively ending the system .
It was originally assumed that the Tobin tax would require multilateral implementation , since one country acting alone would find it very difficult to implement this tax . Many people have therefore argued that it would be best implemented by an international institution .
The tax then became an issue of the global justice movement or alter-globalization movement and a matter of discussion not only in academic institutions but even in streets and in parliaments in the UK , France , and around the world .
When she has a second son , Connor , she opts to give up her job and become a stay-at-home mom , prompting John to take on a daily column for a pay increase .
At first stumped for material , John realizes the misadventures of Marley might be the perfect topic for his first piece .
Although she denies she is experiencing postpartum depression , Jenny exhibits all the symptoms , including a growing impatience with Marley and John , who asks Sebastian to care for the dog when Jenny insists they give him away . She quickly comes to realize he has become an indispensable part of the family and agrees he can stay .
Marley continues to wreak havoc on the household , providing John with a wealth of material for his column , which becomes a hit with readers and helps increase the newspaper 's circulation .

Jhelum and Ravi join Chenab , Beas joins Sutlej , and then Sutlej and Chenab join to form Panjnad 10 miles north of Uch Sharif in Bahawalpur district .
Panjnad River is formed by successive confluence of the five rivers of Punjab , namely Jhelum , Chenab , Ravi , Beas and Sutlej .
A dam on Panjnad has been erected ; it provides irrigation channels for Punjab and Sindh provinces south of the Sutlej and east of the Indus rivers .
Panjnad River -LRB- Urdu\/Punjabi Shahmukhi : Ù 3\/4 Ù Ø Ù Ø , Punjabi Gurmukhi à à à à à -RRB- -LRB- panj = five , nadi = river -RRB- is a river at the extreme end of Bahawalpur district in Punjab , Pakistan .
Beyond the confluence of Indus and Panjnad rivers , the Indus river was known as Satnad -LRB- Sat = seven -RRB- carrying the waters of seven rivers including Indus river , which is believed to be in ealrlier times the Saraswati\/Ghaggar\/Hakra river which eventually dried and became a seasonal river due to seismic shifts in the glacial region of Himachal Pradesh where it originated and later on Kabul river and the five rivers of Punjab .
The combined stream runs southwest for approximately 45 miles and joins Indus River at Mithankot .
The Indus continues into the Arabian Sea .

The Utman Khel or Utmankhel are a Pashtun tribe who occupy the hills to the north of Peshawar in the Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa province of Pakistan .
They claim to be descendants of Baba Utman Shamraiz , who accompanied Mahmud of Ghazni in his expedition into India in 997 .
Their land is very hilly and difficult , but well cultivated in terraces .
The British conducted military campaigns against them in 1852 , 1878 , and 1898 .
The Utman Khel are a tall , stout and fair race , but their dress and general customs have been assimilated by the neighbouring peoples of Bajour .
Their land lies between the Mohmands and the Ranizais of Swat , to the west and south-west of the junction of the Swat and Panjkora rivers .

However , this season was the first Pacific hurricane season since 1977 to have no systems become major hurricanes by reaching Category 3 or higher on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Scale .
The season saw 16 tropical storms form , of which 7 became hurricanes , which is about average .
The 2003 Pacific hurricane season produced an unusually large number of tropical cyclones which affected Mexico .
The season officially started on May 15 , 2003 in the eastern Pacific , and on June 1 , 2003 in the central Pacific , and lasted until November 30 , 2003 .
These dates conventionally delimit the period of each year when most tropical cyclones form in the northeastern Pacific Ocean .
The most notable cyclones the year were Hurricanes Ignacio and Marty , which killed 2 and 12 people in Mexico , respectively , and were collectively responsible for about $ 1 billion -LRB- 2003 USD -RRB- in damage .
Three other Pacific storms , two of which were hurricanes , and three Atlantic storms also had a direct impact on Mexico .
The only other significant storm of the season was Hurricane Jimena , which passed just to the south of Hawaii , the first storm to directly threaten Hawaii for several years .

PubMed Central is a free digital database of full-text scientific literature in biomedical and life sciences .
Some participating publishers , however , delay release of their articles for a set time after paper publication -LRB- often six months -RRB- .
It grew from the online Entrez PubMed biomedical literature search system .
PubMed Central was developed by the U.S. National Library of Medicine -LRB- NLM -RRB- as an online archive of biomedical journal articles .
The full text of all PubMed Central articles is available free .
Its purpose is to give recognition and support to younger mathematical researchers who have made major contributions .
The medal was first awarded in 1936 to Finnish mathematician Lars Ahlfors and American mathematician Jesse Douglas , and it has been awarded every four years since 1950 .

The White House is the official residence and principal workplace of the President of the United States .
The property is owned by the National Park Service and is part of the President 's Park .
Construction continued with the addition of the South Portico in 1824 and the North in 1829 .
Eight years later , President William Howard Taft expanded the West Wing and created the first Oval Office which was eventually moved as the section was expanded .
Under Harry S. Truman , the interior rooms were completely dismantled and a new internal load-bearing steel frame constructed inside the walls .
In 2007 , it was ranked second on the American Institute of Architects list of `` America 's Favorite Architecture '' .
Once this work was completed , the interior rooms were rebuilt .
A newly constructed East Wing was used as a reception area for social events ; Jefferson 's colonnades connected the new wings .
Reconstruction began almost immediately , and President James Monroe moved into the partially reconstructed house in October 1817 .
The term White House is regularly used as a metonym for the Executive Office of the President of the United States and for the president 's administration and advisers in general .
By 1948 , the house 's load-bearing exterior walls and internal wood beams were found to be close to failure .
Because of crowding within the executive mansion itself , President Theodore Roosevelt had all work offices relocated to the newly constructed West Wing in 1901 .
When Thomas Jefferson moved into the house in 1801 , he -LRB- with architect Benjamin Henry Latrobe -RRB- expanded the building outward , creating two colonnades that were meant to conceal stables and storage .
East Wing alterations were completed in 1946 , creating additional office space .
The third-floor attic was converted to living quarters in 1927 by augmenting the existing hip roof with long shed dormers .
The White House is made up of six storiesâ '' the Ground Floor , State Floor , Second Floor , and Third Floor , as well as a two-story basement .
It has been the residence of every U.S. President since John Adams .
Located at 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW in Washington , D.C. , the house was designed by Irish-born James Hoban , and built between 1792 and 1800 of white-painted Aquia sandstone in the Neoclassical style .
In 1814 , during the War of 1812 , the mansion was set ablaze by the British Army in the Burning of Washington , destroying the interior and charring much of the exterior .
Today , the White House Complex includes the Executive Residence , West Wing , Cabinet Room , Roosevelt Room , East Wing , and the Eisenhower Executive Office Building , which houses the executive offices of the President and Vice President .

King 's is ranked 63rd in the world -LRB- and 16th in Europe -RRB- in the 2010 Academic Ranking of World Universities , 21st in the world -LRB- and 6th in Europe -RRB- in the 2010 QS World University Rankings , and 77th in the world -LRB- and 15th in Europe -RRB- in the 2010 Times Higher Education World University Rankings .
King 's College London -LRB- informally King 's -RRB- is a public research university located in London , United Kingdom and a constituent college of the federal University of London .
King 's has around 18,600 full-time students and 5,030 staff and had a total income of Â # 508 million in 2009\/10 , of which Â # 144 million was from research grants and contracts .
It forms part of the ` Golden Triangle ' of British universities .
It is one of the largest centres for graduate and post-graduate medical teaching and biomedical research in Europe ; it is home to six Medical Research Council centres , the most of any British university , and is a founding member of the King 's Health Partners academic health sciences center .
King 's is a member of the Association of Commonwealth Universities , the European University Association , the Russell Group and Universities UK .
In 1836 King 's became one of the two founding colleges of the University of London .
There are currently 10 Nobel Prize winners amongst King 's alumni and current and former faculty .

Vancouver shares its name with the larger city of Vancouver located 305 m north in the Canadian province of British Columbia .
When clouds do not blanket the Puget-Willamette trough formed by the Cascade and Coast Range , Mount Hood , Mount Saint Helens , and Mount Adams are all visible from Vancouver .
Vancouver is located at 45 Â 38 â 1 â North , 122 Â 36 â 11 â West -LRB- 45.633743 , â ' 122.603011 -RRB- just north of the Columbia River , just west of where the Columbia River Gorge bisects the volcanic Cascade Range and just east of where the Willamette River enters the Columbia . The city of Vancouver is in the Western Lowlands region of Washington .
Both cities were named in honor of sea captain George Vancouver , although the Canadian city was incorporated 29 years after the incorporation of Vancouver , Washington , and more than 60 years after the name Vancouver was first used in reference to the historic Fort Vancouver trading post on the Columbia River .

It was divided into twenty districts called nomes , the first of which was at el-Lisht .
Temperatures are less extreme and rainfall is more abundant .
The climate in Lower Egypt is milder than that of Upper Egypt owing primarily to its proximity to the Mediterranean Sea .
It refers to the fertile Nile Delta region , which stretches from the area between El-Aiyat and Zawyet Dahshur , south of modern-day Cairo , and the Mediterranean Sea .
Lower Egypt was represented by the Low Red Crown Deshret , and its symbols were the papyrus and the bee .
Its patron Goddess was the cobra goddess Wadjet .
Because Lower Egypt was mostly undeveloped scrubland , undeveloped for human life and filled with all types of plant life such as grasses and herbs , the organization of the nomes underwent several changes .
Lower Egypt was known as Ta-Mehu which means `` land of papyrus . ''
The capital of Lower Egypt was Memphis .
A Spanish colony since the late 1800s , the Western Sahara has been on the United Nations list of non-self-governing territories since 1963 .
The Polisario Front has won formal recognition for SADR from 81 states , and was extended membership in the African Union , while Morocco has won recognition or support for its position from several African governments and from most of the Arab League .
In both instances , recognitions have over the past two decades been extended and withdrawn according to changing international trends .
A war erupted between those countries and the Sahrawi national liberation movement Polisario Front , which proclaimed the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic -LRB- SADR -RRB- -LRB- exiled government in Tindouf , Algeria -RRB- .
Since a United Nations-sponsored ceasefire agreement in 1991 , most of the territory -LRB- including the entire Atlantic coast line -RRB- has been controlled by Morocco , strongly backed by France , and the remainder by the SADR , strongly backed by Algeria .

Clayton Moore -LRB- September 14 , 1914 â `` December 28 , 1999 -RRB- was an American actor best known for playing the fictional western character The Lone Ranger from 1949 â `` 1951 and 1954-1957 on the television series of the same name .
Octopuses have a relatively short life expectancy , and some species live for as little as six months .
At least four specimens of the Veined Octopus -LRB- Amphioctopus marginatus -RRB- have been witnessed retrieving discarded coconut shells , manipulating them , and then reassembling them to use as shelter .
The young larval octopuses spend a period of time drifting in clouds of plankton , where they feed on copepods , larval crabs and larval starfish until they are ready to descend to the ocean bottom , where the cycle repeats .
All octopuses are venomous , but only one group , the blue-ringed octopuses , is known to be deadly to humans .
An octopus trails its eight arms behind it as it swims .
When octopuses reproduce , males use a specialized arm called a hectocotylus to insert spermatophores -LRB- packets of sperm -RRB- into the female 's mantle cavity .
The female cares for the eggs , guarding them against predators , and gently blowing currents of water over them so that they get enough oxygen .
Larger species , such as the North Pacific Giant Octopus , may live for up to five years under suitable circumstances .
The exact extent of their intelligence and learning capability is much debated among biologists , but maze and problem-solving experiments have shown that they show evidence of a memory system that can store both short - and long-term memory .
In some species , the female octopus can keep the sperm alive inside her for weeks until her eggs are mature .
Unlike vertebrates , the complex motor skills of octopuses are not organized in their brain using an internal somatotopic map of its body , as is the motor system in vertebrates Some octopuses , such as the mimic octopus , will move their arms in ways that emulate the shape and movements of other sea creatures .
Octopuses have also been observed in what some have described as play : repeatedly releasing bottles or toys into a circular current in their aquariums and then catching them .
However , reproduction is a cause of death : males can only live for a few months after mating , and females die shortly after their eggs hatch .
The female does not hunt during the roughly one-month period spent taking care of the unhatched eggs and may ingest some of her own arms for sustenance .
The octopus is the only invertebrate which has been shown to use tools .
Octopuses often break out of their aquariums and sometimes into others in search of food .
An octopus has a hard beak , with its mouth at the center point of the arms .
Males die within a few months of mating .
In laboratory experiments , octopuses can be readily trained to distinguish between different shapes and patterns .
There are around 300 recognized octopus species , which is over one-third of the total number of known cephalopod species .
At around the time the eggs hatch , the mother leaves the lair and is too weak to defend herself from predators like cod , often succumbing to their attacks .
Octopuses have no internal or external skeleton -LRB- although some species have a vestigial remnant of a shell inside their mantle -RRB- , allowing them to squeeze through tight places .
In the UK , cephalopods such as octopuses are regarded as honorary vertebrates under the Animals -LRB- Scientific Procedures -RRB- Act 1986 and other cruelty to animals legislation , extending to them protections not normally afforded to invertebrates .
They neglect to eat during the -LRB- roughly -RRB- one month period spent taking care of their unhatched eggs , but they do not die of starvation .
The octopus is a cephalopod mollusc of the order Octopoda .
They have even boarded fishing boats and opened holds to eat crabs .
After they have been fertilized , the female lays about 200,000 eggs -LRB- this figure dramatically varies between families , genera , species and also individuals -RRB- .
Octopuses are highly intelligent , likely more so than any other order of invertebrates .
The term octopus may also be used to refer only to those creatures in the genus Octopus .

These axons pass to the olfactory bulb through the cribriform plate , which in turn projects olfactory information to the olfactory cortex and other areas .

Like other forms of pollution -LRB- such as air , water , and noise pollution -RRB- light pollution causes damage to the environment .
Specific categories of light pollution include light trespass , over-illumination , glare , light clutter , and skyglow .
Light trespass occurs when unwanted light enters one 's property , for instance , by shining over a neighbor 's fence . A common light trespass problem occurs when a strong light enters the window of one 's home from the outside , causing problems such as sleep deprivation or the blocking of an evening view .

Tax resistance is the refusal to willingly pay a tax because of opposition to the institution that is imposing the tax , or to some of that institutionâ s policies . Tax resistance can be a form of conscientious objection -LRB- for example , some pacifists refuse to pay taxes that pay for war -RRB- .
In the anti-war tax resistance movement in the United States it is sometimes remarked that there are as many ways to practice tax resistance as there are resisters . Some tax resisters refuse to pay all or a portion of the taxes due , but then make an equivalent donation to charity .

Swiss cheese is a generic name in North America for several related varieties of cheese which resemble the Swiss Emmental . Some types of Swiss cheese have a distinctive appearance , as the blocks of the cheese are riddled with holes known as â eyes .
An Earthship is a type of passive solar house made of natural and recycled materials .
It was named in October 2002 after Megaclite , mother by Zeus -LRB- Jupiter -RRB- of Thebe and Locrus -LRB- although both of these are assigned a different mother by other authors -RRB- .
It belongs to the PasiphaÃ `` group , irregular retrograde moons orbiting Jupiter at distances ranging between 22.8 and 24.1 Gm , and with inclinations ranging between 144.5 Â and 158.3 Â .
Megaclite is about 5.4 kilometres in diameter , and orbits Jupiter at an average distance of 24.687 million kilometers in 792.437 days , at an inclination of 150 Â to the ecliptic -LRB- 148 Â to Jupiter 's equator -RRB- , in a retrograde direction and with an eccentricity of 0.308 .

Eraclea Mare is known for its pinewood and the `` Mort Lagoon '' -LRB- Italian : Laguna del Mort -RRB- .
Eraclea Mare is the Lido of Eraclea .
The Lagoon stretches between the Eraclea 's Lido and the mouth of the Piave river and it is a sea-lagoon , being supplied with water only by the flood-tides .
It is located on the Adriatic Sea near the coast between the rivers Piave and Livenza and between two famous tourist towns : Caorle and Jesolo .
Still uncontaminated , the Mort is characterized by shallow and calm waters with a sandy and muddy seabed , rich in phytoplankton .
A steady growth of foreign tourists , especially from Germany , has been recently recorded .
The Mort Lagoon , an unusual natural formation , was caused by the overflowing of the Piave river in 1935 , whose bed was modified in its last stretch after a large flood .

SP42 goes through it .
Eraclea Mare , one of the destinations of summer tourism on the Adriatic riviera , is together with Jesolo and Caorle one of the best known seaside resorts on the Venetian coast .

A. afarensis was slenderly built , like the younger Australopithecus africanus .
Australopithecus afarensis is an extinct hominid that lived between 3.9 and 2.9 million years ago .
It is thought that A. afarensis was ancestral to both the genus Australopithecus and the genus Homo , which includes the modern human species , Homo sapiens .
In the parliamentary session of 1905 , plans were submitted for an additional station at the south end of the tunnel , under Wellington Street .
Legal problems delayed permission to build the subway and tram route and it was not until 1906 that permission to build was granted and then not to cross the bridge .
In 1953 , London Transport used the tramway to store 120 unused buses and coaches in case they were needed for the Coronation but proposals to convert the tramway subway to a car park or a film studio failed and it was leased out as a storage facility from October 1957 .
In 1946 , it was decided to replace all London 's remaining trams `` as soon as possible '' , this time by diesel buses .
A new sharp curve was built under Lancaster Place to enable an exit through the western side wall of Waterloo Bridge and a triangular junction with the through line was constructed .
In June 1958 , the London County Council proposed making use of the tunnel for light traffic coming from Waterloo Bridge in order to reduce traffic congestion at its junction with Strand and , in April 1962 , that the go-ahead was given for part of the southern end of the subway to be used in this way .
Services opened to the public on 24 February 1906 from The Angel , Islington to Aldwych , with a ceremonial opening by the chairman of the Highways Committee .
In 1929 it was decided to increase the headroom to 16 f by raising the roof or deepening the tunnel as appropriate .
Drivers of the trams recorded difficulty in climbing the ramp north from Holborn tramway station and would sometimes roll all the way back to the station .
On 16 November that year the routes were extended north from The Angel to Highbury station .
In 1937 , the rebuilding of Waterloo Bridge required the diversion of the side entrance to the tramway to a new position centrally underneath the bridge , which opened on 21 November of that year .
With a distance of 16 m , this was the longest tram route operated entirely within the County of London .
In places the trackbed was lowered by 5 f , requiring the underpinning of the walls with concrete .
The southern section of the abandoned tunnel between the Embankment and the Strand Underpass has been converted into a branch of the Buddha Bar chain of bar\/restaurants .
Service patterns continued to change , especially with the opening of tram lines over Blackfriars Bridge on 14 September 1909 , and during the 1920s it was realized that to remain profitable the subway needed to be able to take double-deck trams .
The London County Council had , for many years , wanted to connect its `` North Side '' and `` South Side '' tramway systems in order to be able to send the `` North Side '' vehicles for overhaul to the Central Repair Depot at Charlton in South East London .
In 1902 , it decided to build a subway from Theobalds Road in the north to the Embankment underneath Waterloo Bridge to the south , from where a surface line would continue over the bridge .
Work started on 11 September of that year , resulting in the replacement of the cast iron tubes by a new steel girder-supported roof and the diversion of the sewer .
The eastern side of this junction , leading to Blackfriars , was removed as part of the 1930s upgrade .
During the early hours of the next morning , the remaining trams north of the subway were run through to the depots south of the Thames .
A weekend service , which ran until 1932 , was introduced between Highgate -LRB- Archway -RRB- and Downham via Brockley .
Through services commenced on 10 April 1908 from Highbury station to Tower Bridge and to Kennington Gate , with a procession of six cars going south from the Holborn through to Kennington , then diverting to Elephant and Castle in order to return through the subway to Angel .
Special trams were constructed from non-flammable materials for the route , and wooden trams , common on other routes , were not permitted through the subway .
The two tramway stations were also completely rebuilt .
It was decided soon after to replace all trams in London by `` more modern vehicles . ''
This latter service was short-lived and the tracks were removed in 1930 .
The abandonment program began in 1935 with trams in South-West , West , North-West , North and East London mostly being replaced by trolleybuses .
This involved the demolition of the pedestrian subways under Waterloo Bridge and extensive construction in the bridge 's undercroft .
The approach from the north near Southampton Row was an 170 f open cutting with a 1 in 10 -LRB- 10 % -RRB- gradient .
The Kennington service was not commercially viable and services were diverted to operate to Queens Road in Battersea which , due to a low bridge , could be operated with single-deck vehicles only .
The first journey took 12 minutes northbound and 10 minutes to return , even allowing for the horse-drawn vehicles also using the roads on the overground part of the route .
After the last services ran on the night of 2 February 1930 the tunnel was closed until the formal re-opening on 14 January 1931 using E\/3 type tram no. 1931 on new route 31 , with public services starting the following day .
After leaving the subway at the south end , trams turned right along the Embankment to Westminster Bridge or left on a service from Bloomsbury to the Hop Exchange .
The London Passenger Transport Board was formed in 1933 , taking over the London County Council trams .
Because of a sewer at the northern end and the District Railway to the south it was decided to build the tunnel for single-deck trams only .
Service routes were now Hackney to Wandsworth or Tooting , Leyton to Westminster , Highbury to Waterloo or Norbury and Archway to Kennington .
Construction began that September and it opened to road traffic as the Strand Underpass on 21 January 1964 .
Trams were abandoned in London on 5 July 1952 , after which street tracks were lifted , but those in the subway mostly remain in place .
The replacement program proceeded swiftly until 1940 , when the last pre-war conversion occurred , leaving only the South London trams and the subway routes 31 , 33 and 35 , the only tram routes operating into North London to survive the war .
The tracks passed through cast iron tubes underneath the Fleet sewer before rising slightly to enter Holborn tramway station .
South from here the subway was built with a steel roof to Aldwych tramway station and , because it was not initially planned to run a public service south of here , the tracks leading towards the Strand were used as a depot with appropriate equipment and inspection pits .
The opening of the new tramway along the Embankment meant it was decided to link up with this route instead and the station was never built .
Drivers on routes through the tunnel had to have at least two years ' experience on other services to be considered for these routes .
The first subway route to be withdrawn was route 31 , on 1 October 1950 , with the remaining two routes , 33 and 35 , being withdrawn after service on Saturday , 5 April 1952 , the last public services being ` specials ' on the Sunday , shortly after midnight .
Prototype Kingsway trolleybus no. 1379 , with exits on both sides with folding doors , was constructed for feasibility tests through the subway , but these were unsuccessful as trolleybuses would have had to run on battery power through the subway , headroom restrictions making it impossible to use overhead current collection .
Some prefer the sound produced with tube amplifiers on the grounds that it is more natural and satisfying than the sound from typical transistor amplifiers .
Tube sound -LRB- or valve sound -RRB- is the characteristic sound associated with a vacuum tube-based audio amplifier .

Marshal of the Royal Air Force Hugh Montague Trenchard , 1st Viscount Trenchard GCB OM GCVO DSO -LRB- 3 February 1873 -- 10 February 1956 -RRB- was a British officer who was instrumental in establishing the Royal Air Force .
In 1912 , Trenchard learned to fly and he was subsequently appointed as second in command of the Central Flying School .
Outside of his political work , Trenchard took on the chairmanship of the United Africa Company , which had sought out Trenchard because of his West African knowledge and experience . In 1936 Trenchard was upgraded from Baron to Viscount Trenchard .
Following further recuperation , Trenchard returned to active service in South Africa .
Trenchard is recognized today as one of the early advocates of strategic bombing .
As a young infantry officer , Trenchard served in India and with the outbreak of the Boer War , he volunteered for service in South Africa .
He held several senior positions in the Royal Flying Corps during World War I , serving as the commander of Royal Flying Corps in France from 1915 to 1917 .
He has been described as the Father of the Royal Air Force .
Returning as Chief of the Air Staff under Winston Churchill in 1919 , Trenchard spent the following decade securing the future of the Royal Air Force .
In 1918 , he briefly served as the first Chief of the Air Staff before taking up command of the Independent Air Force in France .
Dust mite excretion , pollen and pet dander are all common allergens , but it is possible to be allergic to anything from chlorine to perfume to royal jelly .
Food allergies are not as common as food sensitivity , but some foods such as peanuts -LRB- a legume -RRB- , nuts , seafood and shellfish are the cause of serious allergies in many people .

The shape reconstruction from lightcurves has been described as quite spherical with large planar , nonconvex parts of the surface .
This gives an axial tilt of 45 Â in both cases .
Massalia has an above-average density for S-type asteroids , similar to the density of silicate rocks .
20 Massalia -LRB- , or as in -RRB- is a large and fairly bright main-belt asteroid .
It orbits at very low inclination in the intermediate main belt , and is by far the largest asteroid in the Massalia family .
The remaining family members are fragments ejected by a cratering event on Massalia .
Massalia is an S-type asteroid .
Massalia was discovered by A. de Gasparis on September 19 , 1852 in Naples , and also found independently the next night by J. Chacornac in Marseilles . It was Chacornac 's discovery that was announced first .
Apart from the few largest bodies over 400 km in diameter , such as 1 Ceres and 4 Vesta , most asteroids appear to have been significantly fractured , or are even rubble piles .
It was Chacornac 's discovery that was announced first .
Massalia was discovered by A. de Gasparis on September 19 , 1852 in Naples , and also found independently the next night by J. Chacornac in Marseilles .
It is also the largest member of the Massalia family of asteroids .
As such , it appears to be a solid un-fractured body , a rarity among asteroids of its size .
Lightcurve analysis indicates that Massalia 's pole points towards either ecliptic coordinates -LRB- Î , Î '' -RRB- = -LRB- 45 Â , 10 Â -RRB- or -LRB- Î , Î '' -RRB- = -LRB- 45 Â , 190 Â -RRB- with a 10 Â uncertainty .
The loss at Vengeance stipulated that Batista could no longer get another chance at the World Heavyweight Championship while Edge remained champion .
He denied ever being a customer of Signature and stated that he has been `` tested regularly by the WWE , and I am in full compliance with the WWE Wellness Program '' .
They had a rematch at SummerSlam in a No Holds Barred match in which Batista pinned JBL .
Plans had been made for Batista to defend the title in a Triple Threat match with Eddie Guerrero and Randy Orton on the November 18 episode , but the match did not take place due to the unexpected death of Guerrero on November 13 , the date of the taping .
As 2005 began , Triple H realized the possibility of Batista becoming a threat to his World Heavyweight Championship .
In an attempt to persuade Batista to challenge WWE Champion John `` Bradshaw '' Layfield rather than him , Triple H concocted a scheme to have Batista run over in a limousine resembling the one used by Layfield .
He then went to the World Wrestling Federation , who sent him to train with Afa Anoa ` i 's school in the Wild Samoan Training Centre .
In WWE , he became a six-time world champion , winning the World Heavyweight Championship four times and the WWE Championship two times . In addition to these championships , Batista has won the World Tag Team Championship three times -LRB- twice with Ric Flair and once with John Cena -RRB- and the WWE Tag Team Championship once -LRB- with Rey Mysterio -RRB- .
In August 2007 , Batista was accused of anabolic steroid use after an ESPN article released the names of wrestlers that were clients of Signature Pharmacy of Orlando , Florida , one of many pharmacies under investigation for filling illegal prescription drugs .
Batista entered anyway and went on to win the Rumble earning the right to participate in the main event of WrestleMania 21 against the World Champion of his choice .
Batista finally claimed his third World Heavyweight Championship after eight consecutive attempts , by defeating Khali in a match that included Rey Mysterio at Unforgiven .
JBL defeated Batista at The Great American Bash by disqualification after the referee saw Batista use a steel chair .
At Armageddon , Batista took part in two matches ; losing to Shawn Michaels in a singles match , and winning a tag team turmoil match along with Ric Flair to become one-half of the World Tag Team Champions .
Batista accepted an open challenge from The Great Khali at The Great American Bash . Edge relinquished the title due to an injury the week before the pay-per-view , and Khali became the new World Heavyweight Champion , winning a Battle Royal and eliminating Batista .
He later won the OVW Heavyweight Championship from `` The Machine '' Doug Basham before losing the belt to The Prototype -LRB- John Cena -RRB- .
Batista won the World Heavyweight Championship on April 3 at WrestleMania 21 .
Initially , Dave did not want help from Evolution and wanted to confront JBL by himself .
He aligned himself with Ric Flair and feuded with Kane , whom he defeated at Armageddon .
In January 2003 , Batista joined Triple H , Ric Flair and Randy Orton to form the villainous stable Evolution .

The symbols are similar to the ratings symbols used by Christgau in print -LRB- except for the scissors , for legibility at a small size -RRB- .
Christgau 's letter grade ratings are output as plain text , like -LRB- B + -RRB- .
If the user clicks on a symbol they will be mapped through to the image page -LRB- example -RRB- , which provides an explanation of the image 's meaning .

On May 1 , 1970 when Asbarez began publishing its English section .
After several successful decades the offices and publishing headquarters moved to Los Angeles in the early 1970 â s.

No authenticated portrait of Robert Hooke exists , a situation sometimes attributed to the heated conflicts between Hooke and Isaac Newton .
Hooke 's collaboration with Christopher Wren also included St Paul 's Cathedral , whose dome uses a method of construction conceived by Hooke .
In the reconstruction after the Great Fire , Hooke proposed redesigning London 's streets on a grid pattern with wide boulevards and arteries , a pattern subsequently used in the renovation of Paris , Liverpool , and many American cities .
Hooke achieved fame in his day as Surveyor to the City of London and chief assistant of Christopher Wren .
This was a position he held for over 40 years .
This proposal was thwarted by arguments over property rights , as property owners were surreptitiously shifting their boundaries .
On 8 July 1680 , Hooke observed the nodal patterns associated with the modes of vibration of glass plates .
In 1664 Hooke also was appointed Professor of Geometry at Gresham College in London and Cutlerian Lecturer in Mechanics .
Robert Hooke FRS -LRB- 18 July 1635 â `` 3 March 1703 -RRB- was an English natural philosopher , architect and polymath who played an important role in the scientific revolution , through both experimental and theoretical work .
Hooke became Curator of Experiments in 1662 to the newly founded Royal Society , and took responsibility for experiments performed at its weekly meetings .
Hooke helped Wren rebuild London after the Great Fire in 1666 , and also worked on designing London 's Monument to the fire , the Royal Greenwich Observatory , Montagu House in Bloomsbury , and the infamous Bethlem Royal Hospital -LRB- which became known as ` Bedlam ' -RRB- .
Hooke was in demand to settle many of these disputes , due to his competence as a surveyor and his tact as an arbitrator .
He ran a bow along the edge of a glass plate covered with flour , and saw the nodal patterns emerge .
Hooke also participated in the design of the Pepys Library , which held the manuscripts of Samuel Pepys 's diaries , the most frequently cited eyewitness account of the Great Fire of London .

Horse Hollow Wind Energy Center is a large wind farm with 735.5 megawatt -LRB- MW -RRB- capacity .
It consists of 291 GE 1.5 MW wind turbines and 130 Siemens 2.3 MW wind turbines spread over nearly 47,000 acres -LRB- 190 kmÂ -RRB- of land in Taylor and Nolan County , Texas .
The first phase of the Horse Hollow Wind Energy Center consisted of 213 MW and was completed in late 2005 ; phase two consisted of 223.5 MW and was completed in the second quarter of 2006 ; phase three which consisted of 299 MW , was completed by the end of 2006 .

Multicellular organisms are organisms that consist of more than one cell , in contrast to single-celled organisms .
Multicellular organisms , especially long-living animals , also face the challenge of cancer , which occurs when cells fail to regulate their growth within the normal program of development .
In order to reproduce , true multicellular organisms must solve the problem of regenerating a whole organism from germ cells -LRB- i.e. sperm and egg cells -RRB- , an issue that is studied in developmental biology .
Changes in tissue morphology can be observed during this process .

Since electrons are fermions , the Pauli exclusion principle forbids them from occupying the same quantum state , so electrons have to `` stack '' within an atom , i.e. have different momenta while at the same place .
The Pauli exclusion principle is a quantum mechanical principle formulated by the Austrian physicist Wolfgang Pauli in 1925 .

As a result the first DNA transposon used as a tool for genetic purposes , the Sleeping Beauty transposon system , was a Tc1\/mariner-like transposon that was ressurected from an long evolutionary sleep .
Transposons are only one of several types of mobile genetic elements .
In vertebrate animal cells nearly all -RRB- 100,000 DNA transposons per genome have genes that encode inactive transposase polypeptides .
They may or may not have originated in the last universal common ancestor , or arisen independently multiple times , or perhaps arisen once and then spread to other kingdoms by horizontal gene transfer .
They copy themselves in two stages , first from DNA to RNA by transcription , then from RNA back to DNA by reverse transcription .
Transposons themselves are assigned to one of two classes according to their mechanism of transposition , which can be described as either `` copy and paste '' -LRB- class I -RRB- or `` cut and paste '' -LRB- class II -RRB- .
In this way , they are similar to viruses .
Bacteria may undergo high rates of gene deletion as part of a mechanism to remove transposons and viruses from their genomes while eukaryotic organisms use RNA interference -LRB- RNAi -RRB- to inhibit transposon activity .
While some transposons may confer benefits on their hosts , most are regarded as selfish DNA parasites .
Various viruses and transposons also share features in their genome structures and biochemical abilities , leading to speculation that they share a common ancestor .
Transposons are found in all major branches of life .
Since excessive transposon activity can destroy a genome , many organisms have developed mechanisms to inhibit this activity .
Transposons may have been co-opted by the vertebrate immune system as a means of producing antibody diversity : The V -LRB- D -RRB- J recombination system operates by a mechanism similar to that of transposons .
The DNA copy is then inserted into the genome in a new position .
Transposition can create phenotypically significant mutations and alter the cell 's genome size .
Retrotransposons behave very similarly to retroviruses , such as HIV .
Transposons are mutagens .
They can damage the genome of their host cell in different ways :

The Juglandaceae , also known as the Walnut Family , is a family of trees , or sometimes shrubs , in the order Fagales .
This east-west section is the route between the state capital in Topeka , the University of Kansas in Lawrence , and the industrial center of Kansas City , Kansas .
In June 1956 , the Federal-Aid Highway Act of 1956 was signed into law , granting funding to the nationwide Interstate Highway System .
The Kansas Turnpike Act , defining a turnpike from Oklahoma to Kansas City , became effective April 7 , 1953 .
While not part of the system 's early plans , the turnpike was eventually incorporated into the Interstate system in late 1956 , and is designated today as four different Interstate Highway routes : I-35 , I-335 , I-470 , and I-70 .
This highway exists entirely as a part of the Kansas Turnpike . In fact , until 1987 , this stretch of the Turnpike was designated solely as the Kansas Turnpike without an Interstate number .
The Kansas Turnpike was built from 1954 to 1956 , predating the Interstate Highway System .
Because the Kansas Turnpike was built before the Interstate Highway System , it is not engineered to current Interstate Highway standards .
It runs in a general southwest-northeast direction from the Oklahoma border , and passes through several major Kansas cities , including Wichita , Topeka , Lawrence and Kansas City .

SchÃ nholzerswilen is a municipality in the district of MÃ 1\/4 nchwilen in the canton of Thurgau in Switzerland .
The most basic form , seen in some gastropods and annelids , consists of a lens of one refractive index .
Ocelli -LRB- pit-type eyes of arthropods -RRB- blur the image across the whole retina , and are consequently excellent at responding to rapid changes in light intensity across the whole visual field ; this fast response is further accelerated by the large nerve bundles which rush the information to the brain .
A far sharper image can be obtained using materials with a high refractive index , decreasing to the edges ; this decreases the focal length and thus allows a sharp image to form on the retina .
In the acute zone the eyes are flattened and the facets larger .
Focusing the image would also cause the sun 's image to be focused on a few receptors , with the possibility of damage under the intense light ; shielding the receptors would block out some light and thus reduce their sensitivity .
The resulting eye is a mixture of a simple eye within a compound eye .
The body of Ophiocoma wendtii , a type of brittle star , is covered with ommatidia , turning its whole skin into a compound eye .
An alternative to a lens is to line the inside of the eye with '' mirrors '' , and reflect the image to focus at a central point .
To minimize the effect of eye motion while the animal moves , most such eyes have stabilizing eye muscles .
They are small , comprising up to about 100 cells covering about 100 Â m .
The directionality can be improved by reducing the size of the aperture , by incorporating a reflective layer behind the receptor cells , or by filling the pit with a refractile material .
Some larger organisms , such as scallops , also use reflector eyes .
The resolution of pit eyes can be greatly improved by incorporating a material with a higher refractive index to form a lens , which may greatly reduce the blur radius encounteredâ '' hence increasing the resolution obtainable .
The ocelli of insects bear a simple lens , but their focal point always lies behind the retina ; consequently they can never form a sharp image .
Good fliers like flies or honey bees , or prey-catching insects like praying mantis or dragonflies , have specialized zones of ommatidia organized into a fovea area which gives acute vision .
The same is true of many chitons .
It detects moving objects as they pass successive lenses .
The flattening allows more ommatidia to receive light from a spot and therefore higher resolution .
A compound eye may consist of thousands of individual photoreceptor units or ommatidia -LRB- ommatidium , singular -RRB- .
This fast response has led to suggestions that the ocelli of insects are used mainly in flight , because they can be used to detect sudden changes in which way is up -LRB- because light , especially UV light which is absorbed by vegetation , usually comes from above -RRB- .
The scallop Pecten has up to 100 millimeter-scale reflector eyes fringing the edge of its shell .
This eye creates an image that is sharp enough that motion of the eye can cause significant blurring .
Found in about 85 % of phyla , these basic forms were probably the precursors to more advanced types of `` simple eye '' .
Compared with simple eyes , compound eyes possess a very large view angle , and can detect fast movement and , in some cases , the polarization of light .
Many small organisms such as rotifers , copeopods and platyhelminths use such organs , but these are too small to produce usable images .

This is in contrast to parallel communication , where several bits are sent as a whole , on a link with several parallel channels .
In telecommunication and computer science , the concept of serial communication is the process of sending data one bit at a time , sequentially , over a communication channel or computer bus .

This is because most of the conodont animal was soft-bodied , thus everything but the teeth were not suited for preservation under normal circumstances .
There are three forms of teeth , coniform cones , ramiform bars , and pectiniform platforms , which may have performed different roles .
The organisms range from a centimeter or so to the giant Promissum , 40 cm in length .
This has made them useful for petroleum exploration where they are known , in rocks dating from the Cambrian to the Late Triassic .
It is now widely agreed that conodonts had large eyes , fins with fin rays , chevron-shaped muscles and a notochord .
The entire class of Conodonts , or at least what was left of them at the time , are postulated to have been wiped out by the Triassicâ `` Jurassic extinction event , which occurred roughly 200 million years ago .
This array constituted a feeding apparatus radically different from the jaws of modern animals .
It was not until early 1980s that the conodont teeth were found in association with fossils of the host organism , in a konservat lagerstÃ tte .
This is because under higher temperatures the phosphate undergoes predictable and permanent color changes , measured with the conodont alteration index .
The eleven known fossil imprints of conodont animals depict an eel-like creature with 15 or , more rarely , 19 elements forming a bilaterally symmetrical array in the head .

An elastic collision is an encounter between two bodies in which the total kinetic energy of the two bodies after the encounter is equal to their total kinetic energy before the encounter .
At any one instant , half the collisions are , to a varying extent , inelastic collisions -LRB- the pair possesses less kinetic energy in their translational motions after the collision than before -RRB- , and half could be described as â super-elastic â -LRB- possessing more kinetic energy after the collision than before -RRB- .
An elastic collision is an encounter between two bodies in which the total kinetic energy of the two bodies after the encounter is equal to their total kinetic energy before the encounter . Elastic collisions occur only if there is no net conversion of kinetic energy into other forms .
Elastic collisions occur only if there is no net conversion of kinetic energy into other forms .
Let mi be the masses , ui the velocities before collision and vi the velocities after collision .

After the sacking of 1237 â `` 1238 , when the Mongols burned the city to the ground and killed its inhabitants , Moscow recovered and became the capital of the independent Vladimir-Suzdal principality in 1327 .

Many factories were evacuated , together with much of the government , and from 20 October the city was declared to be under siege .
The Plague of 1771 was the last massive outbreak of plague in central Russia , claiming up to 100,000 lives in Moscow alone .
Following the Russian Revolution of 1917 , on 12 March 1918 Moscow became the capital of the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic and of the Soviet Union less than five years later .
Moscow is situated on the Moskva River in the Central Federal District of European Russia .

In the course of its history the city has served as the capital of a progression of states , from the medieval Grand Duchy of Moscow and the subsequent Tsardom of Russia to the Soviet Union .

At least 4256 species of crane flies have been described , most of them -LRB- 75 % -RRB- by the specialist Charles Paul Alexander .
Larvae have a distinct head capsule , and their abdominal segments often have long fleshy projections surrounding the posterior spiracles -LRB- almost like tentacles -RRB- .
Their larvae , called `` leatherjackets '' , `` leatherbacks '' , `` leatherback bugs '' or `` leatherjacket slugs '' , because of the way they move , consume roots -LRB- such as those of turf grass -RRB- and other vegetation , in some cases causing damage to plants .
Some larval crane flies are predatory and may eat mosquito larvae . Adult crane flies feed on nectar or they do not feed at all ; once they become adults , most crane fly species exist as adults only to mate and die .
Despite their common names , as adults , crane flies do not prey on mosquitoes , nor do they bite humans .

While some enthusiasts of certain types of jazz have argued for narrower definitions which exclude many other types of music also commonly known as `` jazz '' , jazz musicians themselves are often reluctant to define the music they play .
From its beginnings in the early 20th century jazz has spawned a variety of subgenres : New Orleans Dixieland dating from the early 1910s , big band-style swing from the 1930s and 1940s , bebop from the mid-1940s , a variety of Latin jazz fusions such as Afro-Cuban and Brazilian jazz , free jazz from the 1950s and 1960s , jazz fusion from the 1970s , acid jazz from the 1980s -LRB- which added funk and hip-hop influences -RRB- , and Nujazz in the 1990s .
Traditional jazz enthusiasts have dismissed Bop , the 1970s jazz fusion era -LRB- and much else -RRB- as a period of commercial debasement of the music . According to Bruce Johnson , jazz music has always had a `` tension between jazz as a commercial music and an art form '' .
The web services are labeled by each Wave , for example , Windows Live Hotmail Wave 4 . The programs from Windows Live Essentials are usually called by a year number , for example , Windows Live Messenger 2011 .
Windows Vista provides a link in its user interface to download Windows Live Messenger , and Windows 7 saw the removal of applications such as Windows Mail , Windows Photo Gallery and Windows Movie Maker and replaced with the Windows Live Essentials suite , a software package that allows the downloading and installation of similar offerings from Windows Live . Some web-based Windows Live services such as Windows Live SkyDrive are available outside of Windows ; however , these services are integrated closely with the Windows Live Essentials suite of applications .
This service integrates tightly with other Windows Live services including Windows Live Contacts , Windows Live Calendar , and Windows Live SkyDrive .
It is currently implemented in all but a few Windows Live services .
In its initial release , several Windows Live properties were rebranded and enhanced from Microsoft 's MSN set of products and services .

Ukiyo-e -LRB- or -RRB- is a genre of Japanese woodblock prints -LRB- or woodcuts -RRB- and paintings produced between the 17th and the 20th centuries , featuring motifs of landscapes , tales from history , the theater , and pleasure quarters .
The original subject of ukiyo-e was city life , in particular activities and scenes from the entertainment district .
Beautiful courtesans , bulky sumo wrestlers and popular actors would be portrayed while engaged in appealing activities .
They were mainly meant for townsmen , who were generally not wealthy enough to afford an original painting .

Lilongwe , estimated population 902,388 as of 2009 , is the capital and largest city of Malawi . It lies in the country 's central region , on the Lilongwe River , near the border of Malawi , Mozambique , and Zambia , and on the main north-south highway of Malawi , the M1 .
Taxis are available from hotels and a taxi rank on Presidential Way , North of City Centre Shopping Centre .
Kamuzu International Airport , located about 35 km north of Lilongwe in the suburb of Lumbadzi , offers local turbo-prop
The city started life as a small village on the banks of the Lilongwe river , and became a British colonial administrative center at the beginning of the 20th century .
Due to its location on the main north-south route through the country and the road to Northern Rhodesia -LRB- now Zambia -RRB- , Lilongwe became the second largest city in Malawi . In 1974 , the capital of the country was formally moved from Zomba to Lilongwe .
Recently , as part of political restructuring , the parliament has been shifted to Lilongwe and all parliament members are required to spend time in the new capital .
Lilongwe is served by Malawi Railways and Axa Bus company , and local buses and minibuses run between Old Town , City Centre , Kamuzu International Airport , and other urban centres , including Mzuzu and Blantyre .

It lies in the country 's central region , on the Lilongwe River , near the border of Malawi , Mozambique , and Zambia , and on the main north-south highway of Malawi , the M1 .
Lilongwe is now the political center of Malawi , but Blantyre remains the economic capital .

This project should be your main reference for stub information , and is where new stub types should be proposed for discussion prior to creation . Once a stub has been properly expanded and becomes a larger article , any editor may remove its stub template .
The text of a stub category should contain a definition of what type of stubs are contained in it and an indication of what template is used to add stubs to it .
In general , a stub type consists of a stub template and a dedicated stub category , although `` upmerged '' templates are also occasionally created which feed into more general stub categories .
The new stub category should be correctly added into other categories .

The doctrine of implied repeal is a concept in English constitutional theory which states that where an Act of Parliament conflicts with an earlier one , the later Act takes precedence and the conflicting parts of the earlier Act are repealed -LRB- i.e. no longer law -RRB- .
This doctrine is expressed in the Latin phrase `` leges posteriores priores contrarias abrogant '' .

There are two universities in the City of Manchester . The University of Manchester is the largest full-time non-collegiate university in the United Kingdom and was created in 2004 by the merger of Victoria University of Manchester and UMIST .
Manchester is a city and metropolitan borough of Greater Manchester , England .

Although not an official twin city , Tampere , Finland is known as `` the Manchester of Finland '' â `` or `` Manse '' for short .
The city has one of the most extensive bus networks outside London with over 50 bus companies operating in the Greater Manchester region radiating from the city .
Manchester Metropolitan University was formed as Manchester Polytechnic on the merger of three colleges in 1970 .
First Manchester also operates a three route zero-fare bus service called Metroshuttle which carries commuters around Manchester 's business districts .
The Manchester Ship Canal is open , but traffic to the upper reaches is light .
The University of Manchester is the largest full-time non-collegiate university in the United Kingdom and was created in 2004 by the merger of Victoria University of Manchester and UMIST .
Local operator Northern Rail and First Transpennine Express operates all over the North of England , and other national operators include East Midlands Trains and Virgin Trains .
Manchester is well served by trains . In terms of passengers , Manchester Piccadilly was the busiest English railway station outside London between 2007 â `` 08 and the third busiest between 2008-09 .
In addition , the British Council maintains a metropolitan center in Manchester .
The Manchester Ship Canal was built in 1894 , in some sections by canalisation of the Rivers Irwell and Mersey , running 58 k from Salford to Eastham Locks on the tidal Mersey .
It includes the Manchester Business School , which offered the first MBA course in the UK in 1965 .
Manchester lies within one of the UK 's largest metropolitan areas ; the metropolitan county of Greater Manchester had an estimated population of 2,600,100 , the Greater Manchester Urban Area a population of 2,240,230 , and the Larger Urban Zone around Manchester , the second-most-populous in the UK , had an estimated population in the 2004 Urban Audit of 2,539,100 .
Greater Manchester has an extensive countywide railway network , and two mainline stations .
Manchester city center is also serviced by over a dozen rail-based park and ride sites .
Manchester is well-known for being a city of sport . Two Premiership football clubs bear the city 's name , Manchester United and Manchester City .

An extensive canal network remains from the Industrial Revolution , nowadays mainly used for leisure .
This enabled ocean going ships to sail right into the Port of Manchester .

Blackpool Transport Services -LRB- BTS -RRB- is a bus and tram operator running within the boroughs of Blackpool and Fylde and into the surrounding area , including Fleetwood , Lytham St Annes , Poulton le Fylde and Kirkham , Preston .
BTS is a limited company wholly owned by Blackpool Borough Council , which makes it one of the few remaining municipal bus companies in the UK today .
Though bronze is generally harder than wrought iron , with Vickers hardness of 60 â `` 258 vs. 30 â `` 80 , the Bronze Age gave way to the Iron Age ; this happened because iron was easier to find and easier to process . Bronze was still used during the Iron Age , for example officers in the Roman army had bronze swords while foot soldiers had iron , but , for many purposes , the weaker wrought iron was found to be sufficiently strong .
Tin bronze was superior over arsenic bronze in that the alloying process itself could more easily be controlled -LRB- as tin was available as a metal -RRB- and the alloy was stronger and easier to cast .

FourcÃ s is a commune in south-western France , more precisely in Gascony , in the Gers department , which is a part of the region of Midi-Pyr Ã nÃ es .
In the neighborhood are numerous old castles , little medieval walled villages , small cities built around castles and `` sacred '' places , because the Via Podiensis and the Way of St. James of Compostela are going through the MontrÃ al and left their traces .
FourcÃ s is a typical medieval bastide , a little village where the houses are built in a circle to allow a proper defense .
The summers are long and warm ; the winters are warm and short .
Because of its landscapes and its vineyards the Gers is now and then called by some the `` Tuscany of France '' .

Germaine Tailleferre -LRB- 19 April 1892 - 7 November 1983 -RRB- was a French composer and the only female member of the famous composers ' group Les Six .
Ravel encouraged her to enter the Prix de Rome Competition .
Tailleferre wrote many of her most important works during the 1920s , including her 1st Piano Concerto , The Harp Concertino , the Ballets `` Le marchand d'oiseaux '' -LRB- the most frequently performed ballet in the repertoire of the Ballets SuÃ dois during the 1920s -RRB- and `` La nouvelle CythÃ re '' which was commissioned by Diaghilev for the ill-fated 1929 season of the famous Ballets Russes , and `` Sous le ramparts d'Ath Ã nes '' in collaboration with Paul Claudel , as well as several pioneering film scores , including `` B ` anda '' in which she used African themes .
Born Marcelle Taillefesse at Saint-Maur-des-Foss Ã s , Val-de-Marne , France , as a young woman she changed her last name to `` Tailleferre '' to spite her father who had refused to support her musical studies .
She studied piano with her mother at home , composing short works of her own , after which she began studying at the Paris Conservatory where she met Louis Durey , Francis Poulenc , Darius Milhaud , Georges Auric and Arthur Honegger .
Her work in film music included `` Le petit chose '' by Maurice Cloche and a series of documentaries .
They divorced shortly thereafter .
She remained in the United States until 1927 when she and her husband returned to France .
In 1925 , she married Ralph Barton , an American caricaturist , and moved to Manhattan , New York .
In 1923 , Tailleferre began to spend a great deal of time with Maurice Ravel at his home in Monfort-L ` Amaury .

In the 2000s , some of the active topics have been the role of gene duplication in the emergence of novel gene function , the extent of adaptive molecular evolution versus neutral drift , and the identification of molecular changes responsible for various human characteristics especially those pertaining to infection , disease , and cognition .
Molecular systematics has been made possible by the availability of techniques for DNA sequencing , which allow the determination of the exact sequence of nucleotides or bases in either DNA or RNA .
Some of the key topics that spurred development of the field have been the evolution of enzyme function , the use of nucleic acid divergence as a `` molecular clock '' to study species divergence , and the origin of noncoding DNA .
Molecular evolution emerged as a scientific field in the 1960s as researchers from molecular biology , evolutionary biology and population genetics sought to understand recent discoveries on the structure and function of nucleic acids and protein .
At present it is still a long and expensive process to sequence the entire genome of an organism , and this has been done for only a few species .
Molecular evolution is the process of evolution at the scale of DNA , RNA , and proteins .
Molecular systematics is a product of the traditional field of systematics and molecular genetics . It is the process of using data on the molecular constitution of biological organisms ' DNA , RNA , or both , in order to resolve questions in systematics , i.e. about their correct scientific classification or taxonomy from the point of view of evolutionary biology .
Recent advances in genomics , including whole-genome sequencing , high-throughput protein characterization , and bioinformatics have led to a dramatic increase in studies on the topic .
In pre-modern society , the ordeal typically ranked along with the oath and witness accounts as the central means by which to reach a judicial verdict .
Johannes Hartlieb in 1456 reports a popular superstition of how to identify a thief by an ordeal by ingestion practiced privately without judicial sanction .
Priestly cooperation in trials by fire and water was forbidden by Pope Innocent III at the Fourth Lateran Council of 1215 , and replaced by compurgation .
The practice has much earlier roots , however , being attested as far back as the Code of Hammurabi and the Code of Ur-Nammu , and also in animist tribal societies , such as the trial by ingestion of `` red water '' -LRB- calabar bean -RRB- in Sierra Leone , where the intended effect is magical rather than invocation of a deity 's justice .
Trials by ordeal became rarer over the Late Middle Ages , often replaced by confessions extracted under torture , but the practice was discontinued only in the 16th century .
Indeed , the term ordeal itself , Old English ordÇ # l , has the meaning of `` judgment , verdict '' -LRB- German Urteil , Dutch oordeel -RRB- , from Proto-Germanic \* uzdailjam `` that which is dealt out '' .
Sullivan is a city in Moultrie County , Illinois , United States .
These references to the gods include a character comparing a mortal woman to a god , or saying he would rather be loved by a woman than by the gods .
Whether to honor a character or to mock him , these references were demeaning to the gods .
It is not uncommon , too , for a character to scorn the gods , as seen in Poenulus and Rudens .
Plautus perhaps does this to demoralize the characters .
Naeviusâ imprisonment and eventual exile , an example of state censorship , may have influenced Plautusâ choice of subject matter and manner .
His studies allowed him to produce his plays , which were released between c. 205 and 184 BC .
His acting talent was eventually discovered ; and he adopted the names `` Maccius '' -LRB- a clownish stock-character in popular farces -RRB- and `` Plautus '' -LRB- a term meaning either `` flat-footed '' or `` flat-eared , '' like the ears of a hound -RRB- .
In disposing of highly complex individuals , Plautus was supplying his audience with what it wanted , since â the audience to whose tastes Plautus catered was not interested in the character play , â but instead wanted the broad and accessible humor offered by stock set-ups .
It is from this work , perhaps , that his love of the theater originated .
His comedies are the earliest surviving intact works in Latin literature .
As Walter Juniper wrote , â Everything , including artistic characterization and consistency of characterization , were sacrificed to humor , and character portrayal remained only where it was necessary for the success of the plot and humor to have a persona who stayed in character , and where the persona by his portrayal contributed to humor .
For example , in Miles Gloriosus , the titular â braggart soldierâ Pyrgopolynices only shows his vain and immodest side in the first act , while the parasite Artotrogus exaggerates Pyrgopolynicesâ achievements , creating more and more ludicrous claims that Pyrgopolynices agrees to without question .
Any character in his plays could be compared to a god .
Plautus was sometimes accused of teaching the public indifference and mockery of the gods .
Young men , meant to represent the upper social class , often belittle the gods in their remarks .
Pyrgopolynices from Miles Gloriosus -LRB- vs. 1265 -RRB- , in bragging about his long life , says he was born one day later than Jupiter .
Naevius is most famous for having been imprisoned by the Metelli and the Scipionesâ '' two powerful families of the late 3rd century .
Tolliver argues that drama both reflects and foreshadows social change .
However , when a character scorns a god , it is usually a character of low standing , such as a pimp .
In Pseudolus , Jupiter is compared to Ballio the pimp .
Not much is known about Titus Maccius Plautus ' early life .
These two are perfect examples of the stock characters of the pompous soldier and the desperate parasite that appeared in Plautine comedies .
The state controlled stage productions , and Plautusâ plays would have been banned , had they been too risquÃ .
It is likely that there was already much skepticism about the gods in Plautusâ era .
His first tragedy took place in 235 BC . Plautus would have been living at the exact time as Naevius , but began writing later .
Soldiers often bring ridicule among the gods .
Parasites , pimps , and courtesans often praise the gods with scant ceremony .
Plautus did not make up or encourage irreverence to the gods , but reflected ideas of his time .
Gnaeus Naevius , another Roman playwright of the late 3rd century BC , wrote tragedies and even founded the fabula praetexta -LRB- history plays -RRB- , in which he dramatized historical events .

Recipe for Hate is Bad Religion 's seventh full-length album , released on September 21 , 1993 . This was their last album on Epitaph Records and the band switched to Atlantic Records before its release .
The album got the band 's highest U.S. chart position to date , debuting at # 14 on Billboard 's Heatseekers chart , with `` American Jesus '' and `` Struck a Nerve '' in particular becoming major rock radio hits at their time .
While the album was released on a major label , Recipe for Hate initially received mixed reviews from music critics , who generally found it to be less impressive than Bad Religion 's past releases , though it has gained a cult following in recent times .

The study of folklore is sometimes called folkloristics .
Folklore consists of legends , music , oral history , proverbs , jokes , popular beliefs , fairy tales and customs that are the traditions of that culture , subculture , or group .

The name was announced as Thrym in IAU Circular 8177 .
It was discovered by Gladman , et al . in 2000 , and given the temporary designation S\/2000 S 7 .
Thrymr is about 5.6 km -LRB- 3.48 miles -RRB- in diameter , and orbits Saturn at an average distance of 20,810 Mm in 1120.809 days , at an inclination of 175 Â to the ecliptic -LRB- 151 Â to Saturn 's equator -RRB- , in a retrograde direction and with an eccentricity of 0.453 .
However , the IAU Working Group on Planetary System Nomenclature later decided to add the nominative case ending - r to the root Thrym .
Its name comes from Norse mythology , where Thrymr is a Jotun or frost giant .
Thrymr or Saturn XXX , is a natural satellite of Saturn .
Thrymr may have formed from debris knocked off of Phoebe at some point in the past .

`` The Little Mermaid '' is a fairy tale by the Danish poet and author Hans Christian Andersen about a young mermaid willing to give up her life in the sea and her identity as a mermaid to gain a human soul and the love of a human prince .
Fort Campbell is a United States Army installation located astraddle the Kentucky-Tennessee border between Hopkinsville , Kentucky , and Clarksville , Tennessee .
The fort is named in honor of Union Army Brigadier General William Bowen Campbell , the last Whig Governor of Tennessee .

It was the mathematical aspect of surveying that led him to exploring the geometrical significance of complex numbers .
Wessel 's elder brother Johan Herman Wessel was a major name in Danish-Norwegian literature .
Wessel 's approach on addition was : `` Two straight lines are added if we unite them in such a way that the second line begins where the first one ends and then pass a straight line from the first to the last point of the united lines .
In 1763 , having completed secondary school , he went to Denmark for further studies -LRB- Norway having no university at the time -RRB- .
Since it was in Danish , it passed almost unnoticed , and the same results were later independently found by Argand and Gauss .
Even though this was n't Wessel 's main intention with the publication , he felt that a geometrical concept of numbers , with length and direction , was needed .
His paper was re-issued in French translation in 1899 , and in English in 1999 as On the analytic representation of direction -LRB- ed .
In 1778 he acquired the degree of candidatus juris .
From 1794 , however , he was employed as a surveyor -LRB- from 1798 as Royal inspector of Surveying -RRB- .
This line is the sum of the united lines '' .
This is the same idea as used today when summing vectors .
Wessel was born in Jonsrud , Vestby , Akershus , Norway .
Caspar Wessel -LRB- June 8 , 1745 - March 25 , 1818 -RRB- was a Danish-Norwegian mathematician .
J. LÃ 1\/4 tzen et al . -RRB- .
His fundamental paper , Om directionens analytiske betegning , was published in 1799 by the Royal Danish Academy of Sciences and Letters .
Craig James Brown CBE -LRB- born 1 July 1940 in Hamilton , South Lanarkshire -RRB- is a Scottish former professional football player and manager .
Ewerthon Henrique de Souza -LRB- born 10 June 1981 in SÃ # o Paulo , Brazil -RRB- is a Brazilian international football player .
The area south of the Antarctic Circle is known as the Antarctic , and the zone immediately to the north is called the Southern Temperate Zone .
Every place south of the Antarctic Circle experiences a period of twenty-four hours ' continuous daylight at least once per year , and a period of twenty-four hours ' continuous night time at least once per year .
There are , however , several Antarctic research centers from various nations that are inhabited by teams of scientists that rotate on a seasonal basis .
At least three children have been born in Antarctica , albeit in stations north of the Antarctic Circle . See Demographics of Antarctica .
The continent of Antarctica forms a land mass covering much of the area within the Antarctic Circle .
In previous centuries , some semi-permanent whaling stations were established on the continent and some of the whalers would live there for a year or more .
That is to say , there is at least one whole day during which the sun does not set , and at least one whole day during which the sun does not rise .
The Antarctic Circle is one of the five major circles -LRB- or parallels -RRB- of latitude that mark maps of the Earth .
There is no permanent human population on Earth south of the Antarctic Circle .

Eratosthenes knew that on the summer solstice at local noon in the Ancient Egyptian city of Swenet -LRB- known in Greek as Syene , and in the modern day as Aswan -RRB- on the Tropic of Cancer , the sun would appear at the zenith , directly overhead .
He was the first to calculate the tilt of the Earth 's axis -LRB- also with remarkable accuracy -RRB- . He may also have accurately calculated the distance from the earth to the sun and invented the leap day .
Assuming that the Earth was spherical -LRB- 360 Â -RRB- , and that Alexandria was due north of Syene , he concluded that the meridian arc distance from Alexandria to Syene must therefore be 360 Â \/ 7 Â 12 ' = 1\/50 , and was therefore 1\/50 of the total circumference of the earth .
He rounded the result to a final value of 700 stadia per degree , which implies a circumference of 252,000 stadia .
He invented a system of latitude and longitude . He was the first person to calculate the circumference of the earth by using a measuring system using stades , or the length of stadiums during that time period -LRB- with remarkable accuracy -RRB- .
He also knew , from measurement , that in his hometown of Alexandria , the angle of elevation of the sun was 7 Â 12 ' south of the zenith at the same time .
The common Attic stadion was about 185 m , which would imply a circumference of 46,620 km , i.e. 16.3 % too large .
The exact size of the stadion he used is frequently argued .
Eratosthenes calculated the circumference of the earth without leaving Egypt .
He also created a map of the world based on the available geographical knowledge of the era .
His estimated distance between the cities was 5000 stadia -LRB- about 500 geographical miles or 800 km -RRB- by estimating the time that he had taken to travel from Syene to Alexandria by camel .

Like the Greek Apocalypse of Ezra , the work is clearly Christian , and features several apostles being seen in heaven . However , the text is significantly shorter than the Apocalypse .

Australian pearl divers dive for south sea pearl oysters to be used in the cultured south sea pearl industry .
This limits the number of pearls at a harvest period . The pearls are usually harvested after one year for akoya , 2 â `` 4 years for Tahitian and South Sea , and 2 â `` 7 years for freshwater .
In general , cultured pearls are less valuable than natural pearls , whereas imitation pearls almost have no value .
Imitation or fake pearls are also widely sold in inexpensive jewelry , but the quality of their iridescence is usually very poor , and generally speaking , artificial pearls are easily distinguished from genuine pearls . Pearls have been harvested and cultivated primarily for use in jewelry , but in the past they were also stitched onto lavish clothing .
In a haul of three tons , only three or four oysters will produce perfect pearls . Today , the cultured pearls on the market can be divided into two categories .
However , most freshwater cultured pearls sold today come from China . Saltwater pearls grow within pearl oysters , family Pteriidae , which live in oceans .
Before the days of cultured pearls , black pearls were rare and highly valued for the simple reason that white pearl oysters rarely produced naturally black pearls , and black pearl oysters rarely produced any natural pearls at all .
Cultured or farmed pearls from pearl oysters make up the majority of those that are currently sold .
Pearls from the sea are valued more highly than freshwater pearls . Imitation or fake pearls are also widely sold in inexpensive jewelry , but the quality of their iridescence is usually very poor , and generally speaking , artificial pearls are easily distinguished from genuine pearls .
