Into the Fire is the fifth studio album by the Canadian rock artist Bryan Adams .
Adams headed back to Europe and played in East Berlin and later West Berlin .
Six singles were released from the album : `` Heat of the Night '' , `` Hearts on Fire '' , `` Victim of Love '' , `` Only the Strong Survive '' , `` Into the Fire '' and `` Another Day '' .
Adams heads back to the UK on October 13 in Newcastle , England .
It was recorded at Adams ' home in London , England .
Adams would later sell out two nights in a row at Madison Square Garden in New York City and was visited backstage by Brian Wilson of the Beach Boys , he would later get a sold out show in Toronto , Ontario .
Released on March 30 , 1987 through A&M Records , the album was a commercial success , albeit somewhat of a disappointment following the huge success of 1984 's `` Reckless '' . Into the Fire sold over 4 million units worldwide , peaking at number 7 on the US Billboard 200 chart and reaching high positions in charts worldwide .
Adams would later head back to the United States to continue the American leg of the tour , Adams appeared on Late Night with David Letterman .
Adams sold out four nights in a row at Wembley Arena in London .
Adams first stop of the UK leg of the tour at the Princeâ s Trust charity concert at Wembley Stadium , London .
Adams started the Asian leg of the tour and ended up selling out ten concerts , five of which were in Tokyo 's Budokan .
The last concert part of the Into the Fire tour was played in Locarno , Switzerland .
Into the Fire ends up being certified platinum with sales over 100,000 copies sold in Japan .

It consists of two parts , a rotating armature and fixed field windings surrounding the rotating armature mounted around a shaft .
This was achieved by an accelerating relay -LRB- often called a `` notching relay '' -RRB- in the motor circuit which monitored the fall of current as each step of resistance was cut out .
The availability of high-powered semiconductors -LRB- such as thyristors and the IGBT -RRB- has now made practical the use of much simpler , higher-reliability AC induction motors known as asynchronous traction motors . Synchronous AC motors are also occasionally used , as in the French TGV .
Before the mid-20th century , a single large motor was often used to drive multiple driving wheels through connecting rods that were very similar to those used on steam locomotives .
When the armature and the field windings are connected in series , the whole motor is referred to as `` series-wound '' .
As the DC motor starts to turn , the interaction of the magnetic fields inside causes it to generate a voltage internally .
The motor naturally stops accelerating when the drag of the train matches the torque produced by the motors .
When no resistors are left in the circuit , full line voltage is applied directly to the motor .
The rotating shaft of the motor was also the axle for the wheels .
The armature is another set of coils wound round a central shaft and is connected to the field windings through `` brushes '' which are spring loaded contacts pressing against an extension of the armature called the commutator .
As the motor speeds up , the internally generated voltage rises , the resultant EMF falls , less current passes through the motor and the torque drops .
The fixed field windings consist of tightly wound coils of wire fitted inside the motor case .
Traction motors are used in electrically powered rail vehicles such as electric multiple units and electric locomotives , other electric vehicles such as electric milk floats , elevators and conveyors as well as vehicles with electrical transmission systems such as diesel-electric , electric hybrid vehicles and battery electric vehicles .
On an electric train , the train driver originally had to control the cutting out of resistance manually , but by 1914 , automatic acceleration was being used .
Traditionally , these were DC series-wound motors , usually running on approximately 600 volts .
The `` Bi-Polar '' electric locomotives built by General Electric for the Milwaukee Road had direct drive motors .
Usually , the traction motor is three-point suspended between the bogie frame and the driven axle ; this is referred to as a `` nose-suspended traction motor '' .
Traditionally road vehicles -LRB- cars , buses and trucks -RRB- have used diesel and petrol engines with a mechanical or hydraulic transmission system .
It is now standard practice to provide one traction motor driving each axle through a gear drive .
Traction motor refers to an electric motor providing the primary rotational torque of a machine , usually for conversion into linear motion -LRB- traction -RRB- .
A series-wound DC motor has a low resistance field and armature circuit .
All the driver had to do was select low , medium or full speed -LRB- called `` shunt '' , `` series '' and `` parallel '' from the way the motors were connected in the resistance circuit -RRB- and the automatic equipment would do the rest .
Traditionally , resistors were used to limit the initial current .
The advantage of high current is that the magnetic fields inside the motor are strong , producing high torque -LRB- turning force -RRB- , so it is ideal for starting a train .
Because of the high power levels involved , traction motors are almost always cooled using forced air .

Geomorphologists seek to understand why landscapes look the way they do , to understand landform history and dynamics , and to predict future changes through a combination of field observation , physical experiment , and numerical modeling .

This works by convection ; the heat is transferred from the relatively warm object to the relatively cold coolant .
Absolute zero is also 0 Â R on the Rankine scale , another thermodynamic temperature scale , and â ' 459.67 degrees on the Fahrenheit scale .
Fluids used to cool objects are commonly called coolants .
Air cooling is the process of cooling an object by exposing it to air .
The coldest theoretically possible temperature is absolute zero , also called absolute temperature , which is 0 K on the Kelvin scale , a thermodynamic temperature scale , and â ' 273.15 Â C on the Celsius scale .
Another common method of cooling is exposing an object to ice , dry ice , or liquid nitrogen .
This will only work if the air is at a lower temperature than the object , and the process can be enhanced by increasing the surface area or decreasing the mass of the object .

The Civil Polices of Brazil had origin in the General Intendancy of Police , created in Rio de Janeiro in 1808 .
The services of judiciary police are given through the Police stations of Police , agencies that have jurisdiction on small cities or quarters of the great cities .
27 Civil Polices in Brazil , one for each State of the federacy exist .
Today , the constitutional existence of the Civil Police and its attributions elapse of article 144 , IV and 144 Â 4 Â , of the Federal Constitution .
Civil Police had been gradually developing for all country during the governments Imperial and Republican .
The Civil Polices are agencies of the public administration of the federative units of Brazil , whose function is , in accordance with article 144 of the Federal Constitution of 1988 , the exercise of the public security for the preservation of the public order , of the safety of the people and the patrimony .
They are directed by a Head of Police , chosen amongst the Commission agents of Police of career .
Each of the states of Brazil has its own `` Civil Police Department '' , which carries out detective work , forensics and criminal investigation , acting as a state bureau of investigation , while the `` Military Police '' carries out preventive police duties .
In Brazil , the Civil Police is the name of the investigative state police forces .

In October 1998 , during his first period in the Cabinet , Mandelson was the center of media attention when Matthew Parris -LRB- openly gay former MP and then Parliamentary sketch writer of The Times -RRB- mentioned during a live interview on Newsnight , in the wake of the resignation of Ron Davies , that `` Peter Mandelson is certainly gay '' .

The 1956 Winter Olympics , officially known as the VII Olympic Winter Games , was a winter multi-sport event celebrated in Cortina d'Ampezzo , Italy .
A total of 32 nations sent athletes to Cortina d'Ampezzo .
Along with the Soviet Union , Bolivia and Iran competed at the Winter Games for the first time .
Korea , Liechtenstein , and Turkey returned after having missed the 1952 Winter Olympics , while Argentina , Denmark , New Zealand , and Portugal did not compete at these Games , after having participated in the previous edition .
The Natural History Museum is one of three large museums on Exhibition Road , South Kensington , London , England -LRB- the others are the Science Museum , and the Victoria and Albert Museum -RRB- .
In 1986 , the museum absorbed the adjacent Geological Museum of the British Geological Survey , which had long competed for the limited space available in the area .
The museum 's galleries were completely rebuilt and relaunched in 1996 as The Earth Galleries , with the other exhibitions in the Waterhouse building retitled The Life Galleries .
The Natural History Museum 's own Mineralogy displays remain largely unchanged as an example of the 19th-century display techniques of the Waterhouse building .
Built in two distinct phases , with two new buildings adjacent to the main Waterhouse building , it is the most significant new development project in the museum 's history .
The newly-developed Darwin Centre -LRB- named after Charles Darwin -RRB- is designed as a new home for the museum 's collection of tens of millions of preserved specimens , as well as new work spaces for the museum 's scientific staff , and new educational visitor experiences .
Even after the opening , legally the NHM remained a department of the British Museum with the formal name British Museum -LRB- Natural History -RRB- , usually abbreviated in the scientific literature as B.M. -LRB- N.H. -RRB- or BMNH .

Mulhouse is the chief city of an arrondissement of the Haut-Rhin department , of which it is a sub-prefecture .
In RNA , thymine is replaced by uracil -LRB- U -RRB- .
In molecular biology and genetics , two nucleotides on opposite complementary DNA or RNA strands that are connected via hydrogen bonds are called a base pair -LRB- often abbreviated bp -RRB- .
In the canonical Watson-Crick DNA base pairing , adenine -LRB- A -RRB- forms a base pair with thymine -LRB- T -RRB- and guanine -LRB- G -RRB- forms a base pair with cytosine -LRB- C -RRB- .

The orbits of centaurs are unstable due to perturbations by the giant planets .
At perihelion , it moves much closer to the Sun than Uranus , while at aphelion it moves out well beyond the orbit of Neptune .
7066 Nessus -LRB- ; from -RRB- is a centaur -LRB- a type of icy planetoid -RRB- that was discovered by David L. Rabinowitz , working with Spacewatch , at Kitt Peak on 26 April 1993 .
Nessus is estimated to have a relatively long orbital half-life of about 4.9 Myr .
It was the second centaur found by him -LRB- 5145 Pholus being his previous find -RRB- , and the third centaur discovery -LRB- 2060 Chiron was the first -RRB- .
7066 Nessus has an orbital period of 122.4 years , an eccentricity of 0.52 and an inclination to the ecliptic of 15.6 degrees .

With the addition of X11 , this version marks the transition away from a text-only system .
This was famously disapproved of by Tanenbaum in the Tanenbaumâ `` Torvalds debate .
Tanenbaum explained again his rationale for using a microkernel in May 2006 .
Its licensing fee was very small -LRB- $ 69 -RRB- compared to those of other operating systems .
MINIX is a Unix-like computer operating system based on a microkernel architecture created by Andrew S. Tanenbaum for educational purposes ; MINIX also inspired the creation of the Linux kernel .
Although Tanenbaum wished for MINIX to be as accessible as possible to students , his publisher was not prepared to offer material -LRB- such as the source code -RRB- that could be copied freely , so a restrictive license requiring a nominal fee -LRB- included in the price of Tanenbaum 's book -RRB- was applied as a compromise . This prevented the use of MINIX as the basis for a freely distributed software system .
The design principles Tanenbaum applied to MINIX greatly influenced the design decisions Linus Torvalds applied in the creation of the Linux kernel .
It contains X11 , emacs , vi , cc , gcc , perl , python , ash , bash , zsh , ftp , ssh , telnet , pine , and over 400 other common Unix utility programs .
MINIX -LRB- from `` mini-Unix '' -RRB- was first released in 1987 , with its complete source code made available to universities for study in courses and research . It has been free and open source software since it was re-licensed under the BSD license in April 2000 .
Torvalds used and appreciated MINIX , but his design deviated from the MINIX architecture in significant ways , most notably by employing a monolithic kernel instead of a microkernel .
In May 2004 , Kenneth Brown of the Alexis de Tocqueville Institution made the accusation that major parts of the Linux kernel had been copied from the MINIX codebase , in a book called Samizdat .
These accusations were rebutted universallyâ '' most prominently by Andrew Tanenbaum himself , who strongly criticised Kenneth Brown and published a long rebuttal on his own personal website .
When free and open source Unix-like operating systems such as Linux and 386BSD became available in the early 1990s many volunteer software developers abandoned MINIX in favor of these .
Andrew S. Tanenbaum created MINIX at Vrije Universiteit in Amsterdam to exemplify the principles conveyed in his textbook , Operating Systems : Design and Implementation -LRB- 1987 -RRB- .
In April 2000 , MINIX became free\/open source software under a permissive free software licence , but by this time other operating systems had surpassed its capabilities , and it remained primarily an operating system for students and hobbyists .
According to the Nihonshoki and GukanshÅ , Bidatsu had four empresses and 16 Imperial children -LRB- 6 sons and 10 daughters -RRB- .
The actual site of Bidatsu 's grave is known . This emperor is traditionally venerated at a memorial Shinto shrine -LRB- misasagi -RRB- at Osaka .
Though he had many children , none of them would ever become emperor .
The emperor died from a disease which afflicted him with sores , apparently the first royal victim of smallpox in Japan .
Emperor Bidatsu was the 30th emperor of Japan , according to the traditional order of succession .
He was the second son of Emperor Kimmei by his consort Iwahime , a daughter of Emperor Senka .

Though similar to the existing Class 08 shunting locomotives , Class 09 were re-geared to give a maximum top speed of 27.5 mph -LRB- 44 km\/h -RRB- at the expense of a lower tractive effort .

The bear character originates from the popular bulletin board system -LRB- BBS -RRB- website 2channel in Japan , where it was introduced as ã ã ã 1\/4 -LRB- KumÄ -RRB- , which is an interjection of the word ã ã 3\/4 -LRB- Kuma -RRB- meaning bear in Japanese . In spite of the impression of Pedobear in Europe and the United States , KumÄ is not associated with any sexual thing such as pedophilia .

`` Mean Mr. Mustard '' is a song written by John Lennon -LRB- credited to Lennon\/McCartney -RRB- and performed by The Beatles on their album , Abbey Road .
As with the performance of `` She 's Leaving Home '' also in the film , the computerized singing of the Computerettes was performed by the Bee Gees .
Additionally , the original version of the song was a quieter acoustic rendition and was over 4 minutes in length .
According to Lennon , `` In ` Mean Mr. Mustard ' , I said ` his sister Pam ' â '' originally it was ` his sister Shirley ' in the lyric .
The Abbey Road version was recorded with `` Sun King '' in one continuous piece .
The version in the Sgt. Pepper 's Lonely Hearts Club Band film was performed by Mean Mr. Mustard -LRB- played by Frankie Howerd -RRB- and his evil robot companions named the Computerettes .
The song was written in India ; Lennon said that it was inspired by a newspaper story about a miser who concealed his cash wherever he could in order to prevent people from forcing him to spend it .
A demo version of the song was recorded in May 1968 at Kinfauns , George Harrison 's home in Esher , and appears on Anthology 3 .
In that version , Mustard 's sister is named Shirley .
I changed it to Pam to make it sound like it had something to do with it . ''
Lennon changed it to Pam when he saw the opportunity to ease the segue into the song `` Polythene Pam '' , which follows `` Mean Mr. Mustard '' on the album .
On reflection , he did not think highly of the composition , describing it in Anthology as `` a bit of crap I wrote in India . ''

The Kara receives a large amount of freshwater from the Ob , Yenisei , Pyasina , and Taimyra rivers , so its salinity is variable .
The Kara Sea is roughly 1,450 kilometres long and 970 kilometres wide with an area of around 880,000 kmÂ and a mean depth of 110 m.
There is concern about radioactive contamination from nuclear waste the former Soviet Union dumped in the sea and the effect this will have on the marine environment . According to an official `` White Paper '' report compiled and released by the Russian government in March 1993 , the Soviet Union dumped six nuclear submarine reactors and ten nuclear reactors into the Kara Sea between 1965-1988 .
It is separated from the Barents Sea to the west by the Kara Strait and Novaya Zemlya , and the Laptev Sea to the east by the Severnaya Zemlya .
Significant discoveries of petroleum and natural gas , an extension of the West Siberian Oil Basin , have been made but have not yet been developed .
A subsequent appraisal by the International Atomic Energy Agency showed that releases are low and localized from the 16 naval reactors -LRB- reported by the IAEA as having come from seven submarines and the icebreaker `` Lenin '' -RRB- which were dumped at five sites in the Kara Sea .
Its main ports are Novy Port and Dikson and it is important as a fishing ground although the sea is ice-bound for all but two months of the year .
The Kara Sea -LRB- Russian : Ð Ð Ì Ñ Ñ Ð Ð 3\/4 Ð Ð 1\/4 Ð 3\/4 Ì Ñ Ð -RRB- is part of the Arctic Ocean north of Siberia .
TIFF has not had a major update since 1992 , though several Aldus\/Adobe technical notes have been published with minor extensions to the format , and several specifications , including TIFF\/EP -LRB- ISO 12234-2 -RRB- , TIFF\/IT -LRB- ISO 12639 -RRB- , TIFF-F -LRB- RFC 2306 -RRB- and TIFF-FX -LRB- RFC 3949 -RRB- have been based on the TIFF 6.0 specification .
Adobe holds the copyright on the TIFF specification -LRB- aka TIFF 6.0 -RRB- along with the two supplements that have been published .
Tagged Image File Format -LRB- abbreviated TIFF -RRB- is a file format for storing images , popular among Apple Macintosh owners , graphic artists , the publishing industry , and both amateur and professional photographers in general .
Originally created by the company Aldus for use with what was then called `` desktop publishing '' , the TIFF format is widely supported by image-manipulation applications , by publishing and page layout applications , by scanning , faxing , word processing , optical character recognition and other applications .
As of 2009 , it is under the control of Adobe Systems .
Adobe Systems , which acquired Aldus , now holds the copyright to the TIFF specification .
Noraduz cemetery is a medieval cemetery with a large number of early khachkars located in the village of Noratus , Gegharkunik marz near Gavar and Lake Sevan , 90 km north of Yerevan .
During the revival of the khachkar tradition in the 16-17th centuries many khachkars were built under the yoke of the Safavid Empire when oriental influences seeped into Armenian art .
The oldest khachkars in the cemetery date back to the late 10th century .
According to one story the villagers placed helmets on top of the khachkars and leaned swords against them .
From a distance the khachkars looked like armed soldiers holding a defensive position as a result of which Tamerlaneâ s army retreated .
A popular folktale associated with the cemetery concerns the invading army of Tamerlane .
Three master carvers from this period carved khachkars in Noraduz , the most notable of whom was Kiram Kazmogh -LRB- 1551-1610 -RRB- , his contemporaries were Arakel and Meliset .
The Territory of Michigan was an organized incorporated territory of the United States that existed from June 30 , 1805 , until January 26 , 1837 , when the final extent of the territory was admitted to the Union as the State of Michigan .
In 1800 , the whole of the Northwest Territory had 43,365 residents .
Detroit was the territorial capital .
Under the Northwest Ordinance , a territory could apply for statehood once it had surpassed 60,000 inhabitants .
The company was formed in 1925 from a number of major companies that had been working together closely since World War I. During its heyday IG Farben was the fourth-largest company in the world , after General Motors , U.S. Steel and Standard Oil . During the planning of the invasion of Czechoslovakia and Poland , IG Farben cooperated closely with Nazi officials and directed which chemical plants should be secured and delivered to IG Farben .

Anthology is a compilation album by Canadian singer-songwriter Bryan Adams which contains songs he recorded from 1978 through 2005 .
On the first disc , the North American edition has `` The Best of Me '' as the last track , while the International edition moved the song to the 2nd disc , and had `` All I Want Is You '' instead .
Anthology peaked at number 4 on the Canadian Album Chart and number 29 on the UK Albums Chart .
The two disc set includes songs from 1980 -- 2005 .
All the songs are in chronological order of their release , except the last song on the first disc on the North American edition , which was released in 1999 .
A third disc which was a DVD live concert which was recorded in mid 2005 called `` Live in Lisbon '' was included in North America for a limited time .
N.B. was not released in North America , but six tracks from it were included with seven new ones and released in 2008 as Pocketful of Sunshine , with the singles `` Love Like This '' and `` Pocketful of Sunshine '' earning success on the charts . In December 2010 , Bedingfield released her third album in North America named Strip Me .

Philosophical skepticism -LRB- from Greek Ï Î Î Ï Î Ï - skepsis meaning `` enquiry '' - UK spelling , scepticism -RRB- is both a philosophical school of thought and a method that crosses disciplines and cultures .
This skepticism can range from disbelief in contemporary philosophical solutions , to agnosticism , to rejecting the reality of the external world .
In Islamic philosophy , skepticism was established by Al-Ghazali -LRB- 1058 â `` 1111 -RRB- , known in the West as `` Algazel '' , as part of the orthodox Ash ` ari school of Islamic theology .
Many skeptics critically examine the meaning systems of their times , and this examination often results in a position of ambiguity or doubt .
One kind of scientific skepticism refers to the critical analysis of claims lacking empirical evidence .

Roseraie du Val-de-Marne or Roseraie de L'Ha Ã is a garden devoted to roses established in 1899 on rue Albert Watel in L'Ha Ã - les-Roses , Val-de-Marne , France .
Laid out in thirteen formal sections , today Roseraie du Val-de-Marne has a total of 13,100 rose bushes featuring 3200 species and varieties .

From a geometric point of view , all points on a sphere are equivalent -- one could select any arbitrary point on the Earth , and create a paper map that covers the Earth with strips that come together at that point and the antipodal point .
The sphericity of the Earth was established by Hellenistic astronomy in the 3rd century BCE , and the earliest terrestrial globe appeared from that period .
This makes it easy to visualize how days and seasons change .
A facsimile globe showing America was made by Martin Waldseemueller in 1507 .
Early terrestrial globes depicting the entirety of the Old World were constructed in the Islamic Golden Age .
An example of a surviving celestial globe is part of a Hellenistic sculpture , called the Farnese Atlas , surviving in a 2nd century AD Roman copy in the Naples Museum , Naples , Italy .
Mass-produced globes are typically covered by a printed paper map .
One such example was constructed in the 9th century by Muslim geographers and cartographers working under the Abbasid caliph , Al-Ma ` mun .
Another early globe , the Hunt-Lenox Globe , ca .
Then a small disk is used to paper over the inevitable irregularities at the poles .
The earliest known example is the one constructed by Crates of Mallus in Cilicia -LRB- now Ã ukurova in modern-day Turkey -RRB- , in the mid-2nd century BCE .
The word `` globe '' comes from the Latin word globus , meaning round mass or sphere .
The most common type has long , thin gores -LRB- strips -RRB- of paper that narrow to a point at the North Pole and the South Pole .
Another `` remarkably modern-looking '' terrestrial globe of the Earth was constructed by Taqi al-Din at the Istanbul observatory of Taqi al-Din during the 1570s .
The more gores there are , the less stretching and crumpling is required to make the paper map fit the sphere .
1507 , is thought to be the source of the phrase `` Here be dragons . ''
In addition to making it easy to use this mounting also represents the angle of the planet in relation to its sun and the spin of the planet .
A globe is usually mounted at a 23.5 Â angle on bearings .
The oldest surviving terrestrial globe is credited to Martin Behaim in NÃ 1\/4 rnberg , Germany , in 1492 .
No terrestrial globes from Antiquity or the Middle Ages have survived .
Another example was the terrestrial globe introduced to Beijing by the Persian astronomer , Jamal ad-Din , in 1267 .

`` Sveccha means one 's own wish or free will .
The term `` Paro '' means a mysterious or secret pattern to that action done by one 's own Will .
Doing one 's own Will .
The concluding Sanskrit expression in the Avadhoota Upanishad is `` Svecchachara Paro . ''
In other words , we do our Will but with discretion , not making it too obvious , nor to harm or hurt other people .
Svecchachara means a way of life where one acts as one wishes and does what is right in one 's own eyes .

In around 400 BC sphairai were introduced .
In time , the boxers began to fight while standing and wearing gloves -LRB- with spikes -RRB- and wrappings on their arms below the elbows , but otherwise they fought naked .
Korykos were the equivalent to modern punching bags .
Participants trained on punching bags -LRB- called a korykos -RRB- .
However , Spartans never participated in the competitive aspect of boxing , believing the means of defeat to be dishonorable .
They were thongs of ox hide approximately 3 to 3.7 meters long that were wrapped around the hands and knuckles numerous times .
One legend holds that the heroic ruler Theseus invented a form of boxing in which two men sat face to face and beat each other with their fists until one of them was killed .
Boxing was among the contests held in memorial of Achilles ' slain friend Patroclus , toward the end of the Trojan war .
The sphairai were very similar to himantes .
According to the Iliad , Mycenaean warriors included boxing among their competitions honoring the fallen , though it is possible that the Homeric epics reflect later Greek culture .
Fighters wore leather straps -LRB- called himantes -RRB- over their hands -LRB- leaving the fingers free -RRB- , wrists , and sometimes breast , to protect themselves from injury .
Soon after the implementation of the sphairai , the oxys were introduced to boxing .
It was in commemoration of Patroclus that the Greeks later introduced boxing -LRB- pygme \/ pygmachia -RRB- to the Olympic Games in 688 BC .
The scholar and historian Philostratus maintained that boxing was originally developed in Sparta , in order to harden warriorsâ faces for battle .
A band of fleece was placed on the forearm to wipe away sweat .
They were used for practice in the Palaestra and were filled with sand , flour , or millet .
They consisted of several thick leather bands encircling the hand , wrist , and forearm .
There are numerous legends about the origins of boxing in Greece .
Leather braces extended up the forearm to give greater support when punching and the knuckles were reinforced with leather as well .
The early Spartans believed helmets were unnecessary and boxing prepared them for the inevitable blows to the head they would receive in battle .
Until around 500 BC himantes were used as protection for the knuckles and hand .
The only notable difference was that they contained a padded interior when wrapped around the hands and the exterior of the thong was notably more rigid and hard .
Natural ytterbium is a mix of seven stable isotopes .
A soft silvery metallic element , ytterbium is a rare earth element of the lanthanide series and is found in the minerals gadolinite , monazite , and xenotime .
Ytterbium is a chemical element with the symbol Yb and atomic number 70 .

In 1971 , he made a cello out of three television sets stacked up on top of each other and some cello strings .
Nam June Paik -LRB- July 20 , 1932 -- January 29 , 2006 -RRB- was a Korean-born American artist .
Some Catholics have attempted to form cohesive theories of modesty .
One traditional opinion is that Muslim women are required to observe the hijab , covering everything but the hands and face , as a sign of modesty .
Non-orthodox Jewish women tend to adopt the fashions of the non-Jewish society in which they live .
The taqiyah cap may vary in shape , size or color just as the hijab does , with many regional differences according to tradition and personal taste .
Another example is Giuseppe Cardinal Siri of Genoa , who stated that trousers were unacceptable dress for women .
Sometimes this is from a sociological perspective , while at other times it takes a more systematic , Thomistic approach , combined with the writings of the Church Fathers .
In 1992 , New York State 's highest court accepted 14th Amendment arguments and struck down the provision in New York 's Exposure of the Person statute that made it illegal for women to bare their chests where men were permitted to do so .
Naturists reject contemporary Western standards of modesty which discourage personal , family , and social nudity , and seek to create a social environment where people feel comfortable in the company of nude people , and being seen nude , either just by other nudists , or also by the general public .
Some communities apply these standards to girls as young as three .
In Orthodox Judaism , women wear skirts to their knees and to cover their elbows , with blouses covering the collarbone and sleeves coming to or covering elbows .
People can be subjected to peer pressure , both to conform to community standards or to flout them .
Excessive immodesty is called exhibitionism .
Approaches arguing primarily from traditional practices and traditional authorities , such as the saints , can also be found .
The Church also expects men to dress modestly , but the demands are not as strict for them as for women ; this is largely because men are often thought to be more inherently susceptible to sexual thoughts .
Pope Pius XII stated that women should cover their upper arms and shoulders , that their skirts should cover at least as far as the knee , and the neckline should not reveal anything .
Physical modesty dominates the social stage . Fashions and fads at times test the limits of community standards of modesty .
Likewise , men are required to cover everything from ` navel to knee ' ; with some men choosing to extend this to the traditional Islamic head covering taqiyah -LRB- cap -RRB- , the male counterpart to hijab which closely resembles the Jewish yarmulke or kippah but is slightly larger in size .
See-through materials may not be used and clothes are expected not to be tight-fitting , provocative , loud in color , or display texts .
On the other hand , even in an emergency situation some people still insist on maintaining their standards of modesty .
Proponents of modesty often see it as a demonstration of respect for their bodies , for social norms , and for the feelings of themselves and others . Some people believe modesty may reduce sexual crimes .
Modesty has been and continues to be considered important in Islamic society , but the interpretation of what dress constitutes modesty varies .

Other active bushrangers included Dan Morgan , based in the Murray River , and Captain Thunderbolt , killed outside Uralla .
The increasing push of settlement , increased police efficiency , improvements in rail transport and communications technology , such as telegraphy , made it increasingly difficult for bushrangers to evade capture .
In 1900 the indigenous Governor Brothers terrorised much of northern New South Wales .
Bushranging was common on the mainland , but Van Diemen 's Land -LRB- Tasmania -RRB- produced the most violent and serious outbreaks of convict bushrangers .
Leading a band of escaped convicts , Donahue became central to Australian folklore as the Wild Colonial Boy .
He was reported in newspapers around 1827 as being responsible for an outbreak of bushranging on the road between Sydney and Windsor .
Among the last bushrangers was the Kelly Gang led by Ned Kelly , who were captured at Glenrowan in 1880 , two years after they were outlawed .
The bushrangers ' heyday was the Gold Rush years of the 1850s and 1860s as the discovery of gold gave bushrangers access to great wealth that was portable and easily converted to cash .
Indigenous outlaw Musquito defied colonial law and led attacks on settlers .
John `` Black '' Caesar is generally regarded as the first bushranger .
Bold Jack Donahue is recorded as the last convict bushranger .
He bolted from Sydney Cove several times before being shot and killed by a settler at liberty plains in 1796 .
George Melville was hanged in front of a large crowd for robbing the McIvor gold escort near Castlemaine in 1853 .
Frank Gardiner , John Gilbert and Ben Hall led the most notorious gangs of the period .
Throughout the 1830s he was regarded as the most notorious bushranger in the colony .
Hundreds of convicts were at large in the bush , farms were abandoned and martial law was proclaimed .
Much of the activity in this era was in the Lachlan Valley , around Forbes , Yass and Cowra .
Bushranging numbers flourished in New South Wales with the rise of the colonial-born sons of poor , often ex-convict squatters who were drawn to a more glamorous life than mining or farming .

Alaska plaice feed mostly on polychaetes , but also eat amphipods and echiurans .
Like most flatfish , they live on the bottom of the continental shelf , up to 600 metres deep .
Their geographic range is from the Gulf of Alaska in the east , to the Chukchi Sea in the north , to the Sea of Japan in the west .
The 2005 total allowable catch in the Bering Sea and Aleutian Islands management area -LRB- BSAI -RRB- was reached before the end of May of that year .

Alaska plaice can live for up to 30 years , and grow to 60 centimetres -LRB- 24 inches -RRB- long , but most that get caught are only seven or eight years old , and about 30 cm -LRB- 12 in -RRB- .

My Chemical Romance 's general style has been categorized as `` alternative rock '' , `` post-hardcore '' , `` punk revival '' , `` pop punk '' and , most controversially , `` emo '' .
The band 's official website describes their music as simply `` rock '' or `` violent , dangerous pop '' .
Way has also said that his band patterns their career after that of The Smashing Pumpkins , another band they admire .
However , Way has reportedly also described the band 's style as `` What-else-ya-got-emo '' .
Lead singer Gerard Way has stated that the band is heavily influenced by Queen , The Misfits , Black Flag , Iron Maiden , The Cure , Joy Division , Bauhaus , Siouxsie and the Banshees , and The Smiths\/Morrisey .
Way said to Rolling Stone , `` We love bands like Queen , where it 's huge and majestic , but also bands like Black Flag and the Misfits , who would go absolutely crazy . ''
Band frontman Gerard Way has publicly rejected the term `` emo '' , describing the genre as `` fucking garbage '' .

Harvey Bernard Milk -LRB- May 22 , 1930 â `` November 27 , 1978 -RRB- was an American politician who became the first openly gay man to be elected to public office in California , when he won a seat on the San Francisco Board of Supervisors .
Milk served 11 months in office and was responsible for passing a stringent gay rights ordinance for the city .
Despite his short career in politics , Milk became an icon in San Francisco and `` a martyr for gay rights '' , according to University of San Francisco professor Peter Novak .
Anne Kronenberg , his final campaign manager , wrote of him : `` What set Harvey apart from you or me was that he was a visionary .
Milk was posthumously awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 2009 .
In 2002 , Milk was called `` the most famous and most significantly open LGBT official ever elected in the United States '' .
Milk moved from New York City to settle in San Francisco in 1972 amid a migration of gay men to the Castro District .
He imagined a righteous world inside his head and then he set about to create it for real , for all of us . ''

Beryl dropped moderate precipitation just offshore , though the maximum precipitation total in the United States was only 0.97 inches -LRB- 24.6 mm -RRB- on Nantucket .
Throughout much of its duration , the storm tracked through an environment with light vertical wind shear and well-established upper-level outflow .
Across southeastern Massachusetts , police departments maintained extra staff in preparation for any potential problems from the storm .
Shortly after becoming a tropical storm , the low-level circulation of Beryl became exposed with limited deep convection , though deep convection re-developed the following morning .
The only reported damage were some downed telephone poles and fallen tree branches .
About 22 hours before landfall , the National Hurricane Center replaced the watch with a tropical storm warning for the same area , and also issued a tropical storm watch from Woods Hole , Massachusetts westward to New Haven , Connecticut and for the eastern portion of Long Island from east of Fire Island to Port Jefferson .
Overall damage was minor .
Forecasters initially predicted Beryl to brush the Carolinas ; as such , a tropical storm watch was issued for the eastern coast of North Carolina from Cape Lookout northward to Currituck Beach Lighthouse .
Moderate winds were reported along its path , which peaked at 60 mph -LRB- 96 km\/h -RRB- in southern Nova Scotia .
The depression moved slowly to the north-northwest through a break in the subtropical ridge , and as convective banding features became more prominent the system intensified into Tropical Storm Beryl .
Rainfall along southeastern Massachusetts reached 0.33 inches -LRB- 8.38 mm -RRB- at Chatham .
Hours later , it made landfall in southwestern Nova Scotia , and on July 22 the extratropical remnants of Beryl merged with an approaching cold front over Newfoundland .
Beryl produced rough seas along the northeast United States coastline .
Beryl later produced moderate rainfall and gusty winds across Atlantic Canada , resulting in some localized power outages though little damage .
No deaths were reported .
In anticipation of heavy rainfall , the agency also issued heavy rainfall warnings for western Nova Scotia , including Halifax .
Several days prior to the passage of Beryl through Atlantic Canada , the Canadian Hurricane Centre issued gale warnings for the coastal waters off Nova Scotia and Newfoundland .
High surf also occurred along the southern coast of Massachusetts and Rhode Island .
Local Red Cross chapters were opened , as well , with two volunteer teams placed on standby to assist .
Many fishermen secured their boats , while some business owners boarded up windows to prevent storm damage .
Late on July 20 , it began a slow weakening trend after passing over cooler waters .
The convection diminished as it moved through progressively colder waters , and shortly after 1200 UTC on July 21 Beryl became an extratropical cyclone a short distance east of Cape Cod .
After turning to the northeast , Beryl weakened over cooler waters .
Developing from a tropical disturbance on July 18 , it tracked generally northward , and strengthened to attain peak winds of 60 mph -LRB- 95 km\/h -RRB- under generally favorable conditions .
The rainfall caused some flooding , with some overflown streams flooding some streets .
Overall impact was minor ; there were no reported power outages , deaths , injuries , or maritime emergencies in association with the storm .
Waves along the southern coast of Nantucket reached 10 feet -LRB- 3 m -RRB- in height as the storm approached the island , resulting in four people being rescued by lifeguards from rip currents .
The extratropical remnants continued northeastward through Nova Scotia , and on July 22 it merged with an approaching cold front .
Steering winds ahead of an approaching mid-level trough caused Beryl to accelerate northeastward , and early on July 21 the center of the storm crossed the island of Nantucket .
In Massachusetts , its impact was limited to light rainfall and gusty winds , with no reported damage .
The remnants of Beryl dropped moderate precipitation in Atlantic Canada , officially peaking at 2.8 inches -LRB- 71 mm -RRB- in Scots Bay , Nova Scotia with an unofficially higher total of 3.5 inches -LRB- 88 mm -RRB- ; in some locations 1 inch of rain fell in an hour .
Outflow continued to improve , and with warm sea surface temperatures Beryl gradually intensified to attain peak winds of 60 mph -LRB- 95 km\/h -RRB- early on July 20 while located about 120 miles -LRB- 190 km -RRB- east of Nags Head , North Carolina .
Tropical Storm Beryl was the third tropical storm of the 2006 Atlantic hurricane season .
Winds across southeastern Massachusetts were fairly light , with no sustained tropical storm force winds and wind gusts peaking at 44 mph -LRB- 71 km\/h -RRB- ; unofficially gusts reached 51 mph -LRB- 82 km\/h -RRB- .
On July 21 it struck the island of Nantucket , and shortly thereafter it became extratropical .
A cold front moved off the East Coast of the United States on July 16 and stalled off the coast of North Carolina .
Beryl also produced a storm surge of 0.9 feet -LRB- .27 m -RRB- on Nantucket .
The first low quickly organized into an unnamed tropical storm , and the other area initially remained broad and ill-defined .
However , by July 18 , the system became much better organized with improved banding features , and the area developed into Tropical Depression Two while located 220 miles -LRB- 355 km -RRB- south-southeast of Cape Hatteras .
Beryl maintained peak winds for about 18 hours as it paralleled the Mid-Atlantic and New Jersey coasts , during which an eye-like feature developed in the center of the convection .
It gradually decayed into a surface low pressure trough , and developed into two disturbances ; one was centered 290 miles -LRB- 490 km -RRB- south-southeast of Cape Cod and another was located 200 miles -LRB- 320 km -RRB- south of Cape Hatteras , North Carolina .
The winds downed some tree limbs and led to some power outages .
Additionally , a station in Fredericton , New Brunswick reported 1.77 inches -LRB- 45 mm -RRB- in two hours .
The storm caused high waves along the East Coast of the United States , with 19-foot seas -LRB- 5.97 m -RRB- in the open ocean .
In anticipation for the storm , the Massachusetts Emergency Management Agency was activated as a trial run for the hurricane season .
When a more northeastward track became apparent , a tropical storm watch was issued about 33 hours prior to moving ashore from Woods Hole to Plymouth , Massachusetts , including Cape Cod , Nantucket , and Martha 's Vineyard .
They originally worked in the North-East of England but were later transferred to Wales and South-West England .

The United States customary system -LRB- also called American system -RRB- .
The U.S. customary units have common roots with the imperial units , which were used in the British Empire . Many U.S. units are virtually identical to their imperial counterparts , but the U.S. customary system developed from English units in use before the imperial system was standardized in 1824 , and there are several numerical differences from the imperial system .
Due to lack of reliable documentation there is a great degree of debate over Waldo 's role in the Waldensian sect which may have existed before his leadership , while the French historian Thuanus dated his death to the year 1179 .
Centuries after his death , the Waldensian denomination joined the Genevan or Reformed branch of the Protestant Reformation .
The Roman Catholic Church began to persecute the Waldensians , and many were tried and sentenced to death in various European countries during the 12th , 13th , and 14th centuries .
In 1179 , Waldo and one of his disciples went to Rome where they were welcomed by Pope Alexander III , and the Roman Curia .
Between 1175-1185 Peter Waldo either commissioned a cleric from Lyons to translate the New Testament into the vernacular , the Arpitan -LRB- Franco-Proven Ã al -RRB- language or was himself involved in this translation work .
Peter Waldo , Valdo , or Waldes -LRB- c. 1140 -- c. 1218 -RRB- , also Pierre VaudÃ s or de Vaux , is credited as the founder of the Waldensians , a Christian spiritual movement of the Middle Ages , descendants of which still exist in various regions of southern Europe .
Driven away from Lyons , Waldo and his followers settled in the high valleys of Piedmont , and in France , in the Luberon .
They had to explain their faith before a panel of three clergymen , including issues which were then debated within the Church , as the universal priesthood , the gospel in the vulgar tongue , and the issue of self-imposed poverty .
Finally , Waldo was excommunicated by Pope Lucius III during the synod held at Verona in 1184 , and the doctrine of the Poor of Lyons was again condemned by the Fourth Lateran Council in 1215 where they are mentioned by name for the first time , and regarded as heresy .
The results of the meeting were inconclusive , and Waldo 's ideas , but not the movement itself , were condemned at the Third Lateran Council in the same year , though the leaders of the movement had not been yet excommunicated .
From this point onward he began living a radical Christian life giving his property over to his wife , while the remainder of his belongings he distributed as alms to the poor .
By 1170 he had gathered a large number of followers who were referred to as the Poor of Lyons , the Poor of Lombardy , or the Poor of God who would spread their teaching abroad while disguised as peddlers .
Often referred to as the Waldensians -LRB- or Waldenses -RRB- , they were distinct from the Albigensians or Cathari .
Sometime shortly before the year 1160 he was inspired by a series of events , firstly , after hearing a sermon on the life of St. Alexius , secondly , when rejection of transubstantiation was made a capital crime , thirdly , the sudden and unexpected death of a friend during an evening meal .

In addition , Kuala Lumpur is home to the tallest twin buildings in the world , the Petronas Twin Towers , which have become an iconic symbol of Malaysia 's futuristic developments .
The average player will generally have a repertoire of around ten pieces which they will aim to play very well , learning new pieces as and when they feel like it or if the opportunity arises .
Qin pieces are usually around three to eight minutes in length , with the longest being `` Guangling San '' , which is 22 minutes long .
The music of the qin can be categorised as three distinctively different `` sounds . ''
Nowadays , many qin players perform at concerts in large concert halls , almost always , out of necessity , using electronic pickups or microphones to amplify the sound .
Traditionally , the qin was played in a quiet studio or room by oneself , or with a few friends ; or played outdoors in places of outstanding natural beauty .
The first is san yin -LRB- æ # é -RRB- , which means `` scattered sounds . ''
According to tradition , the qin originally had five strings , representing the five elements of metal , wood , water , fire and earth .
The twisted cord of strings is then wrapped around a frame and immersed in a vat of liquid composed of a special mixture of natural glue that binds the strands together .
It can also be called qixianqin -LRB- lit . `` seven-stringed instrument '' -RRB- .
Later in the Tang dynasty , Cao Rou and others simplified the notation , using only the important elements of the characters -LRB- like string number , plucking technique , hui number and which finger to stop the string -RRB- and combined them into one character notation .
By the 20th century , there had been attempts to try to replace the `` jianzi pu '' notation , but so far , it has been unsuccessful ; since the 20th century , qin music is generally printed with staff notation above the qin tablature .
An earlier form of music notation from the Tang era survives in just one manuscript , dated to the seventh century CE , called Jieshi Diao Youlan -LRB- Solitary Orchid in Stone Tablet Mode -RRB- .
Other famous pieces include `` Liu Shui '' -LRB- Flowing Water -RRB- , `` Yangguan San Die '' -LRB- Three Refrains on the Yang Pass Theme -RRB- , `` Meihua San Nong '' -LRB- Three Variations on the Plum Blossom Theme -RRB- , `` Xiao Xiang Shui Yun '' -LRB- Mist and Clouds over the Xiao and Xiang Rivers -RRB- , and `` Pingsha Luo Yan '' -LRB- Wild Geese Descending on the Sandbank -RRB- .
In old times , the se -LRB- a long zither with movable bridges and 25 strings , similar to the Japanese koto -RRB- was frequently used in duets with the qin .
There are a number of ancient sources that discuss qin lore , qin theory and general qin literature .
They sit facing one another , with the student copying the master .
It can , however , be played together with a xiao -LRB- end-blown bamboo flute -RRB- , with other qin , or played while singing .
In 1977 , a recording of `` Flowing Water '' -LRB- Liu Shui , as performed by Guan Pinghu , one of the best qin players of the 20th century -RRB- was chosen to be included in the Voyager Golden Record , a gold-plated LP recording containing music from around the world , which was sent into outer space by NASA on the Voyager 1 and Voyager 2 spacecrafts .
Because Robert Hans van Gulik 's famous book about the qin is called The Lore of the Chinese Lute , the guqin is sometimes inaccurately called a lute .
This is produced by plucking the required string to sound an open note .
Players mainly learn popular well transcribed versions , often using a recording as a reference .
Because of this , traditional qinpu do not indicate them -LRB- though near the end of the Qing dynasty , a handful of qinpu had started to employ various rhythm indicating devices , such as dots -RRB- .
Many traditionalists feel that the sound of the fingers of the left hand sliding on the strings to be a distinctive feature of qin music .
In 2003 , guqin music was proclaimed as one of the Masterpieces of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO .
Sadly , many qinpu compiled before the Ming dynasty are now lost , and many pieces have remained unplayed for hundreds of years .
By tradition the qin originally had five strings , but ancient qin-like instruments with 10 or more strings have been found .
This was partly due to the scarcity of high quality silk strings and partly due to the newer strings ' greater durability and louder tone .
Silk strings are made by gathering a prescribed number of strands of silk thread , then twisting them tightly together .
Additionally , nylon-wrapped metal strings can cause damage to the wood of old qins .
The modern form has been standardized for about two millennia .
The style of singing is similar to that used to recite Tang poetry .
The surface board is round to represent Heaven and the bottom board flat to represent earth .
The top thicker strings -LRB- i.e. strings one to four -RRB- are further wrapped in a thin silk thread , coiled around the core to make it smoother .
If one did not have a teacher , then one had to work out the rhythm by themselves .
Other incorrect classifications , mainly from music compact discs , include `` harp '' or `` table-harp '' .
The entire length of the qin -LRB- in Chinese measurements -RRB- is 3 chi , 6 cun and 5 fen ; representing the 365 days of the year -LRB- though this is just a standard since qins can be shorter or longer depending on the period 's measurement standard or the maker 's preference -RRB- .
Normally , qin players will learn the rhythm of a piece through a teacher or master .
It was so successful that from the Ming dynasty onwards , a great many qinpu -LRB- ç è -RRB- -LRB- qin tablature collections -RRB- appeared , the most famous and useful being `` Shenqi Mipu '' -LRB- The Mysterious and Marvellous Tablature -RRB- compiled by Zhu Quan , the 17th son of the founder of the Ming dynasty .
These are harmonics , in which the player lightly touches the string with one or more fingers of the left hand at a position indicated by the hui dots , pluck and lift , creating a crisp and clear sound .
The qin society will encourage meetings with fellow qin players in order to play music and maybe discuss the nature of the qin . Gatherings like this are called yajis , or `` elegant gatherings '' , which take place once every month or two .
If one sings to qin songs -LRB- which is rare nowadays -RRB- then one should not sing in an operatic or folk style as is common in China , but rather in a very low pitched and deep way ; and the range in which one should sing should not exceed one and a half octaves .
In order for an instrument to accompany the qin , its sound must be mellow and not overwhelm the qin .
The earliest example of the modern shorthand tablature survives from around the twelfth century CE .
The tablature will only be consulted if the teacher is not sure of how to play a certain part .
The guqin -LRB- simplified\/traditional : å ç ; pinyin : gÇ '' qÃ n ; Wades-Giles ku-ch ` in ; ; literally `` ancient stringed instrument '' -RRB- is the modern name for a plucked seven-string Chinese musical instrument of the zither family .
Legend has it that the qin , the most revered of all Chinese musical instruments , has a history of about 5,000 years . This legend states that the legendary figures of China 's pre-history â '' Fuxi , Shennong and Huang Di , the `` Yellow Emperor '' â '' were involved in its creation .
Later , in the Zhou dynasty , Zhou Wen Wang added a sixth string to mourn his son , Bo Yihou .
The third is an yin -LRB- æ é \/ æ é \/ å é \/ è é -RRB- , or `` stopped sounds . ''
The classical collections such as Qin Shi , Qinshi Bu and Qinshi Xu include biographies of hundreds more players .
Certain melodies are also associated with famous figures , such as Confucius and Qu Yuan .
Since qin tablature does not indicate note value , tempo or rhythm , the player must work it out for him\/herself .
This forms the bulk of most qin pieces and requires the player to press on a string with a finger or thumb of the left hand until it connects with the surface board , then pluck .
It is mentioned in Chinese writings dating back nearly 3,000 years , and related instruments have been found in Tomb of Marquis Yi of Zeng from about 2,500 years ago .
Written qin music did not directly tell what notes were played ; instead , it was written in a tablature detailing tuning , finger positions , and stroke technique , thus comprising a step by step method and description of how to play a piece .
The guqin is nearly always used a solo instrument , as its quietness of tone means that it can not compete with the sounds of most other instruments or an ensemble .
Many artists down through the ages have played the instrument , and the instrument was a favorite of scholars .
The guqin is not to be confused with the guzheng , another Chinese long zither also without frets , but with moveable bridges under each string .
Dapu -LRB- æ `` è -RRB- is the transcribing of old tablature into a playable form .
Because of the difference in geography in China , many qin schools known as qin pai developed over the centuries .
Some tablatures do indicate notes using the gongche system , or indicate rhythm using dots .
To enjoy qin songs , one must learn to become accustomed to the eccentric style some players may sing their songs to , like in the case of Zha Fuxi .
Although most contemporary players use nylon-wrapped metal strings , some argue that nylon-wrapped metal strings can not replace silk strings for their refinement of tone .
The second is fan yin -LRB- æ é -RRB- , or `` floating sounds . ''
Traditionally , the instrument was simply referred to as qin -LRB- Wade-Giles ch ` in -RRB- but by the twentieth century the term had come to be applied to many other musical instruments as well : the yangqin hammered dulcimer , the huqin family of bowed string instruments , and the Western piano are examples of this usage . The prefix `` gu - '' -LRB- meaning `` ancient '' -RRB- was later added for clarification .

The guqin is a very quiet instrument , with a range of about four octaves , and its open strings are tuned in the bass register . Its lowest pitch is about two octaves below middle C , or the lowest note on the cello .

Many qin players attend yajis , at which a number of qin players , music lovers , or anyone with an interest in Chinese culture can come along to discuss and play the qin .
Sounds are produced by plucking open strings , stopped strings , and harmonics .

The city of Schwelm was officially established in 1496 and became seat of the Ennepe-Ruhr district in 1929 . According to its area , Schwelm is the smallest town in North Rhine-Westphalia .
Schwelm is situated in the southeast of the `` Ruhrgebiet '' , the Ruhr Area of Germany , between Westphalia and the `` Bergisches Land '' .
Schwelm is home to the `` Brauerei Schwelm '' , the Schwelm Brewery , one of the few remaining private breweries in Germany .

They originally found great popularity among ranchers of the American Southwest , testament to the hardiness of the breed ; while originating in cool , moist Britain , they have proven to thrive in much harsher climates on nearly every continent .

It is the largest member of the group that bears its name , the moons orbiting between 11.4 and 13 million kilometers from Jupiter at an inclination of about 27.5 Â .
Himalia , the largest irregular satellite of Jupiter , was discovered by Charles Dillon Perrine at the Lick Observatory on 3 December 1904 .
The moon covers only a few pixels , but seems to be an elongated object with axes 150 Â 20 and 120 Â 20 km , close to the Earth-based estimations .
Measurements by Cassini confirm a featureless spectrum , with a slight absorption at 3 Î 1\/4 m which could indicate the presence of water .
The moon did not receive its present name until 1975 ; before then , it was simply known as ' or Jupiter Satellite VI , although calls for a full name appeared shortly after its and Elara 's discovery ; A.C.D. Crommelin wrote in 1905 : Unfortunately the numeration of Jupiter 's satellites is now in precisely the same confusion as that of Saturn 's system was before the numbers were abandoned and names substituted .
In February and March 2007 , the New Horizons spacecraft to Pluto made a series of images of Himalia , culminating in photos from a distance of eight million km .

After passing Newfoundland Isaac transitioned into an extratropical storm , and subsequently merged with a larger storm on October 3 .
On October 2 , the Elektra -LRB- call sign SIWB -RRB- reported winds of 52 m while located about 170 m to the east of the storm 's center .
At Cape Race , sustained winds peaked at 46 m , with gusts of up to 60 m. The most intense winds remained offshore .
However , parts of the Avalon Peninsula experienced tropical storm conditions .
By 2100 UTC on October 2 , all tropical cyclone watches and warnings were lifted .
Due to the storm 's rapid passage , rainfall was primarily light and amounted to less than 1 i.
Waves offshore reached 16 f in height .
The watch was upgraded to a tropical storm warning the next day , while a separate watch was posted for the Burin and Bonavista peninsulas , though it was quickly discontinued .
Heavy rainfall and gusty winds were expected , prompting the issuance of rainfall warnings for parts of southeastern Newfoundland , while wind and gale advisories were declared offshore .
A tropical storm watch was issued in response to Isaac on October 1 for the Avalon Peninsula .

Germanicus 's forces smashed across the Rhine and quickly occupied all of the territory between the Rhine and the Elbe .
As a result , in AD 18 Germanicus was granted control over the eastern part of the empire , just as both Agrippa and Tiberius had received before , and was clearly the successor to Tiberius .
Finally , with Tiberius 's withdrawal in AD 26 , Sejanus was left in charge of the entire state mechanism and the city of Rome .
Tiberius Julius Caesar Augustus -LRB- November 16 , 42 BC â `` March 16 , AD 37 -RRB- , born Tiberius Claudius Nero , was Roman Emperor from 14 AD to 37 AD .
Sejanus began a series of purge trials of Senators and wealthy equestrians in the city of Rome , removing those capable of opposing his power as well as extending the imperial -LRB- and his own -RRB- treasury .
Germanicus 's widow Agrippina the Elder and two of her sons , Nero Caesar and Drusus Caesar were arrested and exiled in AD 30 and later all died in suspicious circumstances .
In AD 31 Sejanus was summoned to a meeting of the Senate , where a letter from Tiberius was read condemning Sejanus and ordering his immediate execution .
However , Tacitus ' portrayal of a tyrannical , vengeful emperor has been challenged by several modern historians .
Lucius Aelius Sejanus had served the imperial family for almost twenty years when he became Praetorian Prefect in AD 15 .
Germanicus had managed to deal a significant blow to Rome 's enemies , quell an uprising of troops , and once again return lost standards to Rome , actions that increased the fame and legend of the already very popular Germanicus with the Roman people .
After being recalled from Germania , Germanicus celebrated a triumph in Rome in AD 17 , the first full triumph that the city had seen since Augustus 's own in 29 BC .
His mother divorced his father and was remarried to Augustus in 39 BC , making him a step-son of Octavian .
Problems arose quickly for the new Princeps .
Rather than simply quell the mutiny however , Germanicus rallied the mutineers and led them on a short campaign across the Rhine into Germanic territory , stating that whatever treasure they could grab would count as their bonus .
Germanicus and Tiberius 's son , Drusus Julius Caesar , were dispatched with a small force to quell the uprising and bring the legions back in line .
Tiberius had statues of Sejanus erected throughout the city , and Sejanus became more and more visible as Tiberius began to withdraw from Rome altogether .

The death of Drusus elevated Sejanus , at least in Tiberius 's eyes , who thereafter refers to him as his ` Socius Laborum ' -LRB- Partner in my labors -RRB- .
Her death in AD 29 changed all that .

Taekwondo -LRB- í ê ë ; è æ é `` ; -RRB- is a Korean martial art and the national sport of South Korea . In Korean , tae -LRB- í , -RRB- means `` to strike or break with foot '' ; kwon -LRB- ê , -RRB- means `` to strike or break with fist '' ; and do -LRB- ë , -RRB- means `` way , '' `` method , '' or `` art . ''
Thus , taekwondo may be loosely translated as `` the art of the foot and fist '' or `` the art of kicking and punching . ''
An example of the union of mental and physical discipline is the breaking of wooden boards , which requires both physical mastery of the technique and the concentration to focus one 's power .
Physically , taekwondo develops strength , speed , balance , flexibility , and stamina .
Taekwondo as a martial art is popular with people of both genders and of many ages .

The island of Taiwan was formed approximately 4 to 5 million years ago from a geosyncline -LRB- via plate tectonics -RRB- , and is part of an island arc .
The island is 55 % forests and woodland -LRB- mostly on the mountains -RRB- and 24 % arable land -LRB- mostly on the plains -RRB- , with 15 % going to other purposes . 5 % is permanent pastures and 1 % is permanent crops .
At the northern end of Taiwan , the Philippine Sea Plate slides under the Eurasian Plate .

The nagamaki is considered to be a type of the no-dachi sword , a variation of the long samurai sword .
It was also beveled along the back edge to reduce its weight .
Warriors used the weapon against horsemen .
The way to hold nagamaki was also very specific .
The nagamaki is designed for large sweeping and slicing strokes .
It also works as a spear .
Still , it required more time and materials to create a nagamaki than spears or naginata , this is why it was not as widely used .
Traditionally , it was used as an infantry weapon .
In contrast to it , the naginata blade is shorter , wider and more curved to the tip .
Unlike the naginata , the hands do not change when handling the weapon and the right hand was always the closest to the blade .
The nagamaki -LRB- , literally `` long wrapping '' -RRB- is a Japanese pole weapon with a large and heavy blade , popular between the 12th and 14th centuries .
The blade was single-edged .
It is held with the two hands in a fixed position in the same way a katana is held .
Even the name `` nagamaki '' -LRB- `` long wrapping '' -RRB- is given by the tradition of handle wrapping .
The closest exemplar of real nagamaki that can be seen today is nagamaki-naoshi .
The nagamaki was not spread and developed until much later like the naginata .
The nagamaki is considered the favored weapon of General Oda Nobunaga .
It appears to be like a long katana-shaped halberd , but straighter and thinner , with a very long tsuka .
While handling nagamaki fewer sliding actions on the handle are performed than are with the naginata , where the entire length of the shaft is used .
During the middle of the Muromachi period -LRB- 1336 â `` 1573 A.D. -RRB- it reached its peak of usage .
The nagamaki handle was wrapped with cords in criss-crossed manner , very similar to the wrapping that is made on katana .
It was introduced and used primarily during the Kamakura -LRB- 1192 â `` 1333 -RRB- , Nanbokucho -LRB- 1334 â `` 1392 -RRB- and early Muromachi -LRB- 1392 â `` 1573 -RRB- periods .
It resembles a traditional naginata , but the main difference was that the handle -LRB- tsuka -RRB- of the nagamaki was not a simple wooden shaft ; it was made more like a katana hilt .
It is very much like a glaive .

Chalk hills , known as chalk downland , usually form where bands of chalk reach the surface at an angle , so forming a scarp slope . Because chalk is porous it can hold a large volume of ground water , providing a natural reservoir that releases water slowly through dry seasons .
The traditional uses of chalk have in some cases been replaced by other substances , although the word `` chalk '' is often still applied to the usual replacements .
Chalk is resistant to weathering and slumping compared to the clays with which it is usually associated , thus forming tall steep cliffs where chalk ridges meet the sea . The cubic metre -LRB- US spelling : cubic meter , symbol : m3 -RRB- is the SI derived unit of volume .
A cubic metre of pure water at the temperature of maximum density -LRB- 3.98 Â C -RRB- and standard atmospheric pressure -LRB- 101.325 kPa -RRB- has a mass of 1,000 kg , or one tonne .
It is sometimes abbreviated to cu m , m3 , M3 , m ^ 3 , m \*\* 3 , CBM , cbm when superscript characters or markup can not be used -LRB- e.g. in some typewritten documents and postings in Usenet newsgroups -RRB- .
At 0 Â C , the freezing point of water , a cubic metre of water has slightly less mass , 999.972 kilograms .
It is the volume of a cube with edges one metre in length .

The title of Formula One World Champion Constructor is awarded to the car `` make '' that has scored the most points during the course of the season , where a car 's make takes into account both engine and chassis . Hence , if a car 's chassis and engine constructor are the same entity -LRB- e.g. Ferrari , Toyota , BRM etc. -RRB- then the make is simply the name of that one constructor .
Since the early 1980s the FIA have required that Formula One entrants own the intellectual rights to the chassis that they enter , and so the terms `` entrant '' and `` constructor '' , and hence also `` team '' , have become synonymous .

As both engine and chassis are included in the make name , chassis run with different engines -LRB- e.g. Lotus-Ford , Lotus-BRM -RRB- are counted as two separate makes and points are scored separately .

The World Constructors ' Championship title is awarded to the constructor of the chassis of the make that scores the most points .
An entrant is the person or corporate entity that registers a car and driver for a race , and is then responsible for preparing and maintaining that car during the race weekend .

Cordelia is the innermost moon of Uranus .
Other than its orbit , radius of 20 km and geometric albedo of 0.08 virtually nothing is known about it .
It is also designated Uranus VI .
At the Voyager 2 images Cordelia appears as an elongated object , the major axis pointing towards Uranus .
Cordelia takes its name from the youngest daughter of Lear in William Shakespeare 's King Lear .
It was not detected again until the Hubble Space Telescope observed it in 1997 .

Upper Sorbian is a minority language spoken by Sorbs in Germany in the historical province of Upper Lusatia -LRB- Hornja Å uÅ 3\/4 ica in Sorbian -RRB- , which is today part of Saxony . It is grouped in the West Slavic language branch , together with Lower Sorbian , Czech , Polish , Slovak and Kashubian .
This puts Upper Sorbian as the third largest minority language in Germany , after Turkish and Danish , but before Frisian .

Since the music is hard-coded onto the barrel , the only way for a barrel organ to play a different set of tunes is to replace the barrel with another one .
Especially in churches , some large barrel organs were built as `` barrel and finger '' organs .
Street barrel organs usually play 7 to 9 tunes , although small organs -LRB- usually the older ones -RRB- can play up to 15 tunes .
The pieces of music -LRB- or tunes -RRB- are encoded onto the barrel using metal pins and staples .

MARF , its applications , and the corresponding source code and documentation are released under the BSD-style license .
MARF may act as a library in applications or be used as a source for learning and extension .

Isambard Kingdom Brunel , FRS -LRB- 9 April 1806 -- 15 September 1859 -RRB- , was a leading British civil engineer , famed for his bridges and dockyards , and especially for the construction of the first major British railway , the Great Western Railway ; a series of famous steamships , including the first propeller-driven transatlantic steamship ; and numerous important bridges and tunnels .
Monocytes are produced by the bone marrow from hematopoietic stem cell precursors called monoblasts .
They are cells that possess a large smooth nucleus , a large area of cytoplasm and many internal vesicles for processing foreign material .
These are phagocytosis , antigen presentation and cytokine production .
Monocytes circulate in the bloodstream for about one to three days and then typically move into tissues throughout the body .
Macrophages are responsible for protecting tissues from foreign substances but are also suspected to be the predominant cells involved in triggering atherosclerosis .
Monocytes are usually identified in stained smears by their large kidney shaped or notched nucleus .
Monocytes which migrate from the bloodstream to other tissues will then differentiate into tissue resident macrophages or dendritic cells .
Monocytes and their macrophage and dendritic cell progeny serve three main functions in the immune system .
They constitute between three to eight percent of the leukocytes in the blood .
Monocyte is a type of white blood cell and is part of the human body 's immune system . Monocytes play multiple roles in immune function .

In botany , trunk -LRB- or bole -RRB- refers to the main structural member of a tree that supports the branches and is supported by and directly attached to the roots .
The trunk is the most important part of the tree for timber production .
The trunk is covered by the bark , which is an important diagnostic feature in tree identification , and which often differs markedly from the bottom of the trunk to the top , depending on the species .

A Doppler radar is a specialized radar that makes use of the doppler effect to produce velocity data about objects at a distance .
There are three ways of producing the Doppler effect . Radars may be Coherent pulsed -LRB- CP -RRB- , Continuous wave -LRB- CW -RRB- , or Frequency modulated -LRB- FM -RRB- .

A `` television pilot '' , also known as a pilot episode and series premiere , is the first episode of a television series .
At the time of its inception , the pilot is meant to be the `` testing ground '' to see if a series will be possibly desired and successful and therefore a test episode of an intended television series . It is an early step in the development of a television series , much like pilot lights or pilot studies serve as precursors to the start of larger activity , or pilot holes prepare the way for larger holes .
Johann Carl Friedrich Gauss -LRB- 30 April 1777 - 23 February 1855 -RRB- was a German mathematician and scientist who contributed significantly to many fields , including number theory , statistics , analysis , differential geometry , geodesy , geophysics , electrostatics , astronomy and optics .
Gauss 's presumed method was to realize that pairwise addition of terms from opposite ends of the list yielded identical intermediate sums : 1 + 100 = 101 , 2 + 99 = 101 , 3 + 98 = 101 , and so on , for a total sum of 50 Ã -- 101 = 5050 .
Gauss 's intellectual abilities attracted the attention of the Duke of Braunschweig , who sent him to the Collegium Carolinum -LRB- now Technische UniversitÃ t Braunschweig -RRB- , which he attended from 1792 to 1795 , and to the University of GÃ ttingen from 1795 to 1798 .

The British Transport Commission -LRB- BTC -RRB- was created by Clement Attlee 's post-war Labor government as a part of its nationalisation program , to oversee railways , canals and road freight transport in Great Britain -LRB- Northern Ireland had the separate Ulster Transport Authority -RRB- .
Its general duty under the Transport Act 1947 was to provide `` an efficient , adequate , economical and properly integrated system of public inland transport and port facilities within Great Britain for passengers and goods '' , excluding transport by air .

For example , the year of the Yang Fire Rat occurred in 1936 and in 1996 , 60 years apart .
This means that anyone born from January 1 to January 25 , 1990 was actually born in the year of the snake rather than the year of the horse .
The year 1990 is considered by some people to be the year of the horse .
The dates for Chinese New Year from 1996 to 2019 -LRB- in the Gregorian calendar -RRB- are at the left , along with the year 's presiding animal zodiac and its earthly branch .
As the Chinese New Year starts in late January to mid-February , the Chinese year dates from January 1 until that day in the new Gregorian year remain unchanged from the previous Gregorian year .
The names of the earthly branches have no English counterparts and are not the Chinese translations of the animals .
The elements are rotated every two years while a yin and yang association alternates every year .
Alongside the 12-year cycle of the animal zodiac there is a 10-year cycle of heavenly stems .
For example , the 1989 year of the snake began on February 6 , 1989 .
Many confuse their Chinese birth-year with their Gregorian birth-year .
Each of the ten heavenly stems is associated with one of the five elements of Chinese astrology , namely : Wood , Fire , Earth , Metal , and Water .
The elements are thus distinguished : Yang Wood , Yin Wood , Yang Fire , Yin Fire , etc. .
These produce a combined cycle that repeats every 60 years .
However , the 1989 year of the snake officially ended on January 26 , 1990 .
