The Lachlan river is within the area occupied by the Wiradjuri people .
However , the Lachlan , unlike the Murrumbidgee River and the Murray River further south , does not have its source in the snowfields and does not enjoy the large and reliable spring flow from the melting snow from which those rivers benefit .
The 500 kmÂ swamp , a floodplain for the Lachlan , joins the Murrumbidgee River to the south .
During the flood in August 1990 , 132 houses in Forbes were affected by flood with their yards or their floors covered by water .
The Lachlan River flows west and then south , terminating in the Great Cumbung swamp near Oxley -LRB- between Hay and Balranald -RRB- .
More than 900 families were evacuated , with many rescued from roof-tops by boat and helicopter .
Annual flows have ranged from less than 1,000 megalitres -LRB- 810 acre-feet -RRB- in 1944 to as much as 10,900,000 megalitres -LRB- 8.8 million acre feet -RRB- in 1950 .
In 1870 the river peaked at 15.9 metres at Cowra .
More than 100,000 people live in the Lachlan catchment .
Since 1887 , the highest flood level at Forbes was in June 1952 when the river peaked at 10.80 m -LRB- 35 feet 3 inches -RRB- at the Forbes Iron Bridge .
24 local government organizations provide administration within the region .
The river has flooded every seven years since 1887 at Forbes .
The European discoverer of the Lachlan River in 1815 was Acting-Surveyor George William Evans , who named the river after Lachlan Macquarie , the Governor of the colony of New South Wales .
In the early days of the colony of New South Wales , the southern part of the Lachlan was known as Fish River .
It was only after further exploration that it was realized that these two rivers were the same river and the name Fish River was dropped .
The Wiradjuri tribal area has been described as `` the land of the three rivers , the Wambool later known as the Macquarie , the Kalare later known as the Lachlan and the Murrumbidgee -LRB- Murrumbidjeri -RRB- .
The Murray River formed the Wiradjuri 's southern boundary , the change from woodland to open grassland formed their eastern boundary . ''
Wyangala Dam was built near Cowra to regulate the flow of the river .
At least 500 sheep were drowned on properties in the Eugowra\/Trundle area and most of Eugowra 's 400 residents were evacuated and some residents from Trundle .
14 % of NSW agricultural production is generated in the region from a land area of approximately 10 % of NSW .
Other significant years of floods were : 1891 , 1916 , 1951 , 1956 , 1961 , 1974 , 1976 , 1993 , 1998 .
Floods in 1992 did not reach the same levels at Forbes as in 1990 , however , Lachlan Valley farmers lost about 30 percent of their lucerne crops just before harvest .
The Lachlan River is a significant river in central New South Wales , Australia .
The Lachlan River was substantially explored by John Oxley in 1817 .
Its major headwaters , the Carcoar River , the Belubula River and the Abercrombie River converge near the town of Cowra .
In dry years , the Lachlan can have periods of zero flow of over a year -LRB- for example from April 1944 to April 1945 -RRB- , which is a complete contrast to the Murray and Murrumbidgee which have not been known to cease to flow since European settlement .

Every family hearth was her altar .
Her father , pressured by his mistress , Madame de Montesson , sent her to a convent .
Finally , in 1770 , when she was twenty years old , she was allowed to leave the convent and marry her younger cousin , the duc de Bourbon , the son and heir of Louis Joseph de Bourbon , Prince of CondÃ and his wife Charlotte Ã lisabeth Godefride de Rohan .
She fell out with her royalist husband and son , who both chose to leave France after the storming of the Bastille .
In 1804 , she learned that NapolÃ on I , whom she admired , had had her only son , Louis Antoine , Duke of Enghien , kidnapped , and executed by firing squad in the moat of the ChÃ cents teau de Vincennes .
She was known as Citoyenne VÃ ritÃ during the French Revolution .
In 1822 , while she was taking part in a march towards the PanthÃ on , she lost consciousness , and drew her last breath in the home of a law professor who taught at the Sorbonne .
Relegated to a place near Barcelona , Bathilde founded , despite her small means , a pharmacy and dispensary for the poor , and her house became a gathering place for those who needed aid .
Instead , she resumed her affair with the police officer who had escorted her to Spain in 1797 .
Badly rewarded for her fidelity to the democratic ideals of the Revolution , she survived a year and a half in a prison cell .
She was buried in the OrlÃ ans family chapel her sister-in-law , the Duchess of OrlÃ ans , who had died in 1821 , had built in CollÃ giale de Dreux in 1816 , as the final resting place for Bourbon-Toulouse-Penthi Ã vre and OrlÃ ans families .
Initially , Bathilde was considered as a possible bride for a distant cousin , Ferdinand , Duke of Parma , the favorite grandson of King Louis XV of France ; however , that marriage never materialised .
In retribution , the National Convention decreed the imprisonment of all Bourbons remaining in France .
In November of the same year , her brother was guillotined .
In 1797 , the Directoire decided to exile the last of the Bourbons still living in France .
In 1815 , at the start of the Bourbon Restoration , Louis XVIII traded with her the HÃ tel Matignon for the Ã lysÃ e Palace .
For ten years , the emperor kept the mother of his most famous victim from setting foot in France .
Despite being forty-seven years old at the time , during the months which this journey took , she had an amorous intrigue with a handsome twenty-seven year old police officer -LRB- gendarme -RRB- under whose responsibility she had been put .
Louise Marie ThÃ rÃ se Bathilde d'Orl Ã ans , was the daughter of the Louis Philippe d'Orl Ã ans , Duke of Chartres and his wife , Louise Henriette de Bourbon .
After her death , her nephew , Louis-Philippe , wanting to give an air of respectability to her bohemian lifestyle , burned the manuscript of her memoirs and a file on her young police officer located in the war archives .
Bathilde was born at the ChÃ cents teau de Saint-Cloud , some ten kilometers west of Paris , on 9 July 1750 .
As the Ancien RÃ gime crumbled , she took the name , Citoyenne VÃ ritÃ -LRB- Citizeness Truth -RRB- .
Her mother died in 1759 when Bathilde was just eight years old .
The scandal of her husband 's adultery came out in 1778 , and the consequences fell entirely on her shoulders .
In April 1793 , her nephew , the young duc de Chartres -LRB- future Louis-Philippe King of the French -RRB- , fled France and sought asylum with the Austrians .
While other members of the OrlÃ ans family still in France were kept under house arrest , Bathilde , Philippe Ã galitÃ and his sons were imprisoned in the Fort Saint-Jean in Marseille .
The two maintained a correspondence during her exile .
Bathilde promptly installed a community of nuns on the premises and charged them with praying for the souls of the victims of the Revolution .
During the French Revolution , just like her brother Philippe Ã galitÃ , Bathilde discovered democracy .
With her sister-in-law , Louise Marie AdÃ laÃ de de Bourbon , duchesse d'Orl Ã ans , Bathilde was made to get into an old coach with all her remaining worldly goods and was sent to Spain with her illegitimate daughter .
Her family , in the new moral order of the day , wanted to see her rejoin her husband after a separation of thirty-five years , but she refused .
Later , she passed the child off as the daughter of her secretary , in order to keep the little girl close to her .
She was sister of Philippe Ã galitÃ , the mother of the executed duc d'Enghien and aunt of Louis-Philippe King of the French .
Threatened by the new revolutionary government , she offered her wealth to the First French Republic before it could be confiscated .
During her time at the convent , she became a very spiritual person , a trait that would remain with her all her life .
Louise Marie ThÃ rÃ se Bathilde d'Orl Ã ans , Princess of CondÃ -LRB- 9 July 1750 -- 10 January 1822 -RRB- , was a French princess .
Bathilde got her revenge in 1814 , when the people , seeing in her the mother of the `` Martyr of Vincennes , '' cheered her as she traveled the route back to Paris .
Descended from both Louis XIV of France and his younger brother , Philippe de France , Duke of OrlÃ ans , Bathilde was born a princesse du sang .
She became completely republican during this time period , despite her exile .

Named after philanthropists Robert and Suzanne Gottlieb , the Gottlieb Animal Health and Conservation Center is a 33589 s facility situated in a restricted area in the upper reaches of the zoo .
The first zoo opened in 1912 and was about two miles -LRB- 3.2 km -RRB- south of its current site until about 1965 .
The City of Los Angeles owns the entire zoo , its land and facilities , and the animals .
The zoo is open from 10am -- 5pm every day of the year except December 25 .
Animal care , grounds maintenance , construction , education , public information , and administrative staff are city employees .
In 2002 , the zoo became a certified Botanical Gardens and the official name of the institution was changed to the Los Angeles Zoo and Botanical Gardens .
The zoo , located in Los Angeles ' Griffith Park , is home to 1,100 animals from around the world .

Among other features , it includes a state-of-the-art intensive care unit , an on-site commissary , a surgical suite with observation area , and research facilities .
In 2007 the facility handled 853 medical cases .

Gamma-ray bursts were first observed in the late 1960s by the U.S. Vela satellites , which were built to detect gamma radiation pulses emitted by nuclear weapons tested in space .
They are the most luminous electromagnetic events known to occur in the universe .
Bursts can last from milliseconds to several minutes , although a typical burst lasts a few seconds .
Gamma-ray bursts -LRB- GRBs -RRB- are flashes of gamma rays associated with extremely energetic explosions that have been observed in distant galaxies .
Most observed events have a duration of greater than two seconds and are classified as long gamma-ray bursts .
Most observed GRBs are believed to be a narrow beam of intense radiation released during a supernova event , as a rapidly rotating , high-mass star collapses to form a neutron star or black hole .
Observations suggest significant variation in the jet angle from between 2 and 20 degrees .
The sources of most GRBs are billions of light years away from Earth , implying that the explosions are both extremely energetic -LRB- a typical burst releases as much energy in a few seconds as the Sun will in its entire 10 billion year lifetime -RRB- and extremely rare -LRB- a few per galaxy per million years -RRB- .
However , gamma-ray bursts are thought to be highly focused explosions , with most of the explosion energy collimated into a narrow jet traveling at speeds exceeding 99.995 % of the speed of light .
Almost every well-studied long gamma-ray burst has been associated with a rapidly star-forming galaxy and in many cases a core-collapse supernova as well , unambiguously linking long GRBs with the deaths of massive stars .
It has been hypothesized that a gamma-ray burst in the Milky Way , pointing directly towards the Earth , could cause a mass extinction event .
The initial burst is usually followed by a longer-lived `` afterglow '' emitted at longer wavelengths -LRB- X-ray , ultraviolet , optical , infrared and radio -RRB- .
A subclass of GRBs -LRB- the `` short '' bursts -RRB- appear to originate from a different process , possibly the merger of binary neutron stars .
The approximate angular width of the jet -LRB- that is , the degree of beaming -RRB- can be estimated directly by observing `` jet breaks '' in afterglow light curves : a time after which the slowly-decaying afterglow abruptly begins to fade rapidly as the jet slows down and can no longer beam its radiation as effectively .
On July 2 , 1967 , at 14:19 UTC , the Vela 4 and Vela 3 satellites detected a flash of gamma radiation unlike any known nuclear weapons signature .
Long GRB afterglow observations at high redshift are also consistent with the GRB having originated in star-forming regions .
Because their energy is strongly beamed , the gamma rays emitted by most bursts are expected to miss the Earth and never be detected .
When this effect is taken into account , typical gamma-ray bursts are observed to have a true energy release of about 1044 J , or about 1\/2000 of a Solar mass energy equivalent .
All observed GRBs have originated from outside the Milky Way galaxy , although a related class of phenomena , soft gamma repeater flares , are associated with magnetars within the Milky Way .
Uncertain what had happened but not considering the matter particularly urgent , the team at the Los Alamos Scientific Laboratory , led by Ray Klebesadel , filed the data away for investigation .
When a gamma-ray burst is pointed towards Earth , the focusing of its energy along a relatively narrow beam causes the burst to appear much brighter than it would have been were its energy emitted spherically .
Because these events constitute the majority of the population and because they tend to have the brightest afterglows , they have been studied in much greater detail than their short counterparts .

Pellet are small particles typically created by compressing an original material .
In RNA , which is used for protein synthesis , adenine binds to uracil .
It is no longer considered a true vitamin or part of the Vitamin B complex .
In DNA , adenine binds to thymine via two hydrogen bonds to assist in stabilizing the nucleic acid structures .
The shape of adenine is complementary to either thymine in DNA or uracil in RNA .
In older literature , adenine was sometimes called Vitamin B4 .
However , two B vitamins , niacin and riboflavin , bind with adenine to form the essential cofactors nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide -LRB- NAD -RRB- and flavin adenine dinucleotide -LRB- FAD -RRB- , respectively .
Water vapor or water vapor -LRB- see spelling differences -RRB- , also aqueous vapor , is the gas phase of water . Water vapor is one state of water within the hydrosphere .
Dew point temperature and relative humidity act as guidelines for the process of water vapor in the water cycle .
Water vapor can be produced from the evaporation or boiling of liquid water or from the sublimation of ice .

MÃ 1\/4 nster has approximately 270,000 inhabitants , and in addition more than 10,000 have their secondary residence in the city .

Feynman diagrams are often confused with spacetime diagrams and bubble chamber images because they all describe particle scattering .
This term is represented by the Feynman diagram at the right . This diagram gives contributions to the following processes :
A Feynman diagram consists of points , called vertices , and lines attached to the vertices .
Feynman diagrams were originally discovered by Feynman , by trial and error , as a way to represent the contribution to the S-matrix from different classes of particle trajectories .
Feynman diagrams are graphs that represent the trajectories of particles in intermediate stages of a scattering process . Unlike a bubble chamber picture , only the sum of all the Feynman diagrams represent any given particle interaction ; particles do not choose a particular diagram each time they interact .

Pairs of enantiomers are often designated as `` right - '' and `` left-handed . ''
Molecular chirality is of interest because of its application to stereochemistry in inorganic chemistry , organic chemistry , physical chemistry , biochemistry , and supramolecular chemistry .
A molecule is achiral -LRB- not chiral -RRB- when an improper rotation , that is a combination of a rotation and a reflection in a plane , perpendicular to the axis of rotation , results in the same molecule - see chirality -LRB- mathematics -RRB- . An equivalent definition is that a chiral molecule lacks a plane of symmetry .
In chemistry , chirality usually refers to molecules .
Human hands are perhaps the most universally recognized example of chirality : The left hand is a non-superposable mirror image of the right hand ; no matter how the two hands are oriented , it is impossible for all the major features of both hands to coincide .
The symmetry of a molecule -LRB- or any other object -RRB- determines whether it is chiral .
A molecule can have multiple chiral centers without being chiral overall if there is a symmetry between the two -LRB- or more -RRB- chiral centers themselves .
This difference in symmetry becomes obvious if someone attempts to shake the right hand of a person using his left hand , or if a left-handed glove is placed on a right hand .
The term chirality is derived from the Greek word for hand , Ï Î Î Ï -LRB- cheir -RRB- .
Two mirror images of a chiral molecule are called enantiomers or optical isomers .

Flag design is also a historical process in which current designs often refer back to previous designs , effectively quoting , elaborating , or commenting upon them .
The Flag Identification System was created by Whitney Smith and adopted by FIAV .
Other symbols are used to describe other aspects of the usage of the flag , such as official status and which side of the flag is being shown .
Families of current flags may derive from a few common ancestors as in the cases of the Pan-African colors , the Pan-Arab colors , the Pan-Slavic colors , the Nordic Cross flag and the Ottoman flag .

Kenneth Wregget -LRB- born March 25 , 1964 -RRB- is a retired Canadian professional ice hockey goaltender .
The 1986 â `` 87 season was his first full year in the NHL .
Wregget 's best season came in 1994 â `` 95 when he played in 38 games and compiled a 25 â `` 9-2 record with a 3.21 goals against average and a .903 save percentage while also leading the NHL in wins .
In 1992 , he was traded from the Philadelphia Flyers to the reigning champion Pittsburgh Penguins along with Kjell Samuelsson and Rick Tocchet in exchange for Mark Recchi .
There was frequent speculation that Wregget would take over as the starting goaltender .
In 2009 , he was inducted into the Manitoba Hockey Hall of Fame .
Wregget played for three seasons with the Lethbridge Broncos of the Western Hockey League and won the Del Wilson Trophy as the WHL 's top goaltender in 1984 .
Dicynodontia is a taxon of therapsids or mammal-like reptiles .
Dicynodonts were small to large herbivorous animals with two tusks , hence their name , which means ` two dog tooth ' .
They are also the most successful and diverse of the non-mammalian therapsids , with over 70 genera known , varying from rat - to ox-sized .
Cucurbitaceae is a plant family commonly known as melons , gourds or cucurbits and includes crops like cucumbers , squashes -LRB- including pumpkins -RRB- , luffas , melons -LRB- including watermelons -RRB- .
The family is predominantly distributed around the tropics , where those with edible fruits were amongst the earliest cultivated plants in both the Old and New Worlds .

Tezcatlipoca was a central deity in Aztec religion , one of the four sons of Ometeotl , he is associated with a wide range of concepts including the night sky , the night winds , hurricanes , the north , the earth , obsidian , enmity , discord , rulership , divination , temptation , jaguars , sorcery , beauty , war and strife .
When depicted he was usually drawn with a black and a yellow stripe painted across his face .
The four Tezcatlipocas were the sons of Ometecuhtli and Omecihuatl , lady and lord of the duality , and were the creators of all the other gods , as well as the world and all humanity .
Tezcatlipoca was often described as a rival of another important god of the Aztecs , the culture hero , Quetzalcoatl .
In later myths , the four gods who created the world , Tezcatlipoca , Quetzalcoatl , Huitzilopochtli and Xipe Totec were referred to respectively as the Black , the White , the Blue and the Red Tezcatlipoca .
He had many epithets which alluded to different aspects of his deity : Titlacauan -LRB- `` We are his Slaves '' -RRB- , Ipalnemoani -LRB- `` He by whom we live '' -RRB- , Necoc Yaotl -LRB- `` Enemy of Both Sides '' -RRB- , Tloque Nahuaque -LRB- `` Lord of the Near and the Nigh '' -RRB- and Yohualli Ã ecatl -LRB- `` Night , Wind '' -RRB- , Ome acatl -LRB- `` Two Reed '' -RRB- , Ilhuicahua Tlalticpaque -LRB- `` Possessor of the Sky and Earth '' -RRB- .
Similarities exist with the patron deity of the K ` iche ' Maya as described in the Popol Vuh .
A central figure of the Popol Vuh was the god Tohil whose name means `` obsidian '' and who was associated with sacrifice .
The Tezcatlipoca figure goes back to earlier Mesoamerican deities worshipped by the Olmec and Maya .
His name in the Nahuatl language is often translated as `` Smoking Mirror '' and alludes to his connection to obsidian , the material from which mirrors were made in Mesoamerica and which was used for shamanic rituals .
Quetzalcoatl became the ruler of the subsequent creation `` Sun of Water '' , and Tezcatlipoca destroyed the third creation `` The Sun of Wind '' by striking down Quetzalcoatl .
Tezcatlipoca 's nagual , his animal counterpart , was the jaguar and his jaguar aspect was the deity Tepeyollotl -LRB- `` Mountainheart '' -RRB- .
In one version of the Aztec creation account the myth of the Five Suns , the first creation , `` The Sun of the Earth '' was ruled by Tezcatlipoca but destroyed by Quetzalcoatl when he struck down Tezcatlipoca who then transformed into a jaguar .
Also the Classic Maya god of rulership and thunder known to modern Mayanists as `` God K '' , or the `` Manikin Scepter '' and to the classic Maya as K ` awil was depicted with a smoking obsidian knife in his forehead and one leg replaced with a snake .
The accounts of Plutarch and Diogenes LaÃ `` rtius recount that they exchanged only a few words : while Diogenes was relaxing in the sunlight in the morning , Alexander , thrilled to meet the famous philosopher , asked if there was any favor he might do for him .

An International Standard Serial Number -LRB- ISSN -RRB- is a unique eight-digit number used to identify a print or electronic periodical publication .
The ISO subcommittee TC 46\/SC 9 is responsible for the standard .
The ISSN system was first drafted as an ISO international standard in 1971 and published as ISO 3297 in 1975 .
Year 1791 -LRB- MDCCXCI -RRB- was a common year starting on Saturday -LRB- link will display the full calendar -RRB- of the Gregorian calendar and a common year starting on Wednesday of the 11-day slower Julian calendar .
Advisories are also issued for tropical cyclones which have moved inland , weakened to tropical depression strength , and are no longer the responsibility of the National Hurricane Center .
The HPC issues storm summaries on storm systems bringing significant rainfall and snowfall to portions of the United States .
The NCEP centers to reside in the facility are the Hydrometeorological Prediction Center -LRB- HPC -RRB- , the Climate Prediction Center -LRB- CPC -RRB- , the Ocean Prediction Center -LRB- OPC -RRB- , the Environmental Modeling Center -LRB- EMC -RRB- , and NCEP Central Operations -LRB- NCO -RRB- .
The Hydrometeorological Prediction Center -LRB- HPC -RRB- is one of nine service centers under the umbrella of the National Centers for Environmental Prediction -LRB- NCEP -RRB- , a part of the National Weather Service , which in turn is part of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration -LRB- NOAA -RRB- of the U.S. government .
The HPC serves as a center of excellence in quantitative precipitation forecasting , medium range forecasting -LRB- three to eight days -RRB- and the interpretation of numerical weather prediction models .
The HPC also acts as the backup office to the National Hurricane Center in the event of a complete communications failure .

At the same time a red bull-calf and red boar were added to the sacrifices made on the Vulcanalia , at least in that region of the city .
It was said that whenever Venus is unfaithful , Vulcan grows angry and beats the red-hot metal with such a force that sparks and smoke rise up from the top of the mountain , to create a volcanic eruption .
His smithy was believed to be situated underneath Mount Etna in Sicily .
He later built a smithy under Mount Etna on the island of Sicily .
A fragment of a Greek pot showing Hephaestus found at the Volcanal has been dated to the 6th century BC , suggesting that the two gods were already associated at this date .
Juno was furious and demanded that Vulcan return home , a demand that he refused .
Late in his childhood , he found the remains of a fisherman 's fire on the beach and became fascinated with an unextinguished coal , still red-hot and glowing .
In response to the same fire , Domitian -LRB- emperor 81 -- 96 -RRB- established a new altar to Vulcan on the Quirinal Hill .
Vulcan 's oldest shrine in Rome , called the Vulcanal , was situated at the foot of the Capitoline in the Forum Romanum , and was reputed to date to the archaic period of the kings of Rome , and to have been established on the site by Titus Tatius , the Sabine co-king , with a traditional date in the 8th century BC .
Vulcan had a happy childhood with dolphins as his playmates and pearls as his toys .
Later , Thetis left her underwater grotto to attend a dinner party on Mount Olympus wearing a beautiful necklace of silver and sapphires , which Vulcan had made for her .
He even made slave-girls of gold to wait on him and do his bidding .
He also made the thrones for the other gods on Mount Olympus .
Through his identification with the Hephaestus of Greek mythology , he came to be considered as the manufacturer of art , arms , iron , jewellery and armor for various gods and heroes , including the thunderbolts of Jupiter .
Vulcan 's contribution to the beautiful and foolish Pandora was to mould her from clay and to give her form .
Vulcan carefully shut this precious coal in a clamshell and took it back to his underwater grotto and made a fire with it .
He was the son of Jupiter and Juno , and husband of Maia and Venus .
However , Vulcan had a stronger association than Hephaestus with fire 's destructive capacity , and a major concern of his worshippers was to encourage the god to avert harmful fires .
The Romans identified Vulcan with the Greek smith-god Hephaestus , and he became associated like his Greek counterpart with the constructive use of fire in metalworking .
To punish mankind for stealing the secrets of fire , Jupiter ordered the other gods to make a poisoned gift for man .
Vulcan also had a temple on the Campus Martius , which was in existence by 214 BC .
However he did send Juno a beautifully constructed chair made of silver and gold , inlaid with mother-of-pearl .
Vulcan made pearl-handled knives and spoons for his foster mother , he made a silver chariot for himself , and bridles so that seahorses could transport him quickly .
On the first day after , Vulcan stared at this fire for hours on end .
For three days Juno sat fuming , still trapped in Vulcan 's chair , she could n't sleep , she could n't stretch , she could n't eat .
Juno admired the necklace and asked as to where she could get one .
Vulcan agreed and married Venus .
On the second day , he discovered that when he made the fire hotter with bellows , certain stones sweated iron , silver or gold .
The Volcanalia sacrifice was offered here to Vulcan , on August 23 .
It was Jupiter who finally saved the day , he promised that if Vulcan released Juno he would give him a wife , Venus the goddess of love and beauty .
Thetis became flustered causing Juno to become suspicious and , at last , the queen god discovered the truth : the baby she had once rejected had grown into a talented blacksmith .

Several anti-corporate and not-for-profit forms of alternative protest have surfaced in the punk underground , such as self-made publications known as zines , where there is greater freedom to discuss controversial -LRB- usually far left -RRB- political issues such as discrimination , LGBT community issues , feminism , antitheism , and veganism .
Mainstream films can best be defined as commercial films that have a wide release and play in first run theaters -LRB- A movie theater that runs primarily mainstream film fare from the major film companies and distributors , during the initial release period of each film -RRB- .
In the 1960s this music was exemplified by the music of the hippie counterculture .
The punk subculture generally frowns upon major label bands that play punk music that disavows the DIY punk ethic , and views them as synonymous with mainstream music .
Hollywood movies are usually considered mainstream and blockbusters are also mainstream films .
Punk has lent this stringent DIY ethic to the indie rock that surfaced in the early 1990s underground .
Opposing mainstream music is the music of subcultures .
And though often viewed as a youthful expression of rebellion by the mainstream media , modern punk embodies a range of age groups who generally disagree with the perceived homogeneity of countercultural principals and it is not uncommon for middle-aged people to form punk houses and resistance movements in the face of what they view as the widespread , unfair exploitation of human and animal rights .
This exists in virtually all genres of music and is found commonly in punk rock , indie rock , alternative\/underground hip hop , anti-folk and heavy metal , among others .
Mainstream music denotes music that is familiar and unthreatening to the masses , as for example popular music , pop music , middle of the road music , pop rap or pop rock ; Mainstream jazz is generally seen as an evolution of be-bop , which was originally regarded as radical .
Punk rock has distinguished itself from other non-mainstream genres by self-asserting an active anti-mainstream social movement that resists commercialism and corporate control .
The boundary is vague .
This modern faction is dominantly voiced through the anarcho-punk and crust punk subcultures , in attempt to combat what is seen by those groups as a general devaluation of , and profitization from , life .
Being sold at popular stores , or more typically , at general stores can also be an indicator .

The British Rail Class 91 is a class of 140 mph -LRB- 225 km\/h -RRB- , 6300 H electric locomotives ordered as a component of the East Coast Main Line modernisation and electrification program of the late 1980s .
The Class 91s were given the auxiliary name of InterCity 225 to indicate their envisaged top speed of 225 km\/h -LRB- 140 mph -RRB- .
The other end of the InterCity 225 train set is formed of a Driving Van Trailer , built with a similar body shell to the Class 91 locomotives .
This addition to the mass was made by Martin Luther in his Deutsche Messe and remains traditional in Lutheran Churches .
Such benedictions have been regularly practiced both in the Christian East and West . At the time of the Reformation , Protestants abandoned many of the benedictions of the Roman Catholic Church , including the Apostolic Benediction made by the Pope and his delegates , the `` last blessing '' of the dying , and virtually all benedictions of inanimate objects .
A common form of benediction in Roman Catholic and liturgical Protestant churches is for the worship leader to raise his hands and recite the words of the biblical Priestly Blessing .
Mercury -LRB- I -RRB- fluoride is prepared by the reaction of mercury -LRB- I -RRB- carbonate with hydrofluoric acid .
Mercury -LRB- I -RRB- fluoride or mercurous fluoride is the chemical compound composed of mercury and fluorine with the formula Hg2F2 .
In many Christian traditions , regular public worship is complemented by other forms of worship , such as individual meditation , prayer and study , small group prayer -LRB- often linked with Bible study -RRB- , and formal ceremonies on special occasions , including weddings , funerals , baptisms and events of Church or state .
Throughout most of Christianity 's history , corporate Christian worship has been primarily liturgical , characterized by prayers and hymns , with texts rooted in , or closely related to , the Scripture , particularly the Psalter ; this form of sacramental and ceremonial worship is still practiced by the Roman Catholic , Eastern Orthodox , and Anglican churches , as well as some Protestant denominations such as Lutheranism and Methodism .
Set times for prayer during the day were established -LRB- based substantially on Jewish models -RRB- , and a festal cycle throughout the Church year governed the celebration of feasts and holy days pertaining to the events in the life of Jesus , the lives of the saints , and aspects of the Church 's perception of God .
According to this view , alterations in the patterns and content of worship would necessarily reflect a change in the faith itself .
A great deal of emphasis was placed on the forms of worship , as they were seen in terms of the Latin phrase lex orandi , lex credendi -LRB- `` the rule of prayer is the rule of belief '' -RRB- -- that is , the specifics of one 's worship express , teach , and govern the doctrinal beliefs of the community .
Orthodoxy in faith also meant orthodoxy in worship , and vice versa .
Each time a heresy arose in the Church , it was typically accompanied by a shift in worship for the heretical group .
For some considerations it is useful to specify the volume-specific heat capacity , commonly called volumetric heat capacity , which is the heat capacity per unit volume and has SI units .
Derived quantities that specify heat capacity as an intensive property , independent of the size of a sample , are the molar heat capacity , which is the heat capacity per mole of a pure substance , and the specific heat capacity , often called simply specific heat , which is the heat capacity per unit mass of a material .

The Illinois Senate is the upper chamber of the Illinois General Assembly , the legislative branch of the government of the state of Illinois in the United States .
In contrast , the Illinois House of Representatives is made up of 118 members with its entire membership elected to two-year terms .
House districts are formed by dividing each Senate district in half .
Under the Illinois Constitution of 1970 , senators are divided into three groups , each group having a two-year term at a different part of the decade between censuses , with the rest of the decade being taken up by two four-year terms .
Depending on the election year , roughly one-third , two-thirds , or all Senate seats may be contested .
The body was created by the first state constitution adopted in 1818 . The Illinois Senate is made up of 59 senators elected from individual legislative districts determined by population .
Renowned artist Tone -LRB- ä '' ç è '' -RRB- formed this band after releasing his first debut album titled '' æ ` ç 6:57 am '' -LRB- My 6:57 AM -RRB- , and recruited two other members to form Cool Silly : Rapper\/actor Leeway -LRB- è -- å å ï 1\/4 and singer\/composer Ray Liu -LRB- å è '' ' è `` -RRB- .
Cool Silly is a Taiwanese-American mainstream pop duo consisting of producer\/singer Tone -LRB- ä '' ç è '' -RRB- and rapper\/actor Leeway -LRB- è -- å å -RRB- .
Since their debut , they have often been compared with the Popular Taiwanese rock group F.I.R. because of the similar formation of band members and attractive performance personalities .
The song attracted many fans , which led to Cool Silly 's debut in 2010 with the release of their first digital album , Cool Silly : The Prelude .
The name Cool Silly comes from the band 's ideology that `` a person ca n't be cool unless they 're silly as well '' .
The band insists that the personality of their music is not only `` cool , '' but at the same time `` silly . ''
The first production Model T was produced on August 12 , 1908 and left the factory on September 27 , 1908 , at the Piquette Plant in Detroit , Michigan . On May 26 , 1927 , Henry Ford watched the 15 millionth Model T Ford roll off the assembly line at his factory in Highland Park , Michigan .
The floor lever also controlled the parking brake , which was activated by pulling the lever all the way back .
If the lever was pushed forward and the driver took his foot off the left pedal , the Model T entered high gear , but only when the handbrake lever was fully forward .
Although he started with the Model A , there were not 19 production models -LRB- A through T -RRB- ; some were only prototypes . The production model immediately before the Model T was the Model S , an upgraded version of the company 's largest success to that point , the Model N. The follow-up was the Ford Model A and not the Model U. Company publicity said this was because the new car was such a departure from the old that Henry wanted to start all over again with the letter A. As it happens , the first Plymouth car -LRB- 1928 -RRB- , built by competitor Chrysler Corporation , was named Model U.
Dance Flick is a 2009 American comedy directed by Damien Dante Wayans , written by his uncles , the Wayans Brothers , and starring Damon Wayans , Jr. , and Shoshana Bush . The film is a spoof of the popular dance film genre .
Edward Kennedy `` Duke '' Ellington -LRB- April 29 , 1899 -- May 24 , 1974 -RRB- was an American composer , pianist , and big band leader .
Daisy Kennedy , was born in Washington , D.C. on January 4 , 1879 , and was the daughter of a former American slave .
Ellington went to Armstrong Technical High School in Washington , D.C. . He got his first job selling peanuts at Washington Senators baseball games .
Ellington led his band from 1923 until his death in 1974 .
At that point , the original band dissolved . Paul Ellington , Mercer 's youngest son and executor of the Duke Ellington estate , kept the Duke Ellington Orchestra going from Mercer 's death onwards .
His son Mercer Ellington , who had already been handling all administrative aspects of his father 's business for several decades , led the band until his own death in 1996 .
Ellington created `` Soda Fountain Rag '' by ear , because he had not yet learned to read and write music .
Though Ellington took piano lessons , he was more interested in baseball .
They lived with his maternal grandparents at 2129 Ida Place -LRB- now Ward Place -RRB- , NW in the West End neighborhood of Washington , D.C. His father , James Edward Ellington was born in Lincolnton , North Carolina on April 15 , 1879 and moved to Washington , D.C. in 1886 with his parents .
Ellington called his music `` American Music '' rather than jazz , and liked to describe those who impressed him as `` beyond category '' .
Ellington 's grandson Paul Ellington is a musician and maintains a small salaried band known as the Duke Ellington Legacy , which frequently comprises the core of the big band operated by The Duke Ellington Center for the Arts .
Edward Kennedy Ellington was born on April 29 , 1899 to James Edward Ellington and Daisy Kennedy Ellington .
The band included Otto Hardwick , who switched from bass to saxophone ; Arthur Whetsol on trumpet ; Elmer Snowden on banjo ; and Sonny Greer on drums .
Ellington played throughout the Washington , D.C. area and into Virginia for private society balls and embassy parties .
These included many of the musicians who were members of his orchestra , some of whom are considered among the best in jazz in their own right , but it was Ellington who melded them into one of the most well-known jazz orchestral units in the history of jazz .
He also worked as a butler for Dr. Middleton F. Cuthbert , a prominent white physician , and occasionally worked as a White House caterer .
He wrote on algebra , logic , foundations of mathematics , philosophy of science , physics , metaphysics , and education .
He co-authored the epochal Principia Mathematica with Russell .

In 1900 , Mandelstam entered the prestigious Tenishevsky School . The writer Vladimir Nabokov and other significant figures of Russian and Soviet culture have been among its alumni .
Mandelstam 's non-conformist , anti-establishment tendencies were not heavily disguised .
Ð Ð 3\/4 Ñ Ñ Ð 3\/4 Ð , Tsekh Poetov -RRB- , under the formal leadership of Nikolai Gumilyov and Sergei Gorodetsky .
In 1913 he published his first collection of poems , The Stone -LRB- Russian : Ð Ð Ð 1\/4 Ð Ð 1\/2 Ñ , Kamyen -RRB- ; it was reissued in 1916 under the same title , but with additional poems included .
Mandelstam was born in Warsaw -LRB- then part of the Russian Empire -RRB- to a wealthy Polish Jewish family .
In 1911 , to continue his education at the University of Saint Petersburg , from which Jews were excluded , he converted to Methodism -LRB- which he did not practice -RRB- and entered the university the same year .
At this time , his second book of poems , Tristia , was published in Berlin .
In 1922 , Mandelstam and Nadezhda moved to Moscow .
In April 1908 , Mandelstam decided to enter the Sorbonne in Paris to study literature and philosophy , but he left the following year to attend the University of Heidelberg in Germany .
Mandelstam 's poetry , acutely populist in spirit after the first Russian revolution in 1905 , became closely associated with symbolist imagery . In 1911 , he and several other young Russian poets formed the `` Poets ' Guild '' -LRB- Russian : Ð Ð Ñ
Unsportsmanlike conduct -LRB- or unsporting behavior , or ungentlemanly conduct -RRB- is a term used in many professional sports to refer to a particular player or team who has acted inappropriately and\/or unprofessionally in the context of the game .
The official rules of many sports include a catch-all provision whereby a competitor may be penalized or otherwise cited for unsportsmanlike conduct .

The earliest reference to the site was in the Domesday Book survey of 1086 , wherein the `` minster '' of Southwark seems to be under the control of Bishop Odo of Bayeux -LRB- William the Conqueror 's half-brother -RRB- .
It has been a place of Christian worship for over 1,000 years , but a cathedral only since 1905 .

Southwark Cathedral or The Cathedral and Collegiate Church of St Saviour and St Mary Overie , Southwark , London , lies on the south bank of the River Thames close to London Bridge .
The Cathedral Choir is supported financially by the St Olave 's & St Saviour 's Schools Foundation , which stems from the two parochial schools set up in the 1560s which still hold their commemoration and annual services here as their ` foundation ' church .
The Old English minster was a collegiate church servicing a south Thames area .
The main railway line from London Bridge station to Cannon Street station passes close to the cathedral , blocking the view from the south side .
The present building is mainly Gothic , from 1220 to 1420 .
Borough Market and the Hall of the Worshipful Company of Glaziers and Painters of Glass by the river are in the immediate vicinity .
It is the mother church of the Anglican Diocese of Southwark .

Both water and air arrive together in the camera aeolis -LRB- wind chamber -RRB- .
Here , water and air separate and the compressed air is driven into a wind-trunk on top of the camera aeolis , to blow the organ pipes .
It then drives a water wheel , which in turn drives the musical cylinder and the movements attached .
See more about the Hydraulis and its further development in pipe organ .
The water organ or hydraulic organ -LRB- early types are sometimes called hydraulis , hydraulos , hydraulus or hydraula -RRB- is a type of pipe organ blown by air , where the power source pushing the air is derived by water from a natural source -LRB- e.g. by a waterfall -RRB- or by a manual pump . Consequently , the water organ lacks a bellows , blower , or compressor .
Two perforated â splash platesâ or â diaphragmsâ prevent water spray from getting into the organ pipes .
It is attributed to the Hellenistic scientist Ctesibius of Alexandria , an engineer of the 3rd century BC .
The hydraulis was the world 's first keyboard instrument and was , in fact , the predecessor of the modern church organ .
To start the organ , the tap above the entry pipe is turned on and , given a continuous flow of water , the organ plays until the tap is closed again .
The water , having been separated from the air , leaves the camera aeolis at the same rate as it enters .

The term is used mainly in igneous petrology .
In biochemistry , a trace element is also referred to as a micronutrient ; see List of micronutrients .
In biochemistry , a trace element is a chemical element that is needed in minute quantities for the proper growth , development , and physiology of the organism .
In geochemistry , a trace element is a chemical element whose concentration is less than 1000 ppm or 0.1 % of a rock 's composition .
In analytical chemistry , a trace element is an element in a sample that has an average concentration of less than 100 parts per million measured in atomic count , or less than 100 micrograms per gram .
The legal trademark on the term `` Muppet '' is currently held by The Muppets Holding Company -LRB- now The Muppets Studio , LLC , a division of The Walt Disney Company -RRB- ; although Sesame Workshop and The Jim Henson Company continue to use the term on their characters with certain permissions .
After earlier unsuccessful attempts , the Walt Disney Company bought the Muppets in 2004 .
The Muppeteer or Muppet master always holds the Muppet above his head or in front of his body , with one hand operating the head and mouth and the other manipulating the hands and arms , either with two separate control rods or by `` wearing '' the hands like gloves . One consequence of this design is that most Muppets are left-handed as the puppeteer uses his right hand to operate the head while operating the arm rod with his left hand .

This chapter and its addendum contained most of the controversial material , and is still important today .
I. On the natural history of the man-like Apes p1 -- 56 .
Evidence as to Man 's Place in Nature is an 1863 book by Thomas Henry Huxley , in which he gives evidence for the evolution of man and apes from a common ancestor .
Darwin 's sequel came eight years later , with The Descent of Man , and Selection in relation to Sex -LRB- 1871 -RRB- .
In the Origin Darwin had deliberately avoided tackling human evolution , but left a gnomic trailer : `` Light will be thrown on the origin of man and his history '' .
Robert Chambers in his anonymous Vestiges also clearly made the point .
In the 18th century Linnaeus and others had classified man as a primate , but without drawing evolutionary conclusions .
The book came five years after Charles Darwin and Alfred Russel Wallace announced their theory of evolution by means of natural selection , and four years after the publication of Darwin 's Origin of Species .
On some fossil remains of Man p119 â `` 159 .
Backed by this evidence , the book proposed to a wide readership that evolution applied as fully to man as to all other life .
This contains a summary of what was known of the great apes at that time .
A neanderthal skull-cap and other bones had been found , and various remains of early Homo sapiens .
On the relations of Man to the lower animals p57 â `` 112 .
It was Lamarck , the first to develop a coherent theory of evolution , who discussed human evolution in this context .
Huxley compares these remains with existing human races .
It was the first book devoted to the topic of human evolution , and discussed much of the anatomical and other evidence .

The houses are built from the local Ticino granite with slate roofs and have changed little for several hundred years , leading the Italian writer Piero Bianconi to describe Corippo as `` Verzasca 's gentlest village '' .
Despite this , it possesses the trappings of communities many times its size : an official website -LRB- www.corippo.ch -RRB- , its own coat of arms , a village church , a restaurant , and a mayor who leads a town council consisting of three local citizens .
The village has maintained its status as an independent entity since its incorporation in 1822 .
Corippo lies in the Verzasca valley some 12 kilometers -LRB- 7.4 miles -RRB- from Locarno at the north end of the artificial Lake Vogorno , and 20 km from the border with Italy .
Corippo is a municipality in the district of Locarno in the canton of Ticino in Switzerland .
With a population of just 17 As of 2004 , it is the smallest municipality in Switzerland .

The ounce -LRB- abbreviated : oz , the old Italian word onza , now spelled oncia ; apothecary symbol : â -RRB- is a unit of mass with several definitions , the most commonly used of which are equal to approximately 28 grams . The ounce is used in a number of different systems , including various systems of mass that form part of the imperial and United States customary systems .
The most commonly used ounces today are the international avoirdupois ounce and the international troy ounce .

In the Gulf of Mexico , Shell Oil evacuated about 40 workers from drilling operations .
The depression turned to the northwest , dropping heavy rains on central Texas on August 6 .
The tropical storm moved westward to the south of the central Gulf coast on August 4 .
It strengthened into Tropical Depression Five before gaining intensity and being named Tropical Storm Edouard on August 3 , the fifth named storm of the 2008 Atlantic hurricane season .
Edouard weakened quickly over land and was downgraded to a tropical depression late on August 5 .
A shear line stalled in the northeastern Gulf of Mexico in early August as troughing aloft dug into the northeast Gulf of Mexico .
It made landfall on August 5 on the upper Texas coast about 40 miles southwest of Port Arthur and moved west-northwest into the interior of Texas .
In preparations for the storm , emergency teams along the Louisiana and Texas coasts were activated .
Perry activated up to 1,200 National Guard troops , a 70 member rescue team , six helicopters and an incident management team that brings food and water to affected areas .
Texas Governor Rick Perry issued a disaster declaration for 17 Texas counties that could be in the path of Tropical Storm Edouard .
Under the order , about 200 buses are available in San Antonio and Houston to help in evacuations .
In Cameron Parish , Louisiana the Office of Emergency Preparedness ordered a mandatory evacuation , where Sheriff 's deputies also erected roadblocks .

Aksai Chin , also Aksayqin , Akesaiqin or Akesai Qin -LRB- Hindi : à
Aksai Chin is one of the two main border dispute areas between India and the People 's Republic of China , the other dispute being the one over Arunachal Pradesh , which is administered by India and claimed by China as South Tibet .
It is , however , claimed by India as a part of its state of Jammu and Kashmir .
The etymology of Aksai Chin is uncertain regarding the word `` Chin '' .

Fuji Speedway is a race track standing in the foothills of Mount Fuji , in Oyama , SuntÅ District , Shizuoka Prefecture , Japan .
In 1966 , the track hosted a USAC Indy Car non-championship race , won by Jackie Stewart .
F1 did n't return to Fuji until 2007 .
The race had a dramatic World Championship battle between James Hunt and Niki Lauda , and in awful rainy conditions , Hunt earned enough points to win the title . Mario Andretti won the race , with Lauda withdrawing due to the dangerous conditions .
Fuji Speedway is known for having one of the longest straights in motorsport tracks , at 1.5 k in length .
But even with these changes the main feature of the track remained its approximately 1.5 k long straight , one of the longest in all of motorsports .
Following both poor ticket sales and even worse weather it was decided by FOM that the FIA Japanese Grand Prix would be shared between Fuji Speedway and Suzuka on alternate years with Suzuka holding the next race on Sunday , October 4 , 2009 .
Mitsubishi Estate Co. invested in the circuit and took the management right on October 1965 .
The Fuji circuit is well known to fans of the arcade racing game Pole Position , as cars raced on the circuit in the popular loop .
The track was reopened on April 10 , 2005 .
In 2003 the circuit was closed down to accommodate a major reprofiling of the track , using a new design from Hermann Tilke .
Fuji remained a popular sports car racing venue and FIA World Sportscar Championship visited the track between 1982 â `` 1988 and it was often used for national races .
The only time the circuit is run on a reverse direction is during the D1 Grand Prix round as Keiichi Tsuchiya felt the new layout meant reduced entry speed , making it less suitable for drifting .
Fuji Speedway Corporation was established in 1963 , as Japan NASCAR Corporation .
Close to the circuit is a drifting course , which was built as part of the refurbishment under the supervision of `` Drift King '' Keiichi Tsuchiya .
The circuit hosted its first Formula One championship event in 29 years on September 30 , 2007 .
There was less celebration after the second race in 1977 as Gilles Villeneuve was involved in a crash that killed two spectators on the side of the track , leading to Formula One leaving the speedway .
Therefore , the track was originally designed to be a 4 k high-banked superspeedway , but there was not enough money to complete the project and thus only one of the bankings was ever designed .
Originally managed by Mitsubishi , Fuji Speedway was acquired by Toyota Motor Corporation in 2000 .
NHRA exhibitions were run in 1989 , and in 1993 Shirley Muldowney ran a 5.30 on the quarter-mile strip at Fuji .
A new part of track was built to counteract the problem , and the resultant 4.359 k course proved more successful .
Toyota also hosts its own historic event a week before the NISMO festival called Toyota Motorsports Festival .

WAW dependencies are also known as output dependencies .
In order to have a compact instruction encoding , most processor instruction sets have a small set of special locations which can be directly named .
Different instructions may take different amounts of time -LRB- e.g. , CISC architecture -RRB- .
Instead of delaying the write until all reads are completed , two copies of the location can be maintained , the old value and the new value .
Instructions 4 , 5 , and 6 are independent of instructions 1 , 2 , and 3 , but the processor can not finish 4 until 3 is done , because 3 would then write the wrong value .
When all reads needing the old value have been satisfied , it can be discarded .
While the general-purpose and floating-point registers are discussed the most , flag and status registers or even individual status bits are commonly renamed as well .
Programs are composed of instructions which operate on values .
Anything that is read and written can be renamed .
The false dependency is broken and additional opportunities for out-of-order execution are created .
A typical instruction might say , add X and Y and put the result in Z. In this instruction , X , Y , and Z are the names of storage locations .
Memory locations can also be renamed , although it is not commonly done to the extent practiced in register renaming .
This is the essential concept behind register renaming .
The instructions must name these values in order to distinguish them from one another .
For instance , a processor may be able to execute hundreds of instructions while a single load from main memory is in progress .
This is the sort of false dependency that can be resolved by renaming .
In computer architecture , register renaming refers to a technique used to avoid unnecessary serialization of program operations imposed by the reuse of registers by those operations .
Shorter instructions executed while the load is outstanding will finish first , thus the instructions are finishing out of the original program order .
Now instructions 4 , 5 , and 6 can be executed in parallel with instructions 1 , 2 , and 3 , so that the program can be executed faster .
WAR dependencies are also known as anti-dependencies .
In smaller processors , the names of these locations correspond directly to elements of a register file .
A read from a register or memory location must return the last prior value written to that location , and not one written programmatically after the read .
For example , the x86 instruction set architecture has 8 integer registers , x86-64 has 16 , many RISCs have 32 , and IA-64 has 128 .
; Write-after-write -LRB- WAW -RRB- : Successive writes to a particular register or memory location must leave that location containing the result of the second write .
Reads that precede , in program order , the write of the new value can be provided with the old value , even while other reads that follow the write are provided with the new value .
Out-of-order execution has been used in most recent high-performance CPUs to achieve some of their speed gains .
This can be resolved by squashing -LRB- synonyms : canceling , annulling , mooting -RRB- the first write if necessary .
This is referred to as a true dependency or flow dependency , and requires the instructions to execute in program order .
; Read-after-write -LRB- RAW -RRB- : A read from a register or memory location must return the value placed there by the last write in program order , not some other write .
Many high performance CPUs have more physical registers than may be named directly in the instruction set , so they rename registers in hardware to achieve additional parallelism .
The Immortality-test variation of the Turing test would determine if a person 's essential character is reproduced with enough fidelity to make it impossible to distinguish a reproduction of a person from the original person . The Dance Language vs. The Waggle Dance
In line with recent work in swarm intelligence research involving optimization algorithms inspired by the behavior of social insects and animals such as fish , birds , and ants , recently there has been research on using bee waggle dance behavior for efficient fault-tolerant routing .
From the abstract of Wedde , Farooq , and Zhang -LRB- 2004 -RRB- :
Flowers located directly in line with the sun are represented by waggle runs in an upward direction on the vertical combs , and any angle to the right or left of the sun is coded by a corresponding angle to the right or left of the upward direction .
Austrian ethologist and Nobel laureate Karl von Frisch was one of the first who translated the meaning of the waggle dance . On the right side is a video explaining the waggle dance in depth , as well as the experimentation that went into discovering the dance .
A worker bee 's waggle dance involves running through a small figure-eight pattern : a waggle run -LRB- aka waggle phase -RRB- followed by a turn to the right to circle back to the starting point -LRB- aka return phase -RRB- , another waggle run , followed by a turn and circle to the left , and so on in a regular alternation between right and left turns after waggle runs .
The distance between hive and recruitment target is encoded in the duration of the waggle runs .
The farther the target , the longer the waggle phase , with a rate of increase of about 75 milliseconds per 100 meters .
The direction and duration of waggle runs are closely correlated with the direction and distance of the patch of flowers being advertised by the dancing bee .
A waggle dance consists of one to 100 or more circuits , each of which consists of two phases : the waggle phase and the return phase .
It was once thought that bees had two distinct recruitment dances â '' round dances and waggle dances â '' the former for indicating nearby targets and the latter for indicating distant targets , but it is now known that a round dance is simply a waggle dance with a very short waggle run -LRB- see below -RRB- .
Georges Head battery was built in 1871 after the removal of the British forces from Australia in 1870 .
It took three months and 250 soldiers to roll the gun barrels all the way from North Sydney to the batteries .
In 1877 large mounds of earth were placed between the pits to make sure the guns could not fire upon each other and to help protect the gun crew from enemy fire .
The miners ' job was to explode the mine closest to an approaching enemy ship .
The Georges Head Battery is located on Georges Head , in the suburb of Mosman in Sydney , New South Wales , Australia .
They came along a rough track which later became Military Road .
Georges Head was armed with four 80 pounder rifled muzzle loading guns and two 68 pounder muzzle-loading guns .
